column3: Join the Future: Seeking an IT Manager to Lead Innovation at Sentinel Property Group!
column13: Join the Future: Seeking an IT Manager to Lead Innovation at Sentinel!  Unlock Limitless Potential in the Expansive Domain of IT Management! We are seeking a proactive and innovative IT Manager to join our dynamic team. This is a new position within the company, offering an exciting opportunity for the successful candidate to make a significant impact. The IT Manager will be responsible for overseeing our IT infrastructure, systems, and operations, ensuring they are aligned with our business objectives and contribute to the company's success.  What could your day-to-day entail?  As an IT Manager, your days are a dynamic blend of strategic planning, technical oversight, and stakeholder engagement. You'll lead projects, ensure seamless operation of enterprise systems, evaluate new software solutions, and manage cybersecurity initiatives. With a focus on innovation and excellence, you'll collaborate with internal teams and external vendors to drive transformative change and propel the company's IT landscape forward.  Key Responsibilities:  Strategic Oversight: Lead and manage the Company’s enterprise information systems and IT infrastructure. Develop and implement strategic IT plans to align with company objectives. Project Management: Oversee and manage IT projects from inception to completion, including new software deployments. Ensure business engagement, effective training, and resource management. System Evaluation: Evaluate and recommend new software solutions to enhance operational efficiency and meet strategic goals. Vendor Management: Liaise with external vendors to maintain hardware, internet connections, and manage support requests. Ensure adherence to contracts and Service Level Agreements (SLAs). Training & Support: Ensure all staff receive appropriate training on software usage. Act as the point of contact for internal IT-related queries and provide support as needed. Security & Compliance: Maintain data security, network access, backup systems, and business continuity. Ensure compliance with relevant protocols, licenses, and security standards. Documentation & Reporting: Create and manage comprehensive business case documentation for system changes, improvements, and developments. Ensure IT hardware and software systems are properly documented and approved. Budget Management: Responsible for the annual technology budget, ensuring cost-effectiveness and financial accountability. System & Protocol Development: Design, develop, and coordinate systems, policies, and procedures to support the Company’s IT infrastructure and operational needs.  Are you someone with?  6+ years' experience in IT-focused service delivery and management experience, preferably within the Financial or Property industry. Experience in MRI, Cloud Systems, Network Service, Internet, and other relevant software. Knowledge and experience of cybersecurity initiatives and program implementation. Experience working within a Managed Services environment. SharePoint experience. Progenesis or other property accounting tools/systems experience (desired). Financial Accounting Systems experience. Strong commercial acumen.  What’s in it for you?  Our commitment to your career development. Competitive salary with regular reviews. Prime CBD office location. Company-affiliated discounts. Sick leave bonus. Employee Assistance Program (EAP) support. Engage with a diverse workforce, fostering a mix of perspectives. Vibrant company culture with monthly gatherings. Meaningful impact by contributing to local communities and charities. Company laptop. Build your career with an industry-leading funds management organization.  Who are we?  Sentinel Property Group is a leading property investment fund with over $2 billion in Assets Under Management (AUM). We manage 62 commercial properties across 15 active trusts, including Caneland Central (Mackay’s #1 Shopping Centre) and Casuarina Square (NT’s #1 Shopping Centre), as well as various large-format retail, office, and industrial assets. We cultivate a dynamic and rewarding work environment that continually evolves to create opportunities for professional growth, financial advancement, and career progression.  How to Apply:  Sentinel Property Group is an ever-changing environment where no two days are alike! If you're ready to be challenged, rewarded, and have a blast while doing it, hit that apply button today! Or email your cover letter, resume, and availability to HumanResources@sentinelpg.com.au

column3: ICT Core Services Support Officer Role: ICT Core Services Support Officer Location: Darwin Status: Full-time ongoing Are you looking for your nex
column13: ICT Core Services Support Officer  Role: ICT Core Services Support Officer Location: Darwin Status: Full-time ongoing  Are you looking for your next career move in the Tech Sector? Do you have experience in maintaining ICT services, systems and Infrastructure? Have you previously worked on Active Directory, WINS, DNS, DHCP with knowledge that can translate into all round support? Then the Northern Land Council (NLC) have a great opportunity for you!     About the Role: -  As part of our Information Communication & Technology Section, you will be an integral part of the team that maintains the continued security and delivery of our core ICT services for the whole of the NLC. Keeping us connected so we can carry on delivering our key services to our constituents in the NLC regions.  What you will Bring: -  You’ll be creative, a quick thinker, and someone who can work independently but also collaborate as part of the broader Information communication and Technology team. You will have the ability to apply your experience, knowledge and skills to support the success of the ICT unit by maintaining the security, integrity and operational effectiveness of ICT services, systems and infrastructure.  In addition to this, you will have: -  A Bachelors level degree in IT, Computer Science or relevant field Minimum 2 years practical experience in an ICT support officer role or similar field. Technical skills and experience including: Windows Server, Microsoft Exchange, Office 365, Active Directory, WINS, DNS, DHCP knowledge  For a full copy of the Position Description refer to the link provided below.  What’s in it for you?  This is an exciting opportunity to play a role in helping to keep the NLC connected and able to perform the great work we do. You will be part of a dedicated and collaborative team that supports your professional development.  NLC offers competitive and attractive remuneration, work life balance and a unique opportunity to support our Aboriginal communities in the NLC Region.  We offer:  A base salary of $81,716 per annum plus 14.5% superannuation and salary sacrificing up to $15,900 + Meal Entertainment and Holiday Accommodation benefits up to $2,650 per year. Other benefits under our Enterprise Agreement include: District allowance of up to $4,631 per annum for individuals with dependents and $2,539 without dependents. 5 weeks annual leave, leaving loading, 18 days personal leave; Paid Christmas close down; Upon completion of 12 months of service an Annual airfare with a net (in hand) value of $2,724  Interested applicants should send a copy of their CV along with a cover letter outlining why you are interested in this position and what relevant skills and experiences you will bring to the role.  If you have any further queries please contact: jobs@nlc.org.au  Applications Close: Monday 19th August 2024  About the NLC  Cultural knowledge and lived experience are central to the work that we do here at NLC.  The Northern Land Council (NLC) was established 50 years ago under the Aboriginal Land Rights (NT) Act in 1976, to assist Aboriginal people in the Top End of the NT to acquire and manage their traditional lands, waters and seas.  We are committed to enhancing Aboriginal peoples social, political and economic participation by supporting their aspirations and amplifying their voices on a range of issues impacting on their lands, seas, culture and communities.

column3: Embrace a brand new opportunity as an IT manager for a Company investing our profits in protecting our home planet.
column13: The Company:  Patagonia is an outdoor apparel business like no other, "We’re in business to save our home planet." A certified B Corporation, the company is recognised internationally for its commitment to product quality and environmental activism – and now our one and only shareholder is our home planet with 100% of profits going to fight the environmental crisis. Founded by Yvon Chouinard in 1973, Patagonia is based in Ventura, California with offices around the world including in Doon Marng Warree (Torquay), Australia. Our values stay true to a business that was started by a band of climbers and surfers, and the minimalist style they promoted. The approach we take demonstrates a bias for simplicity and utility - build the best product and provide the best service; examine our practices openly and honestly; protect our home planet; be just, equitable and antiracist; do it our way.    We look for candidates with proven experience who thrive in a team-based atmosphere, individuals who are passionate about their communities, the environment and caring for others. We seek core Patagonia product users, people who love to spend as much time as possible in the mountains, ocean, and wild nature. Folks who deal well with ambiguity, learn on the fly, demonstrate sound judgment, and solve problems creatively are most successful with us. We’re looking for someone who builds and maintains relationships with ease and desires to put the customer at the centre of everything they do.  We don’t want someone who can just do a job – we want the best person for the job. Yet we don’t look for “stars” seeking special treatment and perks. Our best efforts are collaborative, and Patagonia culture rewards the ensemble player, while it barely tolerates those who need the limelight.     Primary Purpose                                                                                                              The IT Manager ANZ, located at Patagonia Australia's Head Office in Doon Marng Warree (Torquay), Wadawurrung Country (Victoria) will be the IT lead supporting the Patagonia Australia / New Zealand business and is responsible for maintaining all technology infrastructure and systems. As the lead for technology in ANZ, the role will utilize third parties, collaborate with global teams, and deploy their own expertise to manage business systems and technology infrastructure, lead the implementation of IT-related projects, and support the development and implementation of the IT strategy in partnership with Patagonia’s global IT department and regional leadership.  This role will deliver practical and innovative IT solutions across the business, being aware of technology trends, whilst balancing risk and cost.   Essential Job Functions                                                                                          3rd Party Service Provider Management  Scope work needed and select 3rd party service providers Manage relationships and track and measure performance Ensure services are delivered to SLA, cost expectations, and Patagonia’s satisfaction Business System Management  Lead implementation of new systems and upgrades including ERP, planning tools, POS Ensure business systems are fit for purpose and deliver value User & System configuration management and administration Continuity and issue resolution with IT vendors Monitor and maintain system integrations Partnership with Digital team on web & e-commerce systems  Hardware & IT Infrastructure  Oversee all IT hardware across office and retail stores Manage purchasing, leases and upgrades Asset management register and plan Manage IT budget  Security and risk management  Manage IT security, governance, and cyber security risk mitigation. Monitor business system and infrastructure for business continuity risks Oversee vendor contracts and monitor compliance Maintain Patagonia’s data policy Support  Develop and oversee user support & training framework with appropriate vendor Create and maintain a document repository for all support materials Monitor service level KPIs  Partnership with Global IT based in the US.   Strong and collaborative relationship with the Global IT team based in the US Implement global IT policies and practices as required. Essential Qualities     Manage the relationship with existing external IT providers Build and maintain a great working relationship with our US IT team IT infrastructure and maintenance, including working with third-party suppliers. Managing the upgrading, installing and configuring of new IT hardware and software in conjunction with partners. Continuous improvement to IT security in conjunction with relevant partners. Ensure that quality IT support is always available to all staff in a timely and consistent manner. Assessment of the suitability and long-term feasibility of existing software platforms in use throughout the business and building recommendations for upgrades At least 5 years in IT, with significant experience in a retail business being highly regarded. Bachelor's degree in computer science, Management Information Systems or equivalent Experience and comprehensive knowledge of information systems and business processes Technical expertise in MS O365, Azure, InTune, JAMF, Avaya, CIN7 / CIN7 POS and ERP systems implementation highly desirable Demonstrated understanding and ability to review, recommend and implement process improvements. Ability to discuss and understand technical details and problem-solving logic Ability to create clear and usable documentation for all tasks performed in the position Strong organizational skills, attention to detail and excellent follow-up Excellent customer service skills, in person, on the phone and in writing Comfortable with team-based work structure; ability to demonstrate flexibility on the job Demonstrates initiative, is conscientious and provides complete follow-through on areas of responsibility Self-motivated and highly organised. Must be able to sit/stand for extended periods of time. Ability to look at a computer screen for extended periods of time. Ability to maintain a composed and professional manner within a flexible and (at times) noisy work environment. Personal alignment with the company mission ‘We’re in business to save our home planet’ will make for a fundamentally more satisfying experience at Patagonia. Interest and understanding of the sports for which the Company produces products for. Equal Employment Opportunity  Patagonia is an equal-opportunity employer. Patagonia recruits, employs, trains, compensates, and promotes without regard to race, religion, colour, gender (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity, gender expression, age, or individuals with a disability. Patagonia is proud of our diverse workforce and encourages applications from diverse cultural backgrounds.  Like our planet, our company is an interconnected network of ecosystems dependent on each other. Patagonia is a global community with members that seek to respect, uplift and celebrate all the qualities that make each of us unique – members that look to champion justice, equity and inclusion across our company and beyond.    Accessibility Support Patagonia is committed to ensuring that our hiring process is accessible for talent with disabilities. If you require assistance and or accommodation in the search and or application process, please contact us at accessibility@patagonia.com.au with your full name, best way to reach you, and the accommodation needed to assist you with the application process.   Benefits:   Patagonia provides employees with competitive benefits package (unique to each role) that may include environmental internships, employee discounts, generous clothing allowance, matching of charity donations and much more.   To learn more about who we are visit www.patagonia.com.au    *Please include a cover letter in your application telling us about your passion for your communities, the environment and caring for others. We'd also love to know how you spend your time in the outdoors!    **Applicants must have full and ongoing working rights within Australia. The position is full-time, 76 hours per fortnight.

column1: IT Auditor - Information Systems Manager/Senior Manager
column3: Experienced technology auditor required to work within this government focused team
column13: Manager / Senior Manager Required   Are you passionate about ensuring the security and efficiency of IT systems? Do you possess a keen eye for detail and a strong understanding of IT controls? If so, we invite you to join our dynamic team as an Internal IT Audit Specialist.  Position Overview: As an Internal IT Audit Specialist, you will play a crucial role in safeguarding our IT systems and operations. You will be responsible for assessing the effectiveness of our IT controls, identifying potential risks, and recommending improvements to mitigate vulnerabilities.   Key Responsibilities:  Conduct comprehensive audits of IT systems, applications, and infrastructure to ensure compliance with company policies, industry standards, and regulatory requirements. Assess the effectiveness of internal IT controls and identify areas of potential weakness or vulnerability. Collaborate with IT and business teams to understand IT processes and identify areas for process improvement and automation. Prepare detailed audit reports outlining findings, recommendations, and action plans to address identified issues. Stay up-to-date with emerging IT trends, cybersecurity threats, and industry best practices to continuously enhance the audit process. Participate in the development and implementation of IT policies, procedures, and governance frameworks. Work closely with external auditors to support external audit processes and ensure compliance with audit requirements. Assist in developing and conducting IT-related training programs for employees to enhance awareness of IT security and compliance. Maintain strong working relationships with various stakeholders, promoting a positive and collaborative audit culture. Qualifications and Skills:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Professional certifications such as CISA (Certified Information Systems Auditor) or CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) preferred. Proven experience in IT auditing, risk assessment, or related fields. Excellent analytical, problem-solving, and communication skills. Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a team-oriented environment. Proficient in using auditing tools, data analysis software, and Microsoft Office suite. Experienced IT/Information Systems Audit Senior required. Currently searching for a professional in the technology, consulting or IT Audit Security space who is looking to join an organisation who will invest in your career growth.  You will possess a solid background in IT Risk/Audit coupled with strong communication skills.  If you would like to find out more about this great opportunity, please contact;  Mark Kew 0410 947710 mark@remedyresourcing.com  (You will be either an Australian Permanent Resident or Citizen)

column2: NT Police, Fire and Emergency Services
column3: Move your career into new Territory
column13: Technical 4 (Remuneration Package $103,138 - $113,078) Communications and Electronic Systems Support Section Ongoing vacancy in Darwin  The Communications and Electronic Support (CESS) Section, more commonly known as Technical Workshop, is a service area within the Business and Operational Support Services portfolio that delivers a 24/7 response, providing a high-level specialist technical support service and advice in telecommunications, mission-critical radio, and specialist electronic services to frontline operational members and civilian employees for the NT Police and NT Fire and Emergency Service. CESS also supports both agencies, NT Government, federal and state agencies in times of natural and manmade disasters, recovery and deployment in response to operations.  About the opportunity There are currently two (2) permanent positions for immediate filling.  The Communications and Electronic Support Services Section is seeking two (2) experienced candidates who are passionate in building a career as a Technical Officer in a dynamic government agency.  This is an exciting opportunity to work with frontline agencies on a range of communication platforms and with a multitude of specialist electronic devices. In this role you will be responsible for providing specialist technical communications and electronic systems support to ensure electronic systems and devices (telecommunications, mission-critical radio and electronic devices) are available and operational at all times. The position deploys to locations across the NT in emergency situations to deliver critical equipment and solve issues as part of whole-of-government disaster response and recovery functions.  The position is responsible for the installation and maintenance of new and existing communications and electronic equipment, as well as develop and manage equipment maintenance schedules, conduct routine maintenance, calibration and ad-hoc repairs. The position is required to have detailed understanding of the full range of systems and devices in use, in order to troubleshoot and provide training to frontline end-users.  The position trials new electronic equipment and systems to assess suitability against the agency’s needs and legislated responsibilities and provides advice about emerging products and issues.  We are looking for individuals with:   • Enthusiasm and a passion for the repair, maintain and service of communications and electronic equipment and systems. • Be innovative and provide technical advice about communications systems and electronic equipment and has the initiative to learn new skills and functionalities of experimental equipment. • Qualifications such as an Associate Diploma in Electronics and Communications, and/or a Trade Certificate Electronics or Radio Fitter, Certificate IV in Electro Technology or equivalent or be working towards one of these qualifications is essential. • Working in a frontline support section offers a number of allowances and entitlements that may be of interest to you. This includes but is not limited to, NT allowance, 6 weeks annual leave (pro rata), and after an appropriate training period, being rostered on-call attracting an on-call allowance and appropriate overtime payment. ​  This is a great time to consider moving to the Territory. Treat yourself to an enviable lifestyle and a work-life balance that allows you to explore the stunning landscapes and gorges, and enjoy the colourful tropical sunsets and spectacular lightening displays. The rich multicultural society and community spirit makes the Territory a great place to live, work and play.  For further information about this vacancy please contact: April Edmonds on 0476 051 170 or April.Edmonds@pfes.nt.gov.au  Quote vacancy number: ​46761 Closing date: ​13.08.2024  Applications should consist of a one page summary sheet, resume / CV and copies of relevant qualifications.   For a copy of the Job Description or to view career opportunities in the Northern Territory Government please visithttps://jobs.nt.gov.au/Home/Search

column3: End-User Compute Engineer - Permanent Role - Require 5 day per week onsite - Northside Brisbane Location
column13: Join our esteemed client, Australia's premier Air Charter Operator, as they expand their dynamic IT team! We're currently seeking a dedicated IT Support Engineer to fill this permanent role, which demands full-time presence onsite, five days a week.  About You  Our client is looking for an adaptable team player with a proactive attitude to take on the role of IT Support Engineer. If you're ready to collaborate closely with the IT Support Manager and roll up your sleeves, this could be the perfect opportunity for you.  The Role  As an IT Support Engineer, you'll play a crucial role in our client's IT support team. Your primary responsibility will be providing frontline support to a diverse user base of technical and non-technical staff within the organisation. With over 1500 users and 2000 endpoints spread across eight bases, you'll be working in a fast-paced, 24/7 environment.  Key Responsibilities:  Deliver outstanding customer service and handle all IT support incidents and service requests. Manage inbound calls and queues efficiently to meet service level expectations. Provide technical support for hardware, software, and business applications. Troubleshoot IT issues, conduct root cause analysis, and implement solutions. Oversee end-user computing tasks such as patching, building, deployment, and asset procurement. Respond to incidents and outages promptly, ensuring effective communication throughout. Administer Microsoft Azure AD, Exchange Online, and other Microsoft 365 services. Contribute to continuous improvement initiatives to enhance service delivery and support efficiency. Exhibit strong leadership qualities and provide support as the second-in-command to the IT Support Manager.  Skills & Experience  Hands-on experience in a similar IT support role. Proficiency with ITSM and device management toolsets. Strong technical skills in computer hardware, peripherals, telephony, and video conferencing. Solid understanding of Windows, iOS, Microsoft 365, and server operating systems. Experience with Microsoft Exchange Online, Active Directory, DNS, DHCP, and network troubleshooting. Excellent communication skills, both verbal and written. Ability to work under pressure and adapt to changing priorities. ITIL certification and CompTIA certifications are preferred. Desirable certifications include Microsoft and Cloud (Azure, 365 Certified, MCSE, MCSA, MCITP, etc.).  This is a full-time onsite position with participation in a weekly after-hours on-call roster. Occasional travel to remote sites may be required. Applicants must undergo drug and alcohol testing and police clearance as part of the recruitment process.  APPLY NOW!  Please apply by upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). If you would like to have a confidential discussion, please contact Alex Coroneo at alex.coroneo@davidsonwp.com, quoting reference JN -032024-36254. Want to know more about Davidson? Visit us at www.davidsonwp.com

column3: IT Business Partner role working within a data-centric product team for Australian well-known business
column13: The Employer West Technology is excited to be partnering with a well known Australian company with consistent growth across the operational technology and critical infrastructure space. The business is continuing to invest in technology with the ongoing development of critical projects and programs.  The Opportunity The IT Delivery Partner will take ownership and manage work associated within the Data Product Delivery team. We are looking for someone with a Business Analysis and/or Project Manager background. You will:  Manage a complex portfolio of delivery for a wide variety of stakeholders Create and maintain robust reporting that can be used to drive delivery performance Track and manage the delivery and execution of the data products Manage projects and initiatives to deliver key reporting and ad-hoc data requests for internal and external stakeholders Liaise with stakeholders to understand requirements for the team to deliver Run required agile ceremonies for the team Work across the product teams to understand and resolve capacity and dependencies The Successful Applicant  Demonstrable experience in a similar/professional role Business Analysis or Project Management Background PM or BA certifications  Working within operational technology or critical infrastructure business preferred, but not essential  Previous experience in an IT Delivery Partner, Project Manager or Business Analyst role Experience of working in a product or data related role ideal Ability to design, plan, organise, and implement projects and tasks within a deadline. Ability to initiate, maintain and control the progress of programs. Resourceful team player who is good at building trusting relationships Corporate Software Applications (SAP, SuccessFactors, PowerBI) preferred This is a permanent role with a well-known Australian brand offering excellent benefits, long-term career opportunities and flexible working. If this sounds like you please get in touch - samking@westrecruitment.com.au

column3: 9 month fixed term Contract | Wollongong location | Hybrid work | Large Government Agency
column13: Primary Purpose of the Role Lead a team in developing, implementing, and enhancing operational and corporate business information systems and enterprise applications. Manage ICT projects to continually improve service delivery and leverage the latest technologies.  Key Responsibilities  Oversee the development and enhancement of business information systems, enterprise applications, databases, and reporting tools, ensuring use of the latest technologies. Manage software development projects, ensuring procedures and resources are in place for smooth integration and minimal disruption. Govern information systems, develop policies and procedures, and ensure compliance with legislation. Implement monitoring processes to assess IT system needs and consult with stakeholders to align solutions with business goals. Develop and communicate policies and SOPs to ensure high-quality IT system applications and accurate data warehousing. Provide technical advice and documentation to support strategic IT decision-making. Manage the administration of information systems, including security and access strategies, to ensure compliance with management practices and legislation. Plan and manage resources effectively, including budget performance and compliance with safety and governance requirements.  Key Challenges  Managing and maintaining integrated solutions to meet operational requirements while optimizing costs. Developing strategies for systems integration and deployment amid increasing data management demands and managing change. Diagnosing and resolving complex issues while ensuring consistency and compliance in a diverse and decentralized environment.  Essential Requirements  Relevant tertiary qualification in IT or related field, or equivalent experience. Proven experience in leading systems integration and data management in a mid-sized organization. Knowledge of AIIMS principles and processes or incident management system  Note: This role includes on-call technical support outside of standard business hours as required.  If you would like to be considered please apply for the role by clicking the apply button or email laura.pierce@randstaddigital.com.au  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.  At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

column3: Working in an internal IT department, supporting a single user base. The team is forward-thinking and offers a great place to work.
column13: Position: IT Coordinator   Location:  Perth, CBD   Salary:  $110,000 - $150,000  Job Type: Permanent     Position Overview:  Working in an internal IT department, supporting a single user base. The team is forward-thinking and offers a great place to work; the team is supportive, friendly, and reasonable. Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management of the company's IT. The successful candidate will have a strong background in IT, excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent interpersonal skills.     Perks:  Supporting a friendly user base. Employee recognition scheme. Modern offices, based in a convenient CBD location. Health and wellbeing benefits. Flexible work policies.     Roles Responsibilities:  Oversee day-to-day operations of the IT department, supporting internal users. System administration duties, ensuring optimal performance. Oversee desktop, network, and infrastructure. Setup, installation, and configuration of software and hardware. Plan, execute, and manage IT projects, including migrations, upgrades, and refreshes. Manage relationships with IT vendors and service providers. Coordinate complex projects with external service providers. Implement and maintain security policies and procedures. Maintain and upgrade technical documentation.     Role Requirements:  Office 365, including email, collaboration tools, and license management. Azure, including VM management, Azure AD, and cloud services. Server management, including Windows Server and Linux. Network configuration and management, including routers, switches, and firewalls. Experience with virtualization technologies such as Hyper-V and VMware. Collaboration tools like MS Teams and document management systems like SharePoint. Device management and security using Intune. Backup and recovery solutions, particularly Veeam. Monitor and maintain system performance using system monitoring tools. Project management certifications such as Prince2 are highly regarded. IT management certifications such as ITIL or ITSM are highly regarded.     About You:  Excellent communicator with strong problem-solving skills. Ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical users. Team player with a collaborative mindset. Strong project and stakeholder management skills.  Self-motivated and proactive. Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage time effectively. Adaptable and flexible, with a willingness to learn new technologies and processes.     We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. We regret that we can only contact shortlisted candidates. If you are not shortlisted, we encourage you to check out our website for other opportunities or to sign up for job alerts. Please note that applicants must be based in Australia with valid working rights to be considered.  We represent organizations that promote diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.     Email: info@ouirecruitment.com  Number: (08) 6219 8033

column3: Join us as a Senior Manager Operational Systems to lead cutting-edge ICT projects and drive innovation across a NSW Government Department.
column13: Senior Manager, IT Operational Systems - 10 Month Fixed Term Contract  $139,787 - $161,663 p/a + super + leave loading 10 Month Fixed Term Contract Wollongong/Hybrid Our client is seeking a dynamic Senior manager, IT Operational Systems to oversee a team responsible for developing, implementing, and refining the NSW Government Department's operational and corporate business information systems and enterprise applications. Manage various ICT projects to enhance the delivery of ICT services to stakeholders, ensuring the integration of the latest technologies and service models throughout the organization.    In this role you will be:   Manage a team responsible for developing and enhancing the business information systems, including applications, databases, and reporting tools. Ensure the use of up-to-date technologies and ICT service models. Oversee the design, execution, and evaluation of software development projects, ensuring smooth integration with minimal disruption to operations. Guide the governance of information systems, develop strategies, policies, and procedures, and ensure compliance with legislation. Implement systems to assess IT needs and work with stakeholders to develop solutions that meet business goals. Create and communicate policies and SOPs to ensure high-quality IT systems and accurate data management. Provide technical recommendations and documentation to support strategic IT decisions for management and executives. Manage the information systems, including security and compliance with information management practices. Plan and oversee asset and resource use, ensuring budget performance and compliance with safety and governance standards. About you:   Previous NSW Government experience in a similar role is highly regarded. Seasoned IT leader with extensive experience in managing and enhancing business information systems and enterprise applications. You possess a strong track record in project management, with a knack for leading complex software development initiatives Expertise in governance, strategy, and policy development ensures compliance and effective data management Benefits of contracting through Ashdown People  5th largest supplier to the NSW Government Get paid weekly Rated 4.9/5 on Google Reviews with over 1100 5⭐ reviews for candidate feedback this year Offer Insurances for ABN Contractors Consistent communication & transparency Detailed onboarding & support Please apply if you are interested. Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted. If you have any question, please contact josh@ashdownpeople.com.au or call 0482 099 279

column3: Deliver monitoring, maintenance and support of all networks, firewalls, security, and server environments as an IT Network & Systems Administrator.
column13: The Company  A local corporation with an established services division are expanding their team. An opportunity within their IT team has become available and are looking for a Network Administrator to provide exceptional on-site maintenance and support of all systems, networks, telephony, and PC applications.  The Role  Reporting to the IT manager, the Network Administrator is responsible for performing daily monitoring of all hardware, systems, and server resources as well as providing support to internal users within a collaborative, team-based environment.  Key responsibilities include:  Provide support on all systems, network, telephony, and PC applications. Effectively monitor the ongoing performance, security, reliability and availability of all networks, firewall and security systems, Microsoft servers and virtual environments. Maintain and develop system documentation and procedures. Proactively identify potential network and system issues, as well as research and provide solutions for such issues.  Your Profile  The ideal candidate will have tertiary qualifications in a computing discipline and/or substantial experience in IT support. Experience in the following is essential:  Demonstrated experience of networking technologies and protocols. Demonstrated ability and experience in the installation, maintenance and configuration of Fortinet based network switches and firewalls. Demonstrated ability and experience in the installation, maintenance, and configuration of Microsoft based server and desktop operating systems. Good understanding of virtualisation technologies. Demonstrated experience of Cisco switching, routing, security, and telephony products Excellent communication skills and a strong commitment to quality customer service. Work well as part of a team and independently.  Apply Today  Please send your resume by clicking on the apply button.  Learn more about our Melbourne recruitment services: http://www.roberthalf.com.au/recruitment-agency-melbourne  Job Reference No: 06810-0012982946 LM  By clicking 'apply', you give your express consent that Robert Half may use your personal information to process your job application and to contact you from time to time for future employment opportunities. For further information on how Robert Half processes your personal information and how to access and correct your information, please read the Robert Half privacy notice: https://www.roberthalf.com/au/en/privacy. Please do not submit any sensitive personal data to us in your resume (such as government ID numbers, ethnicity, gender, religion, marital status or trade union membership) as we do not collect your sensitive personal data at this time.

column1: ICT Desktop Support Officer - Clerk Grade 5/6 - Ongoing
column3: Rewarding Government role within the IT team! Ongoing - Sydney (hybrid working) Clerk Grade 5/6 - $93,295 - $102,941 plus super & leave loading.
column13: Ongoing Full Time – 35 hours per week Clerk Grade 5/6 (between $93,295 - $102,941 plus super and annual leave) Location – Sydney CBD (Haymarket)      About us  Legal Aid NSW helps people with their legal problems. We can help people with most areas criminal law, family law and every day civil law legal issues. We give legal advice, help at court and do family dispute resolution. We can do this over the telephone or at one of our 28 offices.     About the role  You will provide assistance, information and support to customers to solve reported issues and process service requests in order to support client service delivery by Legal Aid NSW staff and external practitioners. Actions desktop calls escalated by ICT Service Desk Officers either remotely or through site visits and in-person support, and liaises with other support providers as required.     About you  We are looking for a highly motivated, experienced individual to provide desktop and endpoint support services. You will have similar experience working in a Service Desk environment and have knowledge of service management software to log, manage and prioritise your workload.  This position is ideal for a friendly, bright personality with exemplary Service Desk experience and desktop skills. You have the motivation and drive to succeed, professional, calm under pressure, resilient in the face of challenges and someone who is happy, excited and passionate about what they do and want the opportunity for further challenges.  We may use this recruitment to create a talent pool for similar ongoing or temporary vacancies we have over the next 18 months.     WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN LEGAL AID NSW!     We are committed to diversity and inclusion  We are committed to creating a culturally safe and genuinely inclusive organisation and workplace for everyone who works and interacts with us. We strive to be a place where people from diverse backgrounds want to work, where voices and cultures are valued and where people feel valued, welcomed, respected and heard.   We want a workforce that reflects our clients, so we can deliver a service that meets the needs of the community. We welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds — including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, the LGBTQI+ community, culturally diverse people and other diverse communities.   We acknowledge, support and accommodate the diverse access needs of people with visible and invisible disabilities. If you need an adjustment to participate in the recruitment process, or you’d like information about what we can do to help you, please contact our team at erecruitment@legalaid.nsw.gov.au.     Other benefits of working with us  You will have access to training, development and mentoring opportunities. We are an accredited Flex Ready certified employer and are recognised as leaders in the area of flexible work. Most of our staff work flexibly — for example, from home some of the time or in a way that helps them balance family and work life.     The essential requirements for this role  You must:  be willing to do a Criminal Record Check  hold Australian or NZ citizenship, Australian Permanent Residency (for ongoing vacancies) or a valid visa to work in Australia (for temporary vacancies) be willing to travel on occasion to site locations within Greater Sydney, regional and remote NSW     How to apply  You MUST submit your application online through iworkfor.nsw.gov.au. If you submit your application late or by email it will NOT be accepted.      Your application must include:  your resume (no more than 5 pages) cover letter (no more than 2 pages). In your cover letter, please address the following two (2) target questions below: What is your experience with common problems experienced and solutions for laptops that are used frequently in varying network and connected states? With a mobile workforce, what are the important considerations in delivering reliable and relevant ICT services?     Make sure your application is complete and you have answered all questions before you submit it.     Do you need help to apply?  It’s important to properly prepare before you apply for a role. Here is some other information to help you:   If you have questions about the role, you can contact the Hiring Manager – Melanie Northcott on (02) 9219 5978 or email: melanie.northcott@legalaid.nsw.gov.au.  If you are an Australian Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and are thinking about applying, you can contact the Aboriginal Services Branch to arrange a confidential conversation about any questions you may have. The Role Description sets out the responsibilities of the role. The focus capabilities and key accountabilities in the role description indicate what is expected at that level. Being familiar with these will help you understand what the panel will be looking for in the successful candidate.  Applying for a Role Working at Legal Aid NSW     Applications Close: Sunday, 18 August 2024 @ 11:59pm (AEST)

column1: EL1 ICT Solution Architect – Multiple Positions
column3: Responsible for the development, management and implementation of ICT Solutions, both on premises and within cloud environments.
column13: Geoscience Australia acknowledges the Traditional Custodians of Country throughout Australia and recognises the continuing connection to lands, waters and communities. We pay our respects to Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders Cultures, and to elders past and present.     About us  Geoscience Australia is Australia's pre-eminent public sector geoscience organisation. We are the nation's trusted advisor on the geology and geography of Australia. We apply science and technology to describe and understand the Earth for the benefit of Australia. We apply our diverse professional expertise, our deep and trusted knowledge, our national-scale Earth observation infrastructure and our strong partnerships, to the opportunities and challenges that face our nation.     Our culture  Our strength lies in our people, including our diversity in backgrounds, skills and experiences, and the way we work together to respond to the emerging needs of our work. We value diversity in gender, backgrounds, culture, and experiences of our employees and are committed to providing an inclusive workplace culture that ensures everyone has equal opportunity to contribute, participate and progress. Applications from people who reflect this diversity are encouraged.  Our workplace is committed to the health, safety and wellbeing of our employees and offers a variety of flexible working arrangements to enhance flexibility, including remote working arrangements.     What we can offer you  When you work at Geoscience Australia you will have access to a range of benefits and the opportunity to experience a workplace culture that truly values and promotes diversity, inclusion, equity and belonging. To learn more about our competitive salary, free onsite parking, generous flexible working arrangements and the role you can play in growing our culture click here.     Our team  Geoscience Australia is a world-leading science organisation with diverse and highly-complex technology needs.  The Enterprise Data and Digital (EDD) branch provides enterprise digital and data service and leadership to Geoscience Australia. EDD’s purpose is to unlock Geoscience Australia’s world-class science – making it faster, easier (more flexible), lower risk and higher impact. The branch works in partnership with science divisions across the organisation to enable their success.     The ICT Strategy and Architecture section plays a key role in providing strategic direction for a combination of current and future Information, Communication and Technology (ICT) solutions and architecture. The section has strong connections with the Director of Technology, and Geoscience Australia’s Design Authority.  Under the general direction and guidance of the Director of ICT Strategy and Architecture, the role will be responsible for the development, management and implementation of ICT Solutions, both on premises and within cloud environments.     The role will provide technical leadership and management by working closely with external service providers and internal stakeholders to understand, design and deliver technology solutions that facilitate secure operations of Geoscience Australia’s systems and services.     The role  ICT Solution Architect is responsible for…     In this role you will:  Work closely with internal stakeholders to understand their requirements to design and deliver ICT Solutions for both enterprise ICT and digital science that are robust, compliant, fit-for-purpose and align with broader organisational strategic objectives.  Work in a complex ICT environment with a diverse set of systems, stakeholder, providers and requirements to deliver innovative solutions and solve problems to support scientific and business outcomes. Utilise your skills and experience to contribute to the planning, development and delivery of ICT strategic objectives, technology roadmaps, and technology standards, practices and principles related to the use of ICT technologies within the organisation. Provide targeted technical advice to software engineers, data scientists, business areas and executive stakeholders via formal and informal documentation and interactive engagement. Determine the extent to which existing solutions perform “as required” within the current environment to ensure that future solutions meet anticipated demand and provide continued improvements. Build positive, collaborative, and enduring working relationships with internal stakeholders, project managers, external suppliers and service providers in order to achieve the best outcomes for the organisation. Through this, collaborate to ensure that solutions are delivered in a timely, cost effective and qualitative manner to minimise operational and project risk and ensure costs are contained. Assist in work planning, cost estimation and budget planning.      To be successful in the role you will:  Have a passion for technology and continuous improvement. Have an unerring focus on value, delivery, and users. Proactively identify risks and issues around delivery, security, costs and architecture. Establish relationships with key stakeholders from other divisions, agencies, and organisations including internationally. Adhere to the APS values and code of conduct and consistently behave in an honest, ethical and professional way.     Required skills, knowledge, experience and/or qualifications   A bachelor degree in Information Technology (or equivalent) from an Australian or overseas tertiary institution is highly desirable Solid ICT infrastructure skills, with a broad understanding of ICT technologies across several domains including networking, hardware, storage, virtualisation, operating systems, public cloud and software platforms. The ideal candidate would have in-depth knowledge in at least 1 of these technology domains.   Excellent communication skills, both written and oral.     Are you unsure about applying?  Did you know that a Hewlett Packard internal report found that men apply for jobs when they meet an average of 60 per cent of the job requirements? Women and other people from diverse backgrounds tend to only apply when they check every box. If you think you have what it takes, but don’t necessarily meet every single point on what we are looking for, please still apply or get in touch with the contact officer to learn more about the role.     To Apply  Please visit the careers page of our website to submit your application via our e-Recruit system. Your application should include:  Your resume (no more than 3 pages) A brief statement (no more than 700 words) outlining your transferable skills, experience and capabilities related to the role and the value you would bring to Geoscience Australia.     If you have any questions regarding the role, please contact Neha Rai on (02) 6249 9193 or email neha.rai@ga.gov.au     To learn more about applying for roles within the Australian Public Services please review, ‘Applying for an APS job: cracking the code’.     Eligibility   To be eligible to apply for this position you must meet the below eligibility criteria.  Be an Australian Citizen at the closing date of application. The successful applicant must be able to obtain, hold and maintain a security clearance of an appropriate level relevant to this role. Commencement of employment is subject to the successful applicant undergoing and satisfying pre- employment screening, which includes a police history check.     Recruitability  RecruitAbility applies to this vacancy. Under the RecruitAbility scheme you will be invited to participate in further assessment activity for the vacancy if you choose to apply under the scheme; declare you have a disability; and meet the minimum requirements for the position. For more information please visit the Australian Public Service Commission website.     Hearing or speech impaired applicants are invited to use the National Relay Service by contacting 133 677, and requesting to be connected with our Recruitment team on 02 6249 9777 in order to obtain selection documentation.     Technical Assistance  If you require technical assistance, call Human Resources on (02) 6249 9777 or email hr@ga.gov.au.     A merit list/pool may be created from this process. If you are successful for the merit pool, your details may be shared with other Australian Public Service agencies unless you choose not to have your details disclosed.

column3: Rapidly grow your skill set in a team environment where customer, people and innovation are foundational to what we do!
column13: IT Managed Service Engineer - Level 1/2/3   About Us:  Gecko IT Solutions, based in Bendigo, is a fast-growing boutique managed services provider of IT solutions to small and medium-sized business customers in Bendigo and North Central Victoria.  Led by a “right-sizing” approach to foster growth, enhance productivity, and drive innovation for our customers, we provide exemplary services 365 days a year to enable our customers to operate more efficiently and effectively.  At Gecko we do things a little differently. All our techs operate at the same level. - gone is the old, restrictive three-tiered support structure! As a member of the Managed Services team, you will enjoy exposure to the complete technology and services stack, from password reset to implementing firewalls - you will grow through doing it all in a supportive, inclusive team environment where we really do value your perspective and input!  With many new customers coming on board, the team needs to grow and it's an exciting time in the team's journey together!   If you have at least 3 years solid experience in level 2 or 3 IT infrastructure support, are motivated by professional and personal growth and have a true customer-first outlook, please read on!  Position Overview:  The IT Managed Service Engineer / Technical Account Manager is a member of the Managed Services Team which delivers technology improvements, support and advice to Gecko IT Solutions’ small to medium sized business customers under managed service agreements.  As an integral technical resource in the team, your role is to provide hands-on technical support with particular attention to your focus group of customers. You will troubleshoot issues, perform regular maintenance, roll out new tech and proactively identify potential problems before they impact the customer's operations.   Drawing on in-depth knowledge of your customers’ needs, developed over time, you will become a trusted adviser to your teammates and your customers directly, influencing the selection, implementation, and optimisation of technology solutions that improve operations.  By supporting users and the technical environment, suggesting upgrades, advocating for best practices, and implementing new solutions that enhance performance and security, this role makes a real difference to the business community of Bendigo and North Central Victoria.  Key Responsibilities: Manage your support queue, providing phone, email, web portal and in-person support, ensuring requests are understood, updated and worked on in a manner reflecting Gecko standards and well understood urgency and impact. Provide overflow support to the team as required. Troubleshoot and resolve hardware, software, workstation, server, network, access and identity and other IT service issues Maintain all aspects of the customers’ technology infrastructure per their managed service agreement Monitor, log and respond to alerts and notifications from the antivirus, backup and disaster recovery, and the remote monitoring and management systems Design new tech solutions, define specs and rollout new tech in support of the sales team  For more information about the role, please reach out to Michael Batrouney on jobs@geckoits.com.au or phone 0419 523 516.  Skills Critical to Your Success: Demonstrated ability to manage a technical service request queue, ensuring requests are understood, updated and worked on in a manner reflecting well-understood urgency and impact Proficiency in Microsoft 365 administration, implementation, and troubleshooting Strong capability managing user identity and access and Microsoft Windows workstations and servers in a Microsoft Active Directory and Entra ID environment Experience administering Hyper-V and ESXi virtual machines Excellent communication skills with a customer-first outlook What We Offer: A fun and exciting work environment where creativity and innovation are baked into what we do! Extensive opportunity for professional growth and skill development Recognition and reward for outstanding team contribution Flexible work arrangements such as scheduled work from home days An extra day of annual leave for your birthday!  Competitive salary and benefits package How to Apply:  To apply for this role, click the Apply button below and ensure you provide the following documents as attachments:  Cover letter briefly outlining why you are interested in this role and briefly describing the responsibilities of your most senior IT support role to date.  NOTE: If you are currently outside a comfortable daily drive commute to the Gecko office, you must include in your letter your thoughts around re-locating Your up-to-date resume  Previous applicants need not re-apply.

column3: A fantastic leadership opportunity with Gladstone Ports Corporation, for anyone based in North QLD, or interstate candidates looking for a sea-change.
column13: Clicks IT Recruitment is partnering with the Gladstone Ports Corporation in their search for their next leader.  After an internal promotion, they are looking for an experienced Infrastructure Leader to be based out of their headquarters in Gladstone.  In this role, you will use your leadership experience to guide and lead a team of 4, with the headcount to grow before years end. You will also play a crucial role in continuously improving the effectiveness, dependability, and security of the existing technology and applications.  Gladstone Ports Corporation is based in North Queensland. It is expected that this role is to be based in Gladstone, QLD on a full time basis.  Key experience required:  Proven experience in an IT leadership role, managing an infrastructure team Proven, hands-on experience with managing Servers (Microsoft), Storage (SAN/DAS/NAS, iSCSI) and Networks (VLANs, routing, switching, wireless & firewalls) Experience in resources industry e.g. mining, oil, gas, utilities, aviation highly desirable Demonstrated interpersonal, verbal and written skills including the ability to liaise and create positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Mandatory C class drivers licence  On offer is a permanent role offering a generous salary between $180,000 - $220,000 + 12.75% super, and a generous relocation package of up to $30,000 for any candidates looking to relocate to Gladstone.  Please note: due to WHS regulations, candidates must be able to pass a drug and alcohol test prior to commencement if successful.  If you're interested in applying for this role, please clearly state on your resume or cover letter, your ability to re-locate to the area.  Candidates must be eligible to work in Australia, with unlimited working rights.  If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Dylan Sheoshker at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 429 171 544.  At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.  We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

column2: St Paul's College Walla Walla NSW
column3: Seeking a Full Time Learning Technology Network & Support Administrator to provide high quality IT support to our students, parents and staff.
column13: Our Christian Co-Educational Day & Boarding College is nestled in the rural setting of Walla Walla (north of Albury). Students are drawn from local communities, the cities of Albury and Wodonga, the Riverina, North Eastern Victoria and more remote locations. The College has 300 students, of whom 90 are boarders.  We invest in growth – of our young people, our staff, our community and our environment. Due to strong growth in student numbers, we are seeking a committed individual to join our Learning Technology team. This role involves providing high-quality IT support to staff, students, and parents, and is primarily a face-to-face role supporting infrastructure, devices, and systems.   Experience and qualification requirements  Diploma, Degree or relevant industry certifications in Information Technology Proven work experience in ICT Support and support to end users Ability to manage a fleet of varied endpoint devices including PCs, laptops, smartphones and tablets Experience administering and troubleshooting Microsoft 365 and Microsoft Azure environments Experience with Microsoft Intune Understanding of client server networks and Microsoft Windows operating systems Understand fundamental network technologies and principals.  The successful applicant will  Work independently as well as part of a team Have the ability to prioritise tasks according to expectations and diversity of requests, reflecting good time management  Be a good listener and communicator Effectively liaise with a broad cross-section of people, including teaching and non-teaching staff Respond proactively and ensure work is carried out with design quality in mind rather than just immediate issue resolution  Have experience in supporting the latest Windows OS, MacOS, Microsoft Office Suite, Microsoft 365 administration and Adobe Creative Cloud Suite.  Possess a sound understanding of networking and wireless technologies  Be enthusiastic and organised   The successful applicant will hold a current NSW Working with Children Check.  Applications (including two referees) and requests for the position description can be emailed to Manager, Executive Services: karen.lowe@stpaulscollege.nsw.edu.au   0260292200  Position commences 30th September, or by negotiation.  Deadline for applications 4pm, 19th August 2024.

column3: One SMG has an excellent opportunity to advance and expand your career in IT Systems Application.
column13: Full time permanent position Located in the buzzing CBD Competitive salary and benefits     Who we are:  With 18 businesses across Australasia, One SMG is an Australian owned and operated dynamic company on the move. Our network includes automotive and caravan dealerships, fleet management, leasing, collision repair centres and property.      About the role:  This position is located at the One SMG Corporate Support Office and presents an excellent opportunity to advance and expand your career in IT Systems Application.     What you will do:  Assist users in becoming efficient and effective with IT systems through training, troubleshooting, and support. Develop and maintain system documentation, user guides, and training materials. Provide technical assistance with the setup, maintenance, and troubleshooting of computer systems, hardware, software, and networks. Respond to technical queries and provide support across the company. Manage and support Microsoft 365, SharePoint Online, and Microsoft Teams environments. Develop workflows and reports to streamline processes within SharePoint. Install, configure, and support enterprise-level and off-the-shelf software, resolving technical and functional issues. Provide recommendations on technologies and strategies to enhance business operations. Support the IT Helpdesk, ensuring timely resolution of incidents and requests. Maintain and monitor servers and devices, ensuring security, backups, and updates. Assist with the on and off boarding of staff.     About you:  Tertiary or equivalent qualifications in IT or a related field. Experience with Office 365, Azure AD, Microsoft AD, SharePoint, and Teams Administration. Proficient with Windows OS and Microsoft products. Skilled in diagnosing a broad range of hardware and software faults. Experienced in supporting desktops, laptops, and tablets. Familiar with Atera Support Tools. Knowledgeable in network virtualization technologies (VMware, Hyper-V). Experience with networking and network infrastructure, including switches and routers. High attention to detail and exceptional quality control. Strong problem-solving skills and lateral thinking abilities. Effective verbal and written communication and customer service skills. Proven ability to learn and adapt quickly. Ability to prioritise tasks in a fast-paced, dynamic work environment. Ability to follow procedures and instructions meticulously.     Desirable but Not Essential:  Certifications in IP Networking, Cisco Networking, and/or Microsoft. Knowledge of Linux.     If you want to join our amazing team, we can offer you:  A competitive salary will be offered to the successful candidate.  You will also be provided with on-the-job training to help you excel in this position.  Career development with in-house upskilling and external learning opportunities. Friendly and inclusive culture, supporting diversity and employee well-being. New car discounts *conditions apply Novated leases available Discounted Corporate membership - Health Insurance  Discounted Gym membership     Pre-Employment Requirements:  Successful completion of a pre-employment medical examination and drug & alcohol screening.     Sound like you? If you'd like to learn more, please email hr@onesmg.au at One SMG or simply click Apply!    Applications close: 5pm, Sunday 18th August 2024.    We maintain the discretion to extend an offer at any stage during the recruitment process. If you are interested in the position submit your application as soon as possible.

column1: ICT Desktop Support Officer – Clerk Grade 5/6 – Temporary
column3: Rewarding Government Opportunity! Temporary Full-Time until June 2025 Sydney (hybrid) Clerk Grade 5/6 - $93,295 - $102,941 plus super & leave loading.
column13: Full Time Temporary until June 2025 – 35 hours per week Clerk Grade 5/6 (between $93,295 - $102,941 plus super and annual leave) Location – Sydney CBD (Haymarket)      About us  Legal Aid NSW helps people with their legal problems. We can help people with most areas criminal law, family law and every day civil law legal issues. We give legal advice, help at court and do family dispute resolution. We can do this over the telephone or at one of our 28 offices.     About the role  You will provide assistance, information and support to customers to solve reported issues and process service requests in order to support client service delivery by Legal Aid NSW staff and external practitioners. Actions desktop calls escalated by ICT Service Desk Officers either remotely or through site visits and in-person support, and liaises with other support providers as required.     About you  We are looking for a highly motivated, experienced individual to provide desktop and endpoint support services. You will have similar experience working in a Service Desk environment and have knowledge of service management software to log, manage and prioritise your workload.  This position is ideal for a friendly, bright personality with exemplary Service Desk experience and desktop skills. You have the motivation and drive to succeed, professional, calm under pressure, resilient in the face of challenges and someone who is happy, excited and passionate about what they do and want the opportunity for further challenges.  We may use this recruitment to create a talent pool for similar ongoing or temporary vacancies we have over the next 18 months.     WHY YOU SHOULD JOIN LEGAL AID NSW!     We are committed to diversity and inclusion  We are committed to creating a culturally safe and genuinely inclusive organisation and workplace for everyone who works and interacts with us. We strive to be a place where people from diverse backgrounds want to work, where voices and cultures are valued and where people feel valued, welcomed, respected and heard.   We want a workforce that reflects our clients, so we can deliver a service that meets the needs of the community. We welcome applications from people with diverse backgrounds — including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, the LGBTQI+ community, culturally diverse people and other diverse communities.   We acknowledge, support and accommodate the diverse access needs of people with visible and invisible disabilities. If you need an adjustment to participate in the recruitment process, or you’d like information about what we can do to help you, please contact our team at erecruitment@legalaid.nsw.gov.au.     Other benefits of working with us  You will have access to training, development and mentoring opportunities. We are an accredited Flex Ready certified employer and are recognised as leaders in the area of flexible work. Most of our staff work flexibly — for example, from home some of the time or in a way that helps them balance family and work life.     The essential requirements for this role  You must:  be willing to do a Criminal Record Check  hold Australian or NZ citizenship, Australian Permanent Residency (for ongoing vacancies) or a valid visa to work in Australia (for temporary vacancies) be willing to travel on occasion to site locations within Greater Sydney, regional and remote NSW     How to apply  You MUST submit your application online through iworkfor.nsw.gov.au. If you submit your application late or by email it will NOT be accepted.      Your application must include:  your resume (no more than 5 pages) cover letter (no more than 2 pages). In your cover letter, please address the following two (2) target questions below: What is your experience with common problems experienced and solutions for laptops that are used frequently in varying network and connected states? With a mobile workforce, what are the important considerations in delivering reliable and relevant ICT services?     Make sure your application is complete and you have answered all questions before you submit it.  Do you need help to apply?  It’s important to properly prepare before you apply for a role. Here is some other information to help you:   If you have questions about the role, you can contact the Hiring Manager – Melanie Northcott on (02) 9219 5978 or email: melanie.northcott@legalaid.nsw.gov.au.  If you are an Australian Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander and are thinking about applying, you can contact the Aboriginal Services Branch to arrange a confidential conversation about any questions you may have. The Role Description sets out the responsibilities of the role. The focus capabilities and key accountabilities in the role description indicate what is expected at that level. Being familiar with these will help you understand what the panel will be looking for in the successful candidate.  Applying for a Role Working at Legal Aid NSW

column3: - Full-time Opportunity. - Work 35 hours a week - Ensure the timely and accurate capture, workflow and distribution of documentation.
column13: Full-time Opportunity. Work 35 hours a week Ensure the timely and accurate capture, workflow and distribution of documentation.   Our Team  At Bayside Council, we are committed to a positive, flexible and supportive workplace culture, where our people and customers feel respected and valued. We are proud to serve our community through operating with transparency, integrity and in the best interests of the Bayside community to deliver exceptional service.     About the Role  The IT Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that IT projects are delivered successfully and adherence to the Bayside Council project management framework.  They work to manage project scope, budgets, and timelines, while also leading project teams and communicating with stakeholders to ensure everyone is aligned and informed about project progress and risks.   About You  The Project Manager is responsible for the following:  Manage successful project delivery of technology projects aligned to an established roadmap and project management framework. Provide a productive, results-oriented, safe and collaborative work environment, promoting and modelling high standards of conduct and behaviour. Setting clear expectations, performance standards, values and behaviours that are integral to the fabric of an outstanding organisation. Develop project plans and coordinate resources to ensure outcomes are achieved within agreed scope, tolerances, and to high standards. Manage changes and risks/issues involved with project delivery. Deliver regular executive level status reporting on project progress.   Our Benefits and Culture  As an organisation, we pride ourselves in offering a flexible working environment centred on delivering great outcomes for our customers, whether internal or external. Bayside Council has a strong culture of collaboration and delivering exciting new initiatives for our community.  On top of the competitive salary, our people enjoy;  3 extra days off during Christmas each year 15 days sick leave each year 2 days health and wellbeing leave Gym membership discounts Additional parental leave entitlements for both parents   Apply Now  Before submitting your application, please take the time to read the job description.  Your application should include an up-to-date resume (max 3 pages) and a covering letter including your skills and experience (max 2 pages).  Applications must be submitted by email to recruitment@bayside.nsw.gov.au.In the Subject Line please quote F24/404 IT Project Manager  Deadline: Tuesday 20 August 2024  Salary Range: $108,863 - $121,927 per annum plus 11.5% superannuation  Enquiries: Kim Pallesen, Lead IT Project Delivery at kim.pallesen@bayside.nsw.gov.au  Applicants may be required to satisfactorily undertake a Criminal History Check, Medical and/or Working with Children Check in accordance with the position.  We are an equal opportunity employer committed to an equitable, diverse and socially inclusive work environment.
