column3: The Solution and Integration Architect is key member of the IT Planning and Delivery Team at Townsville City Council
column13: Full Time Permanent opportunity available (9 Day Fortnight)  Formal qualifications and/or considerable demonstrated experience in the disciplines of Service Management (ITIL), The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF) and Project Management.  LGO7 ($103,497 - $109,840 per annum + superannuation) based on skills, qualifications and experience.   Why Choose Us  Townsville City Council is the largest local government authority in Northern Australia. We are committed to creating value by growing Townsville through driving economic diversity and generating an enriching lifestyle.  Our organisation provides and maintains close to $9 billion worth of community assets including water and wastewater network and treatment plants, bridges, drainage, roads, waste management, community facilities, sporting venues and more.  We contribute to an active lifestyle for our residents and visitors through events, providing recreational facilities, protecting the natural environment and heritage, while creating a mentally and physically healthy city.  We are driving economic diversity and cultivating an enriching lifestyle, growing a city for this and future generations by building a vibrant, sustainable and innovative city.  Council’s vision is for Townsville to be a connected, lifestyle driven and innovation focused city while continuing to deliver service excellence and to be led by our community to create an exciting today and future.  Our Vision: A globally connected community driven by lifestyle and nature.  Our Purpose: Grow Townsville  Our Values: Safety, Excellence, Respect, Value, Enjoyment  About the Role  The Solution and Integration Architect is key member of the IT Planning and Delivery Team which establishes and maintains oversight of the Council’s approach to the use of information, digital services, and associated technology, contributing to the IT Strategy which ensures compliance between business strategies, enterprise transformation activities and technology directions.  About You  The Solution and Integration Architect will have comprehensive experience in evaluation and adoption of emerging IT technology, development of systems architectures and effective solutions for diverse and complex business requirements, leading internal and external multidiscipline, high-performance work teams/groups to deliver outcomes.   Formal qualifications and/or considerable demonstrated experience in the disciplines of Service Management (ITIL), The Open Group Architecture Framework (TOGAF) and Project Management with a minimum 10 years’ relevant industry experience with a minimum of 5 years’ experience in a similar position.  How to Apply  Your application can be submitted through the 'Apply' button. Please include a cover letter (maximum 2 pages), outlining how your skills, qualifications and experience would allow you to achieve success in this role. We also will require your resume and attached copies of any licences and qualifications as per the key requirements of the role.  For further information review the Position Description.   Closing Date:  11.45pm, Monday 19th August 2024  What We Offer  17.5% annual leave loading  Up to 5 weeks annual leave Up to 3 weeks Personal/Carers Leave 14 weeks paid Parental Leave Domestic and Family Violence Leave Natural Disaster Leave Up to *13.5% Superannuation employer contribution for contributing members Salary Sacrifice opportunities Learning and Development opportunities Fitness Passport program offering discounted membership to selected gym, pool, and yoga facilities Employee Loyalty Program offering discounts at selected local businesses Employee Assistance Program  * The Council contribution to employees' superannuation for contributing employees shall be 13.5% of the employees' ordinary time earnings subject to the employee contributing a minimum of 6% of their ordinary time earnings.  We are committed to creating a safe and inclusive workplace where diverse styles, backgrounds, experiences, and perspectives are valued, encouraged, and respected. People from diverse backgrounds (including but not limited to, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander, people with diverse gender identities and sexualities, people from different cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability, and veterans) are encouraged to apply!  If you need any adjustments to be made to the recruitment process or if you would like to discuss any accessibility requirements, please contact hr_recruitment@townsville.qld.gov.au or phone 07 4727 9004 for a confidential discussion.

column3: Join our fun and dedicated team at DLi as an ICT Manager! Drive tech innovation, support our mission and make a real difference.
column13: Fast growing dynamic organisation. Work in a collaborative fun and passionate team. Supportive organisation: Flexibility, Career Development, Remuneration and a focus on wellbeing.   About Us  DLi is a leading provider of disability support services in South Australia. For more than 40 years, we have supported South Australians to live the life they choose through a broad range of services. We deliver these services with knowledge, experience, diligence, and enthusiasm. Services include:  Supported Independent Living In-home Support Behaviour Support Short Term and Medium-Term Accommodation Lifestyle and community Participation programs  Our clients also benefit from our mature approach to disability service provision through our Quality and Safeguarding Team which is responsible for driving a culture of industry best practice and compliance within the organisation, setting us apart from our competitors. The team provides specialist NDIS, psychological and legal compliance advice and support to our staff, managers, team leaders and support workers, ensuring that our clients best interest are at the centre of everything we do at all times and our service delivery is of the highest standards.   Our highly trained, person-centered team is equipped with the necessary resources to fulfill our client’s needs seamlessly. From the initial onboarding process to the delivery of our services, clients have a designated point of contact, ensuring continuity and personalised assistance at every step.  Our Values  Everything we do at DLi is underpinned by our values. These are:  Impactful: We have a positive impact, supporting people to thrive and succeed. Joyful: We create a positive environment, taking great delight in supporting others to flourish. Connected: We take the time to build strong connections so that people feel supported, valued & safe. Supportive: We are kind, understanding and encouraging of people’s goals and aspirations Genuine: We are sincere, honest, respectful and fair.  Your Role  You will have strong interpersonal and relationship building skills with a proven ability to build and maintain collaborative relationships with a wide range of internal and external stakeholders. You are a leader who has a capacity to mentor, empower staff. You will also bring:   Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology or related field is highly desirable. Minimum 5 years’ experience in a senior ICT position and proven experience. managing ICT infrastructure and services. Demonstrated ability to provide sound advice on complex ICT matters. Experience in negotiating and communicating with all levels of management, colleagues and contracted service providers. Well-developed ability to monitor the external and internal environments and proactively seek opportunities to enhance DLi’s operations . Maintain oversight and licence currency of programs and applications utilised by the organisation including Office 365 and Salesforce Customer Relationship Manager Program (Lumary) and HR Information System (Sage). Experience within the NDIS, aged care, health, human services and broader not for profit  sector will be well regarded.   Role Requirements  A Working with Children Check NDIS Worker Screening Check Evidence of right to work in Australia Australian Driver’s Licence Completion of the NDIS Quality, Safety & You Orientation Module Occasional after hours and weekend work may be required  What's in it for you?  You will get the opportunity to work in a values-led organisation with a supportive family-friendly environment. At DLi, we offer you training and professional development, a competitive salary, and attractive salary sacrifice options. You will be joining DLi as we continue to build our services in line with our new strategic growth plan. Most importantly, a role where you see the difference you are making!  WFH, hybrid and flexible working environment. Salary Packaging Benefits of up to $15,899 per year, tax free. An additional pre-tax benefit of up to $2,650 per year to pay for meals and entertainment. Employee Assistance and Wellbeing Program – counselling services for staff and immediate family members. Training through our trusted providers. City fringe with on-site parking.  DLi is an Equal Opportunity Employer with a diverse workforce. DLi is committed to improving and sustaining employment outcomes for people from diverse backgrounds.  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people from different cultural backgrounds and people with disabilities are encouraged to apply.  We are on an exciting journey, and we invite you to apply to join us on the ride!  For further information about the role please contact our People & Culture team at recruitment@dli.org.au

column3: Deliver high level technology-based consultancy, services and solutions that support the team and unit manager to achieve results. Permanent role!
column13: The Technical Consultant delivers high level technology-based consultancy, services and solutions that support the team and unit manager to achieve results.  Within this context the Technical Consultant works to resolve both routine and complex operational issues with respect to installations, maintenance, upgrades, commissioning, modification, design, development, testing, implementation, and the evaluation of diverse systems, applications and processes. In achieving this, the role adheres to agreed standards and operating procedures and as necessary undertakes research and analysis to inform day to day operations, system design and project direction.  The Role  In line with established policy and procedures, provide technical support to meet customer requirements and improve the customer experience with respect to systems, applications, platforms and languages. Activities may encompass IT support, installations, testing, deploying, upgrading, remote monitoring, scripting, system administration or business as usual (BAU) including desktop, mobile devices, videoconferencing, servers and communications. Identify, develop and implement creative technical solutions by undertaking research, analysis and testing. Interpret guidelines, systems and processes to find alternative approaches to resolve operational problems and share ideas, techniques and proposals with the team. Deliver services and support in accordance with service level agreements, standards or project requirements and contribute to the maintenance of supporting documentation. Liaise with vendors and service providers as directed and ensure customers understand how to effectively utilise infrastructure, systems, tools and processes. Source, verify and provide clear high-level technical advice to management, customers and stakeholders on routine operational matters. Work with one or more teams to support projects, BAU and change initiatives. When delivering technical tasks or projects, ensure that agreed targets, milestones, outcomes and standards are met. Contribute to a culture of high performance and teamwork within the business unit and wider branch by adopting a collaborative, consultative and cooperative approach. Fostering productive partnerships with colleagues, customers and stakeholders supports the achievement of positive results.  Note: - Please refer to the Statement of Duties for all the selection criteria of this position to address in your application.  Please enter 3 dot points you wish to highlight about the hospital/site/area/team:  Working as a part of a small team within Support North West. Covering the North West region including the North West Regional Hospital, Mersey Community Hospital, Primary Health North West, Ambulance Services, Mental Health, Oral Health Services. A diverse role including technical and leadership work.  Details of Appointment  Permanent full time day worker position working 76 hours per fortnight, commencing as soon as possible.  *notwithstanding hours may be negotiated with the successful applicant  Applicants should note that, for a period of twelve months from the date of publication, this selection process may be used to fill subsequent or similar full time and part time vacancies.  Salary: $104,756 - $118,730 per annum. Our Employer 11.5% superannuation contribution is on top of this amount.  Salary range is in accordance with Public Sector Unions Wages Agreement 2022  Eligibility:  Applicants should note the following criteria are desirable:  Appropriate qualifications in ICT or related discipline  Industry recognised certifications  Current Driver’s Licence  The Head of the State Service has determined that the person nominated for this job is to satisfy a pre‑employment check before taking up the appointment, on promotion or transfer. The following checks are to be conducted:  Conviction checks in the following areas: crimes of violence sex related offences serious drug offences crimes involving dishonesty Identification check Disciplinary action in previous employment check.  How to Apply  Apply Online.  Please click the "Apply" button on this screen.  This ensures important questions about you are answered.   You will be prompted to complete a 1-2 page application outlining your experience, skills and knowledge as they relate to the attached Statement of Duties.  Please note:  We do not require a separate statement addressing the selection criteria. All attachments must be in Microsoft Word or PDF format. Referee details are submitted as part of the online application so make sure you have the contact details of two referees before applying.  Download the Statement of Duties and any Associated Documents  We encourage you to review the Applicant Guide and Statement of Duties prior to applying for an overview of the duties, program, selection process and selection criteria.  Statement of Duties   527460, 517725, 517719 Technical Consultant (Client Services) ICT3 (July 2023) CSU.pdf  527460, 517725, 517719 Technical Consultant (Client Services) ICT3 (July 2023) CSU.pdf  Applicant Guide  Department of Health - Applicant Guide June 22.pdf Department of Health - Applicant Guide June 22.docx  For more information   Alan Tuff  Position: Acting Manager North/North West Support Phone:  0400 564 006 E-mail: alan.tuff@health.tas.gov.au  Important information  The email account you provide when submitting job applications will be used in correspondence to you.  It is important that this is kept up to date and monitored regularly.  To update your email address (or contact number), log in to www.jobs.tas.gov.au and look for “Existing applicant login” where you can update your details  The Department of Health values workforce diversity and recognises the value each person offers which is shaped by their unique characteristics, background, experiences, knowledge, skills, values and perspectives.

column3: The City of Ballarat is looking for a Coordinator ICT Program to join our growing IT team
column13: Position Objectives  The Coordinator ICT Program is responsible for a number of outcomes:  Planning, coordinating and delivering ICT Projects and programs within ICT portfolio including vendor/partner run initiatives. Responsible to establish and deliver a program roadmap of initiatives that drive benefit for City of Ballarat. Planning, scheduling, monitoring and reporting activities related to the program to ensure each project contributes to the overall success of the portfolio. The position is responsible to identify risks and manage issues with appropriateness of work, identify interdependencies, impact on business activity, deviation from strategic aims, erosion of expected benefit, program staffing and costs. Manage project budgets within the programme of work, monitoring expenditure and costs against delivered and realised benefits as the programme progresses. Manage program resources, expenses and capital costs against project/program forecasts. Develop, lead and maintain strong, collaborative working relationships with Council stakeholders, partners and customers in relation to business improvements and technology project outcomes.Collaborate effectively with the broader project management community to facilitate standardisation through reuse of standards, practices, tools and process for project portfolio delivery. Advocate ePMO methods and tools to deliver a standardised quality of service of portfolio, program and project management.  Qualifications and Experience  Degree or diploma with relevant experience working as a Project Manager, plus post graduate qualifications or qualifications in another field or lesser formal qualifications with extensive and diverse experience or intensive specialist experience. Demonstrable experience in managing and successful delivery of ICT projects and initiatives. Demonstrated understanding of Project Methodology frameworks and processes is essential including Cost models, scheduling, change requests, scope management, issues and risk management, status reporting, and a sound understanding of budgeting and financials. Demonstrated ability to multi-task and to effectively manage multiple projects and actions concurrently.  Key Selection Criteria  Qualifications and experience as listed above. Demonstrated ability and experience in managing multiple complex ICT related projects concurrently, including project scoping, planning, governance, reporting, implementation, and benefits realization using a recognized project management methodology such as AGILE, Prince2 or PMI Demonstrated experience managing, controlling, and reporting on project budgets, including assisting project sponsors with understanding total cost of ownership and return on investment. Extensive experience in conducting EOI and/or Tender commercial negotiations with vendors and management of the vendor/client organisation interface throughout the Project lifecycle. Strong leadership, people management and team building skills to effectively lead cross functional project teams. Excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills  To apply for this position please click on the Apply button and submit your application. The closing date for this position is 20 August 2024.  Please ensure that you provide your cover letter and current resume together with responding to the Key Selection Criteria.  The successful applicant will be required to undergo a full employment medical and police check.   For any additional questions, please contact Sonny Shah– sonnyshah@ballarat.vic.gov.au.    The City of Ballarat is an equal opportunity employer committed to providing a safe and inclusive working environment that embraces and values diversity, flexibility and child safety. We welcome applications from all walks of life and celebrate the diversity and richness this brings to our workplace and reasonable adjustments will be made to the process to ensure equitable access. We undertake an employment screening process to ensure this commitment is upheld, this includes ensuring the successful candidate holds a valid working with children check and satisfactory criminal history record check.

column3: As IT Services Manager, lead a team to deploy transformational integration with an operational focus. Ensure the best outcomes for at risk youth.
column13: The Organisation  Marist180 has 515 permanent staff with 250 casuals, working across 69 houses and four main office hubs. Marist180 is one of the larger providers for services to youth at risk in Australia today.   The Opportunity  Reporting to the Chief Financial Officer, as IT Services Manager you will be responsible for:  Network security, data integrity, software development, and hardware maintenance; Working closely with other departments to identify, recommend, implement, and support cost-effective technology solutions; Development of a roadmap for the organisation’s IT structure and investment for the next 2-5 years; Management of IT vendors to ensure the best return on investment for IT spend; Transformational systems integration and operational focus to ensure the best outcomes for at risk youth; and Developing and upskilling a small team of enthusiastic IT support staff.  About You  For this appointment, you will be an experienced IT Services Manager with the following skills:  Outstanding leadership and people management expertise; Superior relationship and stakeholder management skills especially well-developed negotiation and influencing capabilities; Proven vendor management experience; Demonstrable expertise in IT strategic planning including the assessment of current systems and the provision of an integrated cost-effective IT solution that provides one single view of their clients; Capability to provide system and support services 24/7 across geographically dispersed sites; Well-developed analytical skills to enable evidence-based decision-making by the executive team; Experience managing and resolving complex IT incidents; Proven experience fostering a culture of continuous improvement and innovation in IT practices; and Ability to represent Marist180 reflecting their values and ethics.  What’s on Offer  This exciting opportunity offers the:  Opportunity to use your IT skills to support the integration of IT services to provide one single view of their clients; The opportunity to lead future transformational IT solutions; Being part of an organisation highly committed to providing tailored services to the needs of the individuals they support; and A competitive salary and additional benefits include salary sacrificing packaging options.  How to Apply For a confidential discussion or role related questions, please contact Christine O’Donnell of The Orchard Talent Group on 0419 142 153 or email Christine@orchardtalent.com.au. To apply please submit your current CV via the link. Please note applicants must have a legal right to work in Australia.

column3: A large, multinational company is looking to add an experienced Service Desk Engineer to their Perth-based team.
column13: Position Overview: OUI Recruitment is looking for an experienced Service Desk Engineer to join an internal environment. This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, combining the benefits of remote work and office collaboration. As the first responder, you will provide support for a wide range of issues, ensuring smooth operations and user satisfaction.   Perks:    Flexible working arrangements (work from home). Awesome management and a very supportive leadership team. Career progression, funded certifications, and study support. Senior and collaborative team environment for you to learn from.     Role Responsibilities:    Provide end-user support and troubleshooting for a variety of issues. Troubleshoot M365-related issues (Intune, Teams, SharePoint). Provide hardware and software support. Configure, deploy and maintain desktops, laptops and monitors. Support and troubleshoot network issues, including Wi-Fi and VPN connectivity. Maintain and support printers, scanners, and other peripherals. Perform software installations, updates, and patches. Implement and support IT security measures and protocols. Provide guidance and training to end-users on technology and best practices. Document procedures, configurations, and solutions for future reference. Work autonomously while also being able to seek guidance when necessary. Utilise logical thinking and problem-solving skills to resolve issues effectively.     Qualifications and Skills:     Tafe diploma in IT or equivalent (Bachelor's degree preferred). 3+ years of previous experience in an IT support role. Strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication abilities. Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively. Hold relevant certifications in M365 or Azure (desirable, not essential).     We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. We regret that we can only contact shortlisted candidates. If you are not shortlisted, we encourage you to check out our website for other opportunities or to sign up for job alerts. Please note that applicants must be based in Australia with valid working rights to be considered.  We represent organizations that promote diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.  Email: info@ouirecruitment.com Number: (08) 6219 8033

column3: Join a highly regarded company / Work flexible hours / Work with enterprise level gear / Interviewing now
column13: The Client    Our client is a highly regarded managed service provider based on the South side of Brisbane. Their continuing success has led to a need to bring on a new Level 1/level 2 IT support specialist to work with clients from the Gold Coast upwards.      The Role  We are looking for a passionate junior 1st and 2nd Technical Support specialist to assist with end-to-end management of incidents and service requests either with a first-time fix or escalating to the appropriate party. This role will see you supporting PC, MAC, iPAD’s. Using WorkSpace One MDM and supporting Cisco/Meraki networks.   Training will be provided but we do require a year or two of relevant commercial experience.     Required Skills:  1-2 years’ experience in IT support with at least 12 months as 1st-2nd line (Or similar) Knowledge in Microsoft Products  Previous experience working Meraki networks is an advantage  Demonstrable experience in infrastructure and application support Excellent communication skills are a must  Please note: You must hold a current driver's license and own your own vehicle for this position.   Apply Now    To apply for this opportunity please click on "apply" below or contact Ben Griffiths from Verify Consulting on 0452 214 062 / ben.griffiths@verifyconsulting.com.au

column3: Working in an internal IT department, supporting a single user base. The team is forward-thinking and offers a great place to work.
column13: Position: IT Coordinator   Location:  Perth, CBD   Salary:  $110,000 - $150,000  Job Type: Permanent     Position Overview:  Working in an internal IT department, supporting a single user base. The team is forward-thinking and offers a great place to work; the team is supportive, friendly, and reasonable. Reporting to the Operations Manager, you will be responsible for the day-to-day management of the company's IT. The successful candidate will have a strong background in IT, excellent problem-solving skills, and excellent interpersonal skills.     Perks:  Supporting a friendly user base. Employee recognition scheme. Modern offices, based in a convenient CBD location. Health and wellbeing benefits. Flexible work policies.     Roles Responsibilities:  Oversee day-to-day operations of the IT department, supporting internal users. System administration duties, ensuring optimal performance. Oversee desktop, network, and infrastructure. Setup, installation, and configuration of software and hardware. Plan, execute, and manage IT projects, including migrations, upgrades, and refreshes. Manage relationships with IT vendors and service providers. Coordinate complex projects with external service providers. Implement and maintain security policies and procedures. Maintain and upgrade technical documentation.     Role Requirements:  Office 365, including email, collaboration tools, and license management. Azure, including VM management, Azure AD, and cloud services. Server management, including Windows Server and Linux. Network configuration and management, including routers, switches, and firewalls. Experience with virtualization technologies such as Hyper-V and VMware. Collaboration tools like MS Teams and document management systems like SharePoint. Device management and security using Intune. Backup and recovery solutions, particularly Veeam. Monitor and maintain system performance using system monitoring tools. Project management certifications such as Prince2 are highly regarded. IT management certifications such as ITIL or ITSM are highly regarded.     About You:  Excellent communicator with strong problem-solving skills. Ability to articulate technical concepts to non-technical users. Team player with a collaborative mindset. Strong project and stakeholder management skills.  Self-motivated and proactive. Strong organizational skills with the ability to prioritize and manage time effectively. Adaptable and flexible, with a willingness to learn new technologies and processes.     We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. We regret that we can only contact shortlisted candidates. If you are not shortlisted, we encourage you to check out our website for other opportunities or to sign up for job alerts. Please note that applicants must be based in Australia with valid working rights to be considered.  We represent organizations that promote diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.     Email: info@ouirecruitment.com  Number: (08) 6219 8033

column3: Fixed Term - Full Time (12 months with the possibility of extension)
column13: *UPDATED CLOSING TIME MONDAY 19 AUGUST 2024 AT 9.30AM*     Fixed Term - Full Time (12 months with the possibility of extension)     Only Australian Citizens, Permanent Residents or those with valid working entitlements will be considered     Substantive Equality Statement  Lotterywest and Healthway strive to create a better and healthier Western Australia, where diversity is encouraged, and everyone is respected, welcomed, supported, and treated equally. We value the strength of a diverse workforce and view inclusivity as essential to our success. We are committed to fostering a respectful and inclusive workplace and community that encourages employees to be themselves. We seek and celebrate diversity and encourage applications from all backgrounds and cultures including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, LGBTQIA+ and people with disability.     The Organisation  Lotterywest is the only State Government owned and operated lottery in Australia, where all the available profit is returned to the Western Australian Community through discretionary and statutory grants. Lotterywest has supported the Western Australian community for over 90 years. Its vision for ‘a hopeful, healthy, connected and sustainable community life for all Western Australians’.  Lotterywest is the employing agency for Healthway, which is the only State Government agency dedicated to health promotion. For over 30 years Healthway has been providing grant funding to sport, arts and racing organisations, community activities, and to health promotion projects and research. Healthway’s vision is for a ‘healthy and more active Western Australia.’     What we Offer  By joining the team at Lotterywest, you’ll experience the satisfaction that comes with being part of an organisation that is helping make a positive impact in the community and turns dreams into reality.We believe in flexibility, work-life balance and support, so you can be the best at what you do.  You will have access to several employee benefits including:  A flexible work environment with the ability to purchase leave and negotiate flexible working hours. A commitment to employee professional growth A friendly working environment with a variety of wellness and social activities on offer. Lotterywest’s Head Office is located in the heart of Subiaco, with excellent access to public transport, a range of public parking options and end-of-trip facilities for staff choosing to cycle, run or walk to work.  For the latest updates and to learn more about Lotterywest, follow us on Facebook or visit our website www.lotterywest.wa.gov.au     Job Description  Reporting to the Chief Information Officer the Chief Technology Officer is a senior leader in leading, shaping and delivering connected, integrated, contemporary lottery gaming and e-commerce operations for WA's lotteries and other business needs. The role is also a technology leader within the Gaming System Replacement (GSR) program.  The role has the following key focus areas:  Assures that information and communication systems, policies, processes and procedures meet operational, legislative, security and service delivery requirements and risks effectively assessed and mitigated for business continuity. Ensures that the provision of gaming, business systems and related information and data is timely, secure and efficient, utilising innovative, effective, efficient and contemporary solutions to improve the overall performance and delivery of business outcomes consistent with Government policy on Information Communication Technology (ICT).     The focus of this role centres on ensuring the availability, security, reliability, supportability, usability and quality of corporate and gaming operations. This is inclusive and not limited to:  Gaming, Healthway and key corporate environments, including digital presence across website and mobile solutions. Retailor Technical Operational environments. Data centres and cloud environments. Directing and managing the delivery of key requirements through vendor relationships with providers, inclusive of contract compliance responsibilities. Identifying, escalating and addressing issues, risks and matters that may affect Lotterywest's 24/7 Operations.     Mandatory / special role requirements  Police Clearance     Selection Criteria  Substantial experience in technical operation and delivery of complex enterprise solutions in a 24/7 operating environment. Demonstrated experience in e-commerce and technology transformation programs where legacy systems are replaced with contemporary solutions. Demonstrated experience in monitoring the performance of ICT contracts, engaging with vendors and ensuring the delivery of services to agreed standards, and performance and ongoing growth of relationships. Demonstrated comprehensive understanding of contemporary ICT issues, trends and requirements, including translating understanding into the design of effective contract, commercial and vendor governance requirements.     Required Qualifications:  Possession of a Bachelor's Degree in Information Technology (IT) or other relevant discipline. Possession of or progress towards a formal qualification in project and contract management. Knowledge of the Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) concerning information technology services     Leadership Context  Leadership Expectations provides a common understanding of the mindsets and expected behaviours required of all our employees and the public sector.     The leadership context for this role is Leading Leaders.     Want to know more?  For full details of the role and what we are looking for you are encouraged to click the Apply button which will take you to the JobsWA Board. Please refer to the job pack for instructions on how to apply.     Suitable applicants may be considered for future similar employment opportunities during the next twelve (12) months at Lotterywest.     For Further Job Related Information  Enquiries about the role can be directed to Caroline Niewiarowski-Fish, Chief Information Officer on (08) 9488 6245.     Join Lotterywest  Applicants are required to apply online and need to submit the following documents in Word or PDF format only:  A current resume/CV A cover letter of no more than two (2) pages addressing the Selection Criteria and the Leadership Context.  To submit your application, please click on the Apply for the job button.  Our People and Culture team are happy to help if you need assistance on (08) 9488 6228.  Unfortunately, we can’t accept late applications so please allow yourself enough time to complete your application before the due date and time     Protecting your Privacy  Lotterywest will only contact you from the official @lotterywest.wa.gov.au domain. If you receive any emails from any other domain asking for your personal information, you should not respond to them. If you receive what appears to be Lotterywest communications not from the official domain, please send an email with the details to HumanResourceServices@lotterywest.wa.gov.au

column3: Exceptional opportunity for an experienced CIO to provide innovation and strategic leadership within a complex healthcare environment.
column13: Play a crucial role in the ICT journey and transformation in Queensland Health  Strategic leadership role Significant change agenda Regional lifestyle benefits  Wide Bay Hospital and Health Services (WBHHS) is situated in one of Queensland’s most iconic and naturally beautiful regions at the gateway to the Southern Great Barrier Reef. It is a leading healthcare provider in Queensland, responsible for the delivery of public hospital and health services. The Health Service provides acute care services to a population of over 225,000 residents including several rural communities.  Reporting to the Executive Director Finance & Performance, you will work closely with the Board, Chief Executive, and the Executive Leadership team to design and implement digital strategies that align with WBHHS’s vision for an efficient, innovative, and sustainable healthcare service, including the digital strategy and implementation for the new $1,2 billion hospital being built in Bundaberg. Other areas of focus will be cyber security, integration of clinical monitoring and assessment, virtual care and electronic medical records across the service.  Key Responsibilities:  Provide expert analysis and advice to the Board, Chief Executive, and Executive Leadership team on digital technologies and trends. Design and execute a strategic vision for digital capabilities, including virtual care, smart hospitals, business intelligence, and various clinical, operational, and administrative systems. Lead the development and implementation of the Cyber Security Strategy and Information Security Management System (ISMS). Drive the organisation-wide data strategy, ensuring timely and actionable insights for strategic and operational service delivery. Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, including Queensland Health, to promote and influence digital transformation initiatives. Establish and manage governance arrangements for effective delivery of ICT and IM services, ensuring alignment with WBHHS and Queensland Health objectives. Foster a culture of continuous improvement, professional development, and innovation within the ICT and IM team.   Qualifications and Requirements:  Tertiary qualifications in information technology, business, commerce, or a related field, and/or equivalent experience. Senior management or executive-level leadership and experience is highly desirable. Ability to work across various WBHHS facilities. Class C motor vehicle licence. Immunisation against Hepatitis B and assessment for Tuberculosis (TB) risk as per Queensland Health guidelines.   The position is an ongoing, fulltime role which can be based at Bundaberg, Hervey Bay or Maryborough.  This is a truly unique opportunity to provide innovation and leadership to deliver digital solutions that are fit for purpose and meet internal and external stakeholder needs now and into the future. Please contact Kim Gillespie, Senior Consultant via kimg@ccentric.com.au or on +61 406 551 917 for a confidential discussion and/or to receive a candidate information pack.

column1: Senior Manager, IT Platforms and Architecture
column3: An exciting permanent opportunity in RT Health as a Senior Manager- IT Platforms and Architecture
column13: At RT Heath, we’re all about community. It’s the reason we were founded back in 1889 and it’s why we’re still here today supporting more than 48,000 hardworking Aussies across the rail, transport and energy industries. Australia’s first registered health fund and proudly not for profit, we’ve spent 130+ years supporting our members with great value health cover and a level of care that we’re known for. We’re now a proud division of HCF, Australia’s largest not-for-profit health fund but we remain focused on our commitment to support hardworking men, women and families on their health journeys.  Our members come first. Always.  As the Senior Manager of RT Health’s IT platforms team, you will play a pivotal role in ensuring the smooth functioning of the RT health IT platform. You will lead a team responsible for managing and optimising IT for corporate and member services including datacentre, cyber security, cloud, network, storage and compute elements. Your hands on expertise will contribute to enhancing efficiency, performance and security of the platform.  Key Tasks:  Work with the head of technology to develop strategic technical solutions to meet business requirements. Develop and maintain a comprehensive IT platform architecture that aligns with the objectives of RT Health. Ensure the architecture across cloud, on-prem and hybrid environments is secure and compliant with governance and compliance requirements. Implementation and management of on-prem and cloud platform solutions that are resilient and secure in line with business service levels. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure seamless design of technical solutions. Stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies relevant to private health insurance. Ensure RT Health complies with all relevant APRA prudential standards including CPS234 and CPS230. Maintain current knowledge of federal & state privacy & security laws & regulations, plus industry best practices (e.g., Cyber Security, ISO, APRA, OAIC, and GDPR). Motivate and lead a team of system administrators and support analysts responsible for platform support and maintenance. Conduct regular vendor assessments to assess the security and performance as well as address any issues. Assess risks associated with platform changes, upgrades, and migrations. Implement robust change management processes to minimise disruptions  Essentials:  Minimum 5 years’ experience managing a complex IT platform involving network, storage and compute infrastructure systems. Microsoft Azure IaaS architecture including Virtual Machines, App Services, Firewalls, and Application Gateways. Microsoft 365 design and architecture including Exchange Online, SharePoint Online, Teams, Purview and Defender. Microsoft Intune experience including compliance policies and configuration profiles. Experience in PowerShell scripting at an intermediate level to assist in automation and maintenance of tasks. Experience managing a SEIM and handling security incidents. Experience operating a vulnerability management platform. Experience managing a backup and disaster recovery solution with proven experience in disaster recovery planning and testing. Experience in Windows server design and architecture including SQL, IIS, NPS, Exchange, File and Print. Hands on experience in datacentre operations including management of multipathing, power distribution and diverse networks. Experience in network design and architecture including experience with SD-WAN, 802.1x and VPN. Experience maintaining information security and managing information assets for confidentiality, integrity and availability. Must have understanding and experience in supplier governance. Demonstrable ability to research and implement innovative solutions to improve security, operational efficiency, quality, and service levels. Possess knowledge of information technology security principles & methods (e.g. firewalls, encryption). Knowledge of risk management processes.  Desirable:  Relevant security certification such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Information Security Manager (CISM), Certified Cloud Security Professional (CCSP). Microsoft, VMWARE, Dell, Azure, Office 365. Exposure to CRM systems such as Salesforce, ZOHO Knowledge & experience with implementing and maintaining policy, process and controls for APRA CPS231 (Outsourcing), APRA CPS234 (Information Security), CPS234 (BCP), CPS 220 (Risk Management)  Culture & Benefits  We’re all about creating a fantastic people experience, guided by our values, so that we can in turn better deliver for our members. We work with our people to create a work experience that is inclusive, supportive, safe and respectful so we can do the best for our members.  50% subsidy on HCF Private Health Insurance 18 weeks Parental Leave for all genders 6 additional leave days to support your wellbeing and medical needs Mental Health & Wellbeing programs Discounts to pet, life, travel and general insurance Come and join our HCF team!  A career with us  Please check out our website at https://www.hcf.com.au/about-us/careers  At HCF, we are dedicated to fostering an inclusive and collaborative work environment that upholds our core values. We look for the human in each other and use that to guide what we do and how we do it. HCF takes pride in our diverse workforce and inclusive workplace culture and we celebrate the richness of perspectives brought by individuals with different backgrounds and experiences, including age, ethnicity, cultural or spiritual background, gender identity, disability, education, and socio-economic status.  All suitably qualified applicants will receive fair and equitable consideration for employment. If you require any adjustments to assist you in making your application or throughout the selection or onboarding process, please reach out to vacancy@hcf.com.au and we will make every effort to assist you.

column3: Elevate your career—apply now to become a key player as a Network Specialist with us!
column13: ABOUT THE ROLE:  Kinetic IT are searching for an experienced Technical Specialist in Cisco Networking to join our team. If you’re self-motivated and enjoy working collaboratively, this role is for you.  You’ll be part of our managed services delivery team, working onsite with our customer based in Canberra. Your role will involve providing strong technical leadership, mentoring your teammates, and building positive relationships with clients and stakeholders.  KEEN TO GET INVOLVED? YOU’LL JUST NEED SOME OF THE FOLLOWING:  Experience configuring and managing Cisco routers, switches, and firewalls. Experience with Cisco IOS, IOS-XE, ISE and DNAC Knowledge of TCP/IP, OSPF, EIGRP, BGP, VLANs, and NAT. Network security expertise with firewalls and VPNs. Experience with F5 BIG-IP for load balancing and application delivery. Capable of handling complex ICT systems and providing senior-level support. Availability to participate in the On Call roster - 1 in 3 weeks throughout the year, with flexibility to support afterhours on an ad hoc basis Driving improvements and innovation. Building and maintain trusted partner relationships. Strong written communication for clear documentation. Understanding of ITIL Framework.  ADDITIONAL REQUIREMENTS:  Active Australian Government security clearance (essential) Cisco and network certifications ITIL certification (desirable) Ability to work to an on-call roster, and flexibility  Don’t meet every requirement? Don’t worry, we’d still love to hear from you!  At Kinetic IT we value diversity and are actively seeking candidates with varied backgrounds. In selecting the right person for this role, we will consider your skills and experience as well as your personal qualities, attitude and potential for development.  THE KINETIC IT DIFFERENCE  Flexible working, paid parental leave, and other benefits tailored to your individual goals Regular fun company and social events – Sundowner, Family Fun Day, Quiz Night and End of Year Party Vendor Exam Support, ITIL V4 Training and Communities of Practice groups Dedicated professional development reviews every 6 months, with monthly follow ups An open and supportive culture where we respect all people and individuals, and everyone has a voice  ABOUT KINETIC IT  We are recognised market leaders in the delivery of high-quality technology solutions to large public, private, and government organisations.  As an Australian-owned company, we take a lot of pride in delivering exceptional service that exceeds our customers’ expectations and positively contributing to our industry and community.  We hire for the long term and have a strong focus on training and developing our employees.  Everyday our amazing 1,300+ crew come to Kinetic IT not just to work but to be challenged, grow and be part of something bigger.  HOW TO APPLY  First, check out our website Kineticit.com.au. If you like what you see then, Click the ‘Apply Now’ button. You can also send your CV direct to on careers@kineticit.com.au and quote WWREQ0026987

column3: Stand alone role, providing expertise on IT Audit and Risk and reporting in to the CTO.
column13: Position Overview:  We are seeking a highly skilled IT Risk and Audit Professional for a blue chip company in Perth. This role reports directly to the CTO and is not for the faint-hearted-it's a challenging, high-profile position that demands expertise in IT risk management and audit standards, exceptional communication skills, and the ability to perform under pressure. You will be the go-to expert, confidently addressing complex questions from multiple panels, including external audit committees, and will play a pivotal role in enhancing the maturity of the risk environment.  You will confidently present and respond to inquiries from various panels, demonstrating a deep understanding of the risk landscape and audit requirements across a complex group of companies. In collaboration with the Cyber Manager, you will work to develop and enhance the maturity of the IT risk environment, ensuring that practices align with industry standards and best practices.  Your role will see you providing strategic insights and recommendations on risk management and audit processes and acting as a trusted advisor to senior management. You will need to convey complex risk and audit information clearly and concisely, ensuring that all stakeholders, including senior management and external audit committees, are fully informed and engaged.  Qualifications & Experience:  The ideal candidate will be big 4 trained, with experience in reporting to the highest audit and risk management standards. You should have strong experience within the information security field, with hands-on experience conducting risk and compliance activities in IT environments. You must be able to think on your feet and provide quick, accurate responses in high-pressure situations.  A degree in a relevant field is required, and security or risk specialist qualifications, such as CISSP or CISM, are a distinct advantage.  Why Apply  This role offers a unique opportunity to work in a highly visible and challenging environment where your expertise will directly impact the organization's risk and audit standards. If you thrive in a fast-paced, complex environment and are ready to take on a key role in IT risk and audit, we want to hear from you.   For more information or a confidential discussion, please contact Jilly Mcilchere on jilly.mcilchere@peoplebank.com.au or 08 94231404 quoting reference 263201    To apply please click the 'Apply Now' button.     Diversity and inclusion are strongly supported at Peoplebank. People of all nationalities, gender identities, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, are encouraged to apply.

column3: Permanent opportunity for a Desktop support person to join a growing team supporting a business going through a large transformation.
column13: About The Company Operating in the Aged Care and Health care industry this organisation provide a full range of health care services including at home care, aged care, retirement villages and dementia care etc.    Currently underway are several new initiatives and transformation projects. This has resulted in the development of a Transformation Office that is responsible for driving a range of strategic initiatives focused on enhancing organisational and operational capability, with a key focus on technology-enabled business solutions.    About The role This is a desktop support role where you will be working and solving issues and problems with users in the office., It will therefore be an office-based role. This role will be to resolve L1/L2 desktop issues. The Sys Admin, Security, Projects, Applications support etc. is all done by either an MSP or the Senior Sys Admins, Technical Engineers and Applications support team but these tasks will offer career progression.    Responsibilities  Deliver high standards of IT deskside support to users across a wide range of systems, technologies and platforms. Provide quality technical support and outstanding customer service to the entire organisation Complete end user Incident support and Service Request tasks consistently and methodically to ensure supported to industry-leading standards. Work collaboratively with both technical and non-technical colleagues to identify, detect and resolve issues at their core. Proactively liaise with third party providers to ensure timely service and support outcomes for the organisation. Troubleshoot and diagnose problems in line with business priorities Assist in project work (as directed by your line manager/management team) at a level appropriate to skill-set. Document all support activities and maintain accurate records to assist in building the IT knowledge-base. Continuously evaluate and assist in providing enhancements to IT support processes and procedures    Skills and experience   High level of customer service experience to internal and external customers. Ability to be able to identify and resolve client issues in a timely and proactive manner. Ability to provide consistent collaborative and high-quality support to the IT team. Ability to provide outstanding customer service to the Organisation. Sound technical understanding and demonstrated success in desk-side and/or Service Desk roles. Experience supporting a wide range of IT environments, systems and platforms. Experience working in an ITIL aligned / compliance driven environment. This role offers the opportunity to work on a collaborative and consultative team environment where you will be supported and where creativity in encouraged. You will be exposed top working alongside execs through to techies with a structured career path.    For more information call Paul Thomson on 0415176085 or send your resume to paul.t@muraconnect.com.au

column3: Permanent Full-Time IT Test Lead, you'll enhance our testing practices, mentor a team of testers, and oversee test planning.
column13: About the role   In this role, you will be instrumental in establishing and enhancing testing practices within the organisation. You will play an important role in ensuring that testing activities align with industry best practices. As the IT Test Lead, you will guide and mentor other testers working on different IT projects, providing them with the support and knowledge to excel in their roles. You will also actively participate in test planning and execution across multiple IT products, developing and implementing testing strategies, methodologies, and processes to ensure the quality and reliability of IT systems and applications.  Work type: Permanent Full-Time Classification: Band 8 ($115,035 - $127,911 pa plus super)  Key responsibilities include:  Recommending professional IT Testing advice and solutions to various stakeholders. Researching and analysing IT Testing best practices to deliver impactful solutions. Facilitating innovation and best practices in the department to enhance customer and community satisfaction. Developing and maintaining strategic networks with relevant key stakeholders. Implementing best practice processes for conducting testing activities. Creating and documenting test plans for functional and non-functional requirements. Coordinating the activities and efforts of testers across multiple projects. Mentoring and coaching internal testers and stakeholders on best practices. Managing testing environments for proper configuration. Providing regular reports on testing progress, outcomes, and metrics. Collaborating with Project Managers to develop Test Strategies and Test Plans. Supervising and guiding the development of Test Cases, assisting with defect resolution, and conducting end-to-end testing. Supporting Project Managers in identifying and scoping change requests. Participating in retrospective meetings to discuss successes and failures in testing processes and identify areas for improvement.  About you To be successful in this role, you will have:  Strong written and verbal communication skills. Experience in leading the Test and QA practice and coaching/mentoring other test analysts. Demonstrated people skills to support, influence, and collaborate with relevant stakeholders. Well-developed problem-solving and stakeholder management skills. Strong knowledge of software testing methodologies and tools. Experience with automation testing tools and frameworks. Proficiency in test management software and QA methodologies. Working knowledge of SQL and scripting.  Essential Experience:  A tertiary qualification in IT, Business, or similar fields. Significant professional experience as a Test Lead or Senior Tester, preferably within a Local Government or Public Sector setting. Hands-On experience in development and execution of detailed test plans and test case. Experience in setting up testing practices and mentoring others in a similar capacity. Familiarity with Agile methodologies such as Value stream delivery and DevOps practices.  If this sounds like the role for you, then click apply now!   Child Safety Responsibilities    We are committed to being a child-safe organisation and have zero-tolerance for child abuse. We have specific policies, procedures, and mandatory training in place to support employees, volunteers, and contractors to achieve and adhere to these commitments. Please read our Child Safe Standards Management Policy.    Diversity and Inclusion   At the City we want a workforce that reflects the community we live in. We welcome and embrace everyone, all people with their own unique experiences, and support and encourage all our employees to do their best work, have equal access to opportunities and a just working environment. For this reason, we particularly welcome and encourage applications from First Nations people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds, from the LGBTQIA+ community, people with disability and people of all genders, ages and diverse experience.    Create our future together at the City of Greater Geelong Join the City of Greater Geelong, a community-focused workplace on Wadawurrung Country. We deliver over 130 services to our growing population, striving to make our city a great place to live, work, and study. Our central location for Central Geelong-based employees is the Civic Precinct, Wurriki Nyal, a modern, sustainable, and inclusive workplace, along with our outreach locations.  If you're passionate about inclusivity and community, apply now – we’d love to meet you!  A career with us We support accessibility and encourage discussions about any adjustments or support you may need during the recruitment process.  We offer:  salary sacrificing and novated lease options cultural and ceremonial leave study leave paid parental leave (16 weeks primary and six weeks secondary) and superannuation payments on all 52 weeks primary parental leave IVF, surrogate and miscarriage bereavement leave training and career development opportunities a healthy and safe environment our employee wellbeing program corporate membership rates at Swim Sport and Leisure facilities unlimited access to LinkedIn Learning   Applications and Enquiries  Click the Position Description link to view more information about this position.  Applications close: 11:55pm Tuesday 20th August 2024  Position Description (Word Version)  Position Description (PDF Version)  Enquiries: Iftekhar Siddiqui | iftekhar.siddiqui@geelongcity.vic.gov.au  Click the Apply button to submit your application or find out more about this opportunity. If we can assist you with any reasonable adjustments in order to submit your application for this role, please contact the Talent Acquisition team via email at careers@geelongcity.vic.gov.au noting your preferred method of communication and contact details and a member of the team will be in touch.     We collect demographic data to help us learn who our advertisements are reaching and how we can reach an even more diverse audience.  We are committed to building a more diverse team. Your responses to our demographic questions are strictly confidential and will not be individually shared.

column3: High Salary | Hybrid | Clear career progression | Funded certification | 20 year reputation | Business going through growth | stable & secure
column13: Tektalent has partnered with our client whom are a long-standing & stable family owned IT solutions provider that provide industry leading customer service & technical advice across many verticals, specializing in security & digital transformation.   Our client is growing due to their spectacular customer engagement and are wanting to grow the team by recruiting a permanent Systems Administrator who is at the level 2 - 2.5 capacity, this is not an L3 role, however will grow into one if that is what you want.  Role responsibilities  The purpose of the role as a Systems Admin & Engineer is pivotal in managing and optimizing our clients' IT infrastructure, encompassing systems, networks, cloud, and security Taking escalations from our helpdesk, you will be responsible for delivering reliable and responsive service, focusing on results and happy customers. Get involved, take ownership of different technologies you love, and become the de facto expert.  The tasks encompass a wide spectrum, from daily administration to designing and implementing tailored solutions Reactive Support - Working remotely or onsite, solve IT issues before they become problems in a timely and efficient manner Proactive Support - Analyze client IT environment and determine the best fit solutions, improve system efficiency Informed - Stay up to date with industry standards & accreditation to ensure systems are maintained according to best practices and are secure Team - Collaborate with colleagues to share Knowledge. Mentor junior technicians  Experience required  3 + years’ experience in IT support in an internal or MSP environment  Experience in the following technologies (You don't need experience in all) Microsoft 365 & Azure Cloud technologies, Windows Servers and Desktop, Active Directory, Group Policy, PowerShell, Microsoft Collaboration and Voice Technologies, Virtualization - Hyper-V and or VMware, Backup, Antivirus & Endpoint protection, IP Networking, including LAN, SDN & WAN, Microsoft, HP, Dell, IBM, Ubiquiti & Sophos  Love technology and embrace industry standards BAU support with ad hoc project work Focused on learning and mastering your craft Be passionate about achieving the best results, energetic, forward-thinking, and ready to grow Have a genuine interest in helping clients and understanding their needs, solving problems with technical solutions  Benefits & what is on offer  Hybrid & family friendly work flexibility  Business that is Growing due to high customer demand Customers are focused on the SMB market Easily accessible office that is close to the city & all public transport  Exposure to a variety of clients and industries to keep the role interesting Structured training, mentoring and coaching Interview is short and sweet (Just one round) Weekly personal training group funded by the business Fridge fully stocked with food to cover your weekly lunch & snacks  Monthly team lunch Regular team building / social activities to build culture Clear career progression They encourage their engineers to certify and up-skill, build a career path in a specialization which they will support & fund Direct access to the senior engineers / mentors  Work with the latest tech stack in MS Join a like-minded team that are hungry to learn and grow professionally & personally, a team that want to learn new things & try new technologies     If you are an experienced Systems Administrator / Senior IT Support Engineer, please apply and we will review your application as soon as possible.     Alternatively, you can email chris@tektalent.com.au directly for immediate review.     Tektalent looks forward to hearing from you.     #SCR-chris-brydon

column3: Introduce and drive the adoption of agreed technical standards and design principles in pursuit of designing robust, scalable, and secure solutions
column13: Solutions Architect  Technology & Transformation   Armidale or Port Macquarie based, with flexible arrangements considered for the right applicant  Continuing Opportunity.  About Us   At Regional Australia Bank we feel that being connected with regional Australia and its people is undoubtedly the most exciting and inspiring part of our brand. Being a customer-owned bank, we are a bank with a difference. We work to support our customers and the communities we live in and want to make your experience as a RAB employee a great one.   About this role   As a Solutions Architect, you will ensure the seamless integration and architectural alignment of our banking solutions to support our current and future needs. Your key responsibilities will include:   Application Architecture Strategy & Standards: Develop and enforce technical standards and design principles.  Software Development Life cycle Practice: Enhance and oversee best practices in software development.  Oversight & Leadership: Lead and guide technical teams to achieve robust and scalable solutions.  Solution Design: Design secure, scalable, and innovative solutions.   Further information  For further information or to discuss the role in more detail contact Julie Armstrong, Chief Information Officer via email: jarmstrong@regionalaustraliabank.com.au.   A copy of the position description can be viewed by the Careers section of the Regional Australia Bank website.    To Apply  To express your interest please submit your application including a cover letter and resume outlining why you feel you are suited to this position via the Careers section Regional Australia Bank website.   You must be either Australian citizen or a holder of an Australian Permanent Residency Visa to apply for this position.  Applications close: midnight Sunday 18 August 2024.

column3: Come and join our team as a Materials Tester! Permanent opportunities available.
column13: It's a great time to join the City with our new Certified Agreement in the works! Starting 29 July 2024, we’ll see new pay rates, with a 4.5% bump on 16 October 2024, and another 4% increase on 16 October 2025 (or up to 6.5% if Brisbane CPI is higher). Exciting stuff ahead!     About the team  Located in the Infrastructure Gold Coast Department, The Engineering, Design and Standards Branch is responsible for infrastructure engineering, design, survey, specifications, asset standards, electrical infrastructure and contributed assets across all customer and community facing infrastructure classes.  About your new role  We are seeking to appoint two Materials Testers (banded Federal Level 2-5) to undertake materials testing investigations of Councils structures, roadways, footpaths, waterways, natural environment and stormwater drainage systems with materials testing or local government experience.  You will be required to undertake a range of tasks directly related to construction materials testing in accordance with the scope of the laboratories NATA accreditation, as well as other supporting activities. The successful applicants will be appointed at the appropriate level based on qualifications, skills and experience between Federal Level 2 and 5.  Career progression and development opportunities with the balance of office work and lab/field work.   Key Deliverables of the position:  •    provide field investigation, sampling and laboratory materials testing services (concrete, aggregates, soils, road pavement and surfaces, and pedestrian surfaces) •    record field data and process field and laboratory test data using relevant business software (Microsoft Office suite, SAP) and technical software as required (e.g. ArcGIS, QESTLab) •    use and maintain Materials Testing Laboratory field and laboratory equipment including but not limited to geotechnical drilling and sampling hardware, concrete coring equipment, surface moisture-density gauge, compression testing machine, pendulum friction tester, floor friction tester and handheld GPS •    undertake site set-up and investigation of both open space and road pavement sites including but not limited to test pitting (both manual hand tools and power assisted), geotechnical drilling and testing (SPT, DPP, DCP), borehole logging, field testing and bulk sampling •    develop and maintain open and transparent working relationships between internal and external customers  We're looking for people who have:  The successful applicant will:  •    consult with a range of people and display sound written, interpersonal and oral communication skills. •    work within a team, undertake materials testing activities, set realistic goals and work priorities to ensure deadlines and commitments are met •    have the ability to rapidly acquire knowledge of policies, procedures, systems and legislation relevant to Materials Testing •    white card, MR licence and current Use Licence under the Radiation Safety Act 1999 desired but not essential  Be part of shaping the Gold Coast's future  The Gold Coast is inspired by lifestyle and driven by opportunity. We are the second largest Council in Australia.  We care about being the most flexible government organisation in Australia and have a range of benefits to help you create the right balance:  9-day fortnight Flexible work arrangements to suit your lifestyle, including hybrid/work from home options, flexible working hours and locations Personal and professional development courses Hybrid office / work from home options Access to350+ fitness facilities through Fitness Passport  4 free confidential counselling sessions a year for you or an immediate family member 1 free nutritionist and financial advice session per year  We pride ourselves on our shared mission of being a high-performing, customer-focused organisation which delivers value-for-money services to the community. We're committed to creating a diverse workplace and inclusive culture.  How to apply  Click 'Apply' to submit your online application. Upload your Resume with a Cover Letter (of no more than 2 pages) outlining how your skills, experience and personal attributes would allow you to achieve success in this role.  Documents needs to be less than 2MB in size and PDF format is preferred. If you encounter technical issues when applying, please email recruitment@goldcoast.qld.gov.au  Our selection process may include a one-way video interview via Criteria, a face-to-face or virtual interview via Microsoft Teams, reference checks via Xref and additional checks including police checks, employment history checks, qualification checks, pre-employment medical reviews and drug and alcohol testing.  Applications close 15 August 2024.
