column3: Drive IT infrastructure and security excellence in a cutting-edge, collaborative environment.
column13: Who We’re Looking For:  We are partnering with Hunter Valley Coal Chain Coordinator (HVCCC) to recruit a Platforms Support Specialist. In this role, you will support HVCCC’s IT infrastructure and security, contributing to the efficient delivery of IT services that support all business processes across the organization. You will collaborate closely with the Cyber Security and Infrastructure Specialist to achieve quality, efficiency, and agility goals.  You will enjoy working with a dedicated team that values customer service, continuous improvement, and the development of robust infrastructure and security systems. This is an on-site, permanent role based in Newcastle NSW.    What You Will Be Doing:   Support the delivery of HVCCC’s IT infrastructure and security services. Monitor operational processes, including backups, patching, incident and problem resolution, and change management. Create knowledge base articles and technical documentation to improve support processes. Ensure that infrastructure and security project plans deliver key outcomes on time, within budget, and according to standards. Identify, evaluate, and implement process and system improvements to enhance customer service.    What You’ll Bring:   Relevant tertiary qualification (IT and related fields) with experience in IT service management (ITIL). Proven experience in supporting infrastructure and cyber security in complex environments. Hands-on experience with Azure infrastructure, including IaaS and PaaS components (Storage Accounts, VMs, Azure SQL, VNets). Understanding of NIST and Essential 8 cyber frameworks and DevOps practices. Strong customer focus with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Self-motivated with high-level analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of working independently and managing variable workload demands.    About the Company:  The Hunter Valley Coal Chain Coordinator (HVCCC) is a member-funded, independent logistics organization that coordinates the planning, scheduling, and operational execution of the Hunter Valley Coal Chain. HVCCC provides its members with insights, advice, and analysis to improve efficiency and maximize value from the shared infrastructure of the coal chain.  By joining HVCCC, you are joining a team of people who genuinely live their cultural values. Recognized as an Employer of Choice across NSW , HVCCC supports employee-focused programs and initiatives that make them a great team to work with. They are an innovative organization that uses cutting-edge digital technology to plan, coordinate, monitor, and report on one of the most complex and economically significant supply chains in the world.   Benefits:   Work for Business NSW State Winner Employer of Choice 2023. 10% performance bonus available. A great opportunity to be a member of a dedicated and collaborative IT and security team within a data-driven business. Use the latest infrastructure and security techniques in Microsoft Azure.  What’s next?  Please note this role is on-site, based in Newcastle NSW, and does not provide sponsorship.  This role is being recruited by NewyTechPeople. All applicants will receive a response.  The easiest way to register your interest is to apply using the link. If you’d like to have a chat before applying, please contact Ellen Bennett at ellen@newytechpeople.com.au.

column3: We're seeking a skilled IT professional who will be responsible for supporting our important SaaS business applications.
column13: About Us:  Welcome to The Perth Mint, where golden career opportunities await.   The Perth Mint is an iconic Western Australian organisation operating on a truly global scale. Situated in East Perth for 125 years, The Perth Mint is a premier tourist destination, an award-winning exporter, and a key supplier of precious metals to markets throughout the world.  There’s no organisation quite like it, with a variety of roles available, from engineers and chemists to artists and technicians.   Foster your fascination and pride in our work. Get inspired every day by the world-class precious metal products we work together to refine, design, produce and then distribute all over the globe. Connect to the rich history of our industry in a workplace firmly rooted in the present — as leaders in sustainability and inclusion.  At The Perth Mint, you’ll be supported in a diverse team where differences are celebrated and your well-being matters — striking the right work-life balance with compassionate team benefits. And if your career goals change, you’ll be empowered to change roles with training and internal mobility.     Our Benefits:  Competitive salaries and employee discounts Flexible work options available - working from home options (up to 2 days available) and options to work flexibly (9-day fortnight, compressed working week, monthly RDO etc.) Extended leave options including purchased leave, leave at half pay and access to pro-rata long service leave Opportunity to work for an endorsed WORK180 employer Paid parental leave and secondary carer’s leave available after 6 months service. 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers and 6 weeks paid secondary care giver’s leave Training and development opportunities Opportunities to be part of our wide and active range of Employee Resourcing Groups: Reconciliation, Gender, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD), Disability, Mental Health and Neurodiversity, and Perth Mint with Pride Charity and volunteer initiatives Income protection after an accident or illness Health and wellness programs, including an Employee Assistance Program, ongoing wellbeing initiatives, and workplace community building spaces Our full list of benefits and why we are recognised as an Endorsed Employer for Women by WORK180 can be seen on the WORK180 website  So go on, make your mark. If you are excited by this role and want to join the team at the iconic Perth Mint, apply today.     The Specialist Business Systems is a skilled IT professional responsible for supporting our important SaaS business applications.  This role supports a strategic approach to aligning technological solutions with organisational goals, while providing troubleshooting and maintenance.  The Specialist Business Systems likes working with people and solving business problems.     Your role as a Specialist Business Systems will involve:  Coordinating relationships with vendors and business users to help meet their needs Facilitating the smooth operation, reliability, and performance of business systems Handling and resolving system-related incidents according to established procedures Recognising opportunities to improve system efficiency, performance, and user experience Participating in the planning, testing, and implementation of system upgrades and enhancements Coordinating system changes effectively to minimise disruptions Recognising opportunities to improve business processes through the use of technology Participating in initiatives to enhance system and process efficiency Keeping documentation and user guides up to date     Experience:  Experience in IT support Demonstrated experience in: system implementation projects; and, supporting and maintaining business systems Understanding of IT infrastructure and operations Experience in working with diverse stakeholders, including business users and technical teams Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology or a related field Relevant industry certifications that demonstrate: an understanding of IT service management; and, proficiency at turning data into useful information  It’s easy to dismiss the perfect opportunity if you don’t see yourself as the perfect fit. If this role feels right – no matter your background or personal circumstances – please submit your application.     Applications close on 19 August 2024. The Perth Mint reserves the right to close applications prior to this date.  Candidates must have the right to work in Australia and pass our national security check.     Our Commitment to Inclusion:  Inclusion is at the core of what we do. We are committed to equality and celebrate the diversity of race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, and all characteristics that make us unique as individuals.  We encourage applications from a range of candidates, including, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, people of all gender identities, youth, seniors, the LGBTQI+ community and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  We recognise that standard recruitment processes are not accessible to everyone. If there are any accommodations or supports that would assist you in participating in the recruitment process for this role, please reach out to recruitment@perthmint.com.  To learn more about our diversity and inclusion initiatives please visit our website.

column3: IT Professional/Network Administrator/Analyst/ICT Support Technicians
column13: ABOUT ARRA  Arra Group is a local WA company that engages with leading oil and gas/mining companies to provide our employees with opportunities that support a great lifestyle. We work in the space of Oil & Gas, Mining, Rail, Civil Construction, Health and Defence. We are also a registered Group Training Organisation, which allows us to place apprentices with the client we work with under a host employer-employee arrangement with plenty of support. Here at Arra, we take pride in looking after our candidates and prioritising their best interests to gain the best employer/employee relationship.     Location: Floreat, WA  Job Type: Fulltime     Job Description:  Research, analyse, and recommend strategies for network architecture and development, implement, manage, maintain, and configure network hardware and software, and monitor and optimise performance, and troubleshoot and provide user support.     Task:  Design, implement, and maintain computer networks, including LANs, WANs, and VPNs. Determine software and hardware requirements to provide solutions to problems Monitor network performance and troubleshoot issues to ensure optimal performance and uptime. Adapting existing programs to meet users’ requirements Install, configure, and maintain network hardware and software, including routers, switches, firewalls, and network monitoring tools. Provide technical support to end-users and resolve network-related issues in a timely manner. Conduct regular security audits and implement security measures to protect against cyber threats and unauthorized access. Designing and maintaining websites Repairing and replacing peripheral equipment such as terminals, printers, and modems Document network configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps. Stay up-to-date with industry trends and advancements in networking technologies.     Requirements:  Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. Proven experience as a Network Administrator, Network Analyst, or similar role. Strong analytical and problem-solving skills. Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.     Being a majority Indigenous owned company focused on developing capacity, growing capability and increasing the economic footprint of Indigenous business in Western Australia; we strongly encourage candidates who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander to apply for this role.     For further information, please contact and provide us with the apprenticeship you are interested in through recruit@arragroup.com.au.

column13: Position Title: Service Desk Analyst   Location: Sydney   About Role: As the first point of contact for the Technology Services team, provide excellent customer service in logging and providing 1st level resolution of all requests sent to our client’s Service Desk and assignment of requests within the team as directed by the service desk lead.  Position Duties:   High level customer service and organisational skills High level of communication skills (written and verbal) and interpersonal skills Excellent organisational skills, time management and ability to take initiative Interest and aptitude in ICT Knowledge of Microsoft 365 and Google Suite applications  Solid technical abilities across a broad range of technologies and applications Knowledge of Mac OS and Windows Operating environments Knowledge of smartphone devices (iOS and Android) Ability to maintain documentation and guides Ability to troubleshoot, solve problems and respond promptly and effectively to technological issues   The following skills would be highly regarded:  Knowledge of Wireless and Network basics Ability to troubleshoot supporting printers JAMF Pro or other MDM solution and Microsoft 365 platforms The following qualifications and experience required for this role are:  2+ years’ experience in providing support in a busy, service-oriented environment is essential Relevant technical experience and ICT qualifications are preferred If you are a dedicated and reliable Service Desk Analyst we encourage you to apply. Please click the button to apply or contact Tamsin Clark on tamsinclark@future-you.com.au if you have any questions Apply Now!

column3: - Full-time Opportunity. - Work 35 hours a week - Ensure the timely and accurate capture, workflow and distribution of documentation.
column13: Full-time Opportunity. Work 35 hours a week Ensure the timely and accurate capture, workflow and distribution of documentation.   Our Team  At Bayside Council, we are committed to a positive, flexible and supportive workplace culture, where our people and customers feel respected and valued. We are proud to serve our community through operating with transparency, integrity and in the best interests of the Bayside community to deliver exceptional service.     About the Role  The IT Project Manager is responsible for ensuring that IT projects are delivered successfully and adherence to the Bayside Council project management framework.  They work to manage project scope, budgets, and timelines, while also leading project teams and communicating with stakeholders to ensure everyone is aligned and informed about project progress and risks.   About You  The Project Manager is responsible for the following:  Manage successful project delivery of technology projects aligned to an established roadmap and project management framework. Provide a productive, results-oriented, safe and collaborative work environment, promoting and modelling high standards of conduct and behaviour. Setting clear expectations, performance standards, values and behaviours that are integral to the fabric of an outstanding organisation. Develop project plans and coordinate resources to ensure outcomes are achieved within agreed scope, tolerances, and to high standards. Manage changes and risks/issues involved with project delivery. Deliver regular executive level status reporting on project progress.   Our Benefits and Culture  As an organisation, we pride ourselves in offering a flexible working environment centred on delivering great outcomes for our customers, whether internal or external. Bayside Council has a strong culture of collaboration and delivering exciting new initiatives for our community.  On top of the competitive salary, our people enjoy;  3 extra days off during Christmas each year 15 days sick leave each year 2 days health and wellbeing leave Gym membership discounts Additional parental leave entitlements for both parents   Apply Now  Before submitting your application, please take the time to read the job description.  Your application should include an up-to-date resume (max 3 pages) and a covering letter including your skills and experience (max 2 pages).  Applications must be submitted by email to recruitment@bayside.nsw.gov.au.In the Subject Line please quote F24/404 IT Project Manager  Deadline: Tuesday 20 August 2024  Salary Range: $108,863 - $121,927 per annum plus 11.5% superannuation  Enquiries: Kim Pallesen, Lead IT Project Delivery at kim.pallesen@bayside.nsw.gov.au  Applicants may be required to satisfactorily undertake a Criminal History Check, Medical and/or Working with Children Check in accordance with the position.  We are an equal opportunity employer committed to an equitable, diverse and socially inclusive work environment.

column3: A fantastic leadership opportunity with Gladstone Ports Corporation, for anyone based in North QLD, or interstate candidates looking for a sea-change.
column13: Clicks IT Recruitment is partnering with the Gladstone Ports Corporation in their search for their next leader.  After an internal promotion, they are looking for an experienced Infrastructure Leader to be based out of their headquarters in Gladstone.  In this role, you will use your leadership experience to guide and lead a team of 4, with the headcount to grow before years end. You will also play a crucial role in continuously improving the effectiveness, dependability, and security of the existing technology and applications.  Gladstone Ports Corporation is based in North Queensland. It is expected that this role is to be based in Gladstone, QLD on a full time basis.  Key experience required:  Proven experience in an IT leadership role, managing an infrastructure team Proven, hands-on experience with managing Servers (Microsoft), Storage (SAN/DAS/NAS, iSCSI) and Networks (VLANs, routing, switching, wireless & firewalls) Experience in resources industry e.g. mining, oil, gas, utilities, aviation highly desirable Demonstrated interpersonal, verbal and written skills including the ability to liaise and create positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Mandatory C class drivers licence  On offer is a permanent role offering a generous salary between $180,000 - $220,000 + 12.75% super, and a generous relocation package of up to $30,000 for any candidates looking to relocate to Gladstone.  Please note: due to WHS regulations, candidates must be able to pass a drug and alcohol test prior to commencement if successful.  If you're interested in applying for this role, please clearly state on your resume or cover letter, your ability to re-locate to the area.  Candidates must be eligible to work in Australia, with unlimited working rights.  If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Dylan Sheoshker at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 429 171 544.  At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.  We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

column3: 1.0 FTE, Full-time Fixed term contract to 31 January 2027. Salary classification at MOA 7 Salary range $117,967.36 - $125,123.62 + 11.5% superannu
column13: 1.0 FTE, Full-time Fixed term contract to 31 January 2027. Salary classification at MOA 7 Salary range $117,967.36 - $125,123.62 + 11.5% superannuation Working within a highly supportive, engaged and professional team  About us  The City of Unley is recognised for its strong community spirit, natural and built environment, business strength and innovative leadership. The Council is considered a Local Government environment and sustainability leader, with a focus on heritage and preservation, while encompassing diversity, sustainability in environmental practices and activated public spaces.  About the role  At the City of Unley, we are dedicated to enhancing our community through innovative and efficient business systems. We are currently seeking a skilled and experienced Senior Systems Analyst to join our team and play a crucial role in a major business-wide system project.  Key Responsibilities  Conduct detailed system analysis and develop functional specifications. Oversee the design and implementation of system configurations. Manage data migration projects, ensuring data integrity and accuracy. Identify opportunities for system improvements and implement changes. Collaborate with stakeholders to coordinate major project developments and deliver effective solutions.  About you  Proven experience as a Systems Analyst or in a similar role, with a strong background in system design and implementation. Expertise in data migration strategies and ensuring data integrity. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to analyse complex systems. Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively liaise with internal and external stakeholders. Experience working with property and rating systems is highly desirable. Demonstrated ability to manage projects and coordinate with diverse teams.     The Unley Employee Experience  We recognise, the need to create environments that enables employees within the organisation to thrive and provide innovative and outstanding services to our community.  We provide a flexible, supportive, and inclusive environment that encourages professional development.  Our outstanding conditions of employment and benefits are designed to attract and retain the best people, as a member of our team, you will benefit from:  Competitive salary and conditions Salary sacrifice contributions to your nominated Superannuation fund Generous support for your ongoing education and development Comprehensive programs designed to improve your health and wellbeing. Work within a dedicated, professional building team.   How to Apply  If you are an experienced Senior Systems Analyst looking for a challenging and rewarding opportunity, we would love to hear from you. Please submit your resume and a cover letter outlining your relevant experience and qualifications online.  For more information about the role or to discuss this opportunity further, please contact Naomi Molloy, Project Manager Business Systems HR@unley.sa.gov.au  Applications close COB Wednesday 21 August 2024.     Pre-employment requirements:  The position is subject to satisfactorily meeting the following employment requirements:  General Employment Probity Check Facet 5 Personality Profiling     Everyone Belongs at Unley…  As part of our commitment to creating a diverse and inclusive workplace, this role is open to candidates seeking workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages and culturally diverse backgrounds including people living with a disability and First Nations People to apply.  We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier free recruitment process and a supportive workplace. Please refer to the Manager’s contact details above for any support you need along the way.  Position Description

column3: The Senior Systems & Cloud Engineer is responsible for providing expert technical leadership.
column13: Applications close at 11:30pm AEST on Monday 19 August 2024 (late applications will not be accepted).  The Australian Sports Commission is embarking on the Green and Gold decade. An exciting time filled with international sporting competitions on home soil, including the Men’s and Women’s Rugby World Cup, and culminating in the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. We have an ambitious new Strategic Vision and we need the best players on our team to help us deliver real results for the sporting sector and all Australians.  Are you up for the challenge?  About the team – The Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking team have responsibility for the design and planning of the structure of the ASC's IT systems. Responsibilities include:  System Design: Creating blueprints for software, hardware, and network components. Scalability and Performance: Ensuring systems can handle growth and high loads. Integration: Coordinating different systems to work seamlessly together. Security: Implementing security measures across the architecture. Alignment with Business Goals: Ensuring technical decisions align with business objectives. Technology Evaluation: Assessing new technologies and their suitability. Cloud Strategy: Defining how cloud services fit into the overall architecture.  About the role – The Senior Systems & Cloud Engineer is responsible for providing expert technical leadership and advocacy for innovative solutions that support the efficient and effective delivery of ASC technology objectives. You will be responsible for leading and managing technical delivery aspects of technology-based projects to ensure technology designs and decisions deliver sustainable. Efficient, secure and integrated solutions. Key duties of the role include:  Designing, implementing, and maintaining ASC’s infrastructure focusing on cloud-based solutions. Configuring and managing cloud services, optimising system performance, and ensuring security and troubleshooting issues. Providing technical advice and support to technology-based projects, including feasibility assessment and risk analysis which aligns with strategic objectives. Integrate enterprise architecture and information security architectures into project solutions. Collaborating with stakeholders and project teams to understand needs and requirements. Assist in the development and implementation of sustainable systems and cloud plans and strategies to deliver outcomes.  About you – Our ideal candidate will have substantial technical leadership and experience with a structured and methodical approach with an ability to focus on achieving the delivery of ASC’s technology objectives. The successful candidate will have:  Substantial technology experience and skill across a broad range of digital enterprise platforms including:Azure, O365, ADFS, Azure AD and modern authentication (SAML, OIDC); SQL and PowerShell scripting, SCCM packaging, server/application patching and VMWare Management; Deploying and managing digital certificates and certificate authorities; Web application deployment and debugging; Network Management experience with Fortinet firewalls, Zscaler, and Aruba networking; Application integration leveraging APIs and automation frameworks; Application Whitelisting and Vulnerability Management.  Demonstrated proficiency in system administration, networking and scripting languages (Python or PowerShell). Demonstrated analytical skills and the ability to negotiate solutions and design services delivery processes. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate with influence when working with non-technical stakeholders and document processes and procedures.  This position is offered as an ONGOING position.   Why work with us? We have offices located in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney.  Across all locations, we offer:  Options for flexible working arrangements. Annual allowances towards training based on individualised career goals. Access to a customised ASC L&D calendar for ongoing professional and career development. Generous superannuation scheme with up to 15.4% employer contributions. Corporate discount on AIS Shop merchandise. Access to Clearinghouse for Sport, an information sharing platform for Sporting professionals.  Additionally, our Canberra campus offers:  Free onsite parking Onsite facilities including café, dining hall, gym, and swimming pool. Priority placement for your children to access the award winning, onsite AIS Caretaker’s Cottage Childcare Centre.  If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact:  Contact Officer: Dillon Sayasane, Director Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking Email address: Dillon.Sayasane@ausport.gov.au   If you would like to learn more about this opportunity or to obtain the job description, click 'Apply' now

column3: Senior Business Systems Administrator
column13: Company description:    Department of Communities and Justice    Job description:    Senior Business Systems Administrator  Location: Parramatta CBD Employment type: Ongoing, Full-time (1 vacancy) Salary: Clerk 9/10, $120,859 to $133,183 p.a. plus employers' contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading  Your role  This role works in DCJ's Digital Experience Unit, which is responsible for managing the DCJ digital channels including the DCJ websites and Intranets. Through these channels we provide inclusive, engaging, and consistent digital experiences for employees, clients and customers.  We are looking for an outstanding individual with an outcome focussed and agile mindset to manage specialist business systems and tools, including DCJ's Creative Library. You will provide high quality advice and recommendations to senior executive on the delivery of user centric, accessible, and compliant digital products to achieve organisational objectives of delivering customer service excellence.  Reporting to the Manager, Product Operations, you'll assist and support the development and implementation of effective digital strategies, standards, governance frameworks and product operations practices.  What you'll do  As part of the Digital Experience team, you will provide specialist management and support for Digital Experience systems and tools, including administration, policy design for usage and compliance. Responsible for performance measuring and monitoring, you will work with key internal and external stakeholders to ensure overall operational maintenance and management of business systems, including the DCJ Creative Library.  You will also engage with senior stakeholders throughout the department's broad portfolio areas to understand the needs and perspectives of stakeholders and ensure digital business systems are fit for purpose and managed and used effectively to meet business, policy, and legislated compliance requirements.  Keeping abreast of abreast of new relevant digital business system features, functionality, and opportunities, you will provide expert recommendations to executive teams for system or business process improvements.  You will work as part of a team of dedicated, passionate digital specialist in a fast-paced agile environment.  What we're looking for  Tertiary qualifications in information technology or a related discipline and/or equivalent knowledge, skills and experience. Demonstrated experience in product management and operational maintenance of a range of online communications products in a large and complex organisation. Demonstrated experience in industry standard visitor analytics and content management systems. Demonstrated understanding of the regulatory environment for government online communications, including security, accessibility, usability, compliance with legislative requirements, brand management and procurement. Ability to coach and mentor junior staff in using industry standard trends and practices to achieve digital communications objectives.  Download the role description.  If you are viewing this ad in Seek and wish to apply via their portal, you will be required to either set up a profile or login via your existing Seek account.  To apply directly via the DCJ Careers site click here. Search for the job and click the ‘Apply now' button.  We focus on hiring people who share our commitment and goals of inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage and integrity. If you meet the essential requirements and the role resonates with you, please apply - you do not need to meet every desired requirement for us to want to talk to you.  What We Offer  We offer a variety of benefits, including:  A challenging and rewarding career Flexible, autonomous work environment Competitive pay and conditions Training and development opportunities to build and maintain capabilities Health & Wellbeing and Employee Assistance Programs.  Want more information? Visit our website to see more information on Working for us.  We do work that really matters  Working for the Department of Communities and Justice (DCJ) provides lots of opportunities to make a real difference. We collaborate with other agencies and community partners, to improve lives and realise the potential of children, adults, families and communities. We're focused on breaking, rather than managing, disadvantage. It's work that really matters.  Apply now and join Australia's top public sector employer where we will support you and provide an exciting and flexible working environment!  Are you ready to join us?  Click apply, attach a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements of the role as well as an up-to-date résumé (maximum 5 pages).  Applications close: Tuesday 20th August 2024 at 11:59pm AEST.  Got a question?  For more information about the role or what it's like to work for DCJ, please contact the hiring manager Jan Dutton on 0459 868 705 or at jan.dutton@dcj.nsw.gov.au  If you've got a question about applying or would benefit from an adjustment in the recruitment process to help you perform at your best (including an alternate method submission of the application), please call Raji Subramanian on 02 8688 7146 or email rajalakshmi.subramanian@dcj.nsw.gov.au  Visit Recruitment adjustments on the DCJ website to learn more.  Inclusion and Diversity lies at the heart of how we recruit  We continue to hire great people with a wide variety of skills, experience and backgrounds. This includes people with disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander People, women, people identifying as LGBTIQ+, culturally and linguistically diverse people, carers and other diversity groups.  To find out what DCJ are doing to build an inclusive and diverse workforce, visit Inclusion and diversity on the DCJ website.  Other Information  A talent pool may be created for future ongoing and temporary roles and is valid for a period of up to 18 months.  For more information visit Your recruitment journey on the DCJ website.  Thank you for your interest in this role. We look forward to receiving your application.  To keep up with recruitment opportunities at DCJ, follow us on Facebook: www.facebook.com/CareersatDCJ/

column3: A large, multinational company is looking to add an experienced Service Desk Engineer to their Perth-based team.
column13: Position Overview: OUI Recruitment is looking for an experienced Service Desk Engineer to join an internal environment. This role offers a hybrid working arrangement, combining the benefits of remote work and office collaboration. As the first responder, you will provide support for a wide range of issues, ensuring smooth operations and user satisfaction.   Perks:    Flexible working arrangements (work from home). Awesome management and a very supportive leadership team. Career progression, funded certifications, and study support. Senior and collaborative team environment for you to learn from.     Role Responsibilities:    Provide end-user support and troubleshooting for a variety of issues. Troubleshoot M365-related issues (Intune, Teams, SharePoint). Provide hardware and software support. Configure, deploy and maintain desktops, laptops and monitors. Support and troubleshoot network issues, including Wi-Fi and VPN connectivity. Maintain and support printers, scanners, and other peripherals. Perform software installations, updates, and patches. Implement and support IT security measures and protocols. Provide guidance and training to end-users on technology and best practices. Document procedures, configurations, and solutions for future reference. Work autonomously while also being able to seek guidance when necessary. Utilise logical thinking and problem-solving skills to resolve issues effectively.     Qualifications and Skills:     Tafe diploma in IT or equivalent (Bachelor's degree preferred). 3+ years of previous experience in an IT support role. Strong organizational and time management skills. Excellent verbal and written communication abilities. Demonstrated problem-solving and decision-making skills. Strong interpersonal skills and ability to work collaboratively. Hold relevant certifications in M365 or Azure (desirable, not essential).     We appreciate your interest in this opportunity. We regret that we can only contact shortlisted candidates. If you are not shortlisted, we encourage you to check out our website for other opportunities or to sign up for job alerts. Please note that applicants must be based in Australia with valid working rights to be considered.  We represent organizations that promote diversity and welcome all qualified applicants regardless of race, gender, disability, religion/belief, sexual orientation, or age.  Email: info@ouirecruitment.com Number: (08) 6219 8033

column3: Drive IT infrastructure and security excellence in a cutting-edge, collaborative environment.
column13: Who We’re Looking For:  We are partnering with Hunter Valley Coal Chain Coordinator (HVCCC) to recruit a Platforms Support Specialist. In this role, you will support HVCCC’s IT infrastructure and security, contributing to the efficient delivery of IT services that support all business processes across the organization. You will collaborate closely with the Cyber Security and Infrastructure Specialist to achieve quality, efficiency, and agility goals.  You will enjoy working with a dedicated team that values customer service, continuous improvement, and the development of robust infrastructure and security systems. This is an on-site, permanent role based in Newcastle NSW.    What You Will Be Doing:   Support the delivery of HVCCC’s IT infrastructure and security services. Monitor operational processes, including backups, patching, incident and problem resolution, and change management. Create knowledge base articles and technical documentation to improve support processes. Ensure that infrastructure and security project plans deliver key outcomes on time, within budget, and according to standards. Identify, evaluate, and implement process and system improvements to enhance customer service.    What You’ll Bring:   Relevant tertiary qualification (IT and related fields) with experience in IT service management (ITIL). Proven experience in supporting infrastructure and cyber security in complex environments. Hands-on experience with Azure infrastructure, including IaaS and PaaS components (Storage Accounts, VMs, Azure SQL, VNets). Understanding of NIST and Essential 8 cyber frameworks and DevOps practices. Strong customer focus with excellent interpersonal, verbal, and written communication skills. Self-motivated with high-level analytical and problem-solving skills, capable of working independently and managing variable workload demands.    About the Company:  The Hunter Valley Coal Chain Coordinator (HVCCC) is a member-funded, independent logistics organization that coordinates the planning, scheduling, and operational execution of the Hunter Valley Coal Chain. HVCCC provides its members with insights, advice, and analysis to improve efficiency and maximize value from the shared infrastructure of the coal chain.  By joining HVCCC, you are joining a team of people who genuinely live their cultural values. Recognized as an Employer of Choice across NSW , HVCCC supports employee-focused programs and initiatives that make them a great team to work with. They are an innovative organization that uses cutting-edge digital technology to plan, coordinate, monitor, and report on one of the most complex and economically significant supply chains in the world.   Benefits:   Work for Business NSW State Winner Employer of Choice 2023. 10% performance bonus available. A great opportunity to be a member of a dedicated and collaborative IT and security team within a data-driven business. Use the latest infrastructure and security techniques in Microsoft Azure.  What’s next?  Please note this role is on-site, based in Newcastle NSW, and does not provide sponsorship.  This role is being recruited by NewyTechPeople. All applicants will receive a response.  The easiest way to register your interest is to apply using the link. If you’d like to have a chat before applying, please contact Ellen Bennett at ellen@newytechpeople.com.au.

column3: Make sure Seqwater's Service Desk provides high-quality support and contributes positively to the overall DTI service delivery.
column13: About Seqwater  Seqwater is the Queensland Government Bulk Water Supply Authority, responsible for delivering safe, secure and cost-effective bulk water supply for over 3 million people across Southeast Queensland.     Seqwater is one of the largest water businesses with the most geographically spread and diverse asset base of any capital city water authority. Our operations extend from the New South Wales border to the base of the Toowoomba ranges.     We commit to delivering a high standard of customer service aligned to our strategic vision. We value working collaboratively with our internal & external customers to improve service delivery.      About Your Opportunity  As the Supervisor - Client Services, you will manage a team of client service officers who are responsible for our Incident Management and Service Request practices, providing excellent customer service, prompt, and accurate client responses, proactively managing adherence to agreed service levels and when possible, exceeding client’s expectations.     Key responsibilities:  Lead the Client Services team to ensure the professional, courteous, and timely support to Seqwater staff. Plan, direct and monitor both the Service Desk and Hub operations; through the monitoring, tracking, reporting and improvement of support services and processes. Oversee resource planning and scheduling including after hours and emergency coverage, managing team performance and KPIs, adherence with service management processes. Perform the day-to-day duties of ITSM Practice Manager for Service Desk, Incident Management and Service Request Management.     About you  To be successful in this role, you will possess:    Demonstrated high level of motivation and aspire to exceed client expectations. Tertiary qualifications in an information technology discipline; or equivalent combination of education and experience. Minimum 5 years’ experience in desktop support, including an understanding of security issues, network services, cloud technologies, access administration, SOE/MOEs and Microsoft and Azure products. Strong Digital leadership and management skills, including change management, fostering a culture of continuous improvement, with knowledge and ability to apply human resource management skills. High level knowledge of ITIL with detailed knowledge of the following practices: Service Desk Incident Management Service Request Fulfilment Knowledge Management Change Management Problem Management       This position has a salary starting at $118,579 plus 12.75% superannuation and is a permanent role.     Appointment to this role may be subject to the provision of a national police check and may be subject to other medical/character requirements. Please note that people with criminal records are not automatically deemed ineligible. Each application will be considered on its merits.  For a more detailed preview of the work that you will be involved in for this role, feel free to take a look at the position description on our careers page - careers.seqwater.com.au   We also invite you to connect with us on LinkedIn and join our growing community of followers to see all the latest news and job opportunities as and when they happen - https://www.linkedin.com/company/seqwater/     If you are looking for an extraordinary career in which you can make a real impact, we'd love to hear from you!     To apply  Submit your resume via the Apply button.     Applications close: 11:55PM AEST, Wednesday 14th August 2024  For further information please email enquiries to recruitment@seqwater.com.au     Please note – applications cannot be accepted via email.

column3: Introduce and drive the adoption of agreed technical standards and design principles in pursuit of designing robust, scalable, and secure solutions
column13: Solutions Architect  Technology & Transformation   Armidale or Port Macquarie based, with flexible arrangements considered for the right applicant  Continuing Opportunity.  About Us   At Regional Australia Bank we feel that being connected with regional Australia and its people is undoubtedly the most exciting and inspiring part of our brand. Being a customer-owned bank, we are a bank with a difference. We work to support our customers and the communities we live in and want to make your experience as a RAB employee a great one.   About this role   As a Solutions Architect, you will ensure the seamless integration and architectural alignment of our banking solutions to support our current and future needs. Your key responsibilities will include:   Application Architecture Strategy & Standards: Develop and enforce technical standards and design principles.  Software Development Life cycle Practice: Enhance and oversee best practices in software development.  Oversight & Leadership: Lead and guide technical teams to achieve robust and scalable solutions.  Solution Design: Design secure, scalable, and innovative solutions.   Further information  For further information or to discuss the role in more detail contact Julie Armstrong, Chief Information Officer via email: jarmstrong@regionalaustraliabank.com.au.   A copy of the position description can be viewed by the Careers section of the Regional Australia Bank website.    To Apply  To express your interest please submit your application including a cover letter and resume outlining why you feel you are suited to this position via the Careers section Regional Australia Bank website.   You must be either Australian citizen or a holder of an Australian Permanent Residency Visa to apply for this position.  Applications close: midnight Sunday 18 August 2024.

column2: University of the Sunshine Coast – UniSC
column3: This role offers the opportunity to lead transformative digital initiatives and collaborate closely with stakeholders to optimise business processes
column13: Senior Business Analyst – Cyber Security Program  Information Technology, Sunshine Coast Campus, Sippy Downs Level 8, $111,613 - $126,406 p.a., plus up to 17% employer superannuation Full-time, fixed-term 18 months  The Opportunity  Join the University of the Sunshine Coast as a Senior Business Analyst and play a pivotal role in transforming our business processes and systems as part of the cyber security program. We are looking for a skilled professional with a strong project delivery background in cyber security to analyse complex business structures, identify requirements, and implement impactful improvements.  In this role, you will document current and future state processes, uncover opportunities for enhancement, and consult with key stakeholders to ensure seamless, organisation-wide changes. Your expertise in cyber security will be crucial in providing accurate advice, timely support, and effective communication and training as part of our process improvement initiatives. Regular updates, detailed reports, and sound recommendations will be essential to your success in driving these projects forward.  For more information, please visit us online Information Technology  You will  lead the analysis of complex business processes and systems, identifying key requirements and implementing effective business changes and process improvements for our cyber security program; develop essential project management documents, including business cases, functional specifications, user acceptance test plans, and communication plans; and manage the integration of key digital projects to optimise the effectiveness and efficiency of solutions across the organisation.  About you  You’re a problem-solver who thrives on understanding and tackling business challenges to deliver impactful solutions. You excel at building and managing relationships with key stakeholders, skilfully eliciting and documenting user requirements with clear visuals. Our ideal candidate possesses a thorough understanding of business processes and user needs and communicates these effectively. You’re adept at defining project boundaries within our PMF framework, and you're always looking to enhance our dashboards and reports, keeping pace with industry trends. Your strong grasp of procurement strategies ensures compliance with UniSC’s policies, and you foster positive, ongoing communication to meet the complex information needs and priorities of our organisation.  You will possess:  Extensive experience and advanced analytical skills, with knowledge of cyber security and ideally student information systems, research management systems, and enterprise resource planning systems. Proven expertise in planning, developing, integrating, and implementing digital systems, applications, and services, preferably within higher education. Strong business acumen with the ability to lead digital impact assessments and risk mitigation to optimise business processes. Excellent organisational skills, capable of managing multiple tasks and achieving successful outcomes through collaborative relationships Outstanding communication and interpersonal skills, with the ability to convey information, gain acceptance of ideas, and engage effectively with diverse stakeholder groups. Experience and knowledge of guidelines, best practices, and operating principles aligned with frameworks and methodologies such as ITIL 4.0, COBIT, NIST CSF, Agile, TOGAF, PRINCE2, DEVOPS, Six Sigma, or BPMN.  UniSC is an equal opportunity employer, committed to diversity and inclusion. We encourage applications from all backgrounds, including those with disabilities, women in STEM, First Nations Peoples, and individuals of diverse cultures, genders, abilities, and experiences. We value achievement relative to opportunity and encourage your commentary on your achievements in this context. For additional support during the application process, please contact us at unisc-careers@usc.edu.au or call +61 7 5430 2830.  Position Description:  ID255_Senior Business Analyst.pdf  To be eligible to apply you must have legal work rights in Australia.  All applications must be lodged through the Careers at UniSC website.  UniSC does not accept unsolicited applications. For agency inquiries, contact unisc-careers@usc.edu.au  Applications for this position close midnight, Tuesday 20th August  Your completed application must include:  a resume, noting your application will be reviewed in alignment to the specified selection criteria as outlined within the position description. There will be opportunity within the application form to also include supporting documentation should you wish.  Further information regarding how to prepare your application is available on our website: Join our team  We would love the opportunity to get to know you better, but we know it works both ways. To get to know a little more about us, visit us at Welcome to UniSC and LinkedIn Life  Have questions or want to know more? For a confidential discussion, please contact:  Melissa Iliadis Cyber Security Program Manager  Phone: 5459 4710 Email: miliadis@usc.edu.au  Discover UniSC  We're all about doing work that matters, connecting with great people, and being part of an incredible journey. We’re not the biggest university. But we’re growing every day, and doing big things. Like ground-breaking research, championing sustainability, producing gold-winning athletes and award-winning alumni.  We're one of the fastest growing universities in Australia, growing to over 2,000 people across 5 campuses in South East Queensland.  Teaching excellence is at the heart of what we do, and our commitment to sustainability is integrated into our teaching, research, and daily operations. Our research tackles the most pressing challenges of our time, with 26 research fields ranked at or above world standard according to the Excellence in Research for Australia Rankings. At UniSC you will have the opportunity to contribute to the educational landscape for future generations.  We foster a collaborative and supportive environment, encouraging continuous professional development and providing resources to enhance your career. We recognise and value the contributions of each team member to our culture and success. We're not afraid to be different, and we're looking for people who share our values and want to be part of a team that is working together to improve our local and global challenges.  Our Culture & Benefits:  Our collaborative, passionate and welcoming culture is what really sets us apart. Modern teaching & research facilities. Professional development and career pathway opportunities. We are a proud recipient of the prestigious Athena SWAN Bronze Award, granted as part of the Science in Australia Gender Equity (SAGE) initiative. Flexible work arrangements & generous leave options. Salary packing options + 17% Super. EAP, fitness passport & discounted private health.

column3: Uplift maturity across Cloud, DevOps and automation. Lead small team and have autonomy. Work with modern technologies.
column13: Your New Employer:  This ambitious and entrepreneurial financial services business has technology at the core of everything they do. Technology has a seat on the ELT and forms a key pillar in their growth and innovation strategy. With an inspirational CIO at the helm who has led a large-scale technology transformation over recent years, this new role plays a key part of the IT leadership team. The company is based in the Sydney CBD and has values-driven leaders who care a lot about empathy, humility and the wellness of their employees. The company have won multiple ‘Best Places to Work’ and ‘Employer of Choice for Gender Equality’ awards and have a strong, well-defined and communicated vision and strategy that focuses on innovation and the customer at its core. They have progressive learning and development programs for staff, with a core focus on providing opportunities for staff to reach their full potential within a positive working environment that celebrates success. They also have a hybrid and flexible working policy.  Your New Role:  You’ll lead a small team (3 direct reports) in designing, building and maintaining technical platforms, while fostering a culture of continuous learning and improvement. You’ll manage a blend of cloud infrastructure (Azure) and on-premise, and will play the role of a Product Owner for platforms (i.e. exploring new ways of doing things, suggesting new features that can improve the platform landscape, developing a roadmap and taking platform ownership). The role will be a blend of project and BAU work, so you’ll need to understand how to manage both.  Key accountabilities of your new role will include:  Leading and transforming Cloud & Platforms services ensuring optimal technology service delivery; Championing contemporary & emerging infrastructure technologies (DevOps/Infrastructure as Code etc); Overseeing the strategic planning, execution, and management of multi-faceted projects related to compliance, control assurance, risk management, security, and infrastructure/information asset protection; Driving agile adoption and facilitate planning, backlog refinement and work prioritisation; Monitoring the current-state solution portfolio to identify deficiencies through ageing of the technologies used by the application, or misalignment with business requireme; Managing and developing the platform architecture for a broader scope of projects or products, working closely with application teams and product owners; Facilitating cross-enterprise BCP exercises, including those with suppliers and business partners; Working closely with the Security team to manage and remediate vulnerabilities, design and implement platform, data and application security; Overseeing (in partnership with the Security team) Identity and Access management processes, including Privileged Access Management, Administration and Management, ensuring robust security protocols and efficient user access controls across systems and networks; and Being responsible for overseeing System Change Management, Administration, Patch Management and User Provisioning, ensuring the seamless integration and maintenance of our systems and networks. Your Background and Experience:  Minimum of five years’ experience in a similar IT Operations Manager, Platform Engineering Manager or Infrastructure Manager role, ideally in a similarly complex business; You will have a strong track record in cloud services (Azure), DevOps and Infrastructure as Code, and will be a leader at heart who takes great pride in uplifting team capability; You will possess strong budget and vendor management skills and will have a reputation of getting things done in your previous roles; You will have strong business acumen with a strong customer and continuous improvement focus. You will be resilient and enjoy building trusted relationships with internal stakeholders. Integrity will be very important to you; and Above all else, you will have a friendly, positive attitude with high levels of emotional intelligence and maturity. How to Apply   For more information or a confidential discussion please call Steven Fulop at u&u on 0418 994 446 quoting reference number 37818.   At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability.  Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. In response to these requests, we will collaborate closely with you to implement the appropriate adjustments.   Additionally, for a barrier-free and inclusive online experience, you can access u&u’s opportunities using accessibility software Recite Me at https://www.uandu.com/jobs.   Please submit your resume in Word format only.

column3: Immerge Recruitment is thrilled to unveil an exceptional opportunity for an experienced Data & AI Leader to join our esteemed client.
column13: Who are we?  Immerge is a specialist recruitment firm, where we connect top talent with leading companies in the technology sector. At Immerge, we are committed to helping companies find the right candidates who can bring technical expertise and industry-specific knowledge to their organisations.  The Role: Head of Architecture Data @ AI   If you're a Senior professional with a proven track record specialising in Architecture and AI, this is your chance to shine.  Key Responsibilities:  Overall responsibility for the domain architecture strategy and overall architecture for all programs, projects and initiatives under the Data & AI domain.  Work with the Enterprise architecture team to lay the foundation and rollout of enterprise information architecture. Model the future state of the data & AI architecture and provide architecture best practices and guidelines. Solution Architecture & Design of all solutions and technology under the data domain. Ensure architectural initiatives are aligned with key performance indicators such as architecture, fitness, cost efficiency, reusability, speed to market/delivery, and effective data utilisation.  Lead & nurture a high-performing delivery culture comprising engaged and empowered employees. Includes mentoring, training and hiring of appropriate skills.  Identify new technologies and foster innovation within the technology domains.   Qualifications and Experience required:  10+ years of Architectural and Design experience specifically in the data & AI domain. Leading large-scale initiatives and designing and delivering programs.  Strong background in data and AI architecture, with expertise in designing and implementing modern data solutions.  5+ years of technical experience including Data & AI platforms (e.g. data warehouse, data lake, AI Models, reporting and analytics platforms, AI/ML, knowledge of CDP/DMP technology)  Next Steps    If you are interested in hearing more, please click apply with your updated CV and reach out to Neil for a confidential conversation on this role and the Technology market in general. Neil@immerge.au  Welcome to connect with me on Linkedin, and please also follow Immerge's Linkedin page for regular job postings and market updates.  https://www.linkedin.com/in/neil-groome-170237218/ https://www.linkedin.com/company/immergeaustralia/  We look forward to working with you, Neil | Immerge | Australia

column3: Support bespoke applications across multiple sites. SQL scripting. Maintain the databases, and use PowerBI for reporting.
column13: Application Support Analyst *Hornsby location *Up to $110k plus super *1 day wfh     What you will be doing: - Provide level 1/2 support to employees and customers, addressing software and hardware issues. - Provide application support for current and future line of business applications. - Create and maintain scripts or applications to automate routine tasks and boost efficiency. -Standard database maintenance and administration tasks - Diagnose and resolve complex technical scripts using SQL - PowerBI for reporting - Face to face support     Required qualifications and skills: -A minimum of 3 years of experience relevant to the role. -Created reports in SQL -Tune and manage performance of applications using SQL and Database tuning -Bespoke application management    They will interview next week - so apply now!    If you have any questions about this role or others we have available you can email our team directly via natalie@thedrivegroup.com.au    For The Latest Jobs, Tech News or to 'Introduce A Friend' for a $1000 Referral Fee - Follow Us On Linkedin:    https://www.linkedin.com/company/thedrivegroup    TheDriveGroup is 100% committed to improving meaningful diversity in the technology industry.    We partner with clients who embrace diversity and seek candidates across all backgrounds, abilities, genders, sexualities, cultures, and faiths.

column3: Maintain and support Fire and Rescue NSW's Operational Communications mission critical & non-critical core applications and system monitoring products
column10: Great salary plus 14% super and up to 12% bonus
column13: Ongoing Full Time (35 hours per week); work-life balance and flexible working arrangements Clerk Grade 11/12 Package up to $181,614 pa. Package includes salary range ($139,787 pa to $161,663 pa), plus employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading Office located in Greenacre, NSW   About the role:        The Principal Application Support Engineer works with the business and project teams to ensure delivery and operation of Fire and Rescue NSW’s Emergency Services Computer Aided Dispatch (ESCAD) system, and drives development and implementation of applications in a mission critical environment.  About you:  You will have demonstrated experience in maintaining and supporting mission critical applications You will have demonstrated experience in developing software components according to software development and security standards.  For more information on the role, please view the Principal Application Support Engineer - ESCAD Role Description.  Should you require more information about this opportunity, please contact Melissa Di Palma, Principal System Administrator - ESCAD on 0498 763 306.  About us:  FRNSW is one of the world’s largest urban fire and rescue services and is the busiest in Australia. Our overriding purpose is to enhance community safety, quality of life, and confidence by minimising the impact of hazards and emergency incidents on the people, property, environment and economy of NSW. We are prepared for anything – helping anyone, anywhere, anytime.  Visit our Careers Page to learn more about Fire and Rescue NSW.  What we can offer:  Work-life balance, flexible working arrangements and flex leave entitlements Free on-site gym and parking Salary packaging: Maxxia and Smartsalary Partnership with Fitness Passport for ongoing staff and their families to access more than 390 gyms and pools at a discounted rate Leadership development programs Ongoing training and development  Our commitment to diversity:  Great people come from all walks of life and at Fire and Rescue NSW we are committed to creating a diverse, inclusive and flexible workforce which reflects the community we serve.  We welcome people with diverse experience, skills and backgrounds, and encourage applications from Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander peoples, individuals who identify as LGBTIQ, people with disability, people with culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, and people of all ages.  If you are a person with disability and require specific arrangements to participate in the recruitment process, please contact the FRNSW Talent Acquisition Team by email at recruitment@fire.nsw.gov.au  How to apply:  To be considered for this role, please provide an up-to-date resume which details your skills and experience as relevant to this role.  Please answer the following two targeted questions. It is recommended you draft your responses in a Word document then paste into the required field in the online application.  1. Describe a mission critical application/system you have supported, and how you ensured optimal performance and availability.  2. Describe a complex technical issue that you have encountered, what processes you followed to resolve it, and what strategies you implemented to minimise reoccurrence.  Visit the PSC website for helpful information on writing your application: https://iworkfor.nsw.gov.au/writing-your-application  Applications close: 19 August 2024 at 11:55 PM  A talent pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type which become available over the next 18 months.
