column3: An established and respected Australian MSP that has grown substantially year-on-year and now has 60 + staff across Australia and the Philippines!
column13: IT Service Technician Level 2 Support    We are working with an established and respected Australian MSP that has grown substantially year-on-year and now has 60 + staff across Australia and the Philippines, with an impressive list of customers nationally, an incredibly high staff retention rate and fantastic, supportive management.    Due to exceptional success and ongoing expansion, they are seeking an experienced IT Service Technician where you will be in the beating heart of the company! Here you will have countless opportunities to grow and learn as well as show the true meaning of quality customer service and technical support across multiple clients.    The Role:  Provide support directly to clients onsite at their premises Provide remote support of servers, desktops, applications, and cloud services in Microsoft-based environments Configure, troubleshoot and remediate issues with firewalls, network switches, virtual infrastructure and more Attend scheduled onsite bookings with clients to execute preventative maintenance on end-user devices and IT infrastructure Engage with highly experienced solutions experts and senior engineers to solve escalated issues and maintain best practices Engage in all levels of IT support in a wide variety of technologies Occasionally provide after-hours emergency support Experience:  Australian PR or Citizenship only A current Australian Driving Licence Experience working in a similar role for an IT provider (MSP) or on an internal IT team Experience using ticketing systems and the ability to communicate with a diverse range of people in a warm, friendly, and helpful manner Excellent written and verbal communication skills Advanced understanding of end-user support and Microsoft Office 365 Strong working knowledge of Windows Servers, Active Directory, virtualisation, and backup technologies General understanding of technical infrastructure, spanning from end-users to the internet, encompassing the devices involved and networking fundamentals A team player who can work collaboratively, with proven skills in troubleshooting, problem-solving and critical thinking   Benefits:  Company-issued Microsoft Surface device and welcome gift during onboarding Offer the option of hybrid working arrangements Competitive training and certification program to ensure employees are always growing and learning - Not only pay for your exams, training resources, and subscriptions but also provide paid work time off to sit the exams A supportive management team that collaborates with all employees to establish training goals, providing mentoring, accountability and support towards achieving successful outcomes Birthday gifts that can be used for anything from technology to gift cards Regular social events, LAN events and generally awesome team culture    If this role or company sounds like your next career move, then please click APPLY online or reach out to me by email at lloyd@nbridge.com.au
column14: Help Desk & IT Support (Information & Communication Technology)

column3: Hybrid 3 days in office, Sports / FinTech / Payments industry, ESOP / Stock options, AWS, Golang, Terraform and stable Business, 10 Mill + user
column13: JDP are stoked to be partnering with THE go-to SaaS platform in their industry. They are on the lookout for a Technical Lead to join their capable team of engineers here in Melbourne.  With staff in the US and Europe they they have a global (and loyal) client base with millions of users and a truely scalable product that is providing measurable ROI and a seamless User Experience. whilst very established in their space they have a streamlined and lean organisation who are nimble and able to make decisions quickly.   They have a complete micro / macro service architecture hosted in AWS, using Golang / React and are building a new white label technology for their stellar list of clients.   I can't give too much away, but happy to talk through the full details confidentially!   What type of individual are they looking for?   Someone who has knowledge across any or all of the following areas - SaaS, Fin-Tech, Payments, Mar-Tech, Sports Someone who has taken ownership of a product and it's strategic direction You've helped a company execute and deliver product strategy Able to demonstrate tangible success and growth of their team / business  You like to work in smaller yet still very established organisations - not to say they don't have a complex and very scalable product  You like to coach and mentor engineers to help them reach their full potential   What sort of technical skills are they looking for?      Expertise with a Cloud native stack on AWS, experience with Terraform Experience writing code with Golang in a production environment An interest in implementing AI or ML technology would be a bonus The have 10+ Billion data points per month - so experience working with Snowflake would be ideal  Experience with designing & architecting solutions end to end   Leading teams that are following quality engineering practices - TDD, BDD  If you have the skills and are curious to find out more, CLICK APPLY or even if you are just passively open to hearing more, please do get in touch with me for a confidential chat on 0491011875 or dominic@justdigitalpeople.com.au   If this position not quite the right one, then don't worry! We always have a wide range of different and cool jobs that are all things Software & Data - from Start-ups to publicly listed businesses :) Who knows, we may just have that special something you've been looking for.

column3: Rare opportunity to be part of an industry leading information security team within a university.
column13: DIGITAL AND CAMPUS SERVICES JOONDALUP COMPETITIVE SALARY PLUS 17% SUPERANNUATION  FULL-TIME, ONGOING  Overview  Edith Cowan University (ECU) is a large, multi-campus university serving communities nationally and internationally. Within ECU, Digital and Campus Services provides an organisation-wide service that is characterised by its responsiveness and customer-orientated approach. Digital and Campus Services brings together and optimises the digital and physical environments for students and staff; supporting their teaching, learning, research and administrative needs.  The Digital Governance, Risk, Security and Operations team support the development, enforcement and maintenance of information security and privacy programs through policy development, incident response and reporting, vulnerability management and overall risk management and assurance efforts.  The Information Security, Risk and Governance team is responsible for the delivery of information security services to ECU which includes security controls, IT risk management, governance, monitoring, managing, reporting, accreditation, and compliance for Digital and Campus Services.    This team is currently overseeing the addition of significant state of the art cyber security capabilities and providing support services for the magnificent addition to our campuses – the Edith Cowan University Perth based City Campus.  Come on, apply to join the team during this exciting period.  The Role  ECU is looking for an Information Security Operations Analyst to join our Information Security Operations team. In this role you will work proactively to identify, investigate, and respond to active and emerging security threats and incidents.  Successful candidates will be required to:  Work with the ECU’s managed services Security Operations Centre (SOC) to respond to identified threat activity, take the necessary mitigating actions and document incidents. Perform triage for active incidents, conduct investigation and remediation, and where appropriate escalate to senior analysts and management. Analyse vulnerabilities and threats to ECU, assess risks and priorities, and take actions for timely resolution. Ensure all incidents are documented end-to-end. Conduct analysis of security event log data sourced from disparate systems across ECU’s enterprise environment, including ECU networks and managed systems, and third-party managed solutions. Use their security operations experience and technical knowledge of solutions to manage, monitor and detect security risks. The solutions might include Microsoft Entra ID, Defender & M365, SIEM solutions, e.g. Logscale, Splunk, SOAR, Firewall and Zero Trust solutions.  It is expected that you can demonstrate 3 years+ experience or relevant skills with the above criteria.  You will also demonstrate personal attributes that are congruent with the University’s values of Integrity, Respect, Rational Inquiry, courage and Personal Excellence.  Benefits & Remuneration  This position attracts a competitive salary plus 17% University superannuation contribution.  ECU supports a work/life balance for staff. Benefits such as flexible working arrangements may also be negotiated to meet your personal circumstances.  ECU has an Award-winning Health and Wellness Program and an extensive range of staff benefits across entertainment, financial, health, travel and consumer goods and services.  For information on the benefits of working at ECU, please visit our website Employment Opportunities Overview.  Contact  Interested applicants are welcome to contact Peter Ward (peter.ward@ecu.edu.au) for more information.   How to Apply  Please upload your resume along with a statement (2 pages maximum) outlining your suitability for this role.   Closing Date:  Applications close on Friday, 30 August 2024 at 11:30pm AWST.  PLEASE NOTE: THIS IS AN ONGOING POSITION; APPLICATIONS WILL ONLY BE ACCEPTED FROM CANDIDATES WHO HAVE EITHER PERMANENT RESIDENCY OR AUSTRALIAN CITIZENSHIP. THIS POSITION DOES NOT ATTRACT ANY RELOCATION PACKAGE TO ECU JOONDALUP CAMPUS IN WESTERN AUSTRALIA.  ECU is a diverse and inclusive workplace reflecting the differences in society. Specific strategies and initiatives are in place to address underrepresentation of specific groups. Applications are encouraged from suitably qualified people from all backgrounds. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people are strongly encouraged to apply.  #LI-DNP

column1: EL1, Assistant Director, Technical Delivery Lead
column2: Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission
column3: Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.
column13: About the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission  The Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission (the Commission) was formed on 1 January 2019. The role of the Commission is to protect and enhance the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of people receiving aged care.     The Commission is the national end-to-end regulator of aged care services and the primary point of contact for consumers and providers in relation to quality and safety. Our vision is to support a world-class aged care system driven by empowered consumers who enjoy the best possible quality of life.      We aim to build confidence and trust in aged care, empower consumers, promote best practice service provision, promote quality standards and hold providers to account for their performance against the expected standards of care. We seek to promote an aged care system that develops safer systems of care, inculcates a culture of safety and quality, and learns from mistakes, while providing the oversight that can assure the community that aged care services are operating as they should, including working on continuous improvement.      Meet some of our people and learn more about the Commission and our Regulatory Strategy on our website www.agedcarequality.gov.au      About the Team  The Enterprise Service Management section aims to optimise the delivery of Digital and IT services across the Commission, by focussing on robust service management practices and leveraging technology to enhance efficiency, transparency, and user satisfaction.     Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.     About the Role  The EL1 Technical Delivery Lead is a critical role within the Enterprise Service Management section which is responsible for managing a team of ICT Professionals solve complex issues. This includes working between teams on critical incidents as well as being the Problem Manager.     This position requires a high capacity for decision making, setting work priorities, taking necessary escalations and the ability to provide technical guidance and training. This role will require vendor management skills as well as project management capability.      Position Duties  Have extensive Microsoft 365 administration experience. Provide Digital services and support solutions to internal stakeholders including, but not limited to, service management, incident and problem management and digital literacy. Need to identify Problems as they arise, ensuring that they are being managed to completion, including communicating with the Business.  Contribute to the Commission’s response to critical incidents ensuring that timely and effective management and escalation of issues is enacted and timely reports are provided to leadership. Be willing to maintain ICT literacy as well as training and mentoring team members.  Work effectively with internal and external stakeholders, such as the Department of Health and other agencies to provide ICT support services. Contribute to the Digital strategy in consultation with the Director of Enterprise Service Management. Be approachable as the leader of the team.  Assist in project work and other duties as directed. Contribute to a positive culture that values innovation and ideas.     Position Eligibility Requirements (Selection Criteria):  Extensive experience delivering Digital level 2 and 3 support services, including knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and domains. A strong customer service focus. A focus on continuous improvement. Experience in the creation and development of technical documentation, knowledge articles and Standard Operating Procedures. The ability to communicate openly and build strong professional relationships with staff, stakeholders and clients at all levels. This includes excellent negotiation and influencing skills. Demonstrated ability working with a project team to deliver effective outcomes. An understanding of SLA’s and ITSM Practices. The ability to deliver high quality work to tight timeframes. Eligibility for NV1 level Security Clearance     Desirable  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience. ITIL Certification. Microsoft Certification. Relevant industry Certification. Experience working in government/public sector. Understanding of the Commission’s role as an end-to-end regulator     Position Notes:  Salary offered will be between $114,247 - $130,300 per annum depending on skills and experience. In addition, 15.4% superannuation will be paid. Only candidates who hold Australian citizenship can apply. Appointment is conditional on successfully completing a national police check. For more information, please visit www.apsc.gov.au/citizenship-aps Non-ongoing opportunities will be offered for varying periods up to 12 months with the option to extend to a total of 24 months. Merit Pool established through this selection process may be used to fill this or future ongoing or non-ongoing vacancies.     In your application, please provide a statement of claims against the position eligibility requirements (selection criteria) in no more than 600-words, including what strengths you would bring to the role, and a copy of your CV.     Please complete the application and submit by Monday 19 August 2024 at 11.30pm (AEST).     Please contact our recruitment team on (02) 9633 3262 or recruitment@agedcarequality.gov.au for assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.     Specific questions about the roles can be directed to James Stephens by emailing james.stephens@agedcarequality.gov.au with the position title in the subject line.     Diversity and Inclusion     The Commission is committed to fostering a workplace with flexible work arrangements to support a diverse, respectful and inclusive culture for all staff.      The Commission recognises the richness of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and is committed to the implementation of our Reconciliation Action Plan. The Commission values the unique knowledge and experience of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employees which strengthens and supports our focus on protecting and enhancing the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of aged care consumers.      Further information:      For further information about the Quality Commission, office locations and other related resources, please visit https://www.agedcarequality.gov.au     For more information on the Australian Public Service, please visit http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code/factsheet-4 and http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code.

column3: We're seeking a highly skilled IT professional responsible for ensuring the optimal performance and support of important SaaS business applications.
column13: About Us:  Welcome to The Perth Mint, where golden career opportunities await.   The Perth Mint is an iconic Western Australian organisation operating on a truly global scale. Situated in East Perth for 125 years, The Perth Mint is a premier tourist destination, an award-winning exporter, and a key supplier of precious metals to markets throughout the world.  There’s no organisation quite like it, with a variety of roles available, from engineers and chemists to artists and technicians.   Foster your fascination and pride in our work. Get inspired every day by the world-class precious metal products we work together to refine, design, produce and then distribute all over the globe. Connect to the rich history of our industry in a workplace firmly rooted in the present — as leaders in sustainability and inclusion.  At The Perth Mint, you’ll be supported in a diverse team where differences are celebrated and your well-being matters — striking the right work-life balance with compassionate team benefits. And if your career goals change, you’ll be empowered to change roles with training and internal mobility.     Our Benefits:  Competitive salaries and employee discounts Flexible work options available - working from home options (up to 2 days available) and options to work flexibly (9-day fortnight, compressed working week, monthly RDO etc.) Extended leave options including purchased leave, leave at half pay and access to pro-rata long service leave Opportunity to work for an endorsed WORK180 employer Paid parental leave and secondary carer’s leave available after 6 months service. 12 weeks paid parental leave for primary caregivers and 6 weeks paid secondary care giver’s leave Training and development opportunities Opportunities to be part of our wide and active range of Employee Resourcing Groups: Reconciliation, Gender, Culturally and Linguistically Diverse (CALD), Disability, Mental Health and Neurodiversity, and Perth Mint with Pride Charity and volunteer initiatives Income protection after an accident or illness Health and wellness programs, including an Employee Assistance Program, ongoing wellbeing initiatives, and workplace community building spaces Our full list of benefits and why we are recognised as an Endorsed Employer for Women by WORK180 can be seen on the WORK180 website  So go on, make your mark. If you are excited by this role and want to join the team at the iconic Perth Mint, apply today.     The Senior Specialist Business Systems is a highly skilled IT professional responsible for ensuring the optimal performance and support of important SaaS business applications.  This role requires a strategic approach to aligning technological solutions with organisational goals, while providing expert-level troubleshooting and maintenance.  The Senior Specialist Business Systems possesses a strong customer focus and the ability to collaborate effectively with both technical and non-technical stakeholders.     Your role as a Senior Specialist Business Systems will involve:  Collaborating with business stakeholders to understand their requirements and translate them into system specifications Building and maintaining strong relationships with vendors and business users to ensure their needs are met Ensuring the smooth operation, reliability, and performance of business systems Managing and resolving system-related incidents according to established procedures Diagnosing, troubleshooting, and resolving system issues and errors promptly Identifying opportunities to improve system efficiency, performance, and user experience Participating in the planning, testing, and implementation of system upgrades and enhancements Communicating and managing system changes effectively to minimise disruptions Identifying opportunities to improve business processes through the use of technology Analysing system data to identify trends, patterns, and areas of improvement Participating in initiatives to enhance system and process efficiency Maintaining up-to-date documentation and user guides Providing training and support to users on system functionalities     Experience:  Experience in IT support and systems administration Demonstrated experience in: system implementation projects; managing organisational change effectively; and, supporting and maintaining business systems Strong understanding of IT infrastructure and operations Experience in working with diverse stakeholders, including business users and technical teams Tertiary qualifications in Information Technology or a related field Relevant industry certifications that demonstrate: a broad skill set; a deep understanding of IT service management; and, proficiency in data analysis for extracting insights from system data  It’s easy to dismiss the perfect opportunity if you don’t see yourself as the perfect fit. If this role feels right – no matter your background or personal circumstances – please submit your application.     Applications close on 19 August 2024. The Perth Mint reserves the right to close applications prior to this date.  Candidates must have the right to work in Australia and pass our national security check.     Our Commitment to Inclusion:  Inclusion is at the core of what we do. We are committed to equality and celebrate the diversity of race, gender, age, sexual orientation, religion, ethnicity, and all characteristics that make us unique as individuals.  We encourage applications from a range of candidates, including, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with disability, people of all gender identities, youth, seniors, the LGBTQI+ community and people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds.  We recognise that standard recruitment processes are not accessible to everyone. If there are any accommodations or supports that would assist you in participating in the recruitment process for this role, please reach out to recruitment@perthmint.com.  To learn more about our diversity and inclusion initiatives please visit our website.

column3: This is a great opportunity for an App Developer, based in Hobart.
column13: This is a great opportunity for an App Developer, based in Hobart.  Your new company   A recognised leader in its sector, this established organisation is passionate about creating products that cater to its customers' needs.    Your new role   Based on-site in Hobart, you will be developing an e-commerce app for business. With a passion for creating high-quality, user-friendly applications, you will need to lead the organisation as the expert in the app development space.  Key responsibilities include, but not limited to:  Develop and maintain mobile applications using React and other cross-platform technologies. Collaborate with developers, product managers, and other teams to create seamless user experiences. Write clean, maintainable, and efficient code. Troubleshoot and debug applications to ensure optimal performance. Stay up-to-date with the latest industry trends and technologies.  Technologies: React, Next.Js, TypeScript, Node.js, Tailwind CSS, Sanity, GraphQL, Git    What you'll need to succeed   Minimum of 3-5 years' experience working with the above tech stack in an app developer role  Strong understanding of mobile application development, including experience with RESTful API's  Excellent communication and collaboration skills  Relevant tertiary qualification    What you'll get in return   This role offers a great work environment within an Employer of Choice organisation. You will work with a collaborative and supportive team and an attractive salary package is on offer.    What you need to do now   If you're interested in this role, click 'apply now' or forward an up-to-date copy of your CV to Kath Fick via email: Kath.Fick@hays.com.au or call +61 3 6108 5552. If this job isn't quite right for you, but you are looking for a new position, please contact us for a confidential discussion about your career.

column3: Work at a Wireless Microwave Communications company who have been in Wireless Communications since 1985.
column13: Communication Technician with Experience at Wave1, Brisbane  About Wave1 Pty Ltd  Wave1 Pty Ltd has been a leading force in Australia’s telecommunications industry for over 35 years. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality wireless solutions, ensuring projects are completed safely, on time, and within budget.  The Role  We are currently seeking a seasoned Communication Technician to join our team at our MacGregor office, conveniently located just 12km south of Brisbane. The successful candidate will be responsible for:  Assisting with pre-sales wireless design Providing support for wireless installation quotes and tenders Offering technical telephone support to customers and service agents Managing installations, installation contractors, and support contractors Performing in-field installation and maintenance work Controlling and maintaining Brisbane engineering spares Documenting project details (such as “as built”)  Qualifications and Skills  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  An Australian Drivers Licence Australian residency ACMA Cabling licence with Endorsements A solid understanding of coax cabling and cat6 cabling Experience in wireless/microwave installations  It would be highly advantageous if the candidate also has:  Certificate III in Telecommunications Industry Construction White Card First Aid Certificate Working with Children certification Working at Heights certification Tower rope rescue training Radiation Awareness training  In addition to these qualifications, proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel is required.  Benefits  Joining our team means becoming part of a company that values innovation, teamwork, and professional growth. We offer a supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and provides opportunities for skill development. Our competitive compensation package includes a fully maintained late model vehicle, comprehensive training, and opportunities for career advancement.  Interested Applicants may forward their resumes to: applicaions@wave1.com.au

column2: Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission
column3: This Australian Company is ranked among the top MSP's in Australia!
column13: Cyber and Cloud technologies! Expand your IT knowledge Northern Beaches     This client is an award-winning Managed Service Provider with a varied and high-profile client base. Due to rapid expansion, we are seeking an outstanding individual to undertake the role of Service Desk Analyst (Level 2). The environment is fast-paced and is a rare opportunity for you to make a genuine impact in a company that focuses on a culture that embraces creativity, fosters innovation and offers real career progression. This will be your chance to demonstrate delivering results for customers and building strong customer relationships. You will be collaborative, team orientated as well as being able to work autonomously.  About the Company  This company is regularly ranked among the top MSPs in Australia. It helps businesses across Australia and New Zealand to use cloud technologies efficiently and securely. It is also committed to support best practice infrastructure solutions to some of Australia’s best-known brands.  About the Role  The purpose of the role is to deliver  with impact, fast reaction results and remote support to customers across Australia; provide technical support to major Australian projects, with a particular focus on SEQ sites and works; build and maintain strong customer relationships while providing onsite support for a range of clients covering physical networking, hardware and peripherals and provide strategic solutions to a variety of technical issues including desktop support, telephony, local area networking and peripherals.   About You  To be successful in this role you need to demonstrate the following: a high skill level of Windows and Mac desktop support, and an understanding of core networking principles and technologies; prior Level 1 and Level 2 IT support experience – preferably in a professional services environment; experience with Autotask (or another ITIL-compliant ticketing system);excellent customer service skills, with experience working in a high-demand environment; the ability to provide excellent customer service and provide clear verbal and written communication skills; technical and solutions focused with demonstrated attention to detail; certifications in Microsoft product support and ITIL frameworks are preferred but not essential and a desire  to upskill on different types of technologies;  Please note , this position will be located on a client site.  For further details contact Rosa on 03 9347 7780 or email your resume to rosa@micalerecruitment.com

column1: EL1, Assistant Director, Technical Delivery Lead
column3: Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.
column13: About the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission  The Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission (the Commission) was formed on 1 January 2019. The role of the Commission is to protect and enhance the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of people receiving aged care.     The Commission is the national end-to-end regulator of aged care services and the primary point of contact for consumers and providers in relation to quality and safety. Our vision is to support a world-class aged care system driven by empowered consumers who enjoy the best possible quality of life.      We aim to build confidence and trust in aged care, empower consumers, promote best practice service provision, promote quality standards and hold providers to account for their performance against the expected standards of care. We seek to promote an aged care system that develops safer systems of care, inculcates a culture of safety and quality, and learns from mistakes, while providing the oversight that can assure the community that aged care services are operating as they should, including working on continuous improvement.      Meet some of our people and learn more about the Commission and our Regulatory Strategy on our website www.agedcarequality.gov.au      About the Team  The Enterprise Service Management section aims to optimise the delivery of Digital and IT services across the Commission, by focussing on robust service management practices and leveraging technology to enhance efficiency, transparency, and user satisfaction.     Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.     About the Role  The EL1 Technical Delivery Lead is a critical role within the Enterprise Service Management section which is responsible for managing a team of ICT Professionals solve complex issues. This includes working between teams on critical incidents as well as being the Problem Manager.     This position requires a high capacity for decision making, setting work priorities, taking necessary escalations and the ability to provide technical guidance and training. This role will require vendor management skills as well as project management capability.      Position Duties  Have extensive Microsoft 365 administration experience. Provide Digital services and support solutions to internal stakeholders including, but not limited to, service management, incident and problem management and digital literacy. Need to identify Problems as they arise, ensuring that they are being managed to completion, including communicating with the Business.  Contribute to the Commission’s response to critical incidents ensuring that timely and effective management and escalation of issues is enacted and timely reports are provided to leadership. Be willing to maintain ICT literacy as well as training and mentoring team members.  Work effectively with internal and external stakeholders, such as the Department of Health and other agencies to provide ICT support services. Contribute to the Digital strategy in consultation with the Director of Enterprise Service Management. Be approachable as the leader of the team.  Assist in project work and other duties as directed. Contribute to a positive culture that values innovation and ideas.     Position Eligibility Requirements (Selection Criteria):  Extensive experience delivering Digital level 2 and 3 support services, including knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and domains. A strong customer service focus. A focus on continuous improvement. Experience in the creation and development of technical documentation, knowledge articles and Standard Operating Procedures. The ability to communicate openly and build strong professional relationships with staff, stakeholders and clients at all levels. This includes excellent negotiation and influencing skills. Demonstrated ability working with a project team to deliver effective outcomes. An understanding of SLA’s and ITSM Practices. The ability to deliver high quality work to tight timeframes. Eligibility for NV1 level Security Clearance     Desirable  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience. ITIL Certification. Microsoft Certification. Relevant industry Certification. Experience working in government/public sector. Understanding of the Commission’s role as an end-to-end regulator     Position Notes:  Salary offered will be between $114,247 - $130,300 per annum depending on skills and experience. In addition, 15.4% superannuation will be paid. Only candidates who hold Australian citizenship can apply. Appointment is conditional on successfully completing a national police check. For more information, please visit www.apsc.gov.au/citizenship-aps Non-ongoing opportunities will be offered for varying periods up to 12 months with the option to extend to a total of 24 months. Merit Pool established through this selection process may be used to fill this or future ongoing or non-ongoing vacancies.     In your application, please provide a statement of claims against the position eligibility requirements (selection criteria) in no more than 600-words, including what strengths you would bring to the role, and a copy of your CV.     Please complete the application and submit by Monday 19 August 2024 at 11.30pm (AEST).     Please contact our recruitment team on (02) 9633 3262 or recruitment@agedcarequality.gov.au for assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.     Specific questions about the roles can be directed to James Stephens by emailing james.stephens@agedcarequality.gov.au with the position title in the subject line.     Diversity and Inclusion     The Commission is committed to fostering a workplace with flexible work arrangements to support a diverse, respectful and inclusive culture for all staff.      The Commission recognises the richness of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and is committed to the implementation of our Reconciliation Action Plan. The Commission values the unique knowledge and experience of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employees which strengthens and supports our focus on protecting and enhancing the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of aged care consumers.      Further information:      For further information about the Quality Commission, office locations and other related resources, please visit https://www.agedcarequality.gov.au     For more information on the Australian Public Service, please visit http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code/factsheet-4 and http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code.

column3: Data Engineer with SSIS, MS SQL Server, Azure expertise, ensuring reliable data, accurate reporting, and insightful analysis. Data Bricks a plus!
column13: Perm Role Based In Sydney hybrid Work Environment  Data Analyst/Engineer  Are you a meticulous and proactive Data Analyst/Engineer looking to make a significant impact? Our Client is looking for someone with expertise in SSIS and MS SQL Server, along with understanding of Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Factory. Familiarity with Data Bricks is a plus. In this role, you will ensure the reliability and accuracy of data systems, uphold the integrity of data processes, and contribute to the development of insightful reports.  Key Responsibilities: - Monitor data loads, promptly addressing any issues to ensure dependable data for reporting. - Investigate and resolve incidents of failed data loads and discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and reliability. - Develop and deliver timely, accurate, and insightful reports using Power BI to support business decision-making.  Requirements: - Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and Microsoft SQL Server. - Knowledge of Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Factory. - Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues. - Proficiency in building and customising reports in Power BI.  Qualifications: - Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field preferred. - Relevant certifications or training in data engineering or related technologies.  Preferred Skills: - Excellent communication skills. - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. - Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.  Apply here or for more information please reach out  If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Poppy Boulton at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 419 740 399.  At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.  We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

column1: System Administrator - Total Synergy - Sydney - $100,000 + super
column3: SaaS company looking for a Total Synergy Sys Admin
column13: System Administrator / Total Synergy / Sydney / $100,000 + super  About the company Our client is an innovative Australian company specializing in B2B SaaS products and consultancy services.  About the role They are looking for a Sys admin to join their team with skills in Total Synergy. The role will be based in Sydney - They have an office in the CBD and have a hybrid working policy.  Duties/Key Skills - High level understanding of Total Synergy software - Support project development, implementation and continuous improvements - Own project setup and admin in Total Synergy - Maintain data integrity with Total Synergy and SharePoint - Troubleshoot and resolve system issues for end users - Support the operational team with the systems management  Benefits Salary range is $80,000 to $100,000 + super  If you’re interested in this opportunity and feel you’re the right fit please click “apply” or contact Kaio at kaio.desouza@allurapartners.com.au  About Allura Partners Allura Partners was founded to support private equity firms by placing C-Suites to lead, transform, and scale portfolio companies. Today, in addition to our proven private equity specialisation, we’ve become a trusted partner for major ASX-listed and private enterprises in Australia, offering executive search, recruitment, and business transformation. Known for integrity, reliability, and results, our expertise spans Executive Search, Accounting & Finance, Transformation & Change, and Technology & Digital. We connect businesses and top-tier talent, exceeding expectations and driving lasting impact.  System Administrator / Total Synergy / Sydney / $100,000 + super

column3: Exciting opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst to join the team!
column13: Our purpose is to keep Victorians energy safe and ensure energy is used confidently. Through education, regulation and enforcement, we work to ensure that energy safety, supply and efficiency are a priority in Victoria and something our customers can be confident in. Our people come from a wide range of professions with diverse skills and experience driving the success of Energy Safe Victoria.  About the opportunity  We have an exciting fixed term (until June 2025) opportunity for a Business Systems Analyst responsibile for supporting a national project for the development of the Electrical Equipment Safety System Platform being managed by Energy Safe Victoria.  You will contribute by:  Elicit and maintain the business system requirements across the lifecycle of new capabilities. Develop working relationships with Product Owner and other key subject matter experts to enhance business functions and project delivery. Help and drive project teams in understanding their system requirements. Support Energy Safe's Business Units, Information Technology, and business system teams to ensure they utilise effective project governance and risk management processes. Develop requirement specifications and/or functional specifications to support successful transition to system implementation where required. Monitor test activities and report on test artifacts (e.g. test plan and test summary report). Complete assigned activities to project timelines. Identify project related issues and risks, ensuring that they are appropriately captured raised and actioned. Perform duties as Scrum Master such as conducting agile ceremonies, removing impediments during sprint development, and providing support to production deployments. Create and maintain documentation for each business system as required.  To be successful, you'll have:  Tertiary qualifications in information technology or similar. Significant experience in a similar role within a project delivery team environment. Proven experience working directly with internal clients and preparing system requirements and business process documentation. Sound understanding of data governance, data exchanges and data quality testing/assessments. Sound understanding of business and information analysis and associated techniques and processes. Good understanding of Agile delivery and related frameworks. Good understanding of Azure DevOps from agile delivery perspective. Good understanding of Pega/ServiceNow. Proven ability to successfully gather requirements and achieve results while working independently. High levels of initiative with ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously with conflicting priorities. Strong problem-solving skills and the ability to identify and predict risks and issues. Strong interpersonal skills with a proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships using effective negotiation, communication and facilitation skills. How to apply  Please refer to the available position description to assess your suitability and submit your current resume and cover letter via the Apply button. Applications will not be accepted via email.  Energy Safe will conduct relevant checks about applicants and the information provided with an application including reference checks and a satisfactory National Police Check.  Energy Safe Victoria values the unique backgrounds, experiences, and contributions that each person brings to our organisation and welcomes and celebrates diversity. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community that we are here to protect. We invite you to talk to us about any preferences or adjustments you may value or require to either the recruitment process or the role itself. If you identify as a person with disability, please let us know how we can provide additional support.  For a confidential discussion, please contact Human Resources via humanresources@energysafe.vic.gov.au.  Applications close at midnight 13 August 2024.  This advertisement may close prior to the closure date without notice, if a high volume of applications is received, therefore we encourage you to apply as soon as possible.

column3: Huntress Product Support is a global team dedicated to supporting our partners while maintaining outstanding customer service standards.
column13: Reports to:  Senior Director of Global Support  Location: Remote Australia  Compensation Range: $135,000 AUD to $150,000 AUD base plus bonus and equity     What We Do:  Founded in 2015 as a fully remote company by former NSA cyber operators, Huntress was built on a simple premise: to force hackers to earn every inch of their access.   Today’s cyber-attacks aren’t limited to large organizations with the security tools that can ward off threats. Hackers don't discriminate and will find a way to penetrate any vulnerability in any size business, which is why Huntress focuses on protecting those small to midsize businesses that make up the backbone of our economy.  Huntress stops hidden threats that sneak past preventive security tools by utilizing our award-winning security platform and expert human threat hunters through dynamic products, including Managed EDR, MDR for Microsoft 365, and Managed Security Awareness Training.  Join the hunt and help us stop hackers in their tracks!  What You’ll Do:   As the support team continues to grow here at Huntress, we’ve identified the need for an individual to help grow and develop this team while maintaining the outstanding customer service standards we have set for our customers!  The Product Support Manager will be working directly with the product support staff to coach, mentor and develop the team to attain goals and metrics. They will be the primary point of escalation for team support and questions and be responsible for creating a communicative and collaborative environment. This individual will be a key component of hiring for this team as well and should have a strong knowledge of interviewing and general hiring practices.   Responsibilities:    Manage a team of product support professionals across several shifts and levels of experience Work to develop and deliver on the team's key metrics, operating procedures, and overall performance Lead the team through coaching, development, coordination, and communication Manage day-to-day operations to ensure requests are resolved in a timely and effective manner Serve as a manager, mentor, knowledge resource, and escalation point for employees while building credibility and trust within the support group Remain abreast of best practices and industry standards to continuously improve our support offering and partner experience  What You Bring To The Team:     5+ years of experience in product support management or a similar role Experience managing, coaching, and elevating a team A customer-first mentality and demonstrated background in delivering an exceptional customer experience Proficiency in Google Suite and Microsoft Suite Experience working with Zendesk or other ticketing systems Extensive familiarity with Slack  Excellent communication skills via Zoom, Slack, etc. with the ability to effectively communicate both synchronously and asynchronously Experience building out teams   What We Offer:   Fully remote work 1-2 trips to the US annually for events such as Sales Kick-Off and Summer Summit! New starter home office set up reimbursement ($731 AUD) Generous personal leave entitlements Digital monthly reimbursement ($169 AUD) Superannuation Healthcare Benefits Access to the BetterUp platform for coaching, personal, and professional growth     Huntress is committed to creating a culture of inclusivity where every single member of our team is valued, has a voice, and is empowered to come to work every day just as they are.  We do not discriminate based on race, ethnicity, color, ancestry, national origin, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, disability, veteran status, genetic information, marital status, or any other legally protected status.   People from all culturally diverse backgrounds, including Aboriginal & Torres Strait Islander Peoples, are encouraged to apply.  We do discriminate against hackers who try to exploit small businesses.  Accommodations:  If you require reasonable accommodation to complete this application, interview, or pre-employment testing or participate in the employee selection process, please direct your inquiries to accommodations@huntresslabs.com. Please note that non-accommodation requests to this inbox will not receive a response.  If you have questions about your personal data privacy at Huntress, please visit our privacy page.

column3: Azure Cloud Systems Engineer - mix of Presales, BAU & project migrations, implementations, troubleshooting for Brisbane MSP
column13: Join exceptionally successful and long term MSP as a Senior MS Cloud Systems Engineer due to growth and huge project pipelines.  MS Cloud Systems Engineer MS Azure, Office 365, AD, Intune, 365 Modern Workplace Brisbane - Hybrid role     Responsibilities:  As a Cloud Systems Engineer with a focus on Azure migrations, you will be responsible for the execution of secure and efficient cloud migrations from on-premises environments to Microsoft Azure. This is a hands-on role that requires a deep understanding of both Azure and on-premises infrastructure as a Level 3 Systems Engineer. Act as a right hand to Solution Architects and provide presales technical advice and articulate technical solutions to clients.  Essential Skills & Experience:  Proven experience leading Microsoft Azure on prem to cloud migrations as a Level 3 Engineer Solid understanding of on-prem & cloud infrastructure across Windows Server, Active Directory, Exchange, 365 etc Hands-on experience with on-prem to cloud migrations, implementations, solution design & architecture, customer facing/pre sales involvement Experience with experience with SaaS, PaaS or IaaS implementations Excellent problem-solving and analytical skills Strong communication and collaboration skills Experience working within an MSP or in a Consulting capacity Benefits:  Competitive salary and benefits package Opportunity to work on cutting-edge cloud technologies Collaborative and fast-paced work environment Career growth and development opportunities High visibility role, ability to make real change and impact positive technical direction. Opportunity to obtain technical certifications through partnerships (with internal incentives) to excel in your career progression. Hybrid - 2 Days Work From Office We'd love to meet you as soon as possible - apply today via the link or email directly to sara.petras@realtimeaustralia.com

column1: EL1, Assistant Director, Technical Delivery Lead
column2: Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission
column3: Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.
column13: About the Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission  The Aged Care Quality and Safety Commission (the Commission) was formed on 1 January 2019. The role of the Commission is to protect and enhance the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of people receiving aged care.     The Commission is the national end-to-end regulator of aged care services and the primary point of contact for consumers and providers in relation to quality and safety. Our vision is to support a world-class aged care system driven by empowered consumers who enjoy the best possible quality of life.      We aim to build confidence and trust in aged care, empower consumers, promote best practice service provision, promote quality standards and hold providers to account for their performance against the expected standards of care. We seek to promote an aged care system that develops safer systems of care, inculcates a culture of safety and quality, and learns from mistakes, while providing the oversight that can assure the community that aged care services are operating as they should, including working on continuous improvement.      Meet some of our people and learn more about the Commission and our Regulatory Strategy on our website www.agedcarequality.gov.au      About the Team  The Enterprise Service Management section aims to optimise the delivery of Digital and IT services across the Commission, by focussing on robust service management practices and leveraging technology to enhance efficiency, transparency, and user satisfaction.     Our Vision is to improve efficiency, reduce risk and transform the user experience.     About the Role  The EL1 Technical Delivery Lead is a critical role within the Enterprise Service Management section which is responsible for managing a team of ICT Professionals solve complex issues. This includes working between teams on critical incidents as well as being the Problem Manager.     This position requires a high capacity for decision making, setting work priorities, taking necessary escalations and the ability to provide technical guidance and training. This role will require vendor management skills as well as project management capability.      Position Duties  Have extensive Microsoft 365 administration experience. Provide Digital services and support solutions to internal stakeholders including, but not limited to, service management, incident and problem management and digital literacy. Need to identify Problems as they arise, ensuring that they are being managed to completion, including communicating with the Business.  Contribute to the Commission’s response to critical incidents ensuring that timely and effective management and escalation of issues is enacted and timely reports are provided to leadership. Be willing to maintain ICT literacy as well as training and mentoring team members.  Work effectively with internal and external stakeholders, such as the Department of Health and other agencies to provide ICT support services. Contribute to the Digital strategy in consultation with the Director of Enterprise Service Management. Be approachable as the leader of the team.  Assist in project work and other duties as directed. Contribute to a positive culture that values innovation and ideas.     Position Eligibility Requirements (Selection Criteria):  Extensive experience delivering Digital level 2 and 3 support services, including knowledge of Microsoft operating systems and domains. A strong customer service focus. A focus on continuous improvement. Experience in the creation and development of technical documentation, knowledge articles and Standard Operating Procedures. The ability to communicate openly and build strong professional relationships with staff, stakeholders and clients at all levels. This includes excellent negotiation and influencing skills. Demonstrated ability working with a project team to deliver effective outcomes. An understanding of SLA’s and ITSM Practices. The ability to deliver high quality work to tight timeframes. Eligibility for NV1 level Security Clearance     Desirable  Bachelor's degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related discipline, or equivalent professional experience. ITIL Certification. Microsoft Certification. Relevant industry Certification. Experience working in government/public sector. Understanding of the Commission’s role as an end-to-end regulator     Position Notes:  Salary offered will be between $114,247 - $130,300 per annum depending on skills and experience. In addition, 15.4% superannuation will be paid. Only candidates who hold Australian citizenship can apply. Appointment is conditional on successfully completing a national police check. For more information, please visit www.apsc.gov.au/citizenship-aps Non-ongoing opportunities will be offered for varying periods up to 12 months with the option to extend to a total of 24 months. Merit Pool established through this selection process may be used to fill this or future ongoing or non-ongoing vacancies.     In your application, please provide a statement of claims against the position eligibility requirements (selection criteria) in no more than 600-words, including what strengths you would bring to the role, and a copy of your CV.     Please complete the application and submit by Monday 19 August 2024 at 11.30pm (AEST).     Please contact our recruitment team on (02) 9633 3262 or recruitment@agedcarequality.gov.au for assistance with accessing our website or with lodging your application.     Specific questions about the roles can be directed to James Stephens by emailing james.stephens@agedcarequality.gov.au with the position title in the subject line.     Diversity and Inclusion     The Commission is committed to fostering a workplace with flexible work arrangements to support a diverse, respectful and inclusive culture for all staff.      The Commission recognises the richness of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander cultures and is committed to the implementation of our Reconciliation Action Plan. The Commission values the unique knowledge and experience of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander employees which strengthens and supports our focus on protecting and enhancing the safety, health, wellbeing and quality of life of aged care consumers.      Further information:      For further information about the Quality Commission, office locations and other related resources, please visit https://www.agedcarequality.gov.au     For more information on the Australian Public Service, please visit http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code/factsheet-4 and http://www.apsc.gov.au/publications-and-media/current-publications/cracking-the-code.

column3: Data Engineer with SSIS, MS SQL Server, Azure expertise, ensuring reliable data, accurate reporting, and insightful analysis. Data Bricks a plus!
column13: Perm Role Based In Sydney hybrid Work Environment  Data Analyst/Engineer  Are you a meticulous and proactive Data Analyst/Engineer looking to make a significant impact? Our Client is looking for someone with expertise in SSIS and MS SQL Server, along with understanding of Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Factory. Familiarity with Data Bricks is a plus. In this role, you will ensure the reliability and accuracy of data systems, uphold the integrity of data processes, and contribute to the development of insightful reports.  Key Responsibilities: - Monitor data loads, promptly addressing any issues to ensure dependable data for reporting. - Investigate and resolve incidents of failed data loads and discrepancies, ensuring data accuracy and reliability. - Develop and deliver timely, accurate, and insightful reports using Power BI to support business decision-making.  Requirements: - Experience with SQL Server Integration Services (SSIS) and Microsoft SQL Server. - Knowledge of Azure SQL Database and Azure Data Factory. - Strong problem-solving skills with the ability to troubleshoot and resolve data-related issues. - Proficiency in building and customising reports in Power BI.  Qualifications: - Degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field preferred. - Relevant certifications or training in data engineering or related technologies.  Preferred Skills: - Excellent communication skills. - Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment. - Strong analytical skills with attention to detail.  Apply here or for more information please reach out  If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Poppy Boulton at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 419 740 399.  At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.  We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

column3: Delivery Manager role with leading Melbourne based client.  Ideal profile will have considerable experience with:  - IT Leadership
column13: Delivery Manager role with leading Melbourne based client.   Ideal profile will have considerable experience with:   - IT Leadership (leading mutiple, multi-disciplinary teams)  - Azure (essential) - Salesforce (essential) - API/Web Applications (essential)  If interested, please contact pobrien@morganconsulting.com.au

column3: We're looking for an SRE with a generalist background to join a tight-knit innovative business in the Risk & Compliance space.
column13: Fully remote role Flexible working arrangements Collaborative, team environment $80k - $90k + super    About the Company: Our client are pioneers in developing cutting-edge risk and compliance software that empowers businesses to navigate the complex landscape of regulatory requirements seamlessly. They are on a mission to redefine the future of risk management, and they need your expertise to build the foundation of their success.  Position: Site Reliability Engineer  Key Responsibilities: Server Infrastructure Focus:  The primary goal is to ensure reliability and availability of the server infrastructure. maintain a secure and scalable infrastructure within Microsoft Azure - Emphasis on maintaining system stability rather than optimizing for performance. Small business with a streamlined software platform for easy maintenance. Maintenance Over New Deployments:  Minimal to no new deployments; the focus is on maintaining the existing system. Seeking someone committed to the ongoing stability of the current setup. Generalist Approach:  Preferring a generalist with a broad skill set. This role will support various business aspects, not just specialized in infrastructure. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure our systems align with industry-leading security and compliance standards. Utilize your expertise in information security to identify and mitigate potential risks. Diverse Responsibilities:  Besides Azure server management, responsibilities may expand to desktop support. Involvement in desktop hardware, software licenses, deployment, email, and collaboration tools. Inclusion of ISO27001-related tasks involving monitoring and adherence to established procedures. Stay abreast of the latest trends and technologies in cloud and information security.    About you:  Proven experience as an Infrastructure Engineer with a focus on information security is essential. Extensive knowledge of Microsoft Azure and Microsoft infrastructure. Strong background in information security, risk management, and compliance. Hands-on experience with implementing and maintaining security controls in a cloud environment. Australian Permanent Residency or Citizenship required. Excellent problem-solving skills and the ability to work collaboratively in a fast-paced environment. Relevant certifications (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Azure Solutions Architect, Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP)). What We Offer:  Competitive salary and benefits package. Flexible working arrangement and fully remote role A collaborative and innovative work environment where your ideas are valued. Professional development opportunities to enhance your skills and advance your career. Talent Forge specialise in recruiting sales professionals in the IT, Business to Business and Industrial markets, we have many unadvertised positions, so if you are actively looking or just dipping your toe in the market then feel free to get in touch. If this position sounds of interest the click apply now or email Paul at paul@talentforge.com.au

column3: Responsible for setting up the organisation's data architecture, building the data lake and all data pipelines and processes for live dashboards.
column13: About us  The Leukaemia Foundation is on an exciting transformation journey to deliver greater impact to our key stakeholders and the Australian community. Join a national organisation standing with Australia to help cure and conquer every blood cancer – with care. Together we’re attacking every blood cancer, from every direction, in every way we can. Now more than ever, the path to conquering blood cancer requires us to work together and ensure 100% access to the right information, the best treatments, the latest trials, tests and diagnostic tools; and the best supportive care to help people not just to survive - but also to live well.     Your next career opportunity  Reporting to the Head of Data and Analytics, this role will be responsible for building all data pipelines and processes to update data in the data lake both sequentially and in real time for our live dashboards. This role will also be responsible for setting up the organisation's data architecture and building the data lake.  We are looking for an experience Data Engineer who is curious, who finds solutions to problems and brings new ideas to the table.  Overtime this role may have the opportunity to move into a leadership role, therefore we are ideally seeking applicants who are not only technically experienced but applicants who are also looking to grow and develop in the leadership space.  This is a permanent full-time position based out of our Melbourne office in Carlton. The Leukaemia Foundation adopts a hybrid working model; therefore, it is expected that the successful applicant will work on site a minimum of 3 days a week. There is flexibility around which days are worked on site, with the exception of Wednesdays, as all teams members across the organisation are required to work on site on Wednesdays.  What we will trust you to:  Assemble large, complex data sets that meet functional / non-functional business requirements. Undertake development activities across the full end-to end development cycle, from initial analysis to design, development, testing, implementation of data processing (ELT/ETL) packages, documentation, and post-delivery maintenance and support using agreed practices consistent with maturing data quality assurance. Lead planning and building the infrastructure required for optimal extraction, transformation, and loading of data from a wide variety of data sources using SQL/Python and Azure/GCP/Snowflake ‘big data’ technologies. Work with internal stakeholders to resolve data-related technical issues and support their data infrastructure needs. Create and facilitate data tools for analytics and data scientists and assist them in building and optimizing our data lake. Lead in the development of reporting, dashboards and analytics using systems and tools as required.  Does this sound like you?  Essential criteria  Relevant tertiary degree and/or post graduate qualifications in Data Engineering, Computer Science and relevant experience working with large volume databases Detailed understanding and knowledge of business intelligence, data warehousing and data lake concepts. Experience in developing data ingestion, data processing and analytical pipelines for big data, relational databases, NoSQL and data warehouse solutions. Hands on engineering of solutions and data pipelines utilising CI/CD and automation Collaboration with Technology teams, Data Analysts and Data Engineers to model, curate and prepare data for analytics and insights Works to build out a framework to fully complete and document all testing in relation to change management, as part of a continuous delivery and integration framework Modern cloud data experience in Microsoft SQL Server BI Stack, ELT/ETL development processes, Transact SQL, Azure, BigQuery, Snowflake, Qlik Replicate, Python or PowerShell Experience with Talend open studio, AWS Glue, Matillion, Google Cloud Dataflow, Stitch, or Data Factory. Experience with AWS, GCP, DBT Databricks, PySpark, Snowflake, GIT, Airflow, Python, SQL and Snowpipe Strong communication skills with experience in presenting and translating business needs into technical solutions and producing informative technical and nontechnical documentation as well as the ability to communicate, support and train non-IT staff  Desired criteria  Microsoft Azure familiarity include Synapse, Data Factory or Google Cloud and Big Query Microsoft Power BI, Looker Studio, Tableau data visualisation skills Salesforce Sales Cloud experience Experience with SSIS, SSRS, SSAS Knowledge of FIA Code of Conduct/Standards of Fundraising  What you will be proud of:  Being part of an organisation that is not only on the path to help cure and conquer every blood cancer (including Leukaemia, Lymphoma and Myeloma) but is committed in ensuring 100% access to the right information, the best treatments, the latest trials, tests and diagnostic tools; and the best supportive care to help people not just to survive - but also to live well. We are committed to building an inclusive and diverse workforce that continues to reflect the community we support. We strongly encourage people from all cultural and linguistically diverse backgrounds to apply, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people. If you have a disability or special need that requires accommodation, please let us know.    What we Offer  Generous salary packaging up to $15,900 and entertainment card up to $2,650 A collaborative, innovative and supportive team culture Ongoing training and development EAP and wellbeing initiatives Paid parental leave  We want to hear from you!   If you're interested in this exciting role, please apply with a one-page cover letter and your CV.   If you would like to find out more about this career opportunity prior to applying, or to view a copy of the position description, please contact the recruitment team recruitment@leukaemia.org.au  CLOSING DATE FOR APPLICATIONS: COB 16 August 2024  Don't delay - apply today! We will be shortlisting and interviewing as we receive applications and may appoint the right candidate ahead of the closing date.  The successful applicant will be required to undergo reference, police, COVID-19 Vaccination and VEVO checks as part of the selection process. The work we do at Leukaemia Foundation involves interaction with people impacted by blood cancer, including those who may be immunocompromised or at higher risk of infection due to other underlying health conditions, therefore all employees are required to be update to date with their COVID-19 vaccinations, unless medically exempt.

column3: The Senior Systems & Cloud Engineer is responsible for providing expert technical leadership.
column13: Applications close at 11:30pm AEST on Monday 19 August 2024 (late applications will not be accepted).  The Australian Sports Commission is embarking on the Green and Gold decade. An exciting time filled with international sporting competitions on home soil, including the Men’s and Women’s Rugby World Cup, and culminating in the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. We have an ambitious new Strategic Vision and we need the best players on our team to help us deliver real results for the sporting sector and all Australians.  Are you up for the challenge?  About the team – The Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking team have responsibility for the design and planning of the structure of the ASC's IT systems. Responsibilities include:  System Design: Creating blueprints for software, hardware, and network components. Scalability and Performance: Ensuring systems can handle growth and high loads. Integration: Coordinating different systems to work seamlessly together. Security: Implementing security measures across the architecture. Alignment with Business Goals: Ensuring technical decisions align with business objectives. Technology Evaluation: Assessing new technologies and their suitability. Cloud Strategy: Defining how cloud services fit into the overall architecture.  About the role – The Senior Systems & Cloud Engineer is responsible for providing expert technical leadership and advocacy for innovative solutions that support the efficient and effective delivery of ASC technology objectives. You will be responsible for leading and managing technical delivery aspects of technology-based projects to ensure technology designs and decisions deliver sustainable. Efficient, secure and integrated solutions. Key duties of the role include:  Designing, implementing, and maintaining ASC’s infrastructure focusing on cloud-based solutions. Configuring and managing cloud services, optimising system performance, and ensuring security and troubleshooting issues. Providing technical advice and support to technology-based projects, including feasibility assessment and risk analysis which aligns with strategic objectives. Integrate enterprise architecture and information security architectures into project solutions. Collaborating with stakeholders and project teams to understand needs and requirements. Assist in the development and implementation of sustainable systems and cloud plans and strategies to deliver outcomes.  About you – Our ideal candidate will have substantial technical leadership and experience with a structured and methodical approach with an ability to focus on achieving the delivery of ASC’s technology objectives. The successful candidate will have:  Substantial technology experience and skill across a broad range of digital enterprise platforms including:Azure, O365, ADFS, Azure AD and modern authentication (SAML, OIDC); SQL and PowerShell scripting, SCCM packaging, server/application patching and VMWare Management; Deploying and managing digital certificates and certificate authorities; Web application deployment and debugging; Network Management experience with Fortinet firewalls, Zscaler, and Aruba networking; Application integration leveraging APIs and automation frameworks; Application Whitelisting and Vulnerability Management.  Demonstrated proficiency in system administration, networking and scripting languages (Python or PowerShell). Demonstrated analytical skills and the ability to negotiate solutions and design services delivery processes. Strong written and oral communication skills. Ability to communicate with influence when working with non-technical stakeholders and document processes and procedures.  This position is offered as an ONGOING position.   Why work with us? We have offices located in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney.  Across all locations, we offer:  Options for flexible working arrangements. Annual allowances towards training based on individualised career goals. Access to a customised ASC L&D calendar for ongoing professional and career development. Generous superannuation scheme with up to 15.4% employer contributions. Corporate discount on AIS Shop merchandise. Access to Clearinghouse for Sport, an information sharing platform for Sporting professionals.  Additionally, our Canberra campus offers:  Free onsite parking Onsite facilities including café, dining hall, gym, and swimming pool. Priority placement for your children to access the award winning, onsite AIS Caretaker’s Cottage Childcare Centre.  If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact:  Contact Officer: Dillon Sayasane, Director Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking Email address: Dillon.Sayasane@ausport.gov.au   If you would like to learn more about this opportunity or to obtain the job description, click 'Apply' now

column3: Kris from Decipher Bureau is recruiting for a lead role to boost Queensland's digital economy and improve government services.
column13: Pioneering Agile Solutions and Innovation in Government Cyber Security:   The team leads digital initiatives, customer experience, and service delivery, supporting agencies with design management, capability development, corporate shared services, and customer service channels.     Your Role:   As the Director Delivery – Cyber Security, you will advance government cyber security maturity. You will also manage resources, set milestones, and provide expert advice to optimize cyber initiatives across government entities.
