You excel in team development and mentoring, with excellent communication, consultation, and negotiation skills. You can present complex technical issues to executive audiences clearly and effectively.    Bachelor's Degree or equivalent experience Strong business acumen in project planning and management Strong verbal, written, and organizational skills AU citizenship or PR     Culture and Benefits:   Join a values-driven team with supportive leadership committed to excellence in government cyber security. We offer a dynamic, fast-paced, and challenging environment where every member contributes to success.    Up to $160k-190k package inc. super (with a potential 10% loading on the base) Flexible working arrangements A diverse and inclusive work culture Opportunities for career training and development     Your Next Steps:   Contract Kris on 0452 564 644 or kris@decipherbureau.com (for cover letters and CVs)

column3: In this role you will manage operations and delivery programs for some of our key clients.
column13: Accenture is a leading global professional services company that helps the world’s leading businesses, governments and other organizations build their digital core, optimize their operations, accelerate revenue growth and enhance citizen services—creating tangible value at speed and scale. We are a talent and innovation led company with 738,000 people serving clients in more than 120 countries. Technology is at the core of change today, and we are one of the world’s leaders in helping drive that change, with strong ecosystem relationships. We combine our strength in technology with unmatched industry experience, functional expertise and global delivery capability. We are uniquely able to deliver tangible outcomes because of our broad range of services, solutions and assets across Strategy & Consulting, Technology, Operations, Industry X and Accenture Song. These capabilities, together with our culture of shared success and commitment to creating 360° value, enable us to help our clients succeed and build trusted, lasting relationships. We measure our success by the 360° value we create for our clients, each other, our shareholders, partners and communities.  Visit us at www.accenture.com.     An exciting opportunity has arisen for a Tech Architecture Manager, within one of our consulting divisions. In this role you will manage operations and delivery programs for some of our key clients. This is a great role – where your work will have a meaningful impact on the client’s business and technology. You will be an integral member of the team and you will work closely with clients, stake holders and colleagues.     Skills and experience:    Application Management: Managing high profile, critical applications for clients Consulting: Experience providing application management expertise in a consulting capacity, for external clients. Technology: Good solid understanding of providing support to a variety of web based applications, custom applications and ERP/SAAS systems. Ability to work under pressure: Ability to handle the periodic pressures or providing application support services and ability to handle application problems and incidents, with a professionally approach - whilst supporting our clients. Communication skills: Strong communication skills and an ability to work with diverse groups, people of all levels of the business, clients, stakeholders and colleagues.    Why Accenture?     At Accenture, we thrive to improve the way the world lives, works, plays, protects, and grows. We create high-performing and intelligent businesses, governments, and flourishing communities. Our purpose is to deliver on the promise of technology and human ingenuity, starting with Accenture and delivering it for our clients. We do it using our unrivalled ability to deliver end-to-end services that transform, digitise, power, run and secure innovative solutions.      Our Commitment to You     Company Culture – Work alongside a group of diverse people, in an inclusive environment, who share your passion about technology and making the world a better place in a truly human way.  Gender Equality - We have set bold goals to achieve a gender-balanced workforce by 2025. This means a workforce that is equally 50% women and 50% men for those whose gender is binary.  Flexible Working Environment – We provide several voluntary options including job-sharing opportunities, flexible time schedules, compressed work weeks, and extended weekends.  18-weeks paid parental leave for the birth or adoption of a child, to all permanent full-time and part-time employees of all gender identities, with no waiting period to access.  Employee Share Purchase Plan – You can own a piece of the company, while working towards its success.   Career Development – From day one, Accenture will help you develop a structured career plan and provide you with the resources you need to achieve your best. You will have access to world class learning and leadership programs within Accenture and with our Learning Partners.  Professional Societies Reimbursement - Accenture in an active member and sponsor of a number of industry professional organisations and supports its employees in their engagement with any professional societies.  Local and International Career Opportunities – We are a global company, serving clients in more than 120 countries and we want to grow our talent by providing them with opportunities across the globe. We also have the Accenture Development Partnerships where our people can use their skills to address complex social, economic, and environmental issues in the developing world.  Relaxation – In additional to your 4 weeks annual leave, you can participate in other leave programs such as the Purchase Leave Program.       …. and many more benefits! We are a Work180 endorsed employer. You can read about our benefits here: https://au.work180.co/employers/accenture/benefits      Equal Employment Opportunity Statement for Australia:     At Accenture, we recognise that our people are multi-dimensional, and we create a work environment where all people feel like they can bring their authentic selves to work, every day.      Our unwavering commitment to inclusion and diversity unleashes innovation and creates a culture where everyone feels they have equal opportunity. Our range of progressive policies support flexibility in ‘where’, ‘when’ and ‘how’ our people work to ensure that Accenture is an organisation where you can strive for more, achieve great things and maintain the balance and wellbeing you need.      We encourage applications from all people, and we are committed to removing barriers to the recruitment process and employee lifecycle. All employment decisions shall be made without regard to age, disability status, ethnicity, gender, gender identity or expression, religion or sexual orientation and we do not tolerate discrimination. If you require adjustments to the recruitment process or have a preferred communication method, please email exectalent@accenture.com and cite the relevant Job Number, or contact us on +61 2 9005 5000.      To ensure our workplace is inclusive and diverse we are setting bold goals and taking comprehensive action. To achieve these goals, we collect information that allows us to track the effectiveness of our Inclusion and Diversity programs. Learn how Accenture protects your personal data and know your rights in relation to your personal data. Read more about our Privacy Statement.

column3: Work at a Wireless Microwave Communications company who have been in Wireless Communications since 1985.
column13: Communication Technician with Experience at Wave1, Brisbane  About Wave1 Pty Ltd  Wave1 Pty Ltd has been a leading force in Australia’s telecommunications industry for over 35 years. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality wireless solutions, ensuring projects are completed safely, on time, and within budget.  The Role  We are currently seeking a seasoned Communication Technician to join our team at our MacGregor office, conveniently located just 12km south of Brisbane. The successful candidate will be responsible for:  Assisting with pre-sales wireless design Providing support for wireless installation quotes and tenders Offering technical telephone support to customers and service agents Managing installations, installation contractors, and support contractors Performing in-field installation and maintenance work Controlling and maintaining Brisbane engineering spares Documenting project details (such as “as built”)  Qualifications and Skills  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  An Australian Drivers Licence Australian residency ACMA Cabling licence with Endorsements A solid understanding of coax cabling and cat6 cabling Experience in wireless/microwave installations  It would be highly advantageous if the candidate also has:  Certificate III in Telecommunications Industry Construction White Card First Aid Certificate Working with Children certification Working at Heights certification Tower rope rescue training Radiation Awareness training  In addition to these qualifications, proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel is required.  Benefits  Joining our team means becoming part of a company that values innovation, teamwork, and professional growth. We offer a supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and provides opportunities for skill development. Our competitive compensation package includes a fully maintained late model vehicle, comprehensive training, and opportunities for career advancement.  Interested Applicants may forward their resumes to: applicaions@wave1.com.au

column3: Deliver excellence and continuous improvement to university IT projects, in the Student & Learning Domain.
column13: Job no: 0063325  Location: Parkville  Role type: Full-time; Continuing  Department: Chief Operating Officer Portfolio; Business Services  Salary: UOM 9 - $139,693 - $145,339 p.a. plus 17% super  Manage projects within the Student and Learning Domain Drive continuous improvement and service excellence across multiple technology platforms, diverse teams and Projects Brilliant benefits and a flexible hybrid work environment!  About the Role As Project Manager, you will lead IT projects within the Student and Learning Domain, driving improvements across the University. You will engage with key University stakeholders to identify and implement improvements, ensuring the delivery of multiple projects across various technology platforms.  Your responsibilities will include:  Managing enterprise application and process improvement projects, ensuring delivery within budget, schedule, and quality Building and maintaining strong relationships with Business Services, stakeholders, external consultants, and vendors Producing necessary documentation for governance committees and senior leaders Contributing to continuous improvement of team services and project management community, maintaining project records and reports  Who we are looking for This is an exciting project delivery role to shape and deliver projects. The ideal candidate will have a proven track record in managing enterprise projects, developing business cases, and working with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. They will possess excellent communication, vendor management, and commercial acumen, with the ability to apply various project delivery methodologies and build productive teams with a positive work culture.  You will also have:  A relevant postgraduate qualification with significant relevant experience or an equivalent combination of relevant significant experience and/or education and training Project management accreditation and/or relevant professional qualifications i.e. PMP, PRINCE2, Six Sigma, Agile etc. Demonstrated track record of ability to manage medium to large ($250k-$3m) enterprise application and process improvement projects  For further information regarding responsibilities and requirements please refer to the attached PD.  This role requires the successful candidate to undergo and maintain an up-to-date Working with Children Check. This is essential to guarantee a secure environment for all individuals at the University. In the case the selected candidate doesn't have a valid Working with Children Check, they will be able to apply for the WWCC as part of the initial onboarding procedures.  Please note: Visa sponsorship is not available for this position. This role requires current valid work rights for Australia.  Your new team – Business Services Business Services provides a full range of class leading information technology, facilities management, finance, HR and health and safety services to all operating entities of the University.  What we offer you! In addition, we offer the opportunity to be part of a vibrant community and enjoy a range of benefits including generous leave provisions, salary packaging, health and well-being services, and discounts on graduate courses. For more information check out our benefits page!  The University of Melbourne We’re tightly connected with the community, both at home and abroad. We take pride in our people, who all contribute to our mission to benefit society through the transformative impact of education and research. Discover more via our website and stay connected with our stories and people on LinkedIn.    Be yourself The University of Melbourne values the unique backgrounds, experiences, and contributions that each person brings to our community and welcomes and celebrates diversity.  First Nations people, those identifying as LGBTQIA+, parents, carers, people of all ages, abilities, and genders, and people of diverse ethnicity, nationality, and faith are encouraged to apply. Our aim is to create a workforce that reflects the diversity of the community in which we live. For more information please visit our Diversity and Inclusion page.  We are dedicated to ensuring barrier free and inclusive practices to recruit the most talented candidates. If you require reasonable adjustments, please contact the employee listed on the first page of the Position Description found below, with an email containing your name and contact details for a confidential discussion. Please ensure your email is titled "Reasonable Adjustments Request".  Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Applicants We aspire to be the University of choice for Indigenous Australians, with unprecedented investment to attract, nurture, and retain Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander students and staff. Tangible support through a range of programs and initiatives will ensure that you personally succeed and flourish while at the University of Melbourne.  For further information, including our 2023-2027 Indigenous strategy please visit -https://about.unimelb.edu.au/reconciliation/murmuk-djerring  Join Us! If you feel this role is right for you, please apply with the following documents:  Resume Cover Letter outlining your interest and experience  Please note that you are not required to respond to the selection criteria in the Position Description.  If you have any questions regarding the recruitment process, please feel free to contact Alex Spezza via email at hr-careers@unimelb.edu.au, ensuring that you include the Position Number and the Job Title as the subject. Please do not share your application to this email address.  If you have any particular questions regarding the job please follow the contact details listed on the Position Description.  Applications close: 21 August 2024 11:55 PM Australian Eastern Standard Time (AEST)  Please note that in the event of sourcing a suitable candidate, the closing date for applications may be brought forward, and the job vacancy may be closed. Therefore, we encourage interested individuals to submit their applications promptly.  Position Description: 0063325 - Project Manager, Student & Learning Domain - PD.pdf

column3: Support Australia’s energy future by driving the delivery of the Integrated System Plan.
column13: AEMO at the Heart of Energy  AEMO is Australia’s independent energy system and market operator and system planner.  AEMO’s purpose is to ensure safe, reliable and affordable energy today, and enable the energy transition for the benefit of all Australians.  Australian governments are now committed to a net zero economy for Australia by 2050 and our vision is to enable this. We have the once-in-a-lifetime opportunity to co-design the future of our energy systems, and our core values revolve around character, commitment, and connection. Join us as we contribute to this significant transition in the energy sector.     About the role The System Planning department is responsible for strategic energy planning to support the investment and operation of Australia's gas and electricity markets and infrastructure as the economy transitions to net zero emissions by 2050. The department conceptualises and assesses long-term infrastructure projects, and conducts detailed reviews of energy security and power system security, operability and reliability.  As the Program Director, you'll spearhead the Integrated System Plan (ISP) project by coordinating outcomes across multiple analytical teams, establish and maintain rigorous governance and reporting arrangements, ensure engagement with internal and external stakeholders is strategic and on track, drive project success, and develop the team’s project delivery capabilities to achieve our strategic energy goals. This full-time, permanent role can be based in Melbourne, Sydney, Adelaide, Brisbane or Perth, or can be remote, and reports to the Manager – Strategic Planning.           What you will be doing   Governance management: Plan and track appropriate governance arrangements for delivery of a multi-team strategic and analytical program. Strategic Program Leadership: Plan and deliver the ISP project, ensuring alignment with corporate strategies, regulatory obligations, and government directions, in collaboration with the managers of the analytical, regulation and stakeholder engagement teams. Stakeholder Engagement: Consult and collaborate with internal and external stakeholders, ensuring project goals are well-defined and achieved. Team Development: Support the uplift of program delivery skills within existing teams of analytical, engineering and engagement experts. Resource Management: Oversee resources, budgets, and schedules, ensuring efficient project execution and compliance with legal and regulatory standards. Risk Management: Identify, evaluate, and manage project risks, taking proactive measures to address issues and ensure project continuity.     What you will bring to the role   Tertiary qualifications in a relevant discipline. Demonstrated excellent interpersonal and communication skills along with highly developed documentation, knowledge and information management skills. Significant industry or related experience in the energy sector (equivalent to experience typically gained over >10 years). Proven experience with complex programs or projects utilising a range of delivery approaches. Extensive project management experience, including resourcing, scheduling, contract engagement, execution, management and budgeting.        In return some of our benefits to you  Flexible working: work from home, part time, job share, hybrid options, and additional leave options Professional development via projects, industry networks, job rotation, study assistance and more Give back with up to 4 days of volunteering leave per year Reward your hard work with annual performance bonuses (subject to eligibility) Embrace a healthier you with our wellness program, discounted health insurance, gym perks and our comprehensive Employee Assistance Program (EAP)     About Our Process   AEMO values diversity and inclusivity in the workplace, welcoming applications from all backgrounds without regard to age, disability, gender, sexual orientation, parental status, race, religion and our First Nation peoples. We are dedicated to accommodating applicants' needs during the application or interview process, simply let the us know by emailing us at talent@aemo.com.au  If you would like to know more about working at AEMO, please check out our careers page for more information.

column3: Fully dedicated Network Security role working to protect a large enterprise state Government account from vulnerabilities and threats.
column13: About us:  At Kinetic IT we pride ourselves on being 100% Australian owned and delivering exceptional service that exceeds our customers' expectations. We are recognised market leaders in the delivery of high-quality IT services in large government and private sector organisations. With 1500 amazing crew across Australia, our strong people-focused culture and dynamic work environment are integral parts of our success.  About the role:  Kinetic is currently looking for a Senior Systems Engineer with demonstrated experience in network security, enterprise infrastructure and cloud technologies. This is a contract role till the end of June 2025. The Senior Systems Engineer will be based on site with one of our enterprise level customers in Perth CBD to assist in supporting the customers security infrastructure and protecting them from potential threats and vulnerabilities.  About you:  Experience in Azure, Palo Alto, NetScaler’s, Defender for Endpoint. Utilising your technical expertise in Wintel and cloud technologies.  Demonstrating a high level of problem-solving skills. Engaging with customers and internal stakeholders at various levels.  Desirable:  Certification in Palo Alto, Azure and Microsoft security.  The Kinetic IT Difference:  Kinetic IT recognises the experience and performance of our crew is intricately bound to the achievement of enduring organisational success.  We provide opportunities for growth and development and recognising both individual and teamwork contribution to achieving our company’s goals. We seek to promote fair, competitive and equitable reward and recognition practices which fosters a diverse and inclusive workplace.  How to apply: First, check out our website Kineticit.com.au. If you like what you see then, Click the ‘Apply Now’ button. You can also send your CV direct to on careers@kineticit.com.au and quote: Senior Systems Engineer

column3: We provide world-class fire and rescue services to Queensland communities with a clear focus on fire prevention, response and control.
column13: Queensland Fire Department  Status: Permanent Flexible Full-time  Classification: AO7  Salary: $127,839.99 - $136,892.79 per annum  Division: Strategy and Corporate Services  Region/Directorate: STRATEGY  Work Unit: Analytics  Location: Kedron 4031  Closing Date: Midnight 21 August 2024  Reference No: QLD_QFD_20048_24  Current Queensland Fire Department employees and volunteers must apply via their internal careers site  About us  The Queensland Fire Department (QFD) provides fire prevention, preparedness and response services to fire in the built and landscape environments, as well as scientific and specialist capabilities to Queensland communities. The QFD provides a multi-hazard emergency response, including road crash rescue, bushfire, hazardous material, technical and vertical rescue, severe weather incidents, remote and swiftwater rescue, and provides a number of functions supporting community safety outcomes.  The department encompasses Queensland Fire and Rescue (QFR), Rural Fire Service Queensland (RFSQ), as well as the broader department which work together to pre-empt, prevent, mitigate and manage the consequences of fires and other emergencies on Queensland communities and support our large volunteer membership across the state.  The QFD is an organisation that is focused on reframing the department’s relationship with Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, communities, and organisations through the Path to Treaty, Closing the Gap and building our cultural capability.  Purpose of the role  Strategic Intelligence and Planning is responsible for the design, development and implementation of best practice approaches, frameworks and guidelines for organisational strategy and ensures compliance with legislative requirements and alignment to government policy.  The Analytics team works closely with internal and external stakeholders to support alignment of strategic planning and thinking, leads strategic foresight initiatives, including environment and horizon scanning that supports and informs business intelligence to support and enhance decision making and ensure QFD is able to prepare and respond to changes in the broader disaster and emergency management environment.  Reporting to the Executive Manager, you will be a key member of the team delivering Analytics and Business Intelligence (BI) solutions that support business performance management and enable the delivery of BI capabilities to guide strategic decision making. You will be responsible for undertaking effective information gathering and data analysis and translating these requirements into data models and structures to enable effective delivery of business intelligence products. You will also manage the technical environments to create and deliver data solutions and provide technical support services for analytical and BI software tools and services.   Key requirements  Highly desirable requirements  Highly developed skills with the following software / technologies to analyse, provide technical direction, standardisation, and professional advice: Cloud platforms (e.g., Amazon Web Services, Azure), Relational databases (e.g. PostgreSQL) Data warehousing (e.g. Azure DB, SQL Server) ETL/ELT software Structured Query Languages -SQL Cloud-enabled BI / visualisation software (e.g. PowerBI) Programming languages (e.g. Python/R) RESTful web APIs Geographic Information Systems (e.g. ArcGIS/QGIS) Version Control Systems (e.g. GIT) Experience in analysing complex datasets and translating these requirements into data models and structures, with strong data modelling, transformation and integration skills. Your key accountabilities  Your part in the ongoing success of our department, in supporting frontline services will see you responsible for a variety of work, including, but not limited to:  Provide expert problem solving and analytics thinking in the development of dataset processes for data modelling, mining, and production, that enable consistent and equitable collection, access, use, analysis and reporting of data. Analyse and solve complex business problems to provide innovative solutions and architecture to meet business data needs and deliver high quality services and outcomes.  Provide technical leadership, guidance and mentorship to team members in the development of ETL processes and programming to enable timely and reliable access to data for action, and ways to improve data reliability, efficiency and quality.  Provide expert guidance and review of data products to ensure quality and compliance with architectural and governance requirements. Liaise, consult and collaborate with key stakeholders to develop effective data model solutions to enhance BI products, reporting and data analysis.  Investigate alternative data sources and design data models to enhance data analysis BI capability needs of the organisation.  Provide strategic advice on the design and implementation of best practice approaches, frameworks and guidelines for performance management and BI products to influence effective decision-making. Research, analyse and interpret current and emerging industry trends relating to the support and enhancement of the technical environment and solutions. Capabilities  To determine your suitability for the role, you will be assessed on the following Leadership Competencies for Queensland behavioural profiles that link to the “key accountabilities” for this role:  Leadership Competency Stream – Team Leader(leading others)  Vision  Stimulates ideas and innovation  Results  Builds enduring relationships Drives accountability and outcomes  Accountability  Fosters healthy and inclusive workplaces Pursue continuous growth Demonstrates sound governance  Once you join us we will want you to exemplify the QFD shared values:  Respect Integrity Trust Courage Loyalty  To find out more about the behaviours and competencies required for this role, visit Leadership competencies for Queensland | For government | Queensland Government Want more information?    Please contact Tanya Langhorne, Executive Manager on phone 0499 806 936 or email Tanya.Langhorne@fire.qld.gov.au.  You can also visit our website to find out more information about joining our team.  How to apply  Please refer to the QFD Public Service Application Guide [All PS Classifications/Streams and Senior Officer] for information on how to apply for this role and contact us to discuss any reasonable adjustments if required.

column3: Join our Telco Fixed Networks team for a field based position in Adelaide SA. Attractive salary package plus Tool of Trade Vehicle.
column13: Join our Telco Fixed Networks team for a field based position in Adelaide SA. Attractive salary package plus Tool of Trade Vehicle.   Downer is a leading provider of end-to-end Technology and Communications service solutions and offers integrated civil construction, wireless, electrical, fibre, copper and radio network deployment capability. As we continue our evolution of growth and innovation, the best people are critical to our success in supporting our customers and catering to market demands.  Under the Telstra Field Operations (TFO) contract, Downer will provide services including network asset relocations (ARCW), wideband business services (WB), facilities design and construction activities including Tele-power and building upgrades; and a continuation of the 5G mobile rollout. These activities will be delivered across New South Wales, Victoria, Tasmania, South Australia and the Northern Territory.  About the role  We're looking for Supervisors in Adelaide SA. This is a field-based role in a fast paced, high pressure environment which will see you responsible for supervising our construction partners, ensuring delivery of ticket of work and project works are on-time and to schedule as well as monitoring quality and delivery of works. With our Zero Harm culture at the forefront, you will always promote safe working practices and a culture of safe behaviours and attitudes. Previous experience in a similar role combined with a collaborative leadership style will ensure your success in this position.  About you  Proven experience as a Supervisor within the telecommunications & civil construction industry Strong understanding of the telecommunications Pit & Pipe network and Fibre Optics networks Ability to work in a high-volume Ticket of Work environment with constantly changing and competing priorities along with an in depth understanding of cost variations and schedule of rates Prior experience with field/scoping requirements, including conducting exchange and street communications network surveys and customer end surveys Effective leadership of construction partners with an uncompromising commitment to safety; dedicated to ensuring compliance at all times to site Safety and Environmental Management plans in consultation with the safety team to achieve "Zero Harm" Ability to activate dig permits and ensure all due diligence has been followed with Construction Partners Effective verbal and written skills including producing reports and paperwork on construction activities including prestart and quality checks. Proficient in MS suite, Word, Excel, Outlook, PowerPoint and SharePoint  What we offer  Attractive salary package plus Tool of Trade of Vehicle Employee benefits & wellness program Access to professional and personal L&D programs Supportive leadership and a great team dynamic  As an employer who acknowledges and embraces the importance of our people's diverse experiences, talents and cultures, we encourage applications from all ages, genders and backgrounds join our inclusive workforce.  For more information please contact Puck Jonker - Senior Recruitment & Sourcing on Puck.Jonker@downergroup.com Please note that applications will not be accepted via email. Please submit your application via the advertisement.

column3: Work at a Wireless Microwave Communications company who have been in Wireless Communications since 1985.
column10: Great Salary + Benefits + Discounts on Offer
column13: Communication Technician with Experience at Wave1, Brisbane  About Wave1 Pty Ltd  Wave1 Pty Ltd has been a leading force in Australia’s telecommunications industry for over 35 years. We pride ourselves on delivering high-quality wireless solutions, ensuring projects are completed safely, on time, and within budget.  The Role  We are currently seeking a seasoned Communication Technician to join our team at our MacGregor office, conveniently located just 12km south of Brisbane. The successful candidate will be responsible for:  Assisting with pre-sales wireless design Providing support for wireless installation quotes and tenders Offering technical telephone support to customers and service agents Managing installations, installation contractors, and support contractors Performing in-field installation and maintenance work Controlling and maintaining Brisbane engineering spares Documenting project details (such as “as built”)  Qualifications and Skills  The ideal candidate will possess the following:  An Australian Drivers Licence Australian residency ACMA Cabling licence with Endorsements A solid understanding of coax cabling and cat6 cabling Experience in wireless/microwave installations  It would be highly advantageous if the candidate also has:  Certificate III in Telecommunications Industry Construction White Card First Aid Certificate Working with Children certification Working at Heights certification Tower rope rescue training Radiation Awareness training  In addition to these qualifications, proficiency in Microsoft Word and Excel is required.  Benefits  Joining our team means becoming part of a company that values innovation, teamwork, and professional growth. We offer a supportive work environment that encourages collaboration and provides opportunities for skill development. Our competitive compensation package includes a fully maintained late model vehicle, comprehensive training, and opportunities for career advancement.  Interested Applicants may forward their resumes to: applicaions@wave1.com.au

column3: Fantastic opportunity for a Test Analyst, to join our HRIS team on a one-year contract
column13: Company description:    About Barwon Health Barwon Health is one of the largest and most comprehensive regional health services in Australia, providing care at all stages of life and circumstance. Services available through Barwon Health cover the full spectrum from primary care, community services, aged care, rehabilitation, mental health, emergency and acute care. We serve more than 500,000 people through the efforts of more than 9000 staff and volunteers across more than 20 sites. Barwon Health is committed to developing a vibrant culture of education, training and research that advances health and wellbeing for all.    Job description:   Temporary full time 80 hours per fortnight until 31/08/2025, with access to ADO's, 5 weeks annual leave and salary packaging. Enjoy a role that will be varied, challenging and rewarding Exciting Regional Health Care Human Resource Information Systems Project  About the facility Our major sites include University Hospital Geelong in Geelong's CBD, the McKellar Centre precinct in North Geelong, Barwon Health North in Norlane, and residential aged care facilities spanning the region. Comprehensive mental health, community health and dental services are delivered through various programs across the Barwon South West Region, including Torquay and Colac.   About the role  The Test Analyst is responsible in supporting the successful implementation of People Plus. People Plus is the SAP Success Factors human resource information system across Health Services in the Barwon South West (BSW). This project is led by Barwon Health. The Test Analyst is responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our HR technology platform through rigorous testing and quality assurance processes. The project scope will include designing, planning, and executing test cases for the following SAP Success Factors modules Recruitment, Professional Development Review (PMGM), Employee Central Payroll, Core HR (Employee Central), HR Reporting (People Analytics), Onboarding and Offboarding.  The Test Analyst will be responsible for Identifying, logging, and tracking defects. The candidate will be responsible for supporting Testing Manager in establishing a comprehensive testing strategy using a risk-based testing model, which includes defining the scope, testing approach, tools, and reporting. Additionally, the Test Analyst assist in creating test plans that outline testing cycles, test case structures, and schedules, ensuring compliance with entry and exit criteria. They will assist the identified other testers identified during various test phases in execution of test cases. and upload of test cases in test management tool for execution by the testers.  Please note Barwon Health will only contact you via our official email and never use unconventional means, such as text messaging or other services.  To obtain a copy to the position description, email recruitment@barwonhealth.org.au with the job request ID and job title.   About the culture You will have the opportunity to be part of a highly skilled, professional and dedicated team who take pride in providing high quality services. We promote positive, respectful relationships and strong partnerships within the workplace. Grow and develop your capabilities with Barwon Health's commitment to professional development.  Barwon Health staff benefits • Excellent working conditions with a high sense of job satisfaction. • A vibrant staff wellbeing program and access to our 24/7 Employee Assistance Program. • Wide-range of professional development opportunities to enhance your career. • Attractive salary packaging benefits. Living expenses capped at $9010 and meals and entertainment capped at $2650.  About Geelong Derived from the local Wathaurong Aboriginal name for the region Djilang, Geelong is thought to mean ‘Tongue of Land'.  Geelong offers a range of lifestyle choices including inner city, coastal, suburban and rural homes. • Geelong is home to world class schools and education providers. • Doorstep to the Great Ocean Road, Bellarine Peninsula and the Surf Coast • Appreciate our vast and abundant parklands, sports and entertainment attractions, and thriving dining and shopping complexes.  To learn more about the region, click here.  Diversity and Inclusion We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion. We celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and talents of our team members, fostering an environment where everyone feels valued and respected. Our commitment to diversity strengthens our ability to provide compassionate and equitable care to all individuals, regardless of their backgrounds, abilities and identities. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities and a workplace that promotes wellbeing, and we welcome and encourage applications from those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. We actively encourage individuals with disabilities and diverse backgrounds and identities to apply for our positions. Should you require any reasonable adjustments or support during the recruitment process, we are here to assist you every step of the way. We are committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. Click here for further information on the Victorian Government's Child Safe Standards.  This role must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and influenza and meet the requirements of the Barwon Health immunisation policy.

column2: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
column3: Manage a bespoke enterprise data lake // Be driven by improving the organisation's utilisation of data.
column13: Are you driven by the pursuit of data excellence?  Do you want to manage and build on the work around a bespoke enterprise level data lake?  I think we've got the role for you.  Join a growing local organisation with a large pipeline of upcoming projects. You'll be a part of a wider data team of 5-8 persons, each experts in their areas. You will learn from each other, and share a common goal of data excellence.  You will assist each other where required, and will build your knowledge outside of your direct role as a result. Your career here will expand your understanding of data lake cloud technologies and infrastructure, develop your engagement abilities further, and provide an inate understanding of data security and privacy measures.  To join this team, you will need the following skills and experience.  SQL Scripting and Python AWS cloud services Power BI and ETL  Desired Knowledge:  Experience or background with DevOps, IaaC and/or Networking Previous experience working within an enterprise data lake environment.  If interested please click apply, or connect with Yuri at yuri.domanski@talentinternational.com to set up a confidential conversation regarding the role and/or your suitability.  Please note that overseas applicants will not be considered for this position. You must have current working rights at the time of application.

column3: Join a growing Newcastle business to support in their major transformation project
column13: Are you an experienced Integration Developer with a passion for designing and implementing robust integration solutions? We are looking for a talented professional to join their team and play a pivotal role in their projects.  Key Responsibilities:  - Manage the end-to-end lifecycle of integration solutions. - Utilize .NET development skills to build and enhance applications. - Create and manage REST APIs. - Develop and maintain integration solutions. - Collaborate with teams using Azure DevOps for project management and CI/CD pipelines. - Ensure seamless integrations across various platforms and ERP systems. - Work with SQL for database integration and management  Qualifications:  - Proven experience in end-to-end lifecycle management of integration projects. - Strong development skills in .NET. - Proficiency in creating and managing REST APIs - .Net. - Hands-on experience with Azure DevOps. - Demonstrated experience with various integration solutions and platforms. - Solid experience with SQL for database integration and management.  Salary: Up to $130k + superannuation  Work Environment: Hybrid working flexibility with 3-4 days in the office.  Location: Must be based in the Newcastle area or nearby.  If you are ready to take on a challenging and rewarding role, we would love to hear from you. Apply now to join their dynamic team and contribute to innovative integration projects. Please reach out to Karan Shah for a confidential chat at 0416 410 657 or ks@asr.com.au

column3: Hybrid role! Growth opportunities! Permanent position! Upskill with Azure!
column13: About the Opportunity:  Are you a passionate Software Developer with a strong foundation in C# and .NET? An exciting opportunity has arisen for a talented individual to join a dynamic development team on a permanent basis. This role offers the chance to work with a supportive team and contribute to innovative projects. If you have solid experience in C# and .NET, and are eager to enhance your skills with Azure, including Service Bus and event architecture, this role is tailored for you.  About You:  We’re looking for a motivated Software Developer with 3-5 years of experience, particularly in C# and .NET. Experience with SQL is essential, and familiarity with Azure is advantageous, though not mandatory. The ideal candidate will be enthusiastic about learning new technologies, including Azure Service Bus, and have a desire for long-term career growth.  Key Requirements:  Strong experience in C# and .NET (essential) Proficiency with SQL (essential) Experience with Azure, especially Service Bus and event architecture (nice to have) Minimum 3-5 years of relevant experience Strong communication skills and a team-oriented mindset Willingness to contribute to design sessions and individual tasks Work rights and long-term employment focus  The Benefits:  Permanent position with long-term career prospects Hybrid work arrangement with Tuesdays working from home Opportunity to work with an experienced team and contribute to exciting projects Located in the city with a flexible work environment  How to Apply:  If this opportunity aligns with your career goals, please submit your application. For more information or inquiries, contact me directly via email at matthew.burke@versegroup.com.au or by phone at (08) 6146 4466.

column3: The Digital Services team works collaboratively across several product teams developing services and experiences for both ASC and sport.
column13: Applications close at 11:30pm AEST on Monday 19 August 2024 (late applications will not be accepted).  The Australian Sports Commission is embarking on the Green and Gold decade. An exciting time filled with international sporting competitions on home soil, including the Men’s and Women’s Rugby World Cup, and culminating in the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. We have an ambitious new Strategic Vision and we need the best players on our team to help us deliver real results for the sporting sector and all Australians.  Are you up for the challenge?  About the team – If you are the successful candidate, you will work in a small delivery team using agile ways of working and a double diamond approach. The Digital Services team works collaboratively across several product teams developing services and experiences for both ASC and sport. We are a collaborative team with a growth mindset and seek to improve government and sport sector information and services. With this dynamic and fun team, you can safely say you will have meaningful and interesting work that impacts everyday Australians.  About the role – The ASC’s Business Analysts are responsible for leading engagement with stakeholders to capture business requirements and develop pragmatic designs for digital-enabled solutions, including the review, analysis and evaluation of system and user needs for teams across the ASC. In consultation with team managers, Business Analysts will implement the organisational strategic agenda to achieve business outcome, including:  Communicate and collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders to capture and translate business requirements. Propose innovative and more efficient business process approaches using structured methods. Coordinate with project teams and project stakeholders Model options and present summarised analysis to senior manager sponsors - make recommendations, champion innovative solutions to achieve ASC outcomes. Support Scrum Masters to develop work breakdown structures, schedules and cost estimates. Coordinate with Developers and Testers to develop solution acceptance plans, test plans and data migration approaches as part of holistic project services. Support technology and digital investment planning process using agile methodology.  About you – We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individuals with a proven track record of driving collaboration across business groups, eliciting and capturing business requirements and develop pragmatic designs for digital-enabled solutions. The successful candidate will have:  Tertiary qualifications and/or business experience agile methodologies, including Human Centred Design. Experience working in structured methods & techniques. Experience working with DevOps, Dynamics 365 and/or SCRUM or Agile methodologies is desirable. Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills. Demonstrated analytical skills, strong attention to detail and the ability to develop innovative solutions, translating these into fit-for-purpose designs and approaches. Strong awareness of digital strategy, platforms and governance. Demonstrated ability to communicate dynamically and persuasively in both written and face-to-face communication.  There is an ONGOING and a FIXED TERM position available. The Fixed Term position is available for 12 months with the possibility of being extended or made ongoing.   Why work with us? We have offices located in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney.  Across all locations, we offer:  Options for flexible working arrangements. Annual allowances towards training based on individualised career goals. Access to a customised ASC L&D calendar for ongoing professional and career development. Generous superannuation scheme with up to 15.4% employer contributions. Corporate discount on AIS Shop merchandise. Access to Clearinghouse for Sport, an information sharing platform for Sporting professionals.  Additionally, our Canberra campus offers:  Free onsite parking Onsite facilities including café, dining hall, gym, and swimming pool. Priority placement for your children to access the award winning, onsite AIS Caretaker’s Cottage Childcare Centre.  If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact:  Contact Officer: Sarah Groube, Director Digital Sector Phone number: sarah.groube@ausport.gov.au Email address: 0411 725 110   If you would like to learn more about this opportunity or to obtain the job description, click 'Apply' now

column3: The Advisor - Road Safety Program coordinates Victoria's major road safety infrastructure initiatives including state and Commonwealth investments.
column13: Company description:    About Us  The Department of Transport and Planning oversees key planning, transport and land use policy decisions and management across the State. A life-cycle approach to planning, building, connecting and sustaining communities means our people can come together to; improve services, deliver sustainable projects, focus on customer engagement, streamline regulatory approval pathways, facilitate community consultation and better realise local economic opportunities for more liveable communities across Victoria.    Job description:    Network Design and Integration Group  The purpose of this Group is to deliver transport priorities through the development and delivery of an integrated pipeline of projects and support the Major Transport Infrastructure Program.  The Network Pipeline and Program Division lead and manage the forward transport pipeline and forward infrastructure programs. The team develop and advise on priorities for infrastructure investment to meet Government's strategic objectives and deliver benefits to the community.  We're focused on outcomes that deliver more choice, connections and confidence in our travel, ensuring the whole transport network works as one to deliver better services and outcomes.  About the Role  The Advisor - Road Safety Program coordinates Victoria's major road safety infrastructure initiatives including state and Commonwealth investments. This role applies program management capabilities to lead the planning and development of programs with regions, councils, and other delivery stakeholders. Current major investment programs include Safer Roads, Commonwealth Road Safety Program and Federal Blackspot. The role requires specialised skills in safe system engineering, program management and delivery, stakeholder management, quality assurance and governance.  To access the Position Description, please click here.  Position Accountabilities  This role involves developing an integrated road safety program to guide investment decisions, coordinating transport portfolio advice to align transport plans with prioritized initiatives, and leading the creation of business cases for road upgrades. It also includes managing the client's role in collaboration with internal and external partners, reviewing program prioritization, and advising ministers on the impacts and risks of the road safety program.  Key Selection Criteria -  Knowledge and Skills -  Project Delivery (Applied) - Defines tasks to be delivered to meet agreed outcomes; Coordinates and guides others in the execution of work activities; Monitors progress of tasks against plans and takes corrective action when required. Innovation and Continuous Improvement (Applied) - Seeks opportunities for continuous improvement and ways to innovate; Offers suggestions and ideas, encourages others to do the same; Leverage on existing continuous improvement systems and procedures to improve outcomes, quality and efficiency of work; Creates space for learning and innovation by seeking for input and feedback from others. Business and commercial acumen (Applied) - Understands associated costs of operations and seek efficient ways of operating. Where external vendors are involved, ensure good understanding on engagement terms and hold parties involved accountable in delivering against agreement. Critical Thinking and Problem Solving (Applied) - Resolves issues through deep understanding or interpretation of existing guidelines. Where guidelines are not available, analyses ideas available and takes action through self, or in consultation with others to resolve problems. If required, determine additional information needed to make informed decisions. Applies critical thinking and problem-solving concepts in the right context. Stakeholder Management (Accomplished) - Identifies issues in common for one or more clients or stakeholders and uses them to build mutually beneficial partnerships; Identifies and responds to stakeholder's underlying needs; Uses understanding of the stakeholder's organisational context to ensure outcomes are achieved. Future Focus (Applied) - Develops objectives that link to broader team and organisational objectives; Takes into account future aims and goals of the team and organisation in prioritising own and others' work. Integrates relevant technologies into own ways of working and supports others in this. Proactively stays up to date with best practice and leading developments relating to expertise and area of work.  Personal Attributes -  Flexibility and Adaptability (Accomplished) - Adapts systems & processes quickly to changed priorities & situations . Outcomes Thinking (Applied) - Works with sense of purpose within the team and enables others to understand the strategic direction of the branch and organisation; Creates a sense of purpose within the team by establishing links between work and impact to the community. Working Collaboratively (Accomplished) - Guides others to create a culture of collaboration; Identifies, and works to overcome, barriers to knowledge or information sharing; Identifies opportunities to work with other teams to deliver outcomes.  Qualifications and Experience  Desirable  Experience in program/project management in the road safety, public sector policy or public health areas. A tertiary qualification in engineering, or strong experience in policy related road safety fields Strong communications and negotiation skills and the ability to present complex information in digestible form. Proven ability to develop and maintain strong partnerships with key stakeholders.  What we offer  Meaningful work making Victorian communities more accessible and liveable Professional growth and development opportunities across the department and the wider Victorian Public Services A hybrid working model focused on collaboration and teamwork Optimal work-life balance initiatives including flexible working arrangements Opportunity to work across multiple urban and suburban hubs We prioritise the development of a safe and inclusive culture  Culture Value  We are an equal opportunity employer, embracing a diverse range of applicants such as veterans, and people who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander, LGBTQIA community members, individuals with disabilities and/or health conditions, as well as those from varied faith and cultural backgrounds. At our department, we prioritize the development of a safe, inclusive, and high-performance culture through shared actions and behaviours that align with our strategy and direction. This empowers our employees to effectively contribute to our goals.  How to Apply  Non-DTP Employees (Including VPS outside of DTP)  Create an account by clicking the ‘Apply' button and follow the prompts. For help, click here for Quick Reference Guide.  Applications close at 11:59 PM on Monday, 19th of August 2024.  Please include a resume and cover letter. All applications must be submitted through the online portal. We're unable to consider email or manual applications.  For more information, contact Sarah Morris, Manager Road Safety Programs at sarah.morris@transport.vic.gov.au. Preferred applicants will need to complete a police check and other pre-employment checks. Your information will be treated confidentially.  If you require additional adjustments across the recruitment process or accessible formats of this ad, please contact us by phone or email.

column2: Talent – Specialists in tech, transformation & beyond
column3: Ready to shape the future of connectivity? Join Easyweb Digital as a Senior Network Engineer and lead transformative projects that empower communities
column13: About the Company  For over a decade, Easyweb Digital has been at the forefront of designing, building, and managing public Wi-Fi networks across Australia and New Zealand. Our dedication to connecting remote and regional communities has established us as a leading provider of broadband wireless network solutions. We are driven by values of care, connectivity, entrepreneurship, and maintaining a family-friendly work environment.  The Role   Join Easyweb Digital as a Senior Network Engineer and play a pivotal role in designing and managing cutting-edge wireless network solutions.   Based in Mulgrave predominantly, but with some flexible work-from-home options, this role offers a dynamic blend of hands-on network engineering, project management, and strategic development.   You'll lead complex IT, application-based, and engineering projects, ensuring robust connectivity for remote and regional communities across Australia and New Zealand. With a focus on career growth, this position offers extensive professional development opportunities in a family-friendly environment.   If you're passionate about driving technological innovation and community service, this role is your chance to excel in a supportive and innovative team.  Key responsibilities of the role include, but not limited to:  Collaborate with technical leads to design and implement functional network solutions that meet both company and customer requirements. Take charge of network design projects from conception to documentation, ensuring all solutions align with client needs and company standards. Implement network setups, manage configurations, and oversee the commissioning of network hardware, working closely with both internal teams and clients. Lead the network monitoring and support processes, designing reports and managing crisis responses to ensure stable and continuous network operations. Utilize ITIL frameworks for effective change, release, problem, and incident management, maintaining high standards of network reliability and security. Provide leadership and mentorship to junior network engineering staff, fostering professional development and knowledge sharing within the team. Some travel will be required to interstate clients (a few days, up to a once a month) Ensure all activities comply with company policies, including health and safety standards.  To secure the role, we are looking for:  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field, with a master’s degree considered advantageous. Certifications and/or significant experience with network technologies from vendors such as Fortinet, Mikrotik, Ruckus Wireless, and others. At least 1 year of experience in a senior network engineering role, demonstrating advanced proficiency in network design, implementation, and support. Strong understanding of network protocols like TCP/IP, UDP, BGP, and experience with complex network environments. Expertise in wireless network design, implementation and support, including WiFi, PTP, and PTMP solutions. Proficiency in managing and configuring network infrastructure, including routers, switches, and firewalls, particularly from vendors like Mikrotik and Fortinet. Experience with cloud networking environments (e.g., AWS, Azure) and familiarity with project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum. ITIL Foundation certification or equivalent experience in an ITIL-based service management environment. Customer first approach with strong communication skills, and enjoys working in a team environment.      Why work for us?  Join our ambitious team at Easyweb Digital making a real difference. Be a part of a mission-driven team dedicated to improving lives through technology. Here's why you should apply:  Impactful Work: Contribute to providing vital connectivity solutions to remote and regional communities, truly making a difference in people’s lives. Innovative Culture: Thrive in an environment that values innovation and encourages new ideas and technologies. Professional Growth: Benefit from continuous learning opportunities, including vendor certifications and advanced training in network engineering and related technologies. Work-Life Balance: Enjoy flexible work arrangements, including options to work from home, and a supportive, family-friendly workplace that values your personal time and well-being. Birthday Leave: Celebrate your special day with a day off on us, ensuring you have the time to enjoy what matters most to you. Competitive Compensation: Receive an attractive salary package, including superannuation and opportunities for career advancement.    Culture & Values:   Commitment to enhancing connectivity and community service. Support for work-life balance and a family-friendly workplace. Opportunities for professional development. Encouragement of an entrepreneurial spirit and problem-solving.  Easy Web Digital is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.     How to Apply:  Apply via the Seek portal.   For further information please contact our external HR Consultant, Sophie (sophie@thesavegroup.com).

column3: Talent is seeking an experienced Technical support engineer to join our client, a local government.
column13: 12 Month Fixed Term Contract Market Rates Flexible WFH - Not fully remote   Adaptable and experienced Technical Support Engineer required to join a local government ICT Operations Team to uplift internal capability and capacity in supporting BAU whilst delivering the FY25 ICT infrastructure project portfolio.  You will augment the existing ICT Operations, Service Delivery and Infrastructure Teams and bring strong technical expertise to work within the existing team structure supporting BAU and the delivery of M365 Intune MDM/MAM whole of business implementation, Windows 11 deployment, M365 Compliance and Cyber Uplift Essential 8 projects. This is an opportunity to be part of foundational work to enable best practice digital delivery and cyber security.  This position will require face to face engagement with peers and stakeholders however hybrid working arrangements can be considered.  We are searching for candidates who can hit the ground running, they must possess superior technical support and implementation skills and experience to immediately uplift the existing team's expertise. It is important you are a team player capable of working closely with the existing team members to upskill and are adaptable to juggle day-to-day support work priorities in parallel with project work.  Skills/Qualifications:  Over 10 years of proven experience as a System Engineer, System Administrator, Technical Specialist with Microsoft technologies specifically: M365 Support and Administration M365 Security and Compliance Intune - MAM/MAM, desktop, and mobile device management Windows 10 and Windows 11 (deploy via Intune) SCCM End user computing technical support, troubleshooting, administration, deployment, packaging, and management in a Microsoft desktop environment. Experience implementing ASD Essential 8 controls. Commvault data backup technical support, administration, and implementation. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. IT Degree qualified or comparable experience and/or industry certifications.  Background:  SOE implementation and deployment in a large, complex setting MDM/MAM whole of business implementation (Microsoft/iOS/Android) Implementing ASD Essential 8 controls Mentoring and cross skilling peers Documenting knowledge base articles and as-built references Working in a ITIL aligned service management team (ServiceNow experience desirable) Delivering project work using Agile work methods  If you are interested in this role please apply below, alternatively you can email you CV to ziomi.warchalowski@talentinternational.com

column3: Fantastic opportunity to lead the establishment of technology monitoring and alert management framework across ABC platforms.
column10: Not for Profit Salary packaging + Additional Leave
column13: About the ABC  The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.  For more information about working at the ABC, please feel free to explore our careers page at https://www.abc.net.au/careers/  About the role  As Senior Platform Monitoring Engineer, you will lead the development and implementation of unified monitoring and alerting/ event management processes and procedures for ABC Platforms. This includes the establishment of associated frameworks and governance; performance and availability monitoring; and enhanced alerting capability. The focus of this work is to successfully detect, alert and proactively respond to technology issues and minimise service impacts.  Key responsibilities    Manage the technology monitoring platforms in scope (e.g. UIM), including management of build and configuration activities and lifecycle management along with related documentation. Define and implement standardised approaches to developing and maintaining dashboards that enable real time visibility for assorted services, along with the health of underpinning infrastructure services and applications. Facilitate the integration of pertinent monitoring and alerting platforms into the service management platform (e.g., ServiceNow) and other associated systems. Enhance operational reliability through the incorporation of monitoring, reporting, and fault handling practices. Provide specialist advice and perform trend analysis to identify opportunities to improve efficiency by automating existing processes. Collaborate with teams across the Product & Technology division to ensure a standardised approach to deploying and maintaining monitoring and event management practices. Provide highly specialised support in the management and improvement of CMDB (Configuration Management Database) for Product & Technology along with related discovery tools. Assist the broader team with Data Centre management/operations and Resiliency Testing as required.     About you    In this role you will bring significant professional experience and skills in technology monitoring and alerting services in a complex technical environment, and a sound understanding of technology service delivery frameworks, methodologies, and related process implementation.   Demonstrated extensive experience with at least two of the following products: Datadog, PagerDuty, Splunk, SumoLogic, UIM, DataMiner, Device42, ServiceNow, or Microsoft System Centre Operations Manager (SCOM). Considerable experience with ensuring high availability and resolving issues in monitoring & alerting services, with a deep understanding of cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements within a technology context. Demonstrated extensive experience in generating capacity and availability reports for technology systems. Strong skills in leadership, critical thinking, problem-solving, with a keen ability to pinpoint issues and areas for enhancement through thorough analysis. Exceptional collaborative ability to work effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders, with highly developed written and verbal communication skills.    About ABC Product and Technology:  The Product & Technology (P&T) Division is responsible for delivering the technology and services that enable the ABC to fulfil its creative, strategic and business goals. The scope of activities and responsibilities of the P&T Division range from keeping ABC programs and services on-air and on-line, to delivering on key projects, as well as assisting in setting the technology strategy and architecture for the ABC.  The ABC strives for diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.  For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to Life Page on ABC LinkedIn.  We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position. All applications are to be made via ABC Careers or your preferred job platform. We cannot accept email submissions.  For more information about this position please contact Brett Whyte, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email whyte.brett@abc.net.au

column3: 9 Month Fixed Term Contract| Large Governemnet Agency | Wollongong location | Hybrid work |
column13: Role Purpose The Senior Business Analyst leads the review and analysis of the organization's business goals, services, and processes to identify and document improvements.  Key Responsibilities  Oversee the implementation of business intelligence solutions and reporting frameworks to enhance performance and support decision-making. Consult with stakeholders to map and optimize business processes for effectiveness and efficiency. Analyze performance against organizational goals, identifying opportunities for process improvements. Lead a team in gathering requirements for projects and implementing strategic initiatives. Develop and review business intelligence metrics to support better organizational outcomes. Collaborate with stakeholders to drive process improvements, support strategic delivery, and promote efficiency. Manage resources and assets, ensuring compliance with budget, safety, and governance requirements.  Key Challenges  Influencing peers and executives to improve processes and gather requirements for complex projects. Building strong internal and external partnerships to achieve optimal results. Fostering a culture of strategic analysis and evidence-based decision-making.  Essential Requirements  Proven experience in complex process mapping and requirements gathering. Experience in business process improvement or business intelligence and reporting. Strong knowledge of AIIMS principles and processes or incident management system       If you would like to be considered please apply for the role by clicking the apply button or email laura.pierce@randstaddigital.com.au  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.                 At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.
