column3: Looking for a outstanding Cyber Security Analyst to join the team in the Managed Services business unit in Canberra.
column13: Company description:    ATTURRA OPERATIONS PTY LTD    Job description:    Why is this an exciting opportunity?  Atturra is one of Australia's fastest growing ASX-listed advisory and IT solutions companies.  The Managed Services area of Atturra's business offers leading Hybrid IT, Private Cloud and Connectivity services, and the team have decades of experience in the industry. This experience coupled with our people, makes us one of the most complete and leading "as a service" providers in the market.  With over 900 employees working across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore and Hong Kong, Atturra works on some of the highest profile projects in Australia. The depth, breadth and scope of our projects means you are continually developing your skillset and the value you can deliver. These are projects that are making a real difference in people's lives.  What our people say: "We are working towards a very bright future."  "It's a company with vision and a promising future."  Why you'll love working here  Culture of possibility  At Atturra we embrace innovation within our teams, fostering an environment of possibility and growth. We believe in creating a supportive and welcoming culture, where everyone is encouraged to achieve success through collaboration, continuous learning and smart work practices.  A strong set of company values  Our culture is reflected by our employees who demonstrate camaraderie, innovation, dedication, respect and excellence in everything they do. These traits have become integral to the way we do business and are the values we strive for.  Valuable employee benefits  • Employee benefits, recognition, and wellbeing platform  • Career growth via succession planning, internal promotions, and mentorship opportunities  • Ongoing investment in professional development through industry and technology certifications and study assistance  • Mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program  • Support for family and caring responsibilities, including paid parental leave  • Employee referral program, with monetary incentives offered  What our people say:  "Atturra has a great working environment and management are very supportive of their staff. We celebrate success and have fun while working hard."  What you'll be doing  We are seeking a highly skilled Cyber Security Engineer with the ability to work in a demanding environment with an enthusiastic sense of customer support, you will need to communicate and coordinate with clients as well as other technology groups in a complex and highly governed environment.  The role will involve:  Providing operational support for a number of cyber security technology functions, such as, Endpoint Security, Network Security and SIEM and Log infrastructure support. Assist with design, deployment and maintenance of cyber security platforms; Developing cyber security policies, processes and procedures Developing security risk management plans, system security plans, security risk assessments and security documentation Contribute to informed and well-articulated security assessments of technical undertakings performed throughout the environment; Monitoring, triaging and escalating cyber security incidents Conducting cyber security audits and remediation Assessing system vulnerabilities and developing mitigation strategies  Working Conditions  Based in Deakin, ACT Permanent full time Hybrid work Australian Citizen with NV1 Security Clearance  What will make you successful in this role?  Sound understanding of security standards including ISM, Essential 8, PSPF ISO 27001, NIST etc Experience cyber security tools, detection and response and Government security environment Experience with Tenable or similar Experience with Splunk as a SIEM solution; Experience with Windows OS\RedHat Enterprise Linux Servers and application maintenance practices, hosted on these platforms and the reporting of such Working knowledge in cybersecurity principles such as hardening standards; and Techniques, vulnerability management and offensive/ defensive capabilities and practices. Relevant certifications  How to apply  Careers | Atturra  https://atturra.com/au-en/careers  Recruitment Agencies/Headhunters:  We got this covered. Our Talent Acquisition team is working on our hiring demands and will reach out should we need extra support. Atturra only accepts referrals from agencies on our official supplier list via Agency Portal. Agencies are required to go through our procurement process, have an approved fee agreement, and be invited to participate in hiring for a job opening by the Atturra Talent Acquisition team. Any profiles or referrals submitted outside of this process will be deemed invalid. We request that you do not contact Atturra employees outside of the Talent Acquisition team for any hiring-related queries. To become an official supplier, send an expression of interest via talentacquisition@atturra.com.  Atturra is passionate about playing an active role in addressing the digital skills gap and being an advocate for diversity and Inclusion, and welcomes applications from all irrespective of their gender, LGBTQI identity, ethnicity, religion, physical ability, or age.

column3: Software Architect roles for Enterprise organisations.
column13: Just Digital People are collaborating with TWO enterprise organisations who are working on some awesome products, to find a Software Architect to join the team.   You will be working collaboratively to define the high-level target state architectures, defining transitional plans, and executing with and across teams.   About You  Minimum 3 years' as a Technical Architect. Strong knowledge in software engineering with extensive experience working with cross-functional teams in designing and delivering end-to-end software. Strong experience exposure to the following technologies/platforms .Net and Nodejs, AWS or Azure. You are comfortable being 30-50% hands-on daily. Please note that all applicants must be a citizen/resident of Australia.  Open to candidates outside of Brisbane however, you will be fully-responsible for your own relocation.  If you have any questions or would like to discuss the role, email bianca@justdigitalpeople.com.au or call 0404 630 653.

column3: Join our internationally recognised specialist medical college in this exciting new role as a Business Change Analyst
column13: Permanent full-time opportunity for an experienced Business Change Analyst St Kilda location, flexible & hybrid working available  Internationally recognised, membership-based specialist medical college  About us:   The Australian and New Zealand College of Anaesthetists (ANZCA) incorporating the Faculty of Pain Medicine, is an internationally recognised specialist medical education institution responsible for the training, examinations, specialist qualification, and continuing professional development of all anaesthetists and pain medicine specialists in Australia and New Zealand.   The college's purpose is to serve our communities by leading high quality patient care in anaesthesia, perioperative and pain medicine, optimizing health and reducing the burden of pain.   About the opportunity:   The position of Business Change Analyst (BA) provides business analysis and requirements elicitation and support business change support to ANZCA's projects (both strategic improvement and compliance) and operational business. The role will involve the facilitation of requirements gathering through stakeholder interviews and workshops, develop business change impact assessments, change artefacts and support to initiatives.  This position reports to the Change Manager.  About the team:  The Project Services team is passionate about looking after our stakeholders, providing quality, timely deliverables and contributing to project success.  We are a supportive, engaged, and collaborative team.  Keys to your success:    You will bring your demonstrated experience and knowledge in business analysis best practices and sound stakeholder management skills.  Specifically, you will have:   Essential:  Excellent analytical and research skills with the ability to collect and analyse complex material /data and present it in accessible formats. Experience with Delivery models such as Waterfall, SCRUM and Agile. Demonstrated ability to create and facilitate workshops. Ability to operate as a SCRUM master when required. Ability to create and manage a product backlog within projects. Ability to manage and guide the project team members with story creation, including scope,  estimates and prioritisation when required. Ability to develop user journeys. Detail oriented combined with analytical skills, and an inquisitive nature regarding problem solving. Strong interpersonal skills with proven ability to build and maintain strong relationships with Proven ability to successfully gather requirements and and support change management activities with minimal supervision. High levels of initiative coupled with the ability to deal with multiple projects simultaneously and conflicting priorities. Exceptional verbal and written communication skills with an ability to write clearly and succinctly. Tertiary qualification in Business/Business Analysis, Information Technology, Change Management or related discipline.  Desirable:  Knowledge and experience in the application of BABOK, PROSCI or similar frameworks. Demonstrated experience as a Business Analyst or Change Analyst in the education or health industry or a membership based organisation. Working experience with Azure DevOps, MS Project, Microsoft Excel, MS Teams & Sharepoint Experience in developing and delivering training programs and materials. Previous experience working with system implementation projects. Experience developing Change Impact assessments and supporting change management activities  What we can offer you:   We offer employment benefits and a working environment that contribute to our people's health, safety and wellbeing, personal and professional development and supports an inclusive, equitable, and respectful college culture.  Join a purpose driven organisation with a team of individuals passionate about improving educational opportunities for health professionals A new role - an opportunity for you to make it your own A competitive remuneration package including full FBT exempt salary packaging Opportunity to grow in the position with genuine career pathways Excellent staff benefits - additional leave over the Christmas period, additional personal leave, health and wellbeing offerings, market leading parental leave, staff recognition program, member advantage program with access to discounted lifestyle benefits and leisure activities Flexible, hybrid working options Free confidential counselling service to support our staff and their close family through life's challenges via our Employee Assistance Program  ANZCA is an equal opportunity employer and our commitment to creating and supporting an inclusive culture is reflected in our diverse mix of talented people passionate about delivering their best. We embrace and value the diverse society we live within and consider all qualified applicants without regard to race, colour, national origin, religion, disability, gender, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation or age. We strongly encourage Aboriginal, Torres Strait Islander and Maori applicants to apply for any of our current opportunities.     Next steps   Apply now and take the next step towards a rewarding and long-term career within a progressive environment. Our application process will require you to submit your current resume. We will progress suitable candidates through the hiring process as soon as we can.   If selected, we will contact you to discuss your application on the phone, you will be invited to meet with us at the college and from there, complete a few background checks. We will help you through this process.  We are committed to making reasonable adjustments to provide a positive, barrier-free recruitment process and supportive workplace, so please let us know what you need.   For more information about ANZCA or for a copy of the position description, please email Nuzee at recruitment@anzca.edu.au  Employer questions   Your application will cover the following questions:   Do you have unrestricted working rights to work in Australia?   What's your expected annual base salary?   How much notice are you required to give your current employer?

column3: Full-time permanent opportunity at SA Water
column13: Your new company    SA Water is a successful, modern water utility that is wholly owned by the Government of South Australia. They employ more than 1,600 people across a broad range of disciplines who operate more than $14 billion of assets, delivering essential water and sewerage services to more than 1.8 million South Australians.      Your new role    SA Water are seeking a Cyber Security GRC Manager who will direct the development and supervision of their Cyber Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance (Cyber GRC) team, services, and capabilities. The role requires you to manage technology risk and fulfill compliance obligations as a critical infrastructure business operating state-wide.   Key role requirements:   Manage Cyber Security governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) services and activities to effectively identify, assess, and manage cyber security risks across the organisation, in alignment with the Corporate Risk Management Framework.  Lead enterprise cyber security planning to achieve business goals safely by prioritising cyber defence initiatives, increasing business focus on cyber security, deploying, and managing current and future cyber security technologies.  Develop and communicate cyber security policies, strategies, plans, current cyber threat and risk profile and maturity to executive team, employees, partners, customers, and stakeholders.  Manage the team that provide specialist cyber security advice to SA Water staff and external vendors.  Lead and manage the organisation’s Cyber Security Compliance Assurance program, scope of which includes meeting cyber security related SoCI obligations, internal assessments, and facilitating audits and assurance of cyber security activities and objectives.  Manage the Cyber Security Awareness program and the team responsible for this program this includes.  Lead and oversee the administration of the Cyber Security Third Party Risk Management function and services.  Identify and classify information and technology assets to ensure protections are commensurate with the value of the asset and recommend appropriate cyber security risk treatments for them.  Direct and deliver Cyber GRC assessments, acting as a business partner and internal trusted advisor.  Monitor external and internal cyber security threats and update inherent risk ratings in a timely manner.  Support SA Water’s Cyber Security team and organisation as Acting CISO in the event required.      What you'll need to succeed    Significant working knowledge of the laws, policies, and standards applicable to cyber security, privacy, cyber risk management, and cyber security aspects of protecting critical infrastructure with demonstrable experience interpreting obligations into cyber security practices and delivery within an organisation or enterprise.  Experience developing and maintaining Information Security Management Systems using recognised formal Cyber Security Frameworks or similar continuous improvement cyber security frameworks in the context of large, complex organisations (e.g., NIST, Essential 8, ISO 27000 etc).   Proven leadership skills to lead a team of specialists, and influence people at all levels internally and externally.  Demonstrated ability to conceptualise, launch and deliver multiple initiatives with complex interdependencies on time and within budget, supported by strong problem solving and analytical capabilities.  Proven experience with delivering Cyber GRC services across various security technologies, including technologies such as firewalls and network based cyber security controls, intrusion detection systems, anti-malware, EDR/XDR systems, web and cloud-based cyber security controls, modern identity security systems, log management, and content filtering.  Relevant Cyber Security certifications (e.g., CISM, CISSP, CRISC etc).       What you'll get in return    Competitive salary and a relocation package on offer for interstate candidates.   Flexible work arrangements (3 days in the office, 2 WFH).  Have your work matter! Work as part of a close-knit team that has high visibility in the organisation.    Lead and manage an experienced GRC team who are highly engaging and motivated!       What you need to do now    If you have the necessary experience as a Cyber Security GRC Manager then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the selection criteria (please request a copy of the PID) or contact Tishan Gamage on Tishan.Gamage@hays.com.au or +61 3 9604 9518 now.

column3: Fantastic opportunity to lead the establishment of technology monitoring and alert management framework across ABC platforms.
column13: About the ABC  The ABC is the nation's most trusted and independent source of Australian conversations, culture, and stories. With over 4,000 employees from diverse backgrounds across over 50 locations around Australia and overseas, we are proud to create, curate and deliver high-quality content that informs, educates and entertains Australian communities.  For more information about working at the ABC, please feel free to explore our careers page at https://www.abc.net.au/careers/  About the role  As Senior Platform Monitoring Engineer, you will lead the development and implementation of unified monitoring and alerting/ event management processes and procedures for ABC Platforms. This includes the establishment of associated frameworks and governance; performance and availability monitoring; and enhanced alerting capability. The focus of this work is to successfully detect, alert and proactively respond to technology issues and minimise service impacts.  Key responsibilities    Manage the technology monitoring platforms in scope (e.g. UIM), including management of build and configuration activities and lifecycle management along with related documentation. Define and implement standardised approaches to developing and maintaining dashboards that enable real time visibility for assorted services, along with the health of underpinning infrastructure services and applications. Facilitate the integration of pertinent monitoring and alerting platforms into the service management platform (e.g., ServiceNow) and other associated systems. Enhance operational reliability through the incorporation of monitoring, reporting, and fault handling practices. Provide specialist advice and perform trend analysis to identify opportunities to improve efficiency by automating existing processes. Collaborate with teams across the Product & Technology division to ensure a standardised approach to deploying and maintaining monitoring and event management practices. Provide highly specialised support in the management and improvement of CMDB (Configuration Management Database) for Product & Technology along with related discovery tools. Assist the broader team with Data Centre management/operations and Resiliency Testing as required.     About you    In this role you will bring significant professional experience and skills in technology monitoring and alerting services in a complex technical environment, and a sound understanding of technology service delivery frameworks, methodologies, and related process implementation.   Demonstrated extensive experience with at least two of the following products: Datadog, PagerDuty, Splunk, SumoLogic, UIM, DataMiner, Device42, ServiceNow, or Microsoft System Centre Operations Manager (SCOM). Considerable experience with ensuring high availability and resolving issues in monitoring & alerting services, with a deep understanding of cybersecurity, risk, and compliance requirements within a technology context. Demonstrated extensive experience in generating capacity and availability reports for technology systems. Strong skills in leadership, critical thinking, problem-solving, with a keen ability to pinpoint issues and areas for enhancement through thorough analysis. Exceptional collaborative ability to work effectively with a diverse range of stakeholders, with highly developed written and verbal communication skills.    About ABC Product and Technology:  The Product & Technology (P&T) Division is responsible for delivering the technology and services that enable the ABC to fulfil its creative, strategic and business goals. The scope of activities and responsibilities of the P&T Division range from keeping ABC programs and services on-air and on-line, to delivering on key projects, as well as assisting in setting the technology strategy and architecture for the ABC.  The ABC strives for diversity and inclusion in the workplace, and to promote a culture of opportunity. Through its services the ABC seeks to represent, connect and engage with all of the Australian community. In line with our focus on diversity, applications are strongly encouraged from Indigenous Australians, people from a range of cultural and linguistic backgrounds, people with disability and LGBTIQA+ individuals. The ABC also aims to achieve a gender-balanced workforce.  For more information on inclusive employee networks within the ABC please refer to Life Page on ABC LinkedIn.  We respectfully request that Recruitment Agencies do not submit applications for this position. All applications are to be made via ABC Careers or your preferred job platform. We cannot accept email submissions.  For more information about this position please contact Brett Whyte, Digital Talent Acquisition Lead via email whyte.brett@abc.net.au

Developers/Programmers (Information & Communication Technology)

column3: A fantastic leadership opportunity with Gladstone Ports Corporation, for anyone based in North QLD, or interstate candidates looking for a sea-change.
column13: Clicks IT Recruitment is partnering with the Gladstone Ports Corporation in their search for their next leader.  After an internal promotion, they are looking for an experienced Infrastructure Leader to be based out of their headquarters in Gladstone.  In this role, you will use your leadership experience to guide and lead a team of 4, with the headcount to grow before years end. You will also play a crucial role in continuously improving the effectiveness, dependability, and security of the existing technology and applications.  Gladstone Ports Corporation is based in North Queensland. It is expected that this role is to be based in Gladstone, QLD on a full time basis.  Key experience required:  Proven experience in an IT leadership role, managing an infrastructure team Proven, hands-on experience with managing Servers (Microsoft), Storage (SAN/DAS/NAS, iSCSI) and Networks (VLANs, routing, switching, wireless & firewalls) Experience in resources industry e.g. mining, oil, gas, utilities, aviation highly desirable Demonstrated interpersonal, verbal and written skills including the ability to liaise and create positive relationships with internal and external stakeholders. Mandatory C class drivers licence  On offer is a permanent role offering a generous salary between $180,000 - $220,000 + 12.75% super, and a generous relocation package of up to $30,000 for any candidates looking to relocate to Gladstone.  Please note: due to WHS regulations, candidates must be able to pass a drug and alcohol test prior to commencement if successful.  If you're interested in applying for this role, please clearly state on your resume or cover letter, your ability to re-locate to the area.  Candidates must be eligible to work in Australia, with unlimited working rights.  If you wish to apply for this position, please submit your resume by clicking the 'Apply Now' button. For further information please contact Dylan Sheoshker at Clicks IT Recruitment on +61 429 171 544.  At Clicks we embrace diversity, inclusion and equal opportunity.  We provide reasonable adjustments, including alternate formats to the recruitment process for individuals with disability. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process, please call 1300 254 257 or email adjustments@clicks.com.au

column3: Full-time permanent opportunity at SA Water
column13: Your new company    SA Water is a successful, modern water utility that is wholly owned by the Government of South Australia. They employ more than 1,600 people across a broad range of disciplines who operate more than $14 billion of assets, delivering essential water and sewerage services to more than 1.8 million South Australians.      Your new role    SA Water are seeking a Cyber Security GRC Manager who will direct the development and supervision of their Cyber Security Governance, Risk, and Compliance (Cyber GRC) team, services, and capabilities. The role requires you to manage technology risk and fulfill compliance obligations as a critical infrastructure business operating state-wide.   Key role requirements:   Manage Cyber Security governance, risk, and compliance (GRC) services and activities to effectively identify, assess, and manage cyber security risks across the organisation, in alignment with the Corporate Risk Management Framework.  Lead enterprise cyber security planning to achieve business goals safely by prioritising cyber defence initiatives, increasing business focus on cyber security, deploying, and managing current and future cyber security technologies.  Develop and communicate cyber security policies, strategies, plans, current cyber threat and risk profile and maturity to executive team, employees, partners, customers, and stakeholders.  Manage the team that provide specialist cyber security advice to SA Water staff and external vendors.  Lead and manage the organisation’s Cyber Security Compliance Assurance program, scope of which includes meeting cyber security related SoCI obligations, internal assessments, and facilitating audits and assurance of cyber security activities and objectives.  Manage the Cyber Security Awareness program and the team responsible for this program this includes.  Lead and oversee the administration of the Cyber Security Third Party Risk Management function and services.  Identify and classify information and technology assets to ensure protections are commensurate with the value of the asset and recommend appropriate cyber security risk treatments for them.  Direct and deliver Cyber GRC assessments, acting as a business partner and internal trusted advisor.  Monitor external and internal cyber security threats and update inherent risk ratings in a timely manner.  Support SA Water’s Cyber Security team and organisation as Acting CISO in the event required.      What you'll need to succeed    Significant working knowledge of the laws, policies, and standards applicable to cyber security, privacy, cyber risk management, and cyber security aspects of protecting critical infrastructure with demonstrable experience interpreting obligations into cyber security practices and delivery within an organisation or enterprise.  Experience developing and maintaining Information Security Management Systems using recognised formal Cyber Security Frameworks or similar continuous improvement cyber security frameworks in the context of large, complex organisations (e.g., NIST, Essential 8, ISO 27000 etc).   Proven leadership skills to lead a team of specialists, and influence people at all levels internally and externally.  Demonstrated ability to conceptualise, launch and deliver multiple initiatives with complex interdependencies on time and within budget, supported by strong problem solving and analytical capabilities.  Proven experience with delivering Cyber GRC services across various security technologies, including technologies such as firewalls and network based cyber security controls, intrusion detection systems, anti-malware, EDR/XDR systems, web and cloud-based cyber security controls, modern identity security systems, log management, and content filtering.  Relevant Cyber Security certifications (e.g., CISM, CISSP, CRISC etc).       What you'll get in return    Competitive salary and a relocation package on offer for interstate candidates.   Flexible work arrangements (3 days in the office, 2 WFH).  Have your work matter! Work as part of a close-knit team that has high visibility in the organisation.    Lead and manage an experienced GRC team who are highly engaging and motivated!       What you need to do now    If you have the necessary experience as a Cyber Security GRC Manager then please apply via the link below with your CV, cover letter and response to the selection criteria (please request a copy of the PID) or contact Tishan Gamage on Tishan.Gamage@hays.com.au or +61 3 9604 9518 now.

column3: Nationally recognized organisation in Brisbane looking for a Data Analyst with strong data migration experience to join immediately.
column13: About the company    We currently have a live opening for a Data Analyst to join one of our client sites in Cannon Hill, Brisbane. This nationally recognised & reputable business is currently undertaking a large program of digital transformation, including a D365 ERP F&O /D365 CRM/CE upgrade (underway & full service) among other exciting initiatives.    This organisation has competitive salary packaging, is detailed orientated and has flexible working arrangements.    Key Responsibilities:  Investigate, evaluate and implement flow through IT systems (ERP/CRM) Development and deployment of information reporting solutions Undertake capacity planning and data monitoring Investigate, evaluate and implement methods for information migration during system changes Train staff in effective use of information repositories and reporting tools as required Work alongside external vendors and validate Software Vendor claims for information suitability to business operations Produce quality documentation for business data storage and information flow       Experience Required:  Previous commercial experience in a similar role Development of Data Models Experience migrating data from on-prem to Cloud Database Design, Development and Tuning Information analysis and reporting Repository and flow documentation Data Cleansing and Migration Change control Azure Cloud migration experience Snowflake experience (Bonus) Proficient in Microsoft office suite Experienced with the Microsoft BI stack (Bonus)    Benefits:  Fixed term position Organisation of considerable repute Office location is easy to commute to via road & public transport Hybrid work model Work with in-demand, popular ERP/CRM Systems Transformation projects - engaging challenges    Please apply for email below for more info. david@dynamorecruitment.com.au

column3: Join us as a data engineer utilising your Databricks and Gen AI experience as we build solutions for our members.
column13: As a data engineer you will be enabling the business by providing data, reporting and analytics solutions, through developing and supporting Data Ingestion and transformation in the Azure Enterprise Data & Analytics Platform (EDAP).  What will you be doing?  Designing, developing, and maintaining scalable data pipelines using Databricks, ensuring robust data processing workflows for cleaning, transforming, and aggregating data. Implementing stringent measures to ensure data quality, governance, and compliance within the data lake, leveraging Databricks lifecycle management to maintain predictive models. Deploying and managing data solutions using Azure cloud platforms, optimising data and platform performance for maximum efficiency. Working closely with various business units, data analysts, and scientists to understand and meet diverse data needs, facilitating the integration and deployment of AI and ML models. Demonstrating the ability to anticipate and balance the needs of multiple stakeholders, building partnerships and working collaboratively to achieve shared objectives. Developing new and innovative strategies to enhance organisational success, handle complex and sometimes contradictory information to effectively solve problems, and focus on building member relationships while delivering customer-centric solutions.  What are we looking for in you?  Extensive experience with Databricks, including proficiency in maintaining operational processes and predictive models through its lifecycle management, along with a strong understanding of data architecture, data modelling, and data lake concepts. Familiarity with Synapse, MLOps, LLM frameworks, and experience in Generative AI. Proven ability to work effectively in cross-functional teams, contributing to the integration and deployment of advanced technologies within the organisation. Expertise in SQL, Python, and PySpark, with significant experience in complex enterprise environments involving multiple platforms and systems. Proficiency in working with cloud platforms such as GCP, Azure, and AWS, and knowledge of Azure-specific solutions like Azure Data Lake, Azure Blob, Azure SQL Database, and Azure SQL Data Warehouse. Skill in maintaining code migrations, monitoring, and deployment using GitHub. Experienced in CI/CD pipelines, ETL processes, data streaming, and data sharing, with familiarity in real-time data processing and integration, particularly with Microsoft and Databricks applications. Broad understanding of Information Management, Data Quality, Master Data Management, Data Governance, and Data Stewardship, all of which are crucial for ensuring the integrity and quality of data across systems. In-depth understanding of Business Intelligence and reporting concepts, with practical experience in BI toolsets, particularly PowerBI. Advanced problem-solving skills, meticulous attention to detail, and experience using REST APIs and Postman for testing and integration.  What can we offer you?  Working in an environment that is embracing a continuous improvement culture using experimentation to support learning. Time dedicated to your personal development time with access to training, development, and certification programs to ensure you can upskill. Being part of empowered, cross-functional agile delivery teams that works with the business to build systems that solve problems. Complete flexibility to choose between working from the home or office with flexible hours for a better work life balance. Building digital systems that will shape the future for the RAC and a better WA. Gain RAC Staff Benefits including free Roadside Assistance and 25% discount on your Insurances, Social Club and access Fitness Passport for cheaper gym memberships.  About RAC  As an Equal Opportunity Employer, RAC values inclusivity and promotes a workplace that actively seeks to welcome contributions from all people. We encourage people of all abilities, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders, diverse cultures and backgrounds, LGBTIQ+ identities, and all age groups to apply.  RAC is committed to flexibility. If you need assistance or adjustments to fully participate in the application process, please contact jason.crooks@rac.com.au.

column3: Work on cutting-edge projects, provide valuable insights, and ensure the success of our customers' cybersecurity and operational monitoring needs.
column13: We are Fujitsu  We use technology to make happier lives. We are a global leader in technology and business solutions that transform organizations and the world around us. We have a long heritage of bringing innovation and expertise, continuously working to contribute to the growth of society and our customers.  About the role  Fujitsu is seeking an experienced Splunk Architect for this upcoming project for a Government client based in Canberra and Brisbane. As a Splunk Architect with 5 or more years of hands-on experience, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our clients' Splunk environments. You will work on cutting-edge projects, providing valuable insights, and ensuring the success of our customers' cybersecurity and operational monitoring needs.   The Specialist will work in a team with other senior technical Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). They will be responsible for informing technical specifications, ensuring compatibility, and incorporating their relevant elements of the High Level Design (HLD) against the endorsed Architecture & Strategy, creating the follow-on specific Detailed Designs (DD), and prototyping and implementing the Splunk capability under the direction of the SION lead architect.  It is a contractual role of 12 months with a possibility of extension for another year and it requires a minimum of Baseline Clearance.  Qualifications:  A minimum of 5 years of experience in designing, implementing, and managing Splunk environments. Splunk certifications, such as Splunk Certified Architect or Splunk Certified Admin, are highly desirable. Lead the implementation of Splunk Enterprise, Enterprise Security, and IT Service Intelligence (ITSI) to meet specific requirements, ensuring efficient data collection, parsing, and indexing. Set up effective monitoring and alerting systems within Splunk to proactively address issues and incidents. Implement and manage security controls within the Splunk environment, ensuring adherence to compliance and best practices. Integrate Splunk with other IT tools, systems, and data sources to provide a holistic view of data and enhance correlation and analysis capabilities. Develop custom Splunk apps, dashboards, and searches to meet unique business requirements and maximize the value of Splunk. Familiarity with ITIL, DevOps, and agile methodologies is advantageous. Experience with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus. Proficiency in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell) for custom Splunk app development. Collaborate with other IT professionals, including network and security experts, to ensure Splunk aligns with broader technology initiatives. Strong communication and teamwork skills, as well as the ability to work directly with clients. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment. A valid drivers license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required. Must demonstrate a can-do attitude. Baseline Clearance minimum, NV1 or NV2 is desirable  Why Fujitsu?  We are an organization with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity, equity and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.  We put people first. We believe in the power of diversity to drive innovation and our Work180 accreditation, AWEI (Australian Workplace Equality Index) Gold Employer status and Rainbow Tick certification for LGBTI+ inclusion show that we value an inclusive culture. We offer tailored career paths across our global organization to support your professional and personal growth. Our customers trust us. We have an excellent reputation across the region and globally. Best in class reward and recognition programs flexible work, volunteering leave and more. We live our values of aspiration, trust and empathy, all day, every day.  As an inclusive employer, Fujitsu aims to recruit a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our purpose. In line with our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, we welcome applications from women and gender diverse people; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; Māori and Pacific people; LGBTI+ people; people with a disability; culturally and linguistically diverse people; and veterans and emergency responders. Applicants who identify as transgender or gender diverse can view a copy of our Frequently Asked Questions to assist with the recruitment journey. For all other general inquiries, please contact careersapac@fujitsu.com  If you don't tick every box in this job description, please don't rule yourself out. Research suggests that women and other people in underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they meet every requirement. We focus on hiring people who value inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage, and integrity, rather than ticking boxes so if this resonates with you, then please apply. For more information, please email careersapac@fujitsu.com.   Thanks in advance.

column1: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead
column2: Medline International Two Australia Pty Ltd
column3: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead Senior Azure DevOps engineers with mentoring skills welcome to apply
column13: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead  Senior Azure DevOps engineers with mentoring skills welcome to apply  Salary - $175 - $195K + 11% super, plus 20% Bonus - APPLY NOW. Reporting to CTO - 100% Cloud environment Managing a team of 12 people across Cloud, Network and Infrastructure. Location - Melbourne - Hybrid office  An exciting new role for a Tech Lead Azure Cloud Engineer working within Kubernetes and containerisation, working with an established market leading in Financial Services. This company is now expanding and hiring Azure Engineers too.  This Cloud Manager / Azure Senior DevOps Tech Lead role will manage the Azure Cloud infrastructure, Networking and Coud Suports team of 12 people. deliver and support digital solutions that provide value to the business working with mobile app, website, software, and data teams.  You will have the opportunity to research and evaluate new tools, frameworks and technologies that will improve the way Azure Cloud is being developed, built, executed, and monitored within the business.  Whilst leading projects and mentoring the team you will work alongside cross functional technical teams including solution architects, project managers, vendors and contractors to design, build and deploy new solutions or enhancements to existing solutions  As the Cloud Azure Manager / Lead will lead projects to design, configure and maintain Azure infrastructure to support the company's distributed systems architecture at scale with remaining hands on.  What you need  Experience of DevOps experience - ideally multiple platform - AZURE & AWS Hands on Cloud Design and Strategy experience Experience in managing infrastructure and deploying applications on Azure Experience with CI/CD pipelines allowing developers to push their changes to production with high confidence Experience in Kubernetes / AKS and containerisation Experience with monitoring/alerting solutions Experience in Jenkins, Bamboo, Infra as code/ Terraform, Ansible, Python and Ruby desirable Technically leading a team and working closely with Vendors and 3rd party consultants  This is a great opportunity to work with a leading tech company that is growing and expanding into new technologies and growing the online market.  Please APPLY for an immediate interview or call 0422869289. I am currently recruiting for several Perm & Contract Cloud, DevOp roles, feel free to email to arrange a time to speak. I look forward to speaking to you soon.  IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.  http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

column3: Looking for a outstanding Linux SME to join the team in the Managed Services business unit in Canberra.
column13: Company description:    ATTURRA OPERATIONS PTY LTD    Job description:    Why is this an exciting opportunity?  Atturra is one of Australia's fastest growing ASX-listed advisory and IT solutions companies.  The Managed Services area of Atturra's business offers leading Hybrid IT, Private Cloud and Connectivity services, and the team have decades of experience in the industry. This experience coupled with our people, makes us one of the most complete and leading "as a service" providers in the market.  With over 900 employees working across Australia, New Zealand, Singapore and Hong Kong, Atturra works on some of the highest profile projects in Australia. The depth, breadth and scope of our projects means you are continually developing your skillset and the value you can deliver. These are projects that are making a real difference in people's lives.  What our people say: "We are working towards a very bright future."  "It's a company with vision and a promising future."  Why you'll love working here  Culture of possibility  At Atturra we embrace innovation within our teams, fostering an environment of possibility and growth. We believe in creating a supportive and welcoming culture, where everyone is encouraged to achieve success through collaboration, continuous learning and smart work practices.  A strong set of company values  Our culture is reflected by our employees who demonstrate camaraderie, innovation, dedication, respect and excellence in everything they do. These traits have become integral to the way we do business and are the values we strive for.  Valuable employee benefits  Employee benefits, recognition, and wellbeing platform Career growth via succession planning, internal promotions, and mentorship opportunities Ongoing investment in professional development through industry and technology certifications and study assistance Mental health support through our Employee Assistance Program Support for family and caring responsibilities, including paid parental leave Employee referral program, with monetary incentives offered  What our people say:  "Atturra has a great working environment and management are very supportive of their staff. We celebrate success and have fun while working hard."  What you'll be doing  We are seeking a highly skilled Red Hat Engineer with the ability to work in a demanding environment with an enthusiastic sense of customer support, you will need to communicate and coordinate with clients as well as other technology groups in a complex and highly governed environment.  The role will involve:  Design, deploy, and manage Red Hat Enterprise Linux systems and environments. Implement automation tools and scripts for provisioning, configuration, and monitoring of RHEL systems. Conduct system performance analysis, tuning, and capacity planning to support business growth and scalability. Troubleshoot and resolve issues related to RHEL systems, including performance tuning, security vulnerabilities, and software bugs. Develop and maintain documentation related to RHEL configurations, processes, and procedures.  Working Conditions  Based in Deakin, ACT Permanent full time Hybrid work Australian Citizen with NV1 Security Clearance  What will make you successful in this role?  5+ years proven experience as a RHEL Systems Engineer Strong proficiency in scripting and automation using tools such as Shell, Python, or Ansible. Deep understanding of RHEL internals, including security, kernel tuning, filesystems, and networking. Proven experience in Red Hat Satellite Experience with virtualization technologies such as VMware Strong business acumen and the ability to understand and articulate technical solutions in business terms. High-level oral, written, and interpersonal communication skills including the ability to negotiate with and influence internal and external clients and stakeholders Relevant certifications (e.g., RHCE, RHCSA) preferred  How to apply  Careers | Atturra  https://atturra.com/au-en/careers  Recruitment Agencies/Headhunters:  We got this covered. Our Talent Acquisition team is working on our hiring demands and will reach out should we need extra support. Atturra only accepts referrals from agencies on our official supplier list via Agency Portal. Agencies are required to go through our procurement process, have an approved fee agreement, and be invited to participate in hiring for a job opening by the Atturra Talent Acquisition team. Any profiles or referrals submitted outside of this process will be deemed invalid. We request that you do not contact Atturra employees outside of the Talent Acquisition team for any hiring-related queries. To become an official supplier, send an expression of interest via talentacquisition@atturra.com.  Atturra is passionate about playing an active role in addressing the digital skills gap and being an advocate for diversity and Inclusion, and welcomes applications from all irrespective of their gender, LGBTQI identity, ethnicity, religion, physical ability, or age.

column3: The ASC’s Change & Release Manager responsible for the transition of technology projects/change into service.
column13: Applications close at 11:30pm AEST on Monday 19 August 2024 (late applications will not be accepted).  The Australian Sports Commission is embarking on the Green and Gold decade. An exciting time filled with international sporting competitions on home soil, including the Men’s and Women’s Rugby World Cup, and culminating in the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. We have an ambitious new Strategic Vision and we need the best players on our team to help us deliver real results for the sporting sector and all Australians.  Are you up for the challenge?  About the team  The Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking Branch, consists of three interconnected teams who work collaboratively to support the ASC’s IT ecosystem:  Architecture Team focuses on designing and planning the overall structure of ASC’s IT systems, including system design, scalability and performance, integration, security, alignment with business goals, technology evaluation and cloud strategy. Infrastructure Team manages the underlying hardware, software, and services that support ASC’s IT operations, including network infrastructure, data centres, storage solutions, virtualisation, monitoring and troubleshooting, capacity planning and disaster recovery. Networking Team: focuses specifically on network-related tasks, including network design, configuration and maintenance, IP address management, network security, performance optimisation, troubleshooting connectivity issues, and wireless networks.  About the role  The ASC’s Change & Release Manager sits within the Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking Branch and is responsible for the transition of technology projects/change into service. You will be responsible for managing both project related and operational changes that will affect or has the potential to affect live services.  You will have full responsibility of ensuring effective control and mitigation of risk to the security, availability, performance and impact on the business and more importantly maintaining our services to internal and external stakeholders.  About you  We are looking for a motivated and driven individual with excellent attention to detail and experience in developing and implementing technology change processes within a Government context.  The successful candidate will have:  Proven experience with coordination and facilitation of technology Change & Release Management processes and procedures. Understanding the Solution Delivery Lifecycle and relationship to Change Management & Release Management. Strong knowledge and understanding of the ITIL best practice framework, with ITIL Certification considered advantageous. Knowledge and understanding of Project Management methodologies, including Agile project delivery. Excellent written and oral communication skills, with the ability to translate technical information to understanding of a layperson.  This position is offered as a fixed term position until September 2025.  Why work with us? We have offices located in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney.  Across all locations, we offer:  Options for flexible working arrangements. Annual allowances towards training based on individualised career goals. Access to a customised ASC L&D calendar for ongoing professional and career development. Generous superannuation scheme with up to 15.4% employer contributions. Corporate discount on AIS Shop merchandise. Access to Clearinghouse for Sport, an information sharing platform for Sporting professionals.  Additionally, our Canberra campus offers:  Free onsite parking Onsite facilities including café, dining hall, gym, and swimming pool. Priority placement for your children to access the award winning, onsite AIS Caretaker’s Cottage Childcare Centre.  If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact:  Contact Officer: Dillon Sayasane - Director, Architecture, Infrastructure & Networking Phone number: 02 6214 1064 Email address: dillon.sayasane@ausport.gov.au   If you would like to learn more about this opportunity or to obtain the job description, click 'Apply' now

column3: In this role, you will manage information assets and business processes throughout their lifecycle!
column13: Our Client This is a sought-after opportunity to join one of Australia’s largest health service providers. The organisation focuses on maximising wellness potential through seamless patient journeys, embracing cultural diversity, collaborating with communities and agencies, enhancing workforce capacity and capability, and maximising technology use.   The Opportunity We are looking for talented professional to join the team and help our client manage information assets and business processes throughout their lifecycle. If you have a passion for software development, human-centred design, and analytical thinking, this opportunity is for you!   Some of your responsibilities will include, but are not limited to: Architecture | Develop complex model structures, ensuring maintainable and high-performance solutions; Solution Design | Translate end-user requirements into effective solution designs; UI/UX Design | Create user-friendly interfaces through exceptional user experience design; Best Practice | Maintain software development standards for consistency and compliance; Documentation | Develop comprehensive documentation throughout the development pipeline; Collaborate | Work within a small team to analyse and rectify incidents, develop application enhancements and ensure application support service levels; Translate Plans and User Stories | Convert plans and user stories into actionable tasks and solution outputs; Human-Centred Design | Ensure that solution outputs meet business requirements through user-focused design; Expert in Technology Stack | Become proficient in the client's technology stack to accelerate technical delivery of their products; Troubleshoot and Improve | Maintain and enhance systems through testing and troubleshooting. Your Skills & Experience Ideally, 5 years of experience in enterprise-grade solutions delivery and/or a degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or Software Engineering; Expertise in UI/UX design, analytical and critical thinking, development and integration, and DevOps; Ability to elicit requirements, prepare design options, and deploy automation; Experience in application support, selecting appropriate testing approaches, and developing and executing test plans. The Offer This is a rewarding permanent opportunity to play an integral role in the ongoing success and growth of a highly reputable organisation.   To ensure compliance with Australian employment law, this role is only open to candidates who possess either the right to work in Australia, permanent residency, citizenship status or visa status.    How to Apply To apply online, click ‘apply’ at the top of this page, or contact our designated Recruitment Consultant, James Campbell-Watson at james@cbcstaff.com.au for a confidential discussion.   At CBC Staff Selection, we are dedicated to fostering an environment that champions equal opportunity, embraces diversity, promotes inclusion and prioritises flexibility and accessibility. All communication with CBC Staff Selection is managed in a highly confidential manner, and your details will not be shared with any future employer without your prior consent.   CBC Staff Selection – Redefining Recruitment With over 35 years’ recruitment experience, CBC Staff Selection specialises in providing professional, quality recruitment services to a wide range of candidates and clients throughout both Far North Queensland (Cairns region) and North Queensland (Townsville region) as well as Regional Queensland.   Job Reference: 1522507/JCW

column3: This role will suit someone with either a SOC L2/Incident Response background or Sec Eng wanting a broader business role
column13: Do you want to join a team full of experienced operators who enjoy the challenge that comes with working for a fast-growing digital organisation, are passionate about protecting customer data, and know how to have fun while doing it?  Are you a Senior SOC Analyst (L2/3) who is seeking to combine SecOps with security engineering?  If so, this role will suit someone transitioning as a Security Operations Analyst or Security Engineer with around 3-4 years’ experience and ideally a mixture of sec operations & engineering experience.   This blended role will appeal to a broad cross-section of security specialists. If you don't tick all the boxes, that's ok...more scope to be cross trained into other security functions that will ultimately enhance your career moving forward.   What's required  Develop bespoke security solutions. Respond to incidents, work with the SOC team and enhance capabilities.  Do you know the security implications around a given vulnerability?  You must have hands on exposure to DLP tools, proxy tools. The current EDR is Crowdstrike although experience with others is ok. The SIEM is Splunk, a big tick if you have used detection products. Cloud expertise? AWS - training here can be provided.  This employer has an exciting, long term Cyber Security roadmap and are happy to upskill.  This organisation has fantastic benefits. Top tier, infact. Generous leave, free breakfasts, flexible working arrangements, excellent parental leave, tailored career programmes & much more!   Keen to learn more? For a confidential discussion please contact Kris at harry@decipherbureau.com or alternatively click apply.  The Decipher Bureau is a highly experienced specialist Cyber Security recruitment company operating across Australia.

column3: Nationally recognized organisation in Brisbane looking for a Data Analyst with strong data migration experience to join immediately.
column13: About the company    We currently have a live opening for a Data Analyst to join one of our client sites in Cannon Hill, Brisbane. This nationally recognised & reputable business is currently undertaking a large program of digital transformation, including a D365 ERP F&O /D365 CRM/CE upgrade (underway & full service) among other exciting initiatives.    This organisation has competitive salary packaging, is detailed orientated and has flexible working arrangements.    Key Responsibilities:  Investigate, evaluate and implement flow through IT systems (ERP/CRM) Development and deployment of information reporting solutions Undertake capacity planning and data monitoring Investigate, evaluate and implement methods for information migration during system changes Train staff in effective use of information repositories and reporting tools as required Work alongside external vendors and validate Software Vendor claims for information suitability to business operations Produce quality documentation for business data storage and information flow       Experience Required:  Previous commercial experience in a similar role Development of Data Models Experience migrating data from on-prem to Cloud Database Design, Development and Tuning Information analysis and reporting Repository and flow documentation Data Cleansing and Migration Change control Azure Cloud migration experience Snowflake experience (Bonus) Proficient in Microsoft office suite Experienced with the Microsoft BI stack (Bonus)    Benefits:  Fixed term position Organisation of considerable repute Office location is easy to commute to via road & public transport Hybrid work model Work with in-demand, popular ERP/CRM Systems Transformation projects - engaging challenges    Please apply for email below for more info. david@dynamorecruitment.com.au

column3: Become a key member of our Infrastructure & Platforms team where you will focus on providing high level technical networking support
column13: Company description:    QinetiQ employs more than 8500 people in more than 50 locations around the world, offering our customers premier expertise in advice, services and creative technology-based products.  QinetiQ Australia, part of the global QinetiQ group, provides technological and scientific expertise to help customers protect and advance their vital interests. As an innovative science and technology company, we help solve some of our customers' most challenging problems. Our determination to deliver and improve today and anticipate and shape tomorrow, makes QinetiQ a very exciting, rewarding and respected place to work and learn.    Job description:    Due to substantial growth of the QinetiQ business, QinetiQ's IT operation is evolving to provide the technology and IT services that will underpin QinetiQ's future global strategy and ambitions. We are now accepting applications for a positive, forward thinking Senior Network Engineer based in Adelaide, Canberra or Melbourne.  Reporting to the Infrastructure & Platforms Manager and as a key member of the Infrastructure & Platforms team, you will have a focus on providing high level technical networking support services to ensure QinetiQ's networking environments are secure, reliable, supported and maintained.  As Senior Network Engineer you will be accountable for:  Installing, configuring, supporting and managing the lifecycle of various network equipment and devices such as Switches, Firewalls, WAPs, etc. Service Ownership of assigned QinetiQ Network Services Establishing key network performance indicators and ensuring they are monitored to ensure network availability and reliability Coordinating the allocation of IP addressing, subnets, IP pools and VLAN allocations Managing the operational integrity of QinetiQ's IT networking infrastructures, ensuring availability, integrity and security Supporting IT Leadership with communication to business in regards to service availability, incidents and change Assume leadership responsibilities within the infrastructure & Platforms team, when the Manager is away or on leave Planning and executing network related maintenance and system upgrades including patches, hot fixes and security configuration Actively contributing to the definition, development and maintenance of network policies, procedures and standards Conducting periodic reviews and audits across all key networking systems and devices  As a suitably experienced and well-rounded IT professional, the Senior Network Engineer will need to bring with them:  Seasoned experience in a similar IT Network Administration/Engineering role A Strong and diverse set of IT technical skills within the Networking domain Proven experience in the planning, design, development and implementation of major/complex IT network infrastructures A strong understanding of network security principles with experience in implementing security measures Deep understanding and knowledge of networking protocols (e.g. IPSEC, HSRP, BGP, OSPF, 802.11, Qos, DNS) Deep understanding and knowledge of network capability and concepts such as SDWAN, Wireless Networking, VLANS, Network Access Control, Load Balancing, VPNs etc. Working knowledge/understanding of ITIL principles Experience working within compliance frameworks such as UK's Cyber essentials (Plus), Australia's ISM, NIST, ISO27001, ITAR and export control  Whilst not essential, a tertiary qualification in computer science or information technology and certifications in CCNP and/or Comp TIA Network + would be advantageous.  Candidates will need to be eligible to obtain a Negative Vetting Level 1 Australian Government Security Clearance.  Whilst applications must be made online, confidential enquiries are welcome and may be directed to Roz Byrne, Talent Acquisition Specialist via email: rbyrne@qinetiq.com.au  Looking for an Employer with Benefits?  At QinetiQ, our competitive remuneration and benefits package supports your evolving needs throughout your career. You'll share in the company's success, and be rewarded for your own. We'll invest in your professional development and provide an inclusive environment for you to succeed.  Some of our benefits include:  Individual professional development fund Flexible work Purchased leave program and loyalty leave Up to 18 weeks paid parental leave Annual incentive scheme Complimentary salary continuance insurance Annual volunteering leave with Operation Give Back Relaxed dress code  A full list of our employee benefits and further information can be found here:  https://www.qinetiq.com/en-au/careers/benefits  If you are a highly motivated senior IT professional with a passion for technology and a track record of successful IT management, we would like to hear from you.

column1: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead
column3: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead Senior Azure DevOps engineers with mentoring skills welcome to apply
column13: Top Financial Services - Azure Manager / Cloud Tech Lead  Senior Azure DevOps engineers with mentoring skills welcome to apply  Salary - $175 - $195K + 11% super, plus 20% Bonus - APPLY NOW. Reporting to CTO - 100% Cloud environment Managing a team of 12 people across Cloud, Network and Infrastructure. Location - Melbourne - Hybrid office  An exciting new role for a Tech Lead Azure Cloud Engineer working within Kubernetes and containerisation, working with an established market leading in Financial Services. This company is now expanding and hiring Azure Engineers too.  This Cloud Manager / Azure Senior DevOps Tech Lead role will manage the Azure Cloud infrastructure, Networking and Coud Suports team of 12 people. deliver and support digital solutions that provide value to the business working with mobile app, website, software, and data teams.  You will have the opportunity to research and evaluate new tools, frameworks and technologies that will improve the way Azure Cloud is being developed, built, executed, and monitored within the business.  Whilst leading projects and mentoring the team you will work alongside cross functional technical teams including solution architects, project managers, vendors and contractors to design, build and deploy new solutions or enhancements to existing solutions  As the Cloud Azure Manager / Lead will lead projects to design, configure and maintain Azure infrastructure to support the company's distributed systems architecture at scale with remaining hands on.  What you need  Experience of DevOps experience - ideally multiple platform - AZURE & AWS Hands on Cloud Design and Strategy experience Experience in managing infrastructure and deploying applications on Azure Experience with CI/CD pipelines allowing developers to push their changes to production with high confidence Experience in Kubernetes / AKS and containerisation Experience with monitoring/alerting solutions Experience in Jenkins, Bamboo, Infra as code/ Terraform, Ansible, Python and Ruby desirable Technically leading a team and working closely with Vendors and 3rd party consultants  This is a great opportunity to work with a leading tech company that is growing and expanding into new technologies and growing the online market.  Please APPLY for an immediate interview or call 0422869289. I am currently recruiting for several Perm & Contract Cloud, DevOp roles, feel free to email to arrange a time to speak. I look forward to speaking to you soon.  IMPORTANT: By submitting your email address and any other personal information when you APPLY to a job, you consent to such information being collected, held, used and disclosed in accordance with our COLLECTIONS NOTICE and PRIVACY POLICY.  http://www.bluefinresources.com.au/privacy-policy

column3: You will lead the agile delivery capability and be responsible for executing the Digital Learning eXperience (DLX) roadmap to achieve great outcomes.
column13: Dynamic Product Owner - Digital Learning available, 12 Months Fixed Term position Salary Level HEW 9 + 17% Superannuation and Flexible Working Arrangements Based at the Melbourne CBD campus (Hybrid role).  About RMIT University  RMIT is a multi-sector university of technology, design and enterprise with more than 96,000 students and close to 10,000 staff globally. The University's mission is to help shape the world through research, innovation and engagement, and to create transformative experiences for students to prepare them for life and work.  https://www.rmit.edu.au/about  https://www.universitiesaustralia.edu.au/university/rmit-university  Why work at RMIT University  Our people make everything at the University possible. We encourage new approaches to work and learning, stimulating change to drive positive impact. Find out more about working at RMIT University, what we stand for and why we are an Employer of Choice.  We want to attract those who will make a difference. View RMIT's impressive standings in university rankings.  https://www.rmit.edu.au/about/facts-figures/reputation-and-rankings   About the Portfolio  The Operations Portfolio enables an integrated, enterprise-wide delivery for best practice student and staff experiences.  The Portfolio incorporates the following business units: Enterprise Projects and Business Performance (EPBP), Communications, People, Information and Technology Services (ITS), Office of the Chief Operating Officer, Procurement and Vietnam Operations.   The Portfolio houses significant drivers and delivery components across the staff and student journeys and enables the overall experience for both groups. The Portfolio is integral in bringing the RMIT strategy to life, across the globe. Each of these functions supports the global operations of the University both directly as well as through its controlled entities.   The Information Technology Services (ITS) function, provides RMIT University with current and emerging Technology systems and services. Our vision of "unleashing technologies to enable great experiences for RMIT communities" supports a proactive and leading-edge technology ecosystem, mindset and delivery empowering the advancement of the University's commitment to advancing Lifelong Learners.    About the Role  Working as part of Architecture & Software Engineering, the Product Owner - Digital Learning is the primary link between stakeholders and squads and is responsible for delivering value in line with customer expectations and aligned with strategic objectives.  The Product Owner - Digital Learning is responsible for the product roadmaps and managing and prioritising the product backlogs across the learning and teaching ecosystem. You will lead the agile delivery capability and be responsible for executing the Digital Learning eXperience (DLX) roadmap to achieve great outcomes for Students and Staff.  Side by side with Customers, you will plan initiatives and facilitate our agile development squads in delivery of work meeting goals committed as part of the quarterly planning process. You will work in partnership with vendors, business owners, and ITS stakeholders in RMIT.    About You  At RMIT, we're looking for diverse, passionate people to join our team.    To be successful in this position, you'll have, as a minimum:   Experience leading teams and managing people Experience in a learning or education management consultant or leadership position Experience in technical product ownership and roadmap management position Excellent attention to detail in written and spoken communications to identify and solve issues Demonstrated experience in successfully using Agile methodologies across programs with cross-functional teams preferred Strong self-confidence and decisive ability to work independently whilst being able to lead and influence stakeholders Strong vendor/partner management capability Experience in working as a scrum master in a distributed squad setup preferred. Analytical and critical thinker with good experience with facilitation, situational awareness, conflict resolution, and continuous improvement Strong technical aptitude and experience leading teams in delivering quality software Great interpersonal skills for building strong working relationships     To Apply  Please click the' Apply' link below to submit your CV and cover letter addressing your suitability for this position.   For further information about this position, please see the Position Description below.  Position Description - Product Owner, Digital Learning   When you join our team, you'll have access to a range of benefits: www.rmit.edu.au/careers/employee-benefits. From travel to fitness, there's something for everyone!     Bring Your Whole Self to Work  We are better for our diversity. When we listen to those who are different to us, or challenge us, we grow stronger together. When we feel like we belong, we can achieve so much more. We respect each other, embrace our differences and build a sense of belonging in our team and beyond.  We are proud that our dedication to diversity has been recognised by a broad spectrum of external organisations. Visit our Linkedin Life pages to learn more and see some of our most recent wins.  RMIT has a strong dhumbali (commitment) to the employment, development and retention of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people within a culturally safe environment; we strongly encourage applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples.  At RMIT, we are committed to supporting adjustments throughout the recruitment and selection process, as well as during employment. We actively support and encourage people with disability to apply to RMIT. To discuss adjustment requirements, please contact Kassie (Senior Talent Acquisition Advisor), via talentsupport@rmit.edu.au or visit our Careers page for more contact information - https://www.rmit.edu.au/careers  RMIT is an equal opportunity employer committed to being a child safe organisation. We are dedicated to attracting, retaining and developing our people regardless of gender identity, ethnicity, sexual orientation, disability and age. Applications are encouraged from all sectors of the community and we strongly encourage applications from the Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander community.  We are a Circle Back Initiative Employer - we commit to respond to every applicant.
