column3: Immediate interview slots, Excellent salaries, Great Transport links
column13: About The Company: Professional Search Group are recruiting for a leading Manufacturing company dedicated to delivering innovative solutions that drive efficiency and growth. They offer a range of fantastic benefits and operate a working from home policy.  Position Overview: We are seeking a highly motivated and experienced ERP Project Manager to join a dynamic team in the CBD in Perth. In this role, you will be responsible for overseeing the implementation and management of ERP systems, ensuring that projects are delivered on time, and aligned with business objectives.  Key Responsibilities:   Lead end-to-end ERP implementation projects, including planning, execution, and monitoring. Collaborate with stakeholders to define project scope, goals, and deliverables. Develop detailed project plans, timelines, and budgets. Manage project resources, including internal teams and third-party vendors. Identify risks and issues, and implement mitigation strategies. Ensure effective communication with stakeholders throughout the project lifecycle. Conduct regular project status meetings and prepare progress reports. Facilitate training sessions and workshops for end-users. Continuously assess project performance and identify areas for improvement. Qualifications:   Bachelor’s degree in Business, Information Technology, or a related field would be preferred. Proven experience as an ERP Project Manager, preferably in Manufacturing. Strong understanding of ERP systems and their implementation processes. Excellent leadership, communication, and interpersonal skills. Strong problem-solving skills and attention to detail. Ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously and meet deadlines. PMP, PRINCE2, or other relevant project management certification is a plus. What We Offer:   Competitive salary and benefits package. Opportunity to work with a supportive and innovative team. Career development and growth opportunities. Flexible work arrangements. Working from home policy. How to Apply: If you’re ready to take your career to the next level and contribute to exciting ERP projects, we want to hear from you! Please submit your CV and a cover letter detailing your relevant experience to wes@psgaus.com.au

column3: Are you passionate about understanding stories, simplifying experiences, and skilled in the PeopleSoft ecosystem? Join our team in ITS
column13: Title: Senior PeopleSoft Administrator Division: Information Technology Services Classification: ANU Officer 8 (Information Technology) Position Description & Selection Criteria: Position Description - ANU8 - Senior PeopleSoft Administrator.pdf Salary package: $112,693-$120,506 plus 17% superannuation (Market Loadings are considered) Term: Full time, Fixed Term (up to 3 years) Location: Acton, Canberra (opportunity for flexible working arrangements) Closing Date: 4 September 2024  About the Role Are you passionate about simplifying processes and enhancing efficiency? Do you have extensive knowledge and expertise in the PeopleSoft ecosystem, including Change Assistant, DPK, and more? Are you driven by building connections with others?  Join our esteemed PeopleSoft team as a Senior PeopleSoft Administrator, where your contributions play a crucial role in supporting vital administrative applications. Embrace the dynamic nature of this position, utilising your technical skills to manage a wide range of responsibilities throughout the application lifecycle, from application support and enhancements to overseeing PeopleSoft Update Manager cycles.  If you're excited about making a significant impact, expanding your technical knowledge, and embracing new tools and features, we encourage you to apply for this opportunity to become part of our dynamic PeopleSoft team dedicated to delivering excellence at the University.  Key Duties:  Support and maintenance of PeopleSoft Architecture environments residing on Microsoft Windows and Database on MSS SQL servers. Deployments of updates to PeopleSoft Finance & Supply Chain Management (FSCM), Human Capital Management & Global Payroll (HCM), and Campus Solutions (CS) applications. Applying Critical Patch Updates (CPU) to the deployed toolset PeopleTools 8.59/8.60; and enabling new tools features.  Technical Experience Required:  PeopleSoft Update Manager (PUM) and Change Assistant PeopleTools patching and upgrades PeopleSoft Interaction Hub PeopleSoft Integration Broker & Integration Gateway Performance Tuning of PeopleSoft systems (Finance, HR and CS) Experience administration of Active Directory and managing Group Policy Trouble shooting network ACLs and local firewalls Experience managing environments using a BigIP F5 load balancer Demonstrate knowledge with nVision tuning and configuration Experience with PeopleSoft Performance Management (PPM), PeopleSoft Testing Framework (PTF) and a functional understanding of and experience in Finance, HR and CS would be beneficial. Experience with Windows server 2019 & MS SQL server 2019 would be beneficial.  Our commitment to excellence means we are consistently seeking avenues for improvement, including the evaluation of new functionality and the implementation of automation within the PeopleSoft applications. You will have the invaluable support of our University's highly skilled technicians and support staff. Additionally, you will enjoy access to relevant conferences and training opportunities to further enhance your capabilities.  About You We welcome applications from individuals who possess the following attributes:  Expertise in secure, large-scale multi-user business solutions via premise platforms, cloud services, or hybrid models. Technical proficiency and extensive experience in system and application administration of n-tier database-driven web applications, encompassing the entire application lifecycle. Implementation of orchestration principles for automating complex computer systems and services, directing automated processes for larger workflows. Proven commitment to client service and demonstrated high-level written and oral communication and interpersonal skills. Demonstrated agility, flexibility, initiative and adaptability to contribute to organizational change and process improvement. Active participation and leadership in teams  For more information about this position, please contact the PeopleSoft Development Technical Lead, Paul Yeoh on E: paul.yeoh@anu.edu.au.  About Us ANU is home to some of the most remarkable people from across the world: visionaries, influential leaders, researchers and advocates creating impact and change nationally, regionally and globally. ANU attracts exceptional staff and students and, through education and enrichment programs, helps them to achieve ambitious goals, and pursue brilliant careers. Ranked in the top 30 universities globally, the first Australian university to be recognised in this elite tier, ANU continues to be an academic resource for the whole of Australia.  About ITS Information Technology Services (ITS) delivers digital solutions that enable the Australian National University to achieve its strategic goals: a student experience equal to the world’s best, and research that transforms society and creates national capability.  ITS is responsible for the University’s digital ecosystem and is leading the delivery of the Digital Master Plan, a 10-year strategic roadmap for the transformation of the University’s digital capability.  Digital Transformation Informed by extensive consultation with ANU students and staff, the ANU Digital Master Plan (DMP) is a 10-year vision to transform the way our University does business - how we work and think. Our digital future will transform the experience of ANU for our students, researchers, academics, professional staff and the wider community, and we are seeking great people to be a part of this history-making journey. Click here to learn more.    Our Campus The University's Acton campus is in the heart of Canberra. From here it's an easy walk, bike ride or drive to some of Australia's most significant political and cultural institutions including Australian Parliament House. You'll find all the conveniences of a small suburb including cafes, bars, supermarkets, childcare centres, a newsagency, post office and even a medical centre right on campus! The Acton Campus is well renowned for its landscape setting, with over 10,000 trees and a commitment to maintenance of open space. It's 'park like' environment is a feature that is internationally recognised.     What we can offer you Our staff enjoy some amazing employee benefits:   ANU offers competitive remuneration packages including 17% superannuation and regular increases. We support flexible and hybrid working, with access to our beautiful, green campus. We offer discounted study, with 75% off ANU courses for staff and 25% for your spouse and children (see eligibility). We have many professional development initiatives including training, mentoring & upskilling opportunities. We have on-site Gyms with staff discounts as well as oval spaces and ANU sports clubs. We are a family friendly campus with access to childcare facilities, designated parent rooms and quiet spaces. ANU offers salary sacrificing including laptops, childcare, novated car leasing, additional superannuation, and more! We offer affordable onsite parking from $34 / fortnight with salary sacrificing options. We care about your wellbeing, with access to the Employee Assistance Program, vaccinations and health insurance plan options. We are one of the leading employers in Australia for parental leave entitlements.      ANU is committed to workforce diversity, creating an inclusive workplace, and providing equal employment opportunities to people with diverse backgrounds and identities. As part of this commitment, we welcome applications from all diversity groups. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, people with disability and people who identify as LGBTQIA+ are particularly encouraged to apply. Click here to learn more.  Our Vision: Support the development of national unity and identity, improve our understanding of ourselves and our neighbours, provide our nation with research capacity amongst the best in the world, and education in areas vital for our future is our mission.  Our Values: Excellence, Original Thinking, Integrity, Respect, Inclusivity, Diversity  How to Apply To apply for this position, please ensure that your submission includes the following:  A statement addressing the selection criteria showing how your skills, experience and approach align with the role in no more than 2 pages.  A current curriculum vitae (CV). The names and contact details of 2 referees.  Applications which do not provide the above or do not address the selection criteria may not be considered for the position.  Reasonable adjustments to support applicants through this recruitment process can be made available upon request. Requests for adjustments will be treated with the strictest of confidentiality.  Please note: The successful candidate will be required to undergo a background check during the recruitment process, in accordance with the Background Checking Procedure. An offer of employment is conditional on satisfactory results.

column3: Work on cutting-edge projects, provide valuable insights, and ensure the success of our customers' cybersecurity and operational monitoring needs.
column13: We are Fujitsu  We use technology to make happier lives. We are a global leader in technology and business solutions that transform organizations and the world around us. We have a long heritage of bringing innovation and expertise, continuously working to contribute to the growth of society and our customers.  About the role  Fujitsu is seeking an experienced Splunk Architect for this upcoming project for a Government client based in Canberra and Brisbane. As a Splunk Architect with 5 or more years of hands-on experience, you will play a pivotal role in designing, implementing, and optimizing our clients' Splunk environments. You will work on cutting-edge projects, providing valuable insights, and ensuring the success of our customers' cybersecurity and operational monitoring needs.   The Specialist will work in a team with other senior technical Subject Matter Experts (SMEs). They will be responsible for informing technical specifications, ensuring compatibility, and incorporating their relevant elements of the High Level Design (HLD) against the endorsed Architecture & Strategy, creating the follow-on specific Detailed Designs (DD), and prototyping and implementing the Splunk capability under the direction of the SION lead architect.  It is a contractual role of 12 months with a possibility of extension for another year and it requires a minimum of Baseline Clearance.  Qualifications:  A minimum of 5 years of experience in designing, implementing, and managing Splunk environments. Splunk certifications, such as Splunk Certified Architect or Splunk Certified Admin, are highly desirable. Lead the implementation of Splunk Enterprise, Enterprise Security, and IT Service Intelligence (ITSI) to meet specific requirements, ensuring efficient data collection, parsing, and indexing. Set up effective monitoring and alerting systems within Splunk to proactively address issues and incidents. Implement and manage security controls within the Splunk environment, ensuring adherence to compliance and best practices. Integrate Splunk with other IT tools, systems, and data sources to provide a holistic view of data and enhance correlation and analysis capabilities. Develop custom Splunk apps, dashboards, and searches to meet unique business requirements and maximize the value of Splunk. Familiarity with ITIL, DevOps, and agile methodologies is advantageous. Experience with cloud environments (AWS, Azure, or GCP) and containerization technologies (Docker, Kubernetes) is a plus. Proficiency in scripting and programming languages (e.g., Python, PowerShell) for custom Splunk app development. Collaborate with other IT professionals, including network and security experts, to ensure Splunk aligns with broader technology initiatives. Strong communication and teamwork skills, as well as the ability to work directly with clients. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. The candidate must have a car, as this position requires travel between location and the transportation of equipment. A valid drivers license and proof of vehicle insurance will be required. Must demonstrate a can-do attitude. Baseline Clearance minimum, NV1 or NV2 is desirable  Why Fujitsu?  We are an organization with a strong set of values and a history of respecting fairness and equality, whilst promoting diversity, equity and inclusion. We constantly push ourselves to do better and strive to bring together a diverse mix of perspectives and talents in an inclusive environment, where we encourage our people to bring their full selves to work. We call this Be Completely You.  We put people first. We believe in the power of diversity to drive innovation and our Work180 accreditation, AWEI (Australian Workplace Equality Index) Gold Employer status and Rainbow Tick certification for LGBTI+ inclusion show that we value an inclusive culture. We offer tailored career paths across our global organization to support your professional and personal growth. Our customers trust us. We have an excellent reputation across the region and globally. Best in class reward and recognition programs flexible work, volunteering leave and more. We live our values of aspiration, trust and empathy, all day, every day.  As an inclusive employer, Fujitsu aims to recruit a diverse range of talents to help us achieve our purpose. In line with our diversity, equity and inclusion strategy, we welcome applications from women and gender diverse people; Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people; Māori and Pacific people; LGBTI+ people; people with a disability; culturally and linguistically diverse people; and veterans and emergency responders. Applicants who identify as transgender or gender diverse can view a copy of our Frequently Asked Questions to assist with the recruitment journey. For all other general inquiries, please contact careersapac@fujitsu.com  If you don't tick every box in this job description, please don't rule yourself out. Research suggests that women and other people in underrepresented groups tend to only apply if they meet every requirement. We focus on hiring people who value inclusion, collaboration, adaptability, courage, and integrity, rather than ticking boxes so if this resonates with you, then please apply. For more information, please email careersapac@fujitsu.com.   Thanks in advance.

column3: The Digital Services team works collaboratively across several product teams developing services and experiences for both ASC and sport.
column13: Applications close at 11:30pm AEST on Monday 19 August 2024 (late applications will not be accepted).  The Australian Sports Commission is embarking on the Green and Gold decade. An exciting time filled with international sporting competitions on home soil, including the Men’s and Women’s Rugby World Cup, and culminating in the Brisbane 2032 Olympic and Paralympic Games. We have an ambitious new Strategic Vision and we need the best players on our team to help us deliver real results for the sporting sector and all Australians.  Are you up for the challenge?  About the team – If you are the successful candidate, you will work in a small delivery team using agile ways of working and a double diamond approach. The Digital Services team works collaboratively across several product teams developing services and experiences for both ASC and sport. We are a collaborative team with a growth mindset and seek to improve government and sport sector information and services. With this dynamic and fun team, you can safely say you will have meaningful and interesting work that impacts everyday Australians.  About the role – The ASC’s Business Analysts are responsible for leading engagement with stakeholders to capture business requirements and develop pragmatic designs for digital-enabled solutions, including the review, analysis and evaluation of system and user needs for teams across the ASC. In consultation with team managers, Business Analysts will implement the organisational strategic agenda to achieve business outcome, including:  Communicate and collaborate with a broad range of stakeholders to capture and translate business requirements. Propose innovative and more efficient business process approaches using structured methods. Coordinate with project teams and project stakeholders Model options and present summarised analysis to senior manager sponsors - make recommendations, champion innovative solutions to achieve ASC outcomes. Support Scrum Masters to develop work breakdown structures, schedules and cost estimates. Coordinate with Developers and Testers to develop solution acceptance plans, test plans and data migration approaches as part of holistic project services. Support technology and digital investment planning process using agile methodology.  About you – We are seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individuals with a proven track record of driving collaboration across business groups, eliciting and capturing business requirements and develop pragmatic designs for digital-enabled solutions. The successful candidate will have:  Tertiary qualifications and/or business experience agile methodologies, including Human Centred Design. Experience working in structured methods & techniques. Experience working with DevOps, Dynamics 365 and/or SCRUM or Agile methodologies is desirable. Highly developed interpersonal and communication skills. Demonstrated analytical skills, strong attention to detail and the ability to develop innovative solutions, translating these into fit-for-purpose designs and approaches. Strong awareness of digital strategy, platforms and governance. Demonstrated ability to communicate dynamically and persuasively in both written and face-to-face communication.  There is an ONGOING and a FIXED TERM position available. The Fixed Term position is available for 12 months with the possibility of being extended or made ongoing.   Why work with us? We have offices located in Canberra, Melbourne and Sydney.  Across all locations, we offer:  Options for flexible working arrangements. Annual allowances towards training based on individualised career goals. Access to a customised ASC L&D calendar for ongoing professional and career development. Generous superannuation scheme with up to 15.4% employer contributions. Corporate discount on AIS Shop merchandise. Access to Clearinghouse for Sport, an information sharing platform for Sporting professionals.  Additionally, our Canberra campus offers:  Free onsite parking Onsite facilities including café, dining hall, gym, and swimming pool. Priority placement for your children to access the award winning, onsite AIS Caretaker’s Cottage Childcare Centre.  If you have any questions about this opportunity, please contact:  Contact Officer: Sarah Groube, Director Digital Sector Phone number: sarah.groube@ausport.gov.au Email address: 0411 725 110   If you would like to learn more about this opportunity or to obtain the job description, click 'Apply' now

column3: Security Assurance Analyst
column10: Our people build skills for the future
column13: Enjoy a career that makes a difference by helping to shape the education experience for Victoria.  Be part of a vibrant Department culture with a strong sense of community and inclusion. Join the Education State. At the Department, we are committed to giving every Victorian the best learning and development experience, making our state a smarter, fairer, more prosperous place.  The Information Management and Technology Division (IMTD) guides the Departments' digital capability and is leading digital transformation for the Department including Victorian government schools. The Division architects, manages and supports the largest technology network in Victoria, supporting a user base of approximately 750,000 staff and students.  IMTD provides innovation and leadership in the transformation and management of the Department's digital capability through the implementation of solutions on the department's cloud environment (IaaS), enterprise cloud platforms (PaaS) and software (SaaS).  About the opportunity  This is an ongoing opportunity to join the Information Security Branch within IMTD reporting to the Security Assurance Manager.  The Security Assurance Analyst is responsible for verifying security and regulatory activities and plays an integral role providing assurance services across the department. It is a hands-on role required to design and undertake control audits, both manual and automated, to demonstrate compliance and identify where exceptions occur. The role will identify and report control weaknesses that result in vulnerabilities. Your findings will help strengthen existing security controls, drive changes in policy, and ultimately improve overall posture for the department and its Victorian government schools.  About you  As our ideal candidate, you will have:  Extensive experience working within an audit capacity using frameworks such as CPS234, ASAE 3402/3150 or other security-related frameworks to measure control effectiveness     Relevant tertiary qualification in Audit, Risk Management, or related field. Proven ability to develop a variety of assurance tests across different controls to support an overall security assurance function affecting ICT technical services, personnel, and facilities management. Experience developing automated assurance tests using scripts, code or tools to support continuous  assurance. Practical experience writing executive reports that detail the methodology and findings of security audits along with suggested recommendations.    Why join us?  An emphasis on work / life balance High-performing team environment Equal opportunity employer Personal & Professional development opportunities Committed to safety & wellbeing Training & development opportunities  For more details regarding this position please see attached position descriptions.  Further Information  For more details regarding this position please see attached position description for the capabilities to address in application.  The department values diversity and inclusion in all forms - gender, religion, ethnicity, LGBTIQ+, disability and neurodiversity. Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander candidates are strongly encouraged to apply. For more information about our work, working for the Department, diversity and inclusion, and our employment conditions visit the Department website and our Diversity and Inclusion page  Applicants requiring adjustments can contact the nominated contact person.  Information about the Department of Education's operations and employment conditions can be located at www.education.vic.gov.au.  For further information pertaining to the role, please contact Robert Munoz - Senior Technical Specialist on  03 7008 8241 or robert.munoz@education.vic.gov.au.  Preferred applicants may be required to complete a police check and may be subject to other pre-employment checks. Information provided to the Department of Education will be treated in the strictest confidence.  Please let us know via phone or email if you require any adjustments to ensure your full participation in the recruitment process or if you need the ad or any attachments in an accessible format (e.g large print) due to any viewing difficulties or other accessibility requirements.  Applications close 11.59pm on 20 August 2024

column3: Rubix Solutions is seeking for an NV2 Platform Application Developer based in Canberra
column13: Location: Canberra Security Clearance: NV2 / TSPV Required    Rubix Solutions is a leading provider of innovative IT solutions, specializing in custom software development and system integration. We are committed to delivering excellence and driving digital transformation for our clients. We are currently seeking a talented Platform Application Developer to join our team in Canberra.  Role Overview: As a Platform Application Developer at Rubix Solutions, you will be responsible for developing, maintaining, and configuring software applications. You will work with a variety of programming languages and technologies, contributing to the success of our projects and the growth of our capabilities.  Required Skills:  Ability to develop code in one or more programming languages (e.g., C#, Java, FastAPI, React, Python). Strong problem-solving skills. Knowledge and experience with software development practices and an aptitude for software configuration and maintenance. Demonstrated ability to develop technical documentation and track work in collaboration tools such as Confluence and JIRA. Proficiency with Source Control tools (GitLab, BitBucket). Willingness to apply existing software developer skills within Palantir Foundry, and develop expertise in the platform. Desirable Skills and Experience:  Containerisation and container orchestration. Configuration-as-code workflows and deployment mechanisms. Integrating and building APIs. Networking, virtualisation, OS, and server management. Information, network, and application security. Experience in data storage platforms and distributed data processing frameworks such as Hadoop or Spark. Familiarity with Palantir’s Foundry platform is desirable but not essential; training will be provided on the job. Familiarity with similar systems (Databricks, Snowflake, Informatica, TIBCO, Denodo, etc.) would also be helpful. Experience with cloud computing services like AWS, Azure, or Google Cloud. How to Apply: Interested candidates who meet the above requirements are encouraged to apply. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.  If this sounds like a match, we'd love to talk to you! Feel free to apply directly or reach out to Stephanie - Stephanie@rubixsolutions.net.au

column13: The Company Appoint Recruit have partner with this growing start up that are making a meaningful impact within a niche market. They are looking to expand their team as demand for their product continues to rise.   The Appointment As a member of this small, dedicated team, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute to a product that is highly valued by it's customers and play a key role in the company’s continued success. Your primary focus will be on front end development while working closely with the product design team to ensure design consistency across the app.   The Appointee The ideal candidate for this role will have commercial experience using Flutter, excellent communication skills, and a passion for tackling challenging tasks every day. You should also have experience with::  Proven experience working with Flutter.  Strong understanding of UI/UX design principles and experience collaborating with design teams. Strong understanding of performance optimisation techniques to ensure the app remains efficient and responsive. Familiarity with CI/CD pipelines and version control. column3: Lead and implement data and technology security measures to protect information assets, support business continuity, and ensure regulatory compliance.
column13: Are you a skilled Data Security Manager looking for a rewarding permanent opportunity to protect vital information assets? Our client is actively seeking a Data Security Manager to drive and implement robust security initiatives, benefiting prestigious clientele and safeguarding internal data. This role can be based in either Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane, or Canberra.   About the company  Our client is a world-leading provider of data-driven solutions. As a medium-sized business, they operate globally. Their innovative analytics products deliver powerful strategic and organisational insights for their clients. Part of a renowned international management consultancy, they are frequently recognised as a top workplace.   About the role   Day to day, your role will be hands-on and will include:  Partnering with the IT team to enhance and maintain the security of cloud-based products; Supporting the Business Continuity Plan during security incidents by offering technical guidance; Advising on data security considerations for product management and software development teams during the creation of new products; Establishing systems to monitor and audit data, ensuring the detection of unauthorised access; Addressing client security inquiries and assisting internal staff with data security concerns; Investigating security breaches to determine root causes and providing detailed reports to executives; and Collaborating with the information security and risk team to contribute to data security policy development.   About you   As the successful candidate, you will have:  A proactive approach to self-education in new areas of technology and security best practices; Exceptional problem-solving skills, with a proven ability to diagnose and identify root causes of complex issues; A strong academic background, with a Bachelor's degree in Computer Science or a related discipline; Knowledge of data security and privacy regulations in Australia, with the ability to learn or existing knowledge of requirements in other countries where the client operates. Knowledge of European/UK GDPR data protection regulations is highly regarded; Highly organised with excellent attention to detail and the ability to manage priorities; Demonstrated ability to work autonomously and take initiative within a team environment; A solid understanding of data security principles and web application security architectures and technologies; and Experience with Microsoft Azure and/or Amazon Web Services security products is highly regarded.   Additional details  The salary for this role is negotiable based on the candidate's experience.  If you are an experienced Data Security Manager, please contact Killian O’Sullivan at u&u on killian.osullivan@uandu.com quoting the reference number #37720, or to apply directly, please follow the link below.   At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability. Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. In response to these requests, we will collaborate closely with you to implement the appropriate adjustments. Additionally, for a barrier-free and inclusive online experience, you can access u&u’s opportunities using accessibility software Recite Me at https://www.uandu.com/jobs  Please submit your resume in Word format only.

column3: Join idoba & be part of a team combining digital technology, mining & processing expertise & software engineering skills to deeply understand problems
column13: idoba is a technology informed services business, born out of the desire to rethink, transform and disrupt mining. We bring people together who have a shared passion to co-create a better future for mining and the processing industry.  We are committed to helping the mining and processing industry work smarter and cleaner.  We combine digital technology, mining & processing expertise and software engineering skills to deeply understand problems and co-create innovative solutions.  Our team members are clever, curious and quirky people who work flexibly between our vibrant open-plan Perth CBD office, client sites and from home.  Solving pivotal challenges and adding transformational value through Productivity, Sustainable operations and Future of work, our team add immense value to our customers regardless of where they are in the mining life cycle.  Due to continued growth, and exciting new engagements with customers, we are looking to add an experienced Business Analyst to our team.  About you and what you can bring,  You will be the type of person who can join any environment and establish yourself as a subject matter expert as well as a trusted adviser. You will be the type of person who thrives when it comes to challenges and seeks solutions through a curious and co-creative mindset.  The preferred candidate will have the following skills and experience;  Demonstrated skills and experience in as an IT Business Analyst (BA) Demonstrated experience and understanding of business process modelling and mapping Demonstrated experience as a BA in system integration projects 5+ years Demonstrated experience in system integration across disparate systems Demonstrated experience in business change of operational processes as a result of system implementation Demonstrated experience in system testing and facilitating User Acceptance Testing Demonstrated experience across Waterfall and Agile methodology for delivery solutions would be desirable Demonstrated experience with Modelling software would be desirable Demonstrated experience of Data Science methods would be desirable Exposure to the mining and resources sector and downstream processing would be preferred Excellent verbal and written communication skills to express ideas logically across all audience levels  About the opportunity,  Working within our team, you will collaborate with a range of internal and external clients on the issues that matter to them. Contributing to complex solving of challenging real-world problems, there is a wide range of work for our team to be focusing on.   Every day is different here at idoba, some of your responsibilities may include,  Eliciting solution requirements from key stakeholders Participating in exploratory data analysis and determining project viability Designing and delivering reports and dashboards, storyboards and presentations to communicate analytical results Providing advice and solutions and contributing your skills and experience working on a variety of projects to meet customer needs Being the customer advocate to meet the solution needs Supporting our software development team  The perks  Be part of a collaborative ecosystem; with a parent company in the Perenti Group that is committed to our success, and a global equity partner in Sumitomo Corporation a network-based structure that empowers our team Vibrant diverse, and inclusive workplace culture in our central CBD office Lifestyle benefits   At idoba, we recognise that a diverse and talented workforce is key as we rethink, transform and disrupt the mining and processing industry and beyond.  We are committed to developing a workplace culture where people with diverse backgrounds, experiences and perspectives are valued for their unique contributions.  For any questions or a confidential discussion regarding these opportunities please contact me directly on merryn.hailes@idoba.com

column3: Design and develop solutions that directly enhance both customer-facing and internal web-based systems.
column13: The City of Casey is one of Victoria’s largest, fastest growing and most diverse cities. The Council plans and delivers quality services and infrastructure for the more than 400,000 residents who call Casey home.  Our workspace is located within Bunjil Place, a must-visit destination nestled within Narre Warren in Melbourne’s south east. Bunjil Place reflects and enhances the city’s rich diversity by providing an energetic and cosmopolitan atmosphere through a lively community meeting place.  Our Benefits:  Benefits | City of Casey   Development-focused organisation with access to diverse professional development courses, networks and programs, including financial support for obtaining relevant certifications. Flexible work options, including remote work, flexible hours, and the ability to purchase additional leave. Multi-award-winning architectural office building with equipped Kitchens, free coffee, onsite Café, Library, and so much more. 2 minutes’ walk to Westfield shopping centre, free onsite carpark, gym/pool with discounted memberships and free workout Wednesday.  We live our values of dreaming big, empowering each other, and making our community proud.  A bit about the role  The Senior Full Stack Developer will design, develop, implement, and maintain quality technical solutions for both customer-facing and internal web-based systems.  You will provide expert advice on integrating digital solutions within the business, particularly involving Technology Infrastructure, to achieve strategic work plans.  Additionally, you will offer expert guidance and high-level technical support to the development team in Agile working, back-end web development, testing methodologies, and development environment configuration.  What you’ll deliver  Take a hands-on approach, collaborating with a team of developers, testers, and visual designers to own and develop new and existing online website experiences. Write functional code using PHP on the front and back-end content management platform Drupal. Build and iterate digital solutions that meet the needs of Council staff and our customers. Deliver efficient solutions tested across the required browsers (Chrome, Safari, IE) and devices (Mobile, Tablet, Desktop), while meeting all applicable WCAG 2.0 AA accessibility requirements. Ensure high level and clear communication to ensure seamless service delivery, reliability and optimal effectiveness of programs and systems.  What you’ll bring  Significant hands-on experience developing across multiple web content management systems (SharePoint, Drupal and WordPress preferred). Broad experience across several web-based technologies – PHP, ASP.Net, Javascript/ES6, React. Solid working experience in developing and integrating APIs, both RESTful and others. Experience working with an Agile methodology. Experience developing forms and workflow across multiple platforms (SharePoint, Drupal and WordPress preferred). Experience in implementing Cloud based solutions (Azure preferred), in all three models: IaaS, PaaS and SaaS. Proven experience in mentoring junior developers. Willingness to undergo pre-employment background checks including National Criminal History Check, Working with Children Check and Eligibility to Work check. A curious, collaborative, and inclusive community mindset.  What’s next?  If you think this role might be for you, we would love to hear from you.  Please apply by following the links and attaching a cover letter and resume. We do not require any selection criteria to be addressed.  Position Description:  Senior Full Stack Developer  To find out more about the role, please contact Harj Sarai, Delivery Lead, on 9705 5622 and hsarai@casey.vic.gov.au.  Applications will be accepted until 11.55pm on Tuesday 20th August 2024.  We encourage people with a disability, lived experience of disability, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islanders and people from culturally diverse backgrounds to apply for this position.  The City of Casey has zero tolerance for child abuse and is committed to creating and maintaining a child safe organisation where protecting children and preventing and responding to child abuse is embedded in the everyday thinking and practice of all employees, contractors and volunteers.  The City of Casey reserves the right not to make any appointments for this position.  For more information about the City of Casey council and to stay across what's happening in our region, follow us on LinkedIn.
