column3: The Developer will help build, deliver, and support a number of our key application and software functions for our client market.
column13: Brisbane location with flexible working Be a part of a world class team   How will I help?  HealthPoint Claims is a high-performing platform that processes real-time eligibility, claims and settlement connecting Health & Care Payers, Providers and Customers.   Our team is responsible for the design, build, testing and support of software that we deliver to our healthcare clients in Australia. To support our growth we are expanding our development team.  The role of Developer will help build, deliver, and support a number of our key application and software functions for our client market. The role will be part of an existing but growing team meaning there is also an opportunity for this role to take part in defining how the team operates and interacts with the wider business and our clients.  In this role you will:  Develop and maintain a variety of software products while working in close collaboration with our product manager, business analysts and support team. Provide technical input, expertise, and guidance to the wider stakeholder group. Ensure adherence to software engineering quality practices. Maintain development practices across all development activities as per the agreed SDLC. Be involved with a range of development services, including requirements analysis, design, and development of relevant database/software products. Help build our development capability, working closely with our product team, business analysts and architects to help set the direction and standards used across the team.  What’s in it for me?  You will play an important and significant part in the future of a business that has been around for 200 years. Our vision is to create better futures together. So, we will back you in the development of your career, with internal career prospects and flexible working. You will also be backed by a fantastic team of people in a can-do, supportive structure.   What do I need?  As an experienced Developer, with a track record of delivering high-quality, fit-for-purpose work to scope and on-time, this is a role that you will find to be a rewarding challenge.  The role will require a confident person who is comfortable contributing to a variety of forums and meetings with senior business leaders to assist in the development of the HealthPoint Claims platform.   To be considered for this role, you should be able to demonstrate the following:  Five or more years of software analysis, design, and programming experience. Experience working within a development environment that adheres to proven agile development methodologies, standards, and technologies. Hands-on and current database development experience including complex scripts, stored procedures, triggers, and views to support front end applications. In-depth knowledge of a broad range of software development activities including integration, packaging, and deployment. Advanced troubleshooting and problem-solving skills. Ability to work autonomously but also support and actively contribute to team collaboration. Demonstrated experience with Java Development, modern JavaScript framework, GIT technologies and Dev Ops Experience using Agile Methodologies Experience with cloud technologies, ideally AWS but Azure also suitable, SQL database experience, preferably Oracle, but SQL Server also suitable and experience with Microsoft Visual Studio and .NET framework are all desirable.  Experience with test automation, Intersystems Caché, Linux development and Infrastructure as code are also desirable.   Essential technology experience:   Experience with InterSystems Caché. Experience with Java development. Experience with a modern Javascript framework. Experience with GIT technologies. Agile methodologies. Dev Ops.  Essential business experience:   Experience with electronic ancillary claiming. Experience with claim settlement systems Experience with settlement and reconciliation web service capability Experience with Australian Medical Provider Registration requirements  Desirable technology experience:  Cloud technologies, ideally AWS but Azure also suitable. SQL database experience, preferably Oracle, but SQL Server also suitable Experience with Microsoft Visual Studio and .NET framework. Test automation. Linux development, comfortable using the command line, ideally Bash Infrastructure as code.  How do I Apply?  Start here. Select the APPLY or APPLY NOW button.  At Westpac we are committed to providing a supportive culture and creating diverse, inclusive, and accessible workplaces, branches, products and services for our customers, employees, and community. This role is open to experienced candidates seeking a discussion around workplace flexibility. We invite candidates of all ages, genders, sexual orientation, cultural backgrounds, people with disability, neurodiverse individuals, and Indigenous Australians to apply. If you have questions about the recruitment process, please email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au.  Do you need reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process?  We can provide reasonable adjustments for individuals with disability and/or neurodiversity. If you require an adjustment to be made during the recruitment process at any stage, please call 1800 655 592 Option 2.3 or email talentacquisition@westpac.com.au">talentacquisition@westpac.com.au

column3: Join a close knit team, based in the South East suburbs that dominates the Automotive industry.
column13: We are working with an amazingly well-established company who have been around for over 50 years, they create & innovate a platform as a service product that provides a range of software solutions for the automotive retail, financial services, and healthcare industries. The team is looking for a DevOps Engineer whose role will consist of reviewing the current tech landscape and looking at future roadmaps.   Skills  Familiarity with version control and infrastructure as code (e.g., Terraform, Ansible) Azure Expertise: Experience with Azure Resource Manager templates for IaC and hands-on experience with Azure cloud services, including Virtual Machines, Application Gateways, Web Apps, Function Apps, Azure Kubernetes Service, Azure Container Apps, and various storage services. CI/CD Tools: Previous experience with CI/CD pipelines, specifically Azure Pipelines Qualifications  Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Engineering, or related field, or equivalent work experience. 3+ years of experience in DevOps or related roles. Experience with developing and maintaining CI/CD pipelines with a focus on infrastructure as code Experience with scripting, particularly PowerShell or Bash Experience with both relational and NoSQL databases. Strong programming skills with expertise in Object-Oriented Programming (OOP); proficiency in C#/.NET is highly preferred Strong understanding of networking fundamentals, including HTTP, REST APIs, TCP/IP, and TLS Experience with platform engineering concepts and practices, a strong understanding of platform scalability and reliability, proficiency in setting up and managing monitoring, logging, and alerting systems.  If you would like to apply for this role please apply below or send your resume to: eva.l@circuitrec.com.au  #SCR-eva-lewis

column3: If you have a strong interest in improving the cyber maturity of an organisation, please apply.
column13: *Hybrid/Remote Working  Twice per week in office for candidates based inside Greater Sydney.  Fully remote role available for candidates outside of this area (NSW, VIC & QLD candidates considered).   The Company  You will be joining an agile, insurance firm backed by one of Australia’s leading financial services institutions.   The business invests in cutting edge technology, products & platforms making this a highly interesting environment for those working in Cyber. Adopting the latest tools, you will play a leading role in managing Cyber across a cloud heavy environment.     The Role  As the Senior Cloud Security Engineer, you will play a leading role in managing & preventing cyber threats. Working in a fully cloud-hosted environment (Azure), you will develop technical controls, manage cyber tools and improve a number of core technical areas.   Reporting to the Head of IT Operations & Cyber, you will make a significant impact on maturing the cyber posture of the organisation in a broad role.   A core part of this role is working in azure – the ideal candidate will bring good experience of working across this platform, with responsibility for managing, configuring & monitoring activities.      Skills & Experience  What we’re looking for from the ideal candidate:  Dedicated experience as a Cyber Engineer responsible for a breadth of technical tasks; Background in infrastructure is essential – with strong knowledge of networking, cloud & infrastructure principles; Experience in cloud hosted/azure environments – as a fully cloud environment the business has a need for someone to be familiar with azure; Experience with the implementation & management of tools is highly desirable (the management of & upkeep, not just use of tools); and Demonstrable experience in developing cyber capabilities – threat hunting, vulnerability management, incident response, security assessments, patching, etc. How to Apply   For more information or a confidential discussion please email liam.watson@uandu.com quoting reference number 37833 or alternatively, click to apply. We look forward to receiving your application and assisting you with your job search.   At u&u Recruitment Partners, we value diversity, equity and inclusion. We welcome applications from Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, people with diverse cultural and linguistic backgrounds and people with disability.  Should you require reasonable adjustments throughout the recruitment process, we encourage you to make a request via adjustments@uandu.com or phone the above-mentioned u&u consultant to discuss. In response to these requests, we will collaborate closely with you to implement the appropriate adjustments.  Additionally, for a barrier-free and inclusive online experience, you can access u&u’s opportunities using accessibility software Recite Me at https://www.uandu.com/jobs.  Please submit your resume in Word format only.

column3: AWS Cloud Architect
column13: HCL Technologies is a global transformational enterprise with significant presence in Australia and New Zealand. Our offices in Sydney, Melbourne, Brisbane, Auckland and Wellington offers an integrated portfolio of services including software-led IT solutions, remote infrastructure management, engineering and R&D services and BPO by leveraging its extensive global offshore infrastructure that impact and redefine the core of our clients' business. For more information, please visit us at www.hcltech.com    Are you ready to be an important part of this ever-transformational journey?     Job DescriptionBachelor's degree or equivalent (overall 15+ years) work experience. Understand customer's IT estate, LOB applications, IT and business priorities and success measures to design implementation architectures and cloud native solutions.  Collaborate with network, security, and application architects and SMEs to develop enterprise grade solutions.    7+ years of hands on AWS experience, with good knowledge of AWS Services Hands-on AWS experience with at least 2 implementations for Cloud native systems  and AWS migration at an enterprise level  Strong Cloud Automation and Scripting experience and the ability to develop AWS EAC (Environment as code),  Automation / IAC (infrastructure As Code) Solutions using AWS SDK  , CloudFormation, Terraform, Ansible, Puppet, Jenkins.... CloudFormation and third-party automation approach/strategy, Environment and application automation Experience with core AWS platform architecture, including areas such as: Organizations, Account Design, VPC, Subnet, segmentation strategies,CloudEndure, MGN, DataSync,Backup and DR approach/design,Network connectivity, Direct Connect, TGW and VPN Set up of MultiAccount Architecture using Landing Zone, Control Tower. AWS Cost Management and Optimization mechanisms Experienced in Security mechanism using AWS Security Hub, GuardDuty, AWS Config, AWS Network Firewall, AWS Inspector  AWS certification must include AWS Certified Solution Architect (Associate or Professional)  Have an engineering, solution, Use Case, PoC, Asset development mindset Demonstrated ability in interacting with clients mid level / senior management Design and Implement AWS architectures and environments Design Native Cloud Application Architectures or optimize applications for AWS Design Migration Approaches from On Prem to AWS using AWS native tools including CloudEndure, MGN, DataSync Contribute towards blogs, whitepapers, presentations on AWS technical and strategic topic Act as a subject-matter expert on AWS and assist Sales/Pre-Sales in RFP activities.  Why Us   We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees   Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe  We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility  We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees   We are a certified great place to work and a top employer in 17 countries, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect   Equality & Opportunity for All   Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.    Note: Please follow the link to apply to the role with your recent resume. If you need more details, feel free to contact  garima.kohli@hcltech.com

column3: - Permanent Role - Hybrid Work Arrangements, office located in CBD - Attractive Package consisting of Base + Super + Bonus
column13: Hudson is partnering with an established fintech company in Australia to look for a solid staff engineer to work on a ground up application to drive digital transformation projects in the pipeline. With challenging projects and clear career growth structure, this is an excellent opportunity to contribute to critical projects and be part of a well-known name in the market.  Qualifications and Experience:  This is not a people manager role, you must be 100% hands on in development in your current role Minimum 10-15 years of software engineering experience in either .Net/Java/C++/Go Providing technical direction and guidance to teams of engineers. Defining the technical vision and strategy for projects or products. Proven ability to develop and implement engineering solutions Strong awareness of SOLID principles and experience with OOP concepts  Please reach out to me via isabelle.ho2@hudson.com with your contact number and resume (in Microsoft word format) should you be interested, do note at point of application we will be only be able to consider candidates with full working rights in Australia and currently based in Sydney, NSW or Melbourne, Victoria.

column3: Are you an experienced Change & Incident Manager who is ready to step into a new challenge and work in an award-winning tier 1 company?
column13: Come and join a thriving company and become part of a diverse global collective of free-thinkers, entrepreneurs and industry experts who are all driven to use technology to reimagine what’s possible. Capgemini. Get the future you want.      For more about why Capgemini https://www.capgemini.com/au-en/careers/why-join-capgemini/     Let’s talk about the role and responsibilities   You will provide onsite and remote ITSM process consultancy and practitioner capability as part of the service engagement.  The Incident component of this position will require some commitment on a rostered basis to work outside of normal office hours.  Developing strong, positive relationships with key stakeholders within Capgemini and our Customer’s business. Liaising with Customers and Resolver Teams to determine priorities, resourcing and timeframes. Experience of developing and applying ITSM processes and supporting them as a process practitioners. Continuously keeping abreast of implemented technologies, and customer profiles. Sound understanding of the ITIL framework with practical experience of operating ITIL aligned Change Management process. Ability to provide training and guidance to resolution teams. Ability to operate, lead and direct as a Change Manager, whilst maintaining progress communication with the customer.    Let's talk about the team   You will be working within a varied complex role with one of Capgemini’s valued customers working with an accomplished team in a collaborative atmosphere.   Let’s talk about your capability and experience   12-18 months experience in a similar role, with experience in the following areas core items – Change and Incident Management ancillary items – Problem Management, Service Continuity, Capacity/Availability, Risk & CSI, Service Transition Presentations skills: able to articulate technical and business value/outcomes to varying audiences. Understanding of issues associated with service delivery management, SLA management, Risk Management and outsourced service delivery and associated activities.  Strong written and verbal communication skills and confidence in a client facing role. Ability to build relationships and trust, conduct formal meetings and provide concise reporting. Extensive ITSM experience with demonstrated experience managing the development and successful implementation and operation of ITIL management processes within large and complex IT environments. Comprehensive understanding of service delivery technologies and the application of these technologies relevant to IT Service Management Ideally, a minimum of ITIL Foundation certificate    About Capgemini     At Capgemini, we are more than just a business, we are a diverse global collective of strategic and technological experts who are passionate about finding ways technology can help our clients, our people and our communities get the future they want.    Our people are the key to making this vision a reality, which is why we have been recognised by the Australian Workplace Equality Index as LGTBQ+ ‘Employer of the Year’ and ‘Inclusion of Trans and Gender Diverse Employees’ for the past two years. We believe in creating a safe, flexible, and inclusive culture where everyone can bring their authentic selves to work, contributing to our inclusive culture and truly belong, and our staff-led community groups are a testament to this commitment. We are committed to being active allies for everyone.   We believe by combining the power of the latest technology with our human energy, we can drive sustainable thinking into our operations and the work we do with clients. Its why we are committing to being carbon neutral for our own operations no later than 2025 and across our supply chain by 2030, and committed to becoming a net zero business by 2040.  Empower yourself with the knowledge and skills you need to succeed with our access to premier learning platforms, sought-after certifications and boundless development opportunities. You’ll be encouraged to gain at least 40 hours of training each year.      For over 50 years our values and ethics have been at heart of our identity. From our approach to ethics to the way we interact with one another, honesty, boldness, trust, freedom, team spirit, modesty, and fun guide and inspire all we do and have led to us being recognised as one of the World’s Most Ethical Companies by the Ethisphere Institute 10 years in a row.      Our Commitment to Diversity & Inclusion   Don’t meet every single requirement for this role? Studies have shown women and people from diverse minority backgrounds are less likely to apply to jobs unless they meet every single requirement. At Capgemini, we are dedicated to building a diverse, inclusive, and authentic workplace, so if you’re excited about this role but your experience doesn’t align perfectly, we encourage you to apply and tell us what you can bring to the role.   We understand for some people, a standard hiring processes can come with challenges. If you are living with a disability, are gender diverse or neurodivergent and we can provide support with access requirements or by making an adjustment to our hiring process, please contact us at talentacquisitionaunz@capgemini.com   Information Security and Compliance  Capgemini Australia has developed and manages, process orientated Management Systems compliant to the requirements of ISO9001, ISO27001 and ISO14001. We are committed to delivering secure solutions and services through state-of-the-art processes and continual improvement frameworks in line with industry best practices as well as contractual, statutory, and regulatory requirements.  #LI-BS1

column3: Step into a newly created position within an evolving team, where you'll have the opportunity to shape data solutions using the latest technologies
column13: Company description:    The Department of Education is the largest provider of public education in Australia with responsibility for delivering high-quality public education to two-thirds of the NSW student population. For more information about the Department of Education, please visit http://www.dec.nsw.gov.au/    Job description:    At the NSW Department of Education, we educate and inspire lifelong learners - from early childhood, through schooling to vocational education and training.  Ongoing Full-Time 35 hours per week Located in Parramatta with flexible working arrangements available Salary $139,787 - $161,663  About the role Step into a newly created position within an evolving team at the NSW Department of Education, where you'll have the opportunity to shape data solutions using the latest technologies. As a Senior Datawarehouse Engineer, you'll work in a dynamic environment, adapting to advancements and managing competing timeframes with agility. You'll be part of a positive, collaborative team that supports your professional development. Your role will involve:  Developing and managing ELT processes for Azure Synapse Analytics, using tools like Azure Data Factory, Spark Notebooks, SSIS, and more. Creating and managing entities, business rules, and strategies in master data management. Developing and deploying SQL, PowerShell, C#, and Python source code through Azure DevOps. Building ADF/Synapse Pipelines, Spark notebooks, and reports using Microsoft BI tools, including Power BI and Azure Analysis Services. Leveraging comprehensive SQL, Power BI, and DAX knowledge to drive data initiatives.  For further information please click here to view the role description  About you We're seeking a candidate who:  Has strong technical expertise in Azure Synapse Analytics, SQL, Power BI, and DAX. Is passionate about data and technology, eager to learn, and adaptable to change. Demonstrates ownership, accountability, and leadership within their role. Is flexible, positive, and capable of managing competing timeframes in a fast-paced environment.  Join us in a role where you can grow, innovate, and make a significant impact on data management. If you're ready to embrace the challenges of a rapidly evolving field and contribute to a supportive and forward-thinking team, we want to hear from you!  Key knowledge and experience  Extensive experience in providing IT support within a large government agency or commercial enterprise. Proven experience in technical, analytics or business intelligence environments. Sound understanding of master data functions. Knowledge of and commitment to implementing the department's Aboriginal Education Policy and upholding the department's Partnership Agreement with the NSW AECG and to ensure quality outcomes for Aboriginal people.  Essential requirements of the role  A valid Working with Children Check for paid employment. Demonstrated understanding of and commitment to the values of public education.  Benefits  Flexible working arrangements available. 35 hour working week Competitive, salary sacrificing, employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading Flex Leave entitlements, generous holidays & leave conditions Opportunities for advancement and mobility across the Department to support your career growth  How to apply Attach a resume (maximum 5 pages) and a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) outlining how you meet the requirements and capabilities of this role.  Please refer to the Applicant's Guide to Applying to assist you with your application.  Note: the selection process will include a range of assessment techniques to assist in determining your suitability for the role. Successful candidates will be required to undertake pre-employment screening for this role which includes a National Criminal History Check.  This is a child-related role. As a condition of employment you will be required to provide a valid Working with Children Check (WWCC) Clearance number (for paid employment). Visit the website for more information.  Closing date Sunday, 18 August 2024 at 11:59pm.  For role enquiries please contact Manasvi Patel details at Manasvi.Patel@det.nsw.edu.au and for recruitment process enquirires please contact Fadi Albehnonissan at fadi.albehnonissan1@det.nsw.edu.au  We welcome applications from all ages and genders, Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander peoples, culturally and linguistically diverse groups, the LGBTQIA+ community, veterans, refugees and people with disability. If we can make some adjustments to our recruitment/interview process to better enable you to shine, please contact the Diversity and Inclusion Team (dandi@det.nsw.edu.au) or visit NSW Department of Education Diversity and Inclusion.  A recruitment pool may be created through this recruitment process. A recruitment pool is a group of applicants who have been assessed and identified as suitable for this role, and who may be considered for a range of similar roles, including temporary, term or ongoing roles, over the next 18 months.     We offer:   Flexible working arrangements available. 35 hour working week Competitive, salary sacrificing, employer's contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading Flex Leave entitlements, generous holidays & leave conditions Opportunities for advancement and mobility across the Department to support your career growth

column3: Senior Software Engineer 2 at SKUVantage, a subsidiary of Salsify.
column13: Come join a company who is a key leader in the industry scaling the next core commerce infrastructure and on the path from $100M to $500M! Founded in 2012, Salsify helps brand manufacturers, distributors, and retailers in over 80 countries collaborate to win on the digital shelf. As the market leader globally, our products are shopper-centric, frictionless, and create memorable commerce experiences. Our products provide a competitive edge through experiences that improve brand trust, amplify product differentiation and assortments, increase conversion rate, improve profit margins, and speed time to market.     Learn how the world’s largest brands, including Mars, L'Oreal, Coca-Cola, Bosch, and GSK, as well as retailers and distributors such as E.Leclerc, Carrefour, Metro, and Intermarché use Salsify everyday to stand out on the digital shelf.     At Salsify, we strive to embody an equitable, diverse, and inclusive company culture. We are united across countries, levels, tenures, and a host of other dimensions of diversity. We understand that while work is just one aspect of who we are, a truly inclusive culture accounts for the full authenticity of every single human being that works here.     ABOUT THE OPPORTUNITY  Salsify ANZ   Manly Vale, Sydney NSW (Hybrid)   SKUVantage, a subsidiary of Salsify     Position:  Full-time        About the business:     Salsify helps brand manufacturers, distributors and retailers in over 80 countries collaborate to win on the digital shelf. As a market leader globally, our solutions are customer centric, frictionless and create memorable commerce experiences.     Our products provide a competitive edge through experiences that improve brand trust, amplify product differentiation and assortments, increase conversion rate, improve profit margins and speed time to market.     Salsify ANZ works with many of Australia's biggest brands and retailers; we are the leader in what we do.  We are now recruiting for an energetic and self-motivated individual to help us further grow our business in the ANZ region.     About the role:     We're looking for a talented and passionate developer who wants to join our Network team. We already have a very experienced, solid team that we want to take to the next step in scaling and making even more successful.  As a Senior Software Engineer at Salsify you will be entrusted to innovate and constantly improve our products to deliver a platform and experience our customers love to use. You will solve complex business and scalability problems and help define the direction of the product as well as work across the entire Salsify technology ecosystem building back-end services and APIs in Ruby, interacting directly with Retailers, Marketplaces and E-Commerce platforms like Amazon, Walmart, BigCommerce, Shopify and much more. Our engineers are simultaneously scaling a demanding application while simplifying complex business processes for our users and learning from top engineers along the way.  We deeply value our engineering culture. We strongly emphasize clarity, competence and autonomy. We care about building the right thing, the right way, and having fun while we do it. Every member of our team has the freedom and responsibility to make Salsify a great place to work.   This position is based in our Manly Vale office, in the Northern Beaches of Sydney.     Key Responsibilities include:  Build and ship production-grade software. Set technical direction and help define the technical approach for the work the team takes on. Work closely with product and engineering management to help define the product roadmap. Engage in customer calls and cross-functional team activities, while assisting with analysis, definition, debugging, remediation and rollout. Collaborate with go-to-market teams to launch new functionality. Grow as a leader both on the team and within the broader engineering organization. Mentor new team members as the team grows, starting from the hiring pipeline and candidate technical background assessment. Participate in tech talks and guilds to exchange ideas and strategies that advance our ability to build quality software. Be proud of what you work on, learn from and give back to your team and the broader Salsify community - contribute to the success of an exciting and fast growing Boston-based company with global customers. Qualifications: 8+ years of commercial software development experience in a cross-functional, agile R&D environment. Experience building consumer-facing applications in a SaaS or product-based company, specializing in back-end development. Experience with contemporary frameworks, build tools, and testing tools. Solid track record of software development using Ruby on Rails. Advanced experience working in a tech stack that includes K8s, AWS, Docker, CircleCI, ElasticSearch, Kafka, RabbitMQ, New Relic, Bugsnag, and PagerDuty. Great verbal and written communication skills, with consolidated experience in writing product and architectural decision-record documentation. An understanding of front-end development, using design systems and an Ember-based tech stack, is a plus. A drive to build scalable and performant applications -- you know that just because a query returns the results you need, it may not be the most efficient approach. An interest in exchanging ideas around building robust, secure, maintainable software. Comfort providing and receiving feedback on implementation ideas. Thoughtful opinions about efficient and secure deployment practices.     Salsify loves a good success story and it would be our privilege to help write yours! We recognize that talent and potential come in all forms and that years of experience does not guarantee on-the-job effectiveness or leadership potential. Our hiring process involves recognizing a person’s achievements, subject matter expertise, and passion, not just check marks next to a job description. If you have an interest in our roles please do not hesitate to apply - we would be happy to speak with you!  A member of Talent 'talent@salsify.com' will be reaching out about next steps if we would like to move forward.  Salsify’s mission is to empower brand manufacturers to win on the digital shelf.  Helping brand manufacturers to win online is what we do. Our culture is who we are. We are empowered. We are positive thinkers. We take action. We care deeply. These values have driven Salsify’s growth and earned the company numerous top workplace awards.  We are headquartered in Boston, Massachusetts and have hubs in Lisbon (Portugal) and Sydney (Australia). If you are excited to work in a fast-paced environment with a team that values agility, curiosity and passion, we want to hear from you!  Please see our Candidate Privacy Statement for information on the personal data we process in connection with your application.  An Inclusive Place To Work  Salsify does not discriminate based on race, religion, color, national origin, sex, gender, gender expression, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, or disability status. Studies have found that people of color and women do not apply to jobs if they do not meet all the requirements. At Salsify we are committed to empowering a diverse workforce. We ensure that individuals with disabilities are provided reasonable accommodation to participate in the job application or interview process, to perform essential job functions, and to receive other benefits and privileges of employment.   ACCOMMODATIONS  Salsify is committed to an inclusive hiring process, and we aim to provide accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you need any accommodations for the application or throughout the interview process please contact cx@salsify.com.

column3: Ready to shape the future of connectivity? Join Easyweb Digital as a Senior Network Engineer and lead transformative projects that empower communities
column13: About the Company  For over a decade, Easyweb Digital has been at the forefront of designing, building, and managing public Wi-Fi networks across Australia and New Zealand. Our dedication to connecting remote and regional communities has established us as a leading provider of broadband wireless network solutions. We are driven by values of care, connectivity, entrepreneurship, and maintaining a family-friendly work environment.  The Role   Join Easyweb Digital as a Senior Network Engineer and play a pivotal role in designing and managing cutting-edge wireless network solutions.   Based in Mulgrave predominantly, but with some flexible work-from-home options, this role offers a dynamic blend of hands-on network engineering, project management, and strategic development.   You'll lead complex IT, application-based, and engineering projects, ensuring robust connectivity for remote and regional communities across Australia and New Zealand. With a focus on career growth, this position offers extensive professional development opportunities in a family-friendly environment.   If you're passionate about driving technological innovation and community service, this role is your chance to excel in a supportive and innovative team.  Key responsibilities of the role include, but not limited to:  Collaborate with technical leads to design and implement functional network solutions that meet both company and customer requirements. Take charge of network design projects from conception to documentation, ensuring all solutions align with client needs and company standards. Implement network setups, manage configurations, and oversee the commissioning of network hardware, working closely with both internal teams and clients. Lead the network monitoring and support processes, designing reports and managing crisis responses to ensure stable and continuous network operations. Utilize ITIL frameworks for effective change, release, problem, and incident management, maintaining high standards of network reliability and security. Provide leadership and mentorship to junior network engineering staff, fostering professional development and knowledge sharing within the team. Some travel will be required to interstate clients (a few days, up to a once a month) Ensure all activities comply with company policies, including health and safety standards.  To secure the role, we are looking for:  A bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Telecommunications, or a related field, with a master’s degree considered advantageous. Certifications and/or significant experience with network technologies from vendors such as Fortinet, Mikrotik, Ruckus Wireless, and others. At least 1 year of experience in a senior network engineering role, demonstrating advanced proficiency in network design, implementation, and support. Strong understanding of network protocols like TCP/IP, UDP, BGP, and experience with complex network environments. Expertise in wireless network design, implementation and support, including WiFi, PTP, and PTMP solutions. Proficiency in managing and configuring network infrastructure, including routers, switches, and firewalls, particularly from vendors like Mikrotik and Fortinet. Experience with cloud networking environments (e.g., AWS, Azure) and familiarity with project management methodologies such as Agile or Scrum. ITIL Foundation certification or equivalent experience in an ITIL-based service management environment. Customer first approach with strong communication skills, and enjoys working in a team environment.      Why work for us?  Join our ambitious team at Easyweb Digital making a real difference. Be a part of a mission-driven team dedicated to improving lives through technology. Here's why you should apply:  Impactful Work: Contribute to providing vital connectivity solutions to remote and regional communities, truly making a difference in people’s lives. Innovative Culture: Thrive in an environment that values innovation and encourages new ideas and technologies. Professional Growth: Benefit from continuous learning opportunities, including vendor certifications and advanced training in network engineering and related technologies. Work-Life Balance: Enjoy flexible work arrangements, including options to work from home, and a supportive, family-friendly workplace that values your personal time and well-being. Birthday Leave: Celebrate your special day with a day off on us, ensuring you have the time to enjoy what matters most to you. Competitive Compensation: Receive an attractive salary package, including superannuation and opportunities for career advancement.    Culture & Values:   Commitment to enhancing connectivity and community service. Support for work-life balance and a family-friendly workplace. Opportunities for professional development. Encouragement of an entrepreneurial spirit and problem-solving.  Easy Web Digital is an equal opportunity employer. We celebrate diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.     How to Apply:  Apply via the Seek portal.   For further information please contact our external HR Consultant, Sophie (sophie@thesavegroup.com).

column3: Nationally recognized organisation in Brisbane looking for a Project Manager with strong digital transformation experience to join immediately.
column13: About the company       We currently have a live opening for a Project Manager (with strong ERP/Digital Transformation project experience) to join one of our client sites in Cannon Hill, Brisbane. This nationally recognised & reputable business is currently undertaking a large program of digital transformation, including a D365 ERP F&O /D365 CRM/CE upgrade (underway & full service) among other exciting initiatives.       This organisation has competitive salary packaging, is detailed orientated and has flexible working arrangements.       The Project Manager, reporting into the Project Lead, will be responsible for driving the daily project operations including the planning, development, and implementation of this organisations key digital transformation journey.       What we are looking for  Previous experience as Project Manager working on similar Digital Transformation Initiatives (Tier 1 ERP/CRM upgrades/implementations); Experience managing large IT and business projects; Experience maintaining & monitoring project plans, schedules, project reporting, and budgets; Experience managing and liaising with key stakeholders and organising effective stakeholder meetings; Ensure object deadlines, quality and budget are met; Documentation of projects status and activities; Vendor Management; Change control experience; A project manager with a ‘hands on’ approach; Complete administrative and day to day project management tasks while; bringing various teams into alignment with one another (internal/external); Strong experience with Project Management methodologies; and D365 F&O / AX / FinOps projects (big plus).       Benefits  Competitive salary packaging; Inclusive & open working culture; Flexible work arrangements; Great feedback from candidates already placed into this delivery team; Gain D365 F&O project experience or build on your Dynamics project portfolio; and Office location is easy to commute to via road & public transport.       Please send your resume through to david@dynamorecruitment.com.au, or click the button below to apply!

column3: Enerven Telecommunications team is expanding into Western Australia! Opportunity to work with NBN to build Business Connections!
column13: Enerven Telecommunications team is expanding into Western Australia! Opportunity to work with NBN to build Business Connections!  At Enerven, we want our work to make a difference. By connecting ideas, people and technology, we’re constantly learning, adapting and designing solutions that are safer, more sustainable and more cost-effective. Enerven specialises in the design, construction and maintenance of electrical, telecommunications, and renewable infrastructure, with specific expertise and experience relating to South Australia’s distribution and transmission network infrastructure. We offer award-winning training, an outstanding culture of safety and a supportive environment that fosters and recognises achievement. Share in a brighter future with Enerven.  At Enerven, we’re focussed on connecting you with tomorrow.  About the role  We are seeking to appoint an experienced Field Supervisor, reporting to the Construction Supervisor, oversees and ensures the successful completion of telecommunication construction activities at the site. This role involves coordinating all work groups and contractors necessary for project success.  The Field Supervisor is tasked with executing assigned work safely, efficiently, and cost-effectively by effectively managing on-site personnel and resources. This role requires proactive supervision to ensure high performance and adherence to project standards.  In collaboration with the Construction Supervisor, the Field Supervisor also provides site support and administration, coordinating with various groups such as communications teams and civil contractors to streamline project operations.  About you  You will be an exceptional communicator on all levels and have a background in building telecommunications infrastructure networks, including optical fibre cable installation, splicing and testing (including data cabling).  Requirements include:  Telecommunication network construction and commissioning experience and contractor management Previous experience in Field leadership in construction or related industry Current Drivers Licence  About us  At Enerven, we want our work to make a difference. By connecting ideas, people and technology, we’re constantly learning, adapting and designing solutions that are safer, more sustainable and more cost-effective.? We offer an outstanding culture focussed on safety and wellbeing, within a supportive working environment that fosters and recognises achievement.?   Just some of the benefits include overtime rates (straight into double time), 12.5% superannuation, 17.5% annual leave loading and an annual electricity reimbursement.     Given safety is at the forefront of everything we do, candidates will undergo comprehensive pre-employment screening, including a medical and a police check.  Don't let this opportunity pass you by.  For further information or any queries about this role, reach out to us at recruitment@enerven.com.au     Your journey towards a brighter, greener future starts here!

column3: Highly competitive Salary for a Professional/Consulting Services (Sales) Sydney, Brisbane, Canberra or Melbourne
column13: Professional/Consulting Services (Sales)  FULL TIME  Flexible - based in either Sydney, Brisbane, Canberra or Melbourne  About ISI   ISI is an Australian based Mainframe and Midrange IT business, specialising in IBM Mainframe, Power (AIX and i-Series), Linux and Storage solutions with a 30-year pedigree in this space.  ISI operates in the Enterprise IT space and as such you must have experience dealing with large scale Federal and Local Governments, the Financial Services Industry (Banking and Insurance), and general large-scale businesses.  The Role:  We are looking for a Professional/Consulting Services Sales resource with Business Development skills who is looking for a long-term career to build and grow our IT Services division. Professional/Consulting Services Sales and management experience are essential.  As the Professional/Consulting Services lead, you will increase market share by identifying, developing, and nurturing enterprise accounts. You will be responsible for the successful onboarding of new clients, managing the account plus the Consulting Services resources that are deployed.  To be successful in this role, you should have the ability to manage multiple accounts concurrently and develop sales strategies to support new business opportunities, which includes defining/qualifying sales opportunities, determining engagement scope and formulating potential solutions based on client requirements.   Strong Communicator: Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills, with the ability to engage and influence senior executives, stakeholders, and team members. Solution-Oriented Leadership: Work with our sales and technical teams to design and implement IT solutions that align with our client's business objectives and technology roadmap. Strategic Thinker: Demonstrated ability to think strategically and analytically, with a keen understanding of the Mainframe / Midrange IT landscape and how it can be leveraged to drive modern business growth. Modern Business Growth: Self-motivated to build and grow the Services practice, leveraging complementary modern Mainframe technologies such as AI, APIs, DEVOPS and Hybrid Cloud.   Specific Requirements  Generate increased sales revenue by engaging with new and existing customers Prospect for new business to identify and generate new opportunities for consulting services roles Build strong relationships with customers and candidates Have confidence in working independently within a small, driven, and ambitious team environment Be a strong hunter and networker Coordinate the price, scope, quote, and contract processes Proven Consulting Services sales experience ideally within the Mainframe, Power, Linux, and Storage IT industry Excellent communication and interpersonal skills. Be highly motivated and driven  What we are offering  A Highly Competitive salary ($150K base + OTE)  How to apply  If you have the skills required and would like to work with an employer who recognises and rewards great performance, please email your CV to resumes@isi.com.au

column3: You will engineer an LLM-based AI product to enhance the strategic performance, accuracy, and delivery of multimillion-dollar projects.
column13: Generative AI Engineer/Practitioner  Location: North Sydney Work Arrangement: 5 days in the office Salary: $160k + super - $175,000 + Super  As a Gen AI Practitioner you will be able to make strategic calls on what are the actual business objectives, and what available or acquirable data are necessary and able to build models. You will have experience building the right models and know that the models are useful for the business.  Key Responsibilities:  Lead the end-to-end development of a Large Language Model-based AI product, from research through to production. Understand the product vision, customer needs, and market demands to drive product development effectively. Develop and scale models to continually grow the AI capability, consistently improving accuracy and efficiency. Work with internal stakeholders to ensure unique business problems are being solved. Ensure that non-biased, ethical AI best practices are developed and maintained. Requirements/What We’re Looking For:  Prerequisites: Must know: Data, Data Science, NLP, Machine Learning, statistics  Skills need:   ◦  Must have experience in Data     ◦  Cloud environments - Databases concepts.   ◦  NLP concepts - Must know, tokenisation, Term frequency, lemmatisation, stemming.    ◦  Must know how Machine learning and Deep learning models work and their distinguished features.   ◦  Knowledge of LLM/NLP modules in Python.   ◦  Large Language models both architecture & modelling (why LLMs. For what purposes)    ◦  Programming skills (Python) in at the level of data science (how to program to do data analysis, automation, model development in LLM Gen-AI and Machine Learning)   ◦  How to measure the accuracy of Gen-AI models. What is overfitting?   ◦  Deep learning models. What are they? Their architecture?  Background:   ◦  Minimum of computer science degree specialised in data science, machine learning or AI.  Years of experience: At least 6 to be able to effectively communicate with both technical and non-technical stakeholders. And be able to understand strategic business objectives and where Gen-AI fits in these objectives. Benefits:  Ability to build a greenfield product from the ground up within a $6 billion international operation. Professional development opportunities and access to industry events and leaders. Dynamic and collaborative company culture. Reach out to Vinolia - vinolia@nbridge.com.au

column3: Partner and consult with clients early in the construction phase to understand and integrate all their AV needs.
column13: About the Company Our client, a fast-expanding leader in the Audio Visual industry, is looking for a skilled and experienced Audio Visual Design Engineer to join their team in St Leonards, Sydney. As the company continues its rapid growth, doubling its team size, this role offers outstanding opportunities for career progression and leadership.  Position Overview In the role of Audio Visual Design Engineer, you will be integral in delivering cutting-edge AV solutions across various sectors, including corporate, government, education, and fit-out projects. This position goes beyond technical skills, emphasizing a consultative approach where you’ll collaborate with clients during the construction phase to seamlessly incorporate AV requirements into the project’s design.  Key Responsibilities  Consultative Client Collaboration: Partner with clients early in the construction phase to understand and integrate their AV needs into the project’s framework. Design and Implementation: Craft detailed AV design plans and specifications tailored to meet client requirements. Project Management: Lead AV installation projects from inception to completion, ensuring high standards of quality and efficiency. Technical Expertise: Offer specialized technical support and guidance to both clients and internal teams. Innovation: Stay current with the latest AV technologies and trends to deliver cutting-edge solutions. Required Skills and Experience  Proven Experience: Significant experience in AV design engineering, with a portfolio showcasing successful projects. Technical Proficiency: In-depth knowledge of AV technologies, including Zoom, Microsoft Teams, Cisco, etc. Communication Skills: Strong communication and interpersonal skills to effectively engage with clients and colleagues. Problem-Solving: Excellent problem-solving abilities with a keen eye for detail. Client-Oriented: A proactive approach to client interaction, especially during the construction phase, ensuring exceptional service. What’s on Offer  Competitive Salary: A competitive salary package, ranging from $90K to $130K + Super, based on experience. Career Advancement: Ample opportunities for career growth and leadership roles within the company. Dynamic Work Environment: Join a supportive, fast-paced work environment in a company that is rapidly expanding. Innovative Projects: Work on a variety of exciting and innovative AV projects. How to Apply If you are a seasoned AV Design Engineer seeking a challenging role with a focus on client consultation and integration, we encourage you to apply! Please send your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and suitability for this position to emilyf@austcorpexecutive.com.au.

column3: Have your say and have your ideas heard! You'll be working within this highly collaborative team on a new Greenfield project.
column13: The Company Appoint Recruit is proud to be partnering with a well-known Brisbane-based company that is embarking on an exciting digital transformation journey. This forward-thinking company is about to begin the next phase of this project and is looking to expand its team to drive this initiative forward.  The Appointment With offices across Australia and a main tech hub located in Brisbane CBD, this small yet highly skilled team are looking for a Mid Level Developer. The new team member will play a crucial role in the development and execution of their innovative Greenfield project, contributing to the company's growth and success.  You day to day will include:  Design and build highly scalable product and systems. Take part working across the development lifecycle, including planning, coding, testing, debugging, and deployment. Work alongside the seniors in the team to learn and developer your skills further, while producing high quality code.  Have your say and have your ideas heard! The Appointee The ideal candidate for this role will be an experienced Mid Level .NET Developer with excellent communication skills. You should also have experience with:  Commercial experience working with .NET Core and/or above.  Solid experience working within the front end, ideally Angular. Previous experience with Automated Integration and Unit Testing.  Knowledge with cloud platforms and CICD. Why This Role Enjoy flexible working arrangements, including two days per week working from home. This is a stable company with progression plans and a large global presence, known positively across their field.  If you are passionate about making a significant impact on software development and looking for a role that offers growth, flexibility, and a supportive environment, we would love to hear from you.   For more information contact Courtney Garrett: courtney@appointrecruit.com.au 0419 945 298  Alternatively hit the "quick apply" button now.

column3: Incredible full stack development opportunity within a dynamic Life Insurance FinTech. Diverse projects spanning AWS, React.JS & Node.JS...
column13: Software Development Engineer  The Opportunity: Talented Engineers needed to join this amazing insurance FinTech where you will be encouraged to introduce new technologies and ways of working. With a growing suite of market leading products, the business has very large scale expansion plans within Australia.   The Opportunities:  Working in these brand new Full Stack roles, you will work on a range of innovative and exciting greenfield insurance applications and products.   The key technical stack is Node.JS on the back end with React.JS on the front, and the project scope includes B2B and B2C claims, underwriting, and policy platforms.   These roles will suit talented full stack developers who are collaborative, and who have a passion for creative design and a desire to forge ahead in their careers with a growing company.   In return for this exceptional role, you will need: Strong full stack capabilities Excellent skills with React.JS and Node.JS AWS capabilities (Event Driven Architecture) Tangible examples of  delivering creative  solutions A really strong team focus Next Steps: If you are interested in this role please click "apply now" or send your up to date CV to anu.yadav@mtr.com.au or call 02 9259 8728

column3: Work on continuous improvement initiatives and project delivery, providing expertise across the full software development lifecycle.
column13: Work with cutting edge web technologies and cloud infrastructure including Azure Integration Services, Function Apps, Web Apps, Azure release pipelines, and much more. Level 8, full-time appointment on a fixed term basis for 12 months, with the possibility of extension. Base salary range: $124,926 – $136,549 p.a. inclusive of Superannuation (negotiable 11-17%)  The University of Western Australia (UWA) is ranked among the top 100 universities in the world and a member of the prestigious Australian Group of Eight research intensive universities. With a strong research track record, vibrant campus and working environments, supported by the freedom to innovate and inspire, there is no better time to join Western Australia’s top university.  About the team  UWA is making significant investments in the Information and Technology Services to enable its strategic direction and goals. UWA is also looking to utilise technology advancements to expand its services and create new and innovative teaching and research models.  Robust, flexible, integrated and agile enterprise architecture, information and technology services are vital to enabling the university strategic objectives.  About the opportunity  As the appointee you will, under broad direction, be responsible for ensuring that the solutions are created and maintained in alignment with best practice and internal standards. You will work on business as usual and continuous improvement initiatives as well as work with project services team members on project delivery. You will be required to contribute and provide expertise across the full software development lifecycle from engaging with internal business customers, eliciting software requirements and to research, build, test, support and document solutions.  About you   Skills and experience include:  Microservices architecture. RESTful Services. Unit and Integration Testing Practices. Familiarity with Secure Development Practices.  To be considered for this opportunity, you will demonstrate:  Relevant tertiary qualification or equivalent competency. Substantial experience across the full Software Development Life Cycle, including demonstrated experience in designing enterprise-grade solutions and extensive relevant experience in developing, implementing, integrating, repairing, and maintaining complex application systems. Extensive technical experience with the following technologies: C#; .NET; Azure Integration Services. Proven experience implementing API layers using REST or SOAP to integrate legacy applications and experience using Pipelines in Azure DevOps for CI/CD and the demonstrated ability to gather and document requirements appropriate to the applied methodology. Sound analytical and problem-solving skills with the ability to recognise and resolve system related problems; work independently and make necessary decisions within guidelines. ITIL Certification or demonstrated experience in ITIL processes, and knowledge of the Higher Education sector is desirable.  Note: Provision of a Current National Police Clearance will be required for the successful applicant.  About your application  Full details of the position's responsibilities and the selection criteria are outlined in the position description:  Integration Developer 517179.pdf  You are required to demonstrate how you meet the selection criteria in your submission either in a separate document or clearly via your Resume and Cover Letter. For information to assist you with compiling statements to answer the selection criteria, please visit Addressing the selection criteria  Demonstrating your skills and experience in relation to the “desirable” attributes listed in this advertisement will be highly regarded.  You may also submit an additional statement (1 page max) outlining any personal circumstances which should be considered when assessing your application. Applicants who have experienced periods of academic/professional interruption or other relevant events can include a description of achievements relative to opportunity in this statement.  Closing date: 11:55 PM AWST on Monday 19th August 2024.  To learn more about this opportunity, please contact Alan Mullett at alan.mullett@uwa.edu.au  This position is only open to applicants with relevant rights to work in Australia.  Application Details: Please apply online via the Apply Now button.  Our commitment to inclusion and diversity  UWA is committed to a diverse workforce and an equitable and inclusive workplace.  We celebrate difference and believe diversity is fundamental to achieving our goals as a globally recognised Top 100 educational and research institution.  We are committed to creating a safe work environment for Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people, women, people from culturally and linguistically diverse backgrounds, the LGBTIQA+ community and people living with disability.  We have a globally competitive, gender neutral parental leave policy with 26 weeks paid leave after 12 months service and 36 weeks after 5 years. We have on-campus childcare facilities for children aged 6 weeks to kindy. We facilitate flexible working, with part-time and job-sharing arrangements considered. We have an ongoing partnership with Pride in Diversity and were recently awarded a Bronze Employer status for LGBTIQA+ inclusion. We have Athena SWAN Bronze accreditation and actively work to improve gender equity.   Should you have any queries relating to your application, please contact the individual named in the advertisement. Alternatively, contact the Talent team at talent-hr@uwa.edu.au with details of your query. To enable a quick response, please include the 6-digit job reference number and a member of the team will respond to your enquiry.

column3: Fantastic opportunity for a Test Analyst, to join our HRIS team on a one-year contract
column10: Our people build skills for the future
column13: Company description:    About Barwon Health Barwon Health is one of the largest and most comprehensive regional health services in Australia, providing care at all stages of life and circumstance. Services available through Barwon Health cover the full spectrum from primary care, community services, aged care, rehabilitation, mental health, emergency and acute care. We serve more than 500,000 people through the efforts of more than 9000 staff and volunteers across more than 20 sites. Barwon Health is committed to developing a vibrant culture of education, training and research that advances health and wellbeing for all.    Job description:   Temporary full time 80 hours per fortnight until 31/08/2025, with access to ADO's, 5 weeks annual leave and salary packaging. Enjoy a role that will be varied, challenging and rewarding Exciting Regional Health Care Human Resource Information Systems Project  About the facility Our major sites include University Hospital Geelong in Geelong's CBD, the McKellar Centre precinct in North Geelong, Barwon Health North in Norlane, and residential aged care facilities spanning the region. Comprehensive mental health, community health and dental services are delivered through various programs across the Barwon South West Region, including Torquay and Colac.   About the role  The Test Analyst is responsible in supporting the successful implementation of People Plus. People Plus is the SAP Success Factors human resource information system across Health Services in the Barwon South West (BSW). This project is led by Barwon Health. The Test Analyst is responsible for ensuring the quality and reliability of our HR technology platform through rigorous testing and quality assurance processes. The project scope will include designing, planning, and executing test cases for the following SAP Success Factors modules Recruitment, Professional Development Review (PMGM), Employee Central Payroll, Core HR (Employee Central), HR Reporting (People Analytics), Onboarding and Offboarding.  The Test Analyst will be responsible for Identifying, logging, and tracking defects. The candidate will be responsible for supporting Testing Manager in establishing a comprehensive testing strategy using a risk-based testing model, which includes defining the scope, testing approach, tools, and reporting. Additionally, the Test Analyst assist in creating test plans that outline testing cycles, test case structures, and schedules, ensuring compliance with entry and exit criteria. They will assist the identified other testers identified during various test phases in execution of test cases. and upload of test cases in test management tool for execution by the testers.  Please note Barwon Health will only contact you via our official email and never use unconventional means, such as text messaging or other services.  To obtain a copy to the position description, email recruitment@barwonhealth.org.au with the job request ID and job title.   About the culture You will have the opportunity to be part of a highly skilled, professional and dedicated team who take pride in providing high quality services. We promote positive, respectful relationships and strong partnerships within the workplace. Grow and develop your capabilities with Barwon Health's commitment to professional development.  Barwon Health staff benefits • Excellent working conditions with a high sense of job satisfaction. • A vibrant staff wellbeing program and access to our 24/7 Employee Assistance Program. • Wide-range of professional development opportunities to enhance your career. • Attractive salary packaging benefits. Living expenses capped at $9010 and meals and entertainment capped at $2650.  About Geelong Derived from the local Wathaurong Aboriginal name for the region Djilang, Geelong is thought to mean ‘Tongue of Land'.  Geelong offers a range of lifestyle choices including inner city, coastal, suburban and rural homes. • Geelong is home to world class schools and education providers. • Doorstep to the Great Ocean Road, Bellarine Peninsula and the Surf Coast • Appreciate our vast and abundant parklands, sports and entertainment attractions, and thriving dining and shopping complexes.  To learn more about the region, click here.  Diversity and Inclusion We believe in the power of diversity and inclusion. We celebrate the unique backgrounds, perspectives, and talents of our team members, fostering an environment where everyone feels valued and respected. Our commitment to diversity strengthens our ability to provide compassionate and equitable care to all individuals, regardless of their backgrounds, abilities and identities. We are committed to providing positive employment opportunities and a workplace that promotes wellbeing, and we welcome and encourage applications from those who identify as Aboriginal and/or Torres Strait Islander. We actively encourage individuals with disabilities and diverse backgrounds and identities to apply for our positions. Should you require any reasonable adjustments or support during the recruitment process, we are here to assist you every step of the way. We are committed to the safety and wellbeing of all children and young people. Click here for further information on the Victorian Government's Child Safe Standards.  This role must be fully vaccinated for COVID-19 and influenza and meet the requirements of the Barwon Health immunisation policy.

column3: Senior Solution Architect
column13: Working at Transurban is different; it's a place where you can see the benefits of your work play out in real life, every day. We create city-sized solutions-building and operating safer, smarter, and more sustainable roads-to solve pressing transport challenges that are slowing cities down.   About the role  We're seeking a Senior Solution Architect to join our dynamic Customer and Billing Platforms team. In this role, you will play a crucial role in designing solution architectures that support transformative initiatives for our CRM and Billing systems.    As the Senior Solution Architect, you'll lead our Delivery Teams, translating business requirements into robust technology solutions. Collaborating with stakeholders, you'll provide input to shape our technology solutions through the lens of our strategic pillars: Customer Advocacy, Platforms for the Future, Protect, and 'How we do it'.   Join us at Transurban to make lasting and positive contributions that shape the future of our cities and communities. It's meaningful, challenging, and exciting work.   Day-to-day, you will:   Provide guidance and expertise in solution architecture and engineering processes across the platform Collaborate with teams to standardise practices and enhance operational efficiency Ensure that solutions align with existing and emerging business and technology environments Follow the Enterprise Architecture roadmap to deliver effective solutions Uphold high quality standards for solutions delivered by Customer Platforms Address the diverse needs of delivery teams and operations within Customer Platforms Create and maintain technical documentation, including solution briefs, design specifications, and architectural diagrams Foster a culture of high performance, continuous improvement, and technical leadership within the team  This role will suit someone with a curious mind and transferrable skills and experiences, including:   Extensive experience in Solution Architecture Experienced technical leader with a growth mindset, strong business acumen, and exceptional leadership skills Proficient in Software Development Life Cycle (SDLC) principles Strong knowledge of Agile, CI/CD, and DevOps methodologies Hands-on experience with diverse solutions, including SaaS architecture (Salesforce, Mulesoft, billing platforms) Cloud technology expertise (AWS EC2, S3, DynamoDB, SQLRDS, Postgres) Familiarity with a wide range of tools, languages, and frameworks Highly developed communication and interpersonal abilities Previous experience working on large-scale, complex enterprise projects Tertiary qualified with a relevant Technology or Business-related degree qualification  If you meet some of these requirements, but not all, we encourage you to submit your application.   With a career at Transurban, you'll enjoy a range of benefits, including:   A range of flexible working and leave options, including the option to purchase an additional six weeks of leave each year 16 weeks paid parental leave (regardless of gender or carer status), with no waiting period, with Superannuation paid during unpaid leave as well Learning and development opportunities to support your career interests Health and wellbeing support-access to Headspace and our EAP program, wellness facilities, and more Share offers and insurance benefits Social activities, community give-back programs and paid volunteer days  We offer a range of flexible working and leave options, so you can balance your work and life commitments and interests. Have a conversation with us about how this could work for you.   We embrace diversity with a foundation of safety, wellbeing and inclusion; where everyone belongs. We treat everyone with fairness, consideration and respect, regardless of gender, gender identity, marital or family status, sexual orientation, age, ethnicity, religious beliefs, cultural or socio-economic background, perspective, and experience - whether they work for us or not. We want to ensure everyone feels comfortable and safe to express ideas, questions and concerns.   We strongly encourage applications from candidates of diverse backgrounds and lived experiences, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander people and people living with disability.   If you require any adjustments or support during the recruitment process, please contact us on careers@transurban.com.   Ready to help us keep cities moving? Apply today.

column3: Looking for a Senior Network Engineer - IP Core in Sydney.
column13: Our client is looking for a Senior Network Engineer in IP Core in Sydney. This household brand is offering a professional team environment and above industry wages     Resource required for the Edge squad supporting mainly Fixed Access Networks specifically SD-WAN This resource will be a SME in SD-WAN and DNAC, and will have secondary skills such as wireless The resource will be strong with traditional Routing and Switching Cisco experience of 5 years and over is required.    This resource will be a Edge Networks lead between the POs, Business and Engineering to ensure technology upgrades, feature enhancements and design deployments are undertaken in a timely manner with utmost quality. They will drive outcomes supporting Networks and the WW business. They will have the ability to flex from HL designs and LL designs as well as coordinate activities and resources.      If this role is of your Interest please do apply or call Andy @ 0422015130

column3: 12-month FTE contract to work in a supportive team and opportunities to expand your skills into M365, audio visual, and networking.
column13: Campus Location: North Sydney, Australia  Job No: APTAV100644#008  Work at our North Sydney campus with a cafe, gym, library, car park, and medical clinic on site with easy access to public transport and the Sydney CBD 17% employer superannuation, salary packaging, and generous leave provisions 12 months fixed-term contract, full-time onsite at our North Sydney campus  About ACU:  Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across eight campuses - Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney, Strathfield, Blacktown and Rome.  ACU aspires to be a home for our staff, offer the care of a family and develop an academic and professional community. Whatever your faith or culture, and whether you are academic or professional staff, there are many opportunities both for learning and contributing at ACU.  As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU's mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.  About the role:  ACU North Sydney Campus currently has an amazing opportunity for a Technology Support Officer to provide onsite desktop and audio-visual support to our staff and students. Under the broad direction of the National Manager, Campus Services or National Manager, you will deliver a client focused experience using service management tools, processes, and reporting, to support the University community and audio-visual enabled spaces.  The primary focus of the role is the remote day-to-day support of technology and IT services used by staff, students and University visitors that form part of the ACU Information Technology environment.  Your strong communication skills and specialist technical knowledge will be crucial in understanding the technical problems to triage and resolve service requests and provide advice and solutions. In this position, you will be required to work rostered hours which may include after hours and nominated weekend support.  More specifically the role entails:  Providing on-campus IT support for staff and students. Fulfilling and logging tickets on ServiceNow our service management platform. Providing technical assistance for Crestron and other audio visual technology within our teaching spaces and meeting rooms.  For full position details, refer to the position description.  Contact:  General enquiries can be sent to Jon Morecroft, National Manager, Campus Services at: jon.morecroft@acu.edu.au  What we offer:  The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement. Total remuneration valued to $95,827 - $103,735(pro rata) pa, including salary component $80,975 - $87,658 (pro rata) pa (HEW 5), employer contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading. 17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff. Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks' salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date. As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous benefits which include but not limited to: flexible work, study leave, a variety of leave provisions and salary packaging. Find out more information about the benefits or working at ACU here.  How to Apply:  Step 1: Review the Position Description and become familiar with Our Mission and the Application process  Step 2: Click the 'View Position Description and Apply' button, and populate your candidate application details, including your:  resume (maximum 5 pages). responses to the Selection Criteria and Core Competencies in a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) or in the online Declaration and Criteria application page. brief online responses to any pre-screening employment questions.  Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights. For further information visit Immigration and Citizenship(homeaffairs.gov.au)  Acting in truth, ACU is dedicated to the dignity of the human person through equitable and respectful opportunities for everyone. ACU can offer support for candidates that may require adjustments through the recruitment process.  Your Privacy of personal information is maintained in accordance with ACU policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers  Applications close: 20-AUG-2024 at 11:59pm AUS Eastern Standard Time  ACU does not accept candidate applications submitted by external recruitment agencies through the ACU careers website.
