column3: Join genU as an ICT System Administrator. 12-month fixed term opportunity. Thrive in a dynamic environment!
column13: Company description:    Karingal St Laurence Limited    Job description:  LOCATION: Geelong, VIC EMPLOYMENT STATUS: Full-Time, 12-month Fixed-Term SALARY: Starting from $87,713 + 11.5% super NOT FOR PROFIT: Salary package up to $15,900 per annum each FBT year plus further meals and entertainment benefits up to $2,649 p.a.  Hey You!  Join our dynamic ICT team at genU as an ICT System Administrator and play a key role in three critical projects. We are looking for a skilled professional with the following experience:  SD-WAN or NBN Rollout Azure Reserved Instances Management and configuration of telephony systems  About You:  Our ideal ICT System Administrator must be able to demonstrate the following:  Tertiary qualifications and/or extensive experience in a relevant field Strong knowledge of operating systems, particularly Windows and Linux Experience with networking protocols and technologies, such as TCP/IP, DNS, and DHCP SD-WAN/NBN Rollout Azure Reserved Instances Management and configuration of telephony systems Experience with Cloud Services and technologies Strong troubleshooting and problem-solving skills Familiarity with security best practices and tools Experience with backup and disaster recovery procedures Strong written and verbal communication skills Time management and the ability to prioritise tasks effectively Strong documentation and organisational skills Experience with scripting and automation tools Understanding of ITIL principles  The following are essential:  NDIS Worker Screening Check, or a willingness to obtain NDIS Worker Orientation Module Certificate of Completion, or a willingness to complete  Desirable:  Experience configuring and troubleshooting devices Experience with digital voice communications and systems Experience with SAP software Passionate about growth and system change Passionate about undertaking challenging tasks  For You!  Here at genU, we are a group of passionate, driven people who want everyone's lives to be happier and healthier, especially people with disabilities, the ageing, and those experiencing disadvantage. We operate solely for community benefit and invest back into the same communities in which our services are delivered.  genU welcomes diversity, including diversity of race, culture, spirituality, gender, age, identity, ability, and sexuality. We are committed to providing a welcoming, innovative, safe, empowering, and respectful environment for all and living these values each and every day.  genU staff have access to a range of benefits, including but not limited to the following:  Investment in You: In addition to a comprehensive induction program and ongoing professional development, genU is committed to providing opportunities for career progression. You will have access to a range of accredited training modules, staff mentoring programs, and our internal jobs board. Commitment to Staff Health & Wellbeing: 24/7 access to an innovative, holistic employee assistance program that supports your emotional, mental, financial, and physical health. Increase your Take Home Pay: Salary package up to $15,900 per annum each FBT year plus further meals and entertainment benefits. Employee Discount Program: Save money with employee discounts and savings at over 450 of Australia's most loved retailers and service providers including Coles, Woolworths, and JB HI-FI. Study Scholarship: All genU employees are eligible for a 25% scholarship towards undergraduate and postgraduate courses at Torrens University. Employee Referral Program: Refer someone to work at genU and receive a generous cash bonus once that person completes their 6-month qualifying period.  Interested?  If you have any questions regarding the role or require a copy of the position description outlining full details of this role, please email recruitment@genu.org.au.  genU is committed to providing accessible, inclusive, and equitable recruitment processes for all candidates. For further details about the role or if you would like to discuss reasonable adjustments during the recruitment process, please contact Simon Novak on 0417 641 625 or at simon.novak@genu.org.au

column3: Fixed term opportunity for a Systems Analyst to turn ideas into valued Information Technology solutions.
column10: Max $515 Day Rate inclusive of Super
column13: Campus Location: North Sydney, Australia | Brisbane, Australia | Melbourne, Australia  Job No: APTAV123822#001  Geographically spread team (VIC, NSW and QLD) that is vibrant, friendly and supportive Benefits include 17% employer superannuation, salary packaging, leave loading and generous leave provisions Fixed-term contract, maternal leave replacement  About ACU:  Australian Catholic University (ACU) is an inclusive community which welcomes students and staff of all beliefs. ACU has over 2,500 staff supporting more than 34,000 students across eight campuses - Ballarat, Brisbane, Canberra, Melbourne, North Sydney, Strathfield, Blacktown and Rome.  ACU aspires to be a home for our staff, offer the care of a family and develop an academic and professional community. Whatever your faith or culture, and whether you are academic or professional staff, there are many opportunities both for learning and contributing at ACU.  As valued members of our community, all staff members are expected to have an understanding of ACU's mission and values and to demonstrate an active contribution to them.  About the role:  Our Digital Portfolio is currently looking to appoint a Systems Analyst who will play a key role, under the broad direction of the National Manager, in identifying and understanding the business needs for information technology, facilitating requirements elicitation, and providing recommendations to implement/select innovative solutions that contribute towards adding value to the University. You will act as an intermediary between IT and other business areas, using a deep understanding of business processes and technology to help business partners achieve their desired outcomes.  Note this role is for the term of the incumbants planned parental leave.  More specifically the role entails:  Responding to customer requests for Information Technology systems from lodged ticket in our service request system or otherwise advised by the Nataional Manager of Enterprise Architecture Services. Scheduling and manging meeting/workshops with stakeholders. Presenting outcomes of requirements and options analysis to determine best value outcomes for the university to stakeholders. Maintaining the Enterprise Architecture repository with technology changes.  For full position details, refer to the position description.  Contact:  General enquiries can be sent to Duaine Nightingale, National Manager, Enterprise Architecture Services at: Duaine.Nightingale@acu.edu.au  What we offer:  The University pursues an excellence agenda and offers an environment where staff are welcomed and safe, and valued through development, participation and involvement. Total remuneration valued to $106,366 - $114,254(pro rata) pa, including salary component $89,881 - $96,546 (pro rata) pa (HEW 6), employer contribution to superannuation and annual leave loading. 17% employer superannuation contributions to eligible continuing and fixed-term staff. Annual leave loading of an equivalent to 17.5% of four weeks' salary pro rata payable, dependent on your commencement date. As an ACU staff member, you will have access to generous benefits which include but not limited to: flexible work, study leave, a variety of leave provisions and salary packaging. Find out more information about the benefits or working at ACU here.  How to Apply:  Step 1: Review the Position Description and become familiar with Our Mission and the Application process  Step 2: Click the 'View Position Description and Apply' button, and populate your candidate application details, including your:  resume (maximum 5 pages). responses to the Selection Criteria and Core Competencies in a cover letter (maximum 2 pages) or in the online Declaration and Criteria application page. brief online responses to any pre-screening employment questions.  Candidates must hold Australian work rights to apply for this position. For permanent/ continuing roles, applicants must have permanent work rights. For further information visit Immigration and Citizenship(homeaffairs.gov.au)  Acting in truth, ACU is dedicated to the dignity of the human person through equitable and respectful opportunities for everyone. ACU can offer support for candidates that may require adjustments through the recruitment process.  Your Privacy of personal information is maintained in accordance with ACU policy. For more details visit: www.acu.edu.au/careers  Applications close: 12-AUG-2024 at 11:59pm AUS Eastern Standard Time  ACU does not accept candidate applications submitted by external recruitment agencies through the ACU careers website.

column3: Play a pivotal role in ensuring smooth ICT operations for a NSW Government Agency committed to saving lives and creating safer communities.
column13: ICT Project Officer | 9 Month FTC | Up to $131k incl. super  $106k - $117.4k p/a + super 9 month FTC Sydney/WFH About the Role  As an ICT Project Officer with this NSW Government Agency, you will play a crucial role in managing and supporting a range of projects. You will contribute to the development and delivery of initiatives aligned with organisational objectives, ensuring they are completed on time, within budget, and to the highest quality standards.  This role is part of an intake for a number of new positions we are recruiting within the Operational Systems Program. All positions will be 9 month Fixed Term Contracts until 30th June 2025, and include leave provisions, including flex time, superannuation and leave loading.  Key Responsibilities  Provide comprehensive project management and support services, including preparing briefs, coordinating resources, maintaining project documentation, and implementing and monitoring project plans. Prepare and maintain high-quality project documentation for reporting, monitoring, and evaluation, ensuring accessibility and transparency. Engage with key stakeholders, coordinating working groups, committees, and consultations to facilitate effective communication and support project completion. Source, collate, and compile data to identify emerging issues, track progress, and report on project milestones and deliverables. Conduct research and analysis, identifying trends and preparing project briefs to support informed decision-making and planning. Collaborate with internal stakeholders to conduct post-implementation reviews, offering guidance and recommending solutions. Analyze and model impacts of proposed changes to  ICT Infrastructure for the Local Investment in Facilities and Teams Program. Coordinate and report on the delivery of ICT services across various internal and external stakeholders. Key Challenges  Collaborating with multiple stakeholders to find effective solutions to complex project challenges. Delivering a range of project management and support services within tight deadlines, limited resources, and competing priorities. Ensuring the timely and budget-compliant delivery of ICT services across a geographically dispersed emergency service agency, where operational activities can impact deliverables and stakeholder availability. About You  Relevant tertiary qualifications and/ or significant experience in projects involving the design, development and procurement of ICT Infrastructure, systems or services NSW State Government experience highly preferred Thorough knowledge of AIIMS principles and processes, and/or willingness to obtain competence within 12 months Benefits of contracting through Ashdown People  5th largest supplier to the NSW Government Get paid weekly Rated 4.9/5 on Google Reviews with over 1200 5⭐ reviews for candidate feedback this year Offer Insurances for ABN Contractors Consistent communication & transparency Detailed onboarding & support Please apply if you are interested or reach out to Georgie at georgina@ashdownpeople.com.au or 0483 907 068. Please note, only shortlisted candidates will be contacted.

column3: The 2025 GWW graduate program is now open! Gain hands-on skills and experience in the water industry and support Melbourne’s fastest-growing region.
column13: Our 2025 GWW graduate program is open to graduates who have studied in the following disciplines:   Engineering/Science  Civil  Environmental Engineering Environmental Science  Business, Arts and Economics  Arts Social Science in Public Policy Public Administration Communication Media Business International Relations Finance Business Management Economics  Information Technology and Digital  Information Technology (IT) and Computer Science Cyber Security Software Programming Data Engineering Data Science     About Greater Western Water  We’re water… and more.  GWW is a Victorian government owned water corporation that provides an essential service to some of the fastest-growing communities in Australia, stretching from Melbourne’s CBD to Lancefield in the north and Bacchus Marsh in the west. Find out more about GWW here!  Why join the GWW graduate program?  As a graduate of GWW, you will experience a range of diverse and challenging experiences through rotations in various business functions across the two years of the program and a permanent role after successful completion of the GWW Graduate Program.     Our 2025 Graduate Program at GWW will offer you:  Diverse hands-on projects. Professional training and development programs partnered with exciting networking opportunities. Ongoing support from rotational teams, mentors, buddy-system, Executive Leadership Team, and our Learning & Development Team. Undertake rotations across various GWW business functions and work on key projects with diverse stakeholders. Participate in tailored learning activities that will develop your self-awareness, leadership capability, business skills, resilience, and agility.  View what our GWW graduates have to say     Skills & Experience  A degree qualification in Engineering, Information Technology & Digital or Business & Arts. A positive attitude and a flexible approach to managing changing priorities in a fast-paced environment. High attention to detail. Excellent interpersonal skills including communication (both verbal and written) and problem solving. Ability to work autonomously and as part of a team. Commitment to professional learning and self-development. Motivation, and a strong work ethic.     See yourself thrive!  Our vision for GWW is Thriving People and Country. We aim to be as diverse as the communities we serve and are deeply committed to building a workplace where everybody thrives. We’re supportive, inclusive, and friendly, and value everyone for who they are and what they can bring.   We’re seeking applicants across all cultural backgrounds, genders, and abilities, and will make reasonable adjustments or access requirements, so please talk to us about what you need.     Don’t meet every single requirement? If you’re passionate about this role, we encourage you to apply.     Benefits  Monthly work life balance day off to treat yourself! We embrace flexibility and connection with a balance of on-site and WFH. Free onsite parking (subject to availability). Gender neutral, 16-week parental leave available from commencement. Opportunities to work across our offices in Sunbury, Footscray, Altona, Melton, and other operational sites within our service region. Free income protection and salary continuance insurance. Access to wellbeing, prayer, and sensory rooms in our Footscray and Sunbury offices. Access to our dedicated Diversity Equity and Inclusion (DEI) team and working group. Celebrating days and events of significance, including Reconciliation Week, NAIDOC week, IDAHOBIT, Pride in Water, and International Day of People with Disability. Opportunity to substitute the Australia Day public holiday for another day. Access to EAP a holistic, confidential, and complimentary counselling and coaching available to all employees, immediate family members and flatmates. Various in-house workshops such as Acknowledgement of Country, and Yan Gadbaha Cultural Safety.  Access to corporate health insurance deals with major providers. Access to LinkedIn learning.     Application Process  You will have completed your undergraduate or postgraduate qualification within the LAST three years (February 2022- February 2025) and be available to commence full-time employment by January 2025. You will need a resume and a current copy of your academic transcripts. Applicants must be Australian Citizens, New Zealand Citizens, or Australian Permanent Residents with permanent Australian working rights.  The application form will request that you upload documents to support this status. Residing in Victoria to be eligible for employment with GWW.  If you have chosen a location outside of your home State, you will need to relocate your own expense for the role.  The final selection stage will be an in-person assessment centre, which is scheduled for Monday, October 28, 2024. Throughout the two-year rotational program, you will have the opportunity to work across our offices in Sunbury, Footscray, Altona, Melton, and other operational sites within our service region. View our service region GWW is partnering with an external Graduate Consultancy for this recruitment.  Applications close: 11:59pm on Sunday 15 September    So, make a splash and kick-start your career in the water industry with GWW today!  For any enquiries, email gwwgraduates@fusiongc.com.au  Successful candidates must undergo pre-employment checks, including reference checks, qualification checks, national police checks, and working rights in Australia checks.

column3: Lead the delivery of continuous improvement initiatives within a claims management environment | Contract until Feb 2025
column13: Lime Recruitment is currently working with a large Queensland government department to recruit a Delivery Lead contract to 17/02/2025 based in the Brisbane CBD and working from home.  This role sits within the Continuous Improvement Workstream within the Claims Management function and is responsible for the successful delivery of business outcomes by leading a cross functional delivery team. The Delivery Lead will provide leadership, set direction and ensure the team is delivering the required outcomes within planned timeframes.  In this role you will:  Collaborate with Claims team representatives to identify improvement opportunities and ways to implement changes quickly and effectively.  Make informed and dynamic decisions with relevant stakeholders to prioritise and maintain the claims improvement backlog.  Lead the team day to day, running team stand ups, planning sessions and other team activities.  Identify and eliminate impediments for the team to ensure a focus on ongoing delivery of outcomes meeting business needs.  Manage risks and issues in a proactive manner.  Work with other Delivery Leaders/Project Managers to ensure plans are aligned across broader claims related work.  Communicate with leaders across the organisation to ensure transparency into delivery progress, challenges, and risks.   You will have:  Previous experience leading improvement initiatives within a claims/insurance environment Practical experience leading an iterative delivery team within a rapid delivery function Strong interpersonal skills with the ability to engage at multiple levels of an organization and engage with executive stakeholders Well-developed experience with agile planning and development tools (e.g. JIRA, Confluence). Proven experience in change management (both technical and non-technical) and building competencies that grow the capacity to deal with change more effectively.  Queensland based candidates only.  Why apply through Lime Recruitment?  Enjoy two pay runs per week without contractor fees. As a Queensland-owned agency, we offer personalised service and are a Tier 1 supplier to the Queensland Government. Awarded Australia’s top-performing small agency in 2021 and 2022, with a finalist spot in 2023. Apply now or contact Daniel Keyte on 0433 013 200 or daniel@limejobs.com.au to find out more!

Key accountabilities  Review and analyse the organisation's business intentions, services, processes and information needs to identify and document changes that lead to business improvements Undertake analysis and interpretation of organisational data to evaluate the performance of the organisation to maximise efficiencies and service to NSW Communities Undertake qualitative and quantitative research to identify trends and assist with determining business priorities Identify, analyse and document user requirements for new business solutions and enhancements   Key knowledge and experience  Developing a business analysis culture in the organization, which is faced with a constantly changing business environment and competing priorities Communicating effectively with a broad range of stakeholders with diverse backgrounds and expertise and encouraging their input into professional business analysis methodologies Applying strong analytical skills to leverage intelligence in operational and technological environments and business systems    If you would like to be considered please apply for the role by clicking the apply button or email chhavi.sharma@randstaddigital.com.au  At Randstad, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. column3: We're looking for a Process and Test Coordinator to lead the establishment, design and continual improvement of our Business Process Management
column13: Process and Test Coordinator  Transformation, Assets & Information  Temporary Full Time (to end of June 2025) LGO Level 7 $105,608 pa cash component plus superannuation  Location     At Fraser Coast Regional Council our people are our most important asset and central to achieving our purpose of Building Better Communities Together.  Committed to providing quality services to our community, we strongly support an inclusive and values driven culture, recognising your individual skills, knowledge and talent. As part of this we have implemented our Leadership Development Program - Boss to Coach and create innovative solutions to labour shortages through our TEMPO program which has been recognised by our HR peers nationally in 2022 as well as winning the LGMA 2023 excellence in innovation award. We offer career and personal development, flexible working arrangements, novated leasing, employee discount program and many other great benefits. To see more about Council and what you could achieve working with us, please visit us on LinkedIn     What we are looking for:  We’re looking for a Process and Test Coordinator to lead the establishment, design and continual improvement of our Business Process Management and Test Management Practices.   The role will involve:  Coordinate process and testing functions across BAU and Business Transformation deliveries Developing and implementing effective test strategies, plans and methodologies Provide technical support, working closely with key stakeholders to identify gaps and design workflows Facilitate quality assurance, ensuring outputs comply with guidelines and best practice  Please click here to view a full Position Description.     What you should have to apply:  You’ll have a number of years experience in a similar role and will be confident and capable leading Business Process Management and Test Management practices. This experience will include process classification frameworks, business analysis, process mapping, process modelling tools and process improvement methodologies. You will have experience leading teams and will get satisfaction from coaching and mentoring. Your strong communication skills with the ability to relate well to both internal and external clients will set you up for success.   You’ll have:  Expertise in process analysis and documentation Expertise in test management methodologies and tools Effective communication with technical teams and business stakeholders Experience within a local government setting is beneficial but not essential     What our Council can offer you:  Learning and Development opportunities Flexible working arrangements, Up to 12% employer super contribution Study assistance program  Reward and recognition 24/7 access to Employee Assistance Program  Vaccinations Paid Emergency Services leave     Application requirements:  Please apply online with your Resume and Cover Letter. For any questions, contact Deon Viljoen, Manager Architecture and Governance, on deon.viljoen@frasercoast.qld.gov.au.      Applications close:  11pm Monday 19th August 2024      Some information about our Council:  Council provides a safe, secure and supportive environment where employees are encouraged and supported to reach their full potential.  TRAITS is an acronym for the values we consider to be integral to the way we go about our work and serve our community. These values are Trust, Respect, Accountability, Initiative, Teamwork and Service.  Council recognises that it is important for employees to be satisfied in their roles, to balance work and life demands and to deliver quality services to the community.     Some information about our Region:  If you’re tired of the City lifestyle and need a better work/life balance then the Fraser Coast is waiting for you!  Located 250kms north of Brisbane the Fraser Coast is a mix of stunning landscapes, islands, cities and towns.  From K’gari - the world's largest sand island to the heritage streetscapes of Maryborough; from the rich farmlands of Tiaro, to the sheltered waters of Hervey Bay.      Before starting your application:  Please ensure your cover letter outlining your suitability for the role and resume are complete in doc, docx or pdf format. PDF format is preferred.  Please note that: Council undertakes a range of checks and assessment methods to assist in selection, including proof of vaccination where relevant, criminal history checks, Licence checks, psychometric testing, functional capacity testing and competency based testing.  Fraser Coast Regional Council is an Equal Employment Opportunity employer. Women, Aboriginal people and Torres Strait Islanders, people with a disability, and members of racial, ethnic and ethno-religious minority groups are encouraged to apply.

column3: Are you an experienced Test Analyst? Our federal client is seeking someone to provide support across their busy department -Australian Citizen Only
column13: PERSOLKELLY brings together the legacy and experience of four organisations that shaped the staffing landscape over the past century: Kelly Services, who pioneered the modern temporary help industry in 1946; SKILLED, who crafted the staffing industry in Australia in 1964; Programmed, the leading provider of operations and maintenance services across Australia and New Zealand; and PERSOLKELLY, the largest workforce solutions provider in APAC.    Test analyst will be responsible for, but not limited, to.   Working closely within Project test teams to assist the test leads developing test plans and execute and report against them. This will be achieved through working with the business' stakeholders and project development teams Developing test plans, test scenarios, and/or test scripts for a specific release. Undertaking testing activities including functional, integration and regression testing for each of these cycles. Reporting and tacking the resolution of issues as they are found in testing Assisting with Issue triaging Developing test reports  Performing other duties as directed from time-to-time by Directors/Tam Leaders or as a delegate  *Please note NV1 is preferred and Australian Citizenship is mandatory for this role.    The successful applicant is expected to have strong attention to detail, excellent customer service and communication skills.    If you meet these requirements, please apply now or for a confidential discussion please call Shannon 0475 142 223 or email shannon.whitney@persolkelly.com.au    PERSOLKELLY strives for diversity, inclusion and equality of our people. We seek a workforce that is representative of the communities we work in. We encourage people of all cultures, gender, age, sexual orientation or abilities to apply.     Who are we  At PERSOLKELLY, our passion is - and always has been - putting you first.  We propel our people forward by supporting their careers in fresh ways, backed by our expertise and capability.  We're committed to creating a safe and inclusive environment which values and respects diverse styles, backgrounds, experience and perspectives.  We welcome and encourage women, people of Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander descent and people from diverse backgrounds to apply.  So it's over to you. column3: We are looking for an IAM Architect to join an OKTA implementation!!!
column13: Initial 6 months contract Location: Hawkesbury Hybrid Work Model (3 days/ office)    Our client is looking for an IAM Architect to join an OKTA implementation. The Architect is responsible for designing, implementing, and managing the organisation's IAM solutions. This role involves working with internal technology teams and vendors to facilitate creation of robust security systems.  Key Responsibilities:   Help IDAM project develop and implement IAM architecture and frameworks that align with the organisation's security policies and regulatory requirements. Review vendor produced designs and documentation for role-based access control (RBAC), single sign-on (SSO), multi-factor authentication (MFA), and identity governance. Evaluate IAM tools implementation and test plans based on industry best practices and organisational needs. Help develop and enforce IAM policies, standards    Essential Skills and Experience:     Bachelor's Degree in the field of Computer Science, Information Technology, Cyber Security, or a related field. Master' Degree a plus. Minimum of 5-7 years' experience in IAM, information security, or related fields, with at least 3 years' experience in an architectural or leadership role. Relevant certifications such as Certified Information Systems Security Professional (CISSP), Certified Identity and Access Manager (CIAM), or Certified Information Security Manager (CISM) are preferred. Strong understanding of IAM principles, technologies, best practices Experience with IAM tools and platforms (eg Okta, SailPoint, Microsoft Azure AD, Ping Identity), preferably Okta. Proficiency in scripting and automation languages (eg Python, PowerShell). Excellent problem solving and analytical skills.      For more info contact Aparna on Aparna.Sharma@peoplebank.com.au   Diversity and inclusion are strongly supported at Peoplebank. People of all nationalities, gender identities, and cultural backgrounds, including Aboriginal and Torres Strait Islander Peoples, are encouraged to apply.

column3: We are currently seeking a talented Data Engineering/Systems Integrator to join our team
column13: Location: Canberra Security Clearance: NV2 / TSPV Required  Rubix Solutions is a leading provider of innovative IT solutions, specializing in custom software development and system integration. We are committed to delivering excellence and driving digital transformation for our clients. We are currently seeking a talented Data Engineering/Systems Integrator to join our team in Canberra.  Role Overview: As a Data Engineering/Systems Integrator at Rubix Solutions, you will be responsible for designing, implementing, and maintaining data engineering solutions. You will work with a variety of tools and technologies to integrate large unstructured data sources, ensuring data quality and consistency in data engineering approaches.  Required Skills:  Significant technical configuration experience on the TechnologyOne product suite. Expertise in designing, implementing, and maintaining data engineering solutions, including ETL/ELT/orchestration tools. Experience with integrating large unstructured data sources. Ability to build well-tested and documented tooling and techniques that ensure consistency in data engineering approaches. Proficiency in data pre-processing techniques such as transformation, integration, normalization, and feature extraction to create useful data structures. Ability to define and ensure data quality using checking and remediation processes. Demonstrated ability to develop technical documentation and track work in collaboration tools such as Confluence and JIRA. Willingness to apply existing data engineering skills within Palantir Foundry and develop expertise in the platform. Desirable Skills and Experience:  Experience with containerization and container orchestration. Experience in integrating and building APIs. How to Apply: Interested candidates who meet the above requirements are encouraged to apply. Please submit your resume and cover letter detailing your relevant experience and qualifications.  If this sounds like a match, we'd love to talk to you! Feel free to apply directly or reach out to Stephanie - Stephanie@rubixsolutions.net.au

column3: Our client is seeking an IT Planning Manager to collaborate with PMO technical teams to estimate time, costs, and resources required for new projects
column13: This role will be focused on estimating and taking care of costings and resources, in order to effectively build business cases for a pipeline of potential projects.  Client Details  Our client is a nationwide freight operator, moving carbon and agricultural commodities, that is incredibly well-established in the industry.  Description  Collaborate with project and technical teams to estimate the time, cost, and resources required for potential new projects. Analyse historical data and utilise estimation techniques to improve accuracy. Develop and effectively build business cases to support the above. Excellent stakeholder engagement skills. Analyse current resource capacity against upcoming project demands. Forecast future resource needs and develop plans to address potential shortages or surpluses.  Profile  Ability to analyse data and effectively put together a business plan. Excellent verbal and written communication skills for interacting with stakeholders. Understanding of project management methodologies and tools. Familiarity with technology projects and the skills required for various roles. Experience with resource management tools, spreadsheets, and project management software.  Job Offer  This is an opportunity for a long-term contract, analysing and kick starting very exciting pieces of work, within a positive and supportive working environment.  To apply online please click the 'Apply' button below. For a confidential discussion about this role please contact Jaclyn Rahme on +61 431 983 002 or email jaclynrahme@michaelpage.com.au

column3: Solutions Architect is responsible for the digital enablement of development teams, solution design and architecture along with technical leadership.
column13: About the role  Based in Brisbane the Solutions Architect is responsible for the digital enablement of development teams, solution design and architecture along with technical leadership and innovation.  Working with a family-friendly team, we offer a supportive hybrid work environment with flexible work from home arrangements. We encourage work-life balance and celebrate additional leave over the Christmas/New Year period and through other flexible leave entitlements.    Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities  Some of the key responsibilities of this role are:  Examine business challenges and opportunities related to digital products, identify solution options, evaluate feasibility, and outline approaches for solution delivery. Identify and address technical risks and issues, ensuring solutions comply with industry standards, legal requirements, and software development standards and best practices. Provide feedback to the development team on the best sequence for product roadmaps from a technical delivery perspective. Document approaches for product solution platform development and quality standards, ensuring alignment with enterprise architecture standards and best practices. Lead the analysis and modelling of product data by leveraging a deep understanding of the problem domain and corporate information needs to establish, revise, or maintain data structures and their components. Collaborate with the development team to comprehend development challenges, identify design patterns at the solution platform level, and plan the implementation of chosen design patterns. Enhance design patterns and developer productivity by coordinating and contributing to the creation of tools, templates, libraries, and framework. Identify solution platform development and integration change impacts and work with platform teams and technical change managers to plan and coordinate platform changes. Work collaboratively with UX/UI and the wider team to define and improve the user experience.   About You  As the ideal candidate, you will have 5+ years’ experience as a Solutions Architect with cloud platforms. You will have experience with internal stakeholder management, have exceptional problem solving skills and bring a solutions focused mindset.  You will have:  About You  Minimum of 5 years’ experience as Solutions Architect University degree in the field of computer science or software engineering or possesses Solutions Architect certifications. Experience with microservices architecture and container deployment Docker; experienced in orchestrating with Kubernetes on Azure Kubernetes Service (AKS) or Amazon Elastic Kubernetes Service (EKS). Proficiency in cloud platforms (AWS, Azure) and their native services. Expertise in various technology stacks and programming languages (.NET, Java, JavaScript, C#, Node.js Typescript, and React). Strong understanding of database architecture (SQL, NoSQL). Experience with Azure, including DevOps Build/Release pipelines, App Services, and Azure SQL. Proficient in RESTful API design, using JSON Schema for API-first, entity-based programming, and service-oriented architecture (SOA).     Application Process  If the above position sounds like an opportunity for you, please apply with your CV and cover letter addressing the essential requirements of the role.  Applications close, 18th August 2024  No agency applications will be accepted at this time.  Further information and the position description can be found on the NHVR Careers site - https://careers.nhvr.gov.au/jobs/search. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact the NHVR recruitment team on recruitment@nhvr.gov.au.  Successful applicants will be required to complete a national police and work rights check.  We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.  About us  The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) commenced operations in 2013 as the national entity responsible for regulating all vehicles in Australia over 4.5 tonnes gross vehicle mass. The NHVR minimises the compliance burden on the heavy vehicle transport industry, reduces duplication and inconsistences across state and territory borders, and ultimately for the heavy vehicle business with government in Australia.  We are headquartered in Brisbane and employ more than 900 people across the ACT, New South Wales, Queensland, South Australia, Tasmania and Victoria.

column3: Senior Data Engineer, multiple temporary opportunities up to June 2026 Locations are flexible across NSW with hybrid working
column13: Senior Data Engineer, multiple temporary opportunities up to June 2026  Locations are flexible across NSW with hybrid working  Revenue NSW is transforming tax compliance with the innovative Better Revenue Outcomes program. We're investing in data matching and visualisation, improving how we detect non-compliance and enhancing digital communication - all to help our customers better understand their tax obligations. The program will deliver an additional $568m in revenue over 4 years.  An exciting ongoing opportunity has arisen for a Senior Data Engineer to join the Better Revenue Outcomes team in Revenue NSW Digital Taxes.  In this hands-on role you will provide technical advice and services in the development of data products and data-related services to support the achievement of business outcomes and strategic goals for the benefit of NSW citizens.  The role will also drive development of data processing frameworks and data architectural approaches scaled to current and future business demands.  You will be joining a friendly, fast-paced, dynamic and diverse team who is passionate about keeping people and places safe.  In this role you will:   Design, develop, and maintain scalable data pipelines. Collaborate with stakeholders and senior leaders to understand data needs and deliver high-quality data solutions. Contribute to ongoing management of data management systems and solutions including enhancements, capacity management, performance monitoring, troubleshooting and resolution of technical issues to ensure effective and optimal usage of systems and resources Implement data integration solutions to consolidate data from various sources, ensuring data accuracy, integrity, and availability. Optimize data storage and retrieval processes to enhance performance and efficiency. Monitor and troubleshoot data pipelines to ensure reliability and performance. Stay current with emerging technologies and industry trends and apply this knowledge to improve our data infrastructure.  Skills and experience required:   Hand on development experience in Python and SQL with thorough knowledge of coding standards Minimum 3 years of data warehouse experience. [SL3][SS4] Knowledge of version control Understanding of ETL processes and concepts Experience in agile/scrum development practices Excellent communication and problem-solving skills An ability to build and foster collaborative relationships with external and internal stakeholders   What we need from you:   An up-to-date CV and a brief cover letter outlining how your skills and experience are aligned to the role. For enquiries regarding this position, please contact Shemai Liang via Shemai.Liang@revenue.nsw.gov.au. column3: We are seeking a highly skilled Program/Project Delivery Lead to join this dynamic team for a six-month initial contract based in Perth.
column13: Program/Project Delivery Lead  Location: Perth, Australia  Duration: 6-Month Initial Contract     Are you a strategic thinker with a knack for financial management and a passion for delivering successful projects? We are seeking a highly skilled Project Delivery Lead to join this dynamic team for a six-month initial contract based in Perth.     Role Overview     As a Delivery Lead, you will:     Direct and Oversee Program Workstreams: Manage budgeting, financial reporting, and ensure strategic alignment with D&T timelines. Champion Prioritisation and Sequencing: Align initiatives with key milestones to ensure coherence. Facilitate Business Case Creation: Streamline the process for D&T budgets and initiatives. Cultivate Stakeholder Relationships: Foster collaboration and engagement with Business Unit stakeholders. Lead Governance Efforts: Deliver comprehensive reports on budget, scope, and project metrics while maintaining standardized documentation. Enforce Project Controls: Manage program risks/issues, lessons learned, and ensure accurate budget management. Optimize Program Budgets: Seek consolidation opportunities to minimize expenses and enhance forecast accuracy. Mentor Delivery Teams: Enhance financial literacy and adherence to delivery frameworks. Manage Project Meetings: Track progress, address critical issues, and escalate concerns proactively. Coordinate Show-Back Sessions: Demonstrate progress and foster stakeholder communication. Lead Finance/WBS: Ensure project components are organized and integrated. Drive Continuous Improvement: Identify and implement enhancements within the program.     Success Criteria     Alignment of program delivery with business case outcomes. Efficient creation and approval of business cases. Accurate reporting to stakeholders on program status. Transparent financial and progress tracking. Effective risk and issue management. Clear data communication for informed decision-making. Supportive collaboration for Business Unit initiative success.     Required Skills     Financial Management: Proficiency in budgeting, financial reporting, and cost management, including Excel. Prioritization and Sequencing: Ability to prioritize and sequence initiatives effectively. Business Case Development: Experience in creating well-written, succinct business cases and initiative briefs. Reporting and Communication: Ability to create meaningful reports for stakeholders and communicate effectively. Project Management: Understanding of project management and delivery frameworks. Governance: Experience in governance/PMO and maintaining standardized documentation. Organization: Highly organized, capable of managing risks, keeping accurate notes, and meeting deadlines. Continuous Improvement: Drive for identifying and implementing program enhancements. SAP Finance Module Knowledge: Highly regarded.     Application Process     If you are a proactive leader with a commitment to excellence and a track record of successful program delivery, we want to hear from you. Apply now to join our team and make a significant impact on our initiatives.     How to Apply     If you are ready to take on this exciting challenge and contribute to our organisation’s success, please submit your resume and a cover letter detailing your experience and suitability for the role to scotta@spellerinternational.com.au     SPELLER INTERNATIONAL - SAP Recruitment Specialists

column3: Responsible for leading, managing, developing, and implementing innovative management strategies to deliver key business systems and processes.
column13: About the role  Based in Brisbane the Project Manager is responsible for leading, managing, developing, and implementing innovative management strategies to deliver key business systems and processes along with training and educational activities to employees.  Working with a family-friendly team, we offer a supportive hybrid work environment with flexible work from home arrangements. We encourage work-life balance and celebrate additional leave over the Christmas/New Year period and through other flexible leave entitlements.    Key Responsibilities/Accountabilities  Some of the key responsibilities of this role are:  Deliver and manage key projects and initiatives. Deliver and follow through with project plans including budgets, resource management, and risk management. Monitor the progress of projects to ensure milestones and performance indicators are met and prepare project status reports for the Executive and relevant governance committees. Undertake post-implementation reviews and reporting. Investigate and negotiate change proposals with the relevant stakeholders. Develop, implement, and maintain a framework and methods for effective communication to inform and engage relevant stakeholders. Communicate with key stakeholders and decision-makers. Resolves issues to ensure progress is maintained. Assure the quality and timely delivery of products and outcomes by vendors where appropriate. Establish and manage contracts with vendors both for the implementation activities an ongoing delivery of support activities where appropriate.   About You  As the ideal candidate, you will have 5+ years’ experience as a Project Manager with experience in GIS/Spatial projects and/or in legacy technology modernization projects. You will have exceptional stakeholder engagement skills and bring a solutions and customer first approach. You will have experience working on a variety of different projects at any given time and pride yourself on bringing stakeholders along the journey to delivery.  You will have:  About You  Minimum of 5 years’ experience as Project Manager   Agile Project Manager/Scrum Master experience under the Agile SCRUM methodology. Extensive experience in managing medium to large and/or complex programs of work. Demonstrated experience ensuring projects are completed on time, on budget, to quality standards and within agreed scope. Experience in managing projects involving spatial/GIS data, solutions and/or platforms (highly regarded) Experience in managing projects involving legacy technology/applications modernization (highly regarded) Experience in Agile methodology and use of DevOps. Experience delivering projects that have intra-program dependencies. Highly developed analytical, conceptual, problem-solving, and organisational skills with an ability to meet priorities, and competing deadlines and use of sound judgment in decision making. Demonstrated strong written communication skills including the ability to clearly and concisely articulate complex issues and risks in high-level documentation including test reports or briefings. Demonstrated high level of interpersonal, negotiation, and communication skills, both written and oral, including demonstrated ability to liaise effectively with internal and external key stakeholders. Demonstrated ability to work as part of a team of people to provide consistent, responsive, and high-quality advice and project support.  Application Process  If the above position sounds like an opportunity for you, please apply with your CV and cover letter addressing the essential requirements of the role.  Applications close, 18th August 2024  No agency applications will be accepted at this time.  Further information and the position description can be found on the NHVR Careers site - https://careers.nhvr.gov.au/jobs/search. If you have any questions, please don’t hesitate to contact the NHVR recruitment team on recruitment@nhvr.gov.au.  Successful applicants will be required to complete a national police and work rights check.  We are committed to being an inclusive, diverse and flexible workplace where differences are valued. We welcome applications from people of all backgrounds, experience and abilities.  About us  The National Heavy Vehicle Regulator (NHVR) commenced operations in 2013 as the national entity responsible for regulating all vehicles in Australia over 4.5 tonnes gross vehicle mass. The NHVR minimises the compliance burden on the heavy vehicle transport industry, reduces duplication and inconsistences across state and territory borders, and ultimately for the heavy vehicle business with government in Australia.

column3: Data Engineer required to work on a large mission-critical cloud security program for an intelligence community customer. Great team + top rates.
column13: As a result of a secured engagement with one of our National Security partners, Helix requires a Data Engineer / System Integrator to join us on a long-term contract (12 months with expected extensions).  We're looking for a Data Engineer / System Integrator with proven experience of solving complex problems, who thrives working as part of a team to push boundaries and is passionate about leveraging technology to produce world-class outcomes for critical intelligence and national security customers.    NV2 clearance is a minimum requirement however TSPV is preferred.   Data Engineer / System Integrator key responsibilities:  Required to undertake significant Technical configuration on the TechnologyOne product suite. Designs, implements, and maintains data engineering solutions, and experience with ETL/ELT/orchestration tools. Experience with integrating large unstructured data sources Build tooling and techniques which are well tested, documented and provides consistency in data engineering approaches. Ability to fuse data sources using various data pre-processing techniques such as transformation, integration, normalisation, and feature extraction to create useful data structures. Ability to define and ensure data quality using checking and remediation processes Demonstrated ability to develop technical documentation and track work in collaboration tools such as Confluence and JIRA. Willingness to apply existing data engineering skills within Palantir Foundry, and develop expertise in the platform. Containerisation and container orchestration. Integrating and building APIs.  Helix is a specialist in the national security consulting and talent provision space, we are passionate about what we do and how our work positively impacts Australians.  If you are mission-focussed and would like to make a difference during your next assignment, get in touch with us to hear about what we have coming up at hello@helixservices.com.au

column13: *Closing Date: 5PM Friday 9 August 2024  face2face reference:  619312  Location: Canberra, ACT, Sydney, NSW, Melbourne, VIC  (Choose one)   Hours: Full-time Contract length:  12 Months Contract + 2x12 Months extension  Entry requirements: Must have Baseline (Minimum)  Pay range: $120.00 to 130.00 Hourly, inc super    About the role:   The role requires skills in full stack development, including proficiency in frameworks such as React, JavaScript, TypeScript, GraphQL, Next.js, .NET, Node.js, Python, or Java. Experience with both relational and document databases is essential, along with a solid understanding of dev-ops practices and tools. Candidates should also be adept at using design systems and design-ops tools like Figma or Storybook. Strong problem-solving and analytical abilities are crucial for managing scalable solutions and leading projects effectively.   Duties  Develop scalable solutions across the full stack, including design, coding, testing, and deployment. Manage release scheduling, tools, and processes for software delivery. Apply modelling techniques and create detailed design specifications. Provide technical expertise for system configuration and integration. Design and automate test plans, ensuring thorough coverage and reporting. Maintain application performance, uptime, and code quality. Lead new projects from conceptualisation to deployment. Use agile methodologies and pursue continuous learning.  Required experience/skills  Bachelor's or Master’s degree in Computer Science or a related field and/or 2-4 years of industry experience Experience with dev-ops practices and tools Experience with frameworks such as React, JavaScript, TypeScript, GraphQL, Next.js, .NET, Node.js, Python or Java. Experience with relational and document databases. Experience with design systems. Desired experience with design-ops tools including Figma and Storybook or similar. column3: Seeking a Senior Project Manager who has delivered regulatory change project and ideally has supplier management experience.
column13: PM-Partners group is a specialist Project Management Consultancy. We have a unique way of running projects and providing training and advice, so our clients get the best results with less cost and risk. Each year we deliver over $3B of projects, train over 10,000 people, and help some of Australia’s leading brands improve their PMOs.       We are seeking a skilled Senior Project Manager to lead a crucial work stream within the CPS230 project. This role involves overseeing third-party supplier management and driving improvements in our governance model. The ideal candidate will be experienced in supplier management and regulatory change-driven projects, with the ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment.     Key Responsibilities:  Lead and manage the work stream focused on third-party supplier oversight for the CPS230 project. Enhance and refine the governance model for how third parties supply to the business. Develop and implement strategies for future operating models that effectively govern supplier relationships. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to ensure project objectives are met efficiently and effectively. Navigate regulatory changes and ensure business-focused outcomes are achieved. Manage relationships with third-party suppliers to ensure alignment with project goals and governance standards.  What We’re Looking For:  Track record of managing regulatory change-driven projects with a strong business focus. Proven experience in supplier management and overseeing third-party relationships. Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced and dynamic environment. Strong leadership, communication, and organisational skills. Experience with operating model enhancements is highly desirable.  What we can offer you!   Culture: A fun, fast paced, collaborative delivery environment  People: A group of talented, experienced, and dedicated Consultants to work by your side with a dedicated Relationship Manager  Passion: Ability to band together when under pressure to deliver first class results to clients  Transparency: Open door policy  Professional Development: On the job development and access to certifications in our Training practice  Care and Support: On-going support and advice from experienced PM-Partners Consultants  Knowledge: Access to PM-Partners Delivery and Advisory practices   If you feel you meet our selection criteria, please submit your resume to Paul Woodhead at PM-Partners via LinkedIn or SEEK application or email –  paulw@pm-partners.com.au

column2: Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment & Water
column3: Play a pivotal role in shaping our digital transformation strategy and driving business success through the effective analysis of complex requirements
column13: Do you want your work to make a difference for NSW?  Working to protect the state’s environment and heritage.     Join a world-class organisation and make a difference to the environment. Thrive in a supportive, collaborative and creative environment. Senior Business Analyst - Temporary (Up to 30th June’25) full-time Office location – Parramatta, NSW, Hybrid working supported Environment Officer Grade 9 Salary relative to experience, and ranges from $116,059 to $129,288 + super  As we embark on our Biodiversity Offsets Scheme Digital Transformation Program, we are seeking a highly talented Senior Business Analyst to play a pivotal role in this transformative journey.     About You  As a Senior Business Analyst, you will play a pivotal role in shaping our digital transformation strategy and driving business success through the effective analysis of complex requirements and the delivery of innovative solutions. You will collaborate closely with stakeholders across various departments to understand business needs, identify opportunities for improvement and develop actionable insights to support decision-making.     Responsibilities  Work closely with a diverse range of stakeholders to gather and analyse business requirements. Conduct thorough analysis of current systems and processes and identify areas for improvement and optimisation Handle ambiguity and provide options for complex situations to ensure effective decision-making. Decision and document business processes, workflows and system requirements. Develop detailed business and functional specifications, user stories and acceptance criteria. Collaborate with technical teams to translate business requirements into technical specifications. Lead stakeholder workshops and meetings and facilitate discussions to gather requirements and drive alignment. Provide guidance and support to project teams throughout the development lifecycle. Conduct impact assessments and risk analysis to ensure successful implementation of proposed solutions. Monitor project progress and identify potential risks or roadblocks. Stay updated on industry trends and best practices to drive continuous improvement and innovation. Communicate effectively with stakeholders at all levels to ensure transparency and alignment throughout the project lifecycle.      For more information read the full Role Description: Senior Business Analyst  For more information from LinkedIn hit Apply to visit the iworkfor.nsw.gov.au website.     Who we are  The Department of Climate Change, Energy, the Environment and Water (DCCEEW) works to protect the state’s environment and heritage. It leads the way on climate change, driving the sustainable transition to a net zero economy, powered by affordable, reliable, and clean energy.  DCCEEW conserves and protects the state’s natural environment. It manages the NSW national park estate, including its rich and diverse biodiversity and Aboriginal cultural heritage for future generations.  DCCEEW also ensures sustainable management of water resources across the state, to support the environment, communities and industry.  We acknowledge the ongoing custodial responsibilities of the Aboriginal peoples of NSW to care for Country and water and are committed to establishing meaningful partnerships with Aboriginal peoples in the management of the environment.     Participation in the NSW Biodiversity Offsets Scheme (BOS) & BCT’s Private Land Conservation (PLC) Programs  All new employees with an existing defined interest in the BOS will be required to disclose their personal (or a close family member’s) participation to ensure potential conflicts are managed appropriately. In some circumstances this may require divestment of the interest.  The BCT also has restrictions on staff participation in its funded PLC programs. No additional funding, beyond that already agreed to by the BCT, may be sought or approved during time as a BCT employee or for a 12-month period following termination of employment.  The Department is committed to protecting the public interest and public trust in the exercise of its functions. These values, together with transparency and accountability, are integral to the administration of the BOS and PLC programs.  If you (or a close family member) participate in the BOS scheme or already hold a funded agreement with the BCT and require further information before submitting your application, please contact the hiring manager. The BOS protocol is available publicly here.     To Apply  If excited by the information above, we look forward to receiving your application, including a copy of your resume and cover letter expressing your interest and suitability for the role.     Applications close Monday 19th August 2024 at 11:55PM.  Should you require further information about the role please contact Ridhima Gulati at ridhima.gulati@dpie.nsw.gov.au.  A recruitment pool may be created for ongoing and temporary opportunities of the same role or role type that may become available over the next 18 months.     Looking for more information or assistance in applying?  Our Diversity team can assist to:  provide alternative formats to apply make adjustments to the recruitment process offer information about workplace adjustments and support networks  We encourage people with disability to apply. If you have disability and require more information on adjustments and assistance to apply, contact the Diversity team on Diversity@DPIE.nsw.gov.au  (please include reference number). If you are an Aboriginal or Torres Strait Islander check out Our Mob on Country to see the work we do and get assistance in applying.  Find us on Facebook, Instagram, and LinkedIn.  Find us here: https://www.facebook.com/nswdcceew http://www.instagram.com/nswdcceew  https://twitter.com/nswdcceew  http://www.youtube.com/@nswdcceew https://www.linkedin.com/company/

column3: Developer required to work on a large mission-critical cloud security program for an intelligence community customer. Great team + top rates.
column13: As a result of a secured engagement with one of our National Security partners, Helix requires a Platform Application Developer to join us on a long-term contract (12 months with expected extensions).  We're looking for a Platform Application Developer with proven experience of solving complex problems, who thrives working as part of a team to push boundaries and is passionate about leveraging technology to produce world-class outcomes for critical intelligence and national security customers.    NV2 clearance minimum requirement however TSPV is preferred  Platform Application Developer key essential responsibilities:  Ability to develop code in one or more programming languages. (e.g. C#, Java, FastAPI, React, Python). Strong problem-solving skills. Knowledge and experience with software development practices and an aptitude for software configuration and maintenance Demonstrated ability to develop technical documentation and track work in collaboration tools such as Confluence and JIRA. Source Control (GitLab, BitBucket). Willingness to apply existing software developer skills within Palantir Foundry, and develop expertise in the platform.  Platform Application Developer desirable experience & capability:  Containerisation and container orchestration. Configuration-as-code workflows and deployment mechanisms. Integrating and building APIs. Networking, virtualisation, OS and server management Information, network and application security. Experience in data storage platforms and distributed data processing frameworks such as Hadoop or Spark. Familiarity with Palantir’s Foundry platform is desirable but not essential as training will be provided on-the-job. Familiarity with similar systems (Databricks, Snowflake, Informatica, TIBCO, Denodo etc.) would also be helpful. Experience with cloud computing services like AWS, Azure or Google Cloud  Helix is a specialist in the national security consulting and talent provision space, we are passionate about what we do and how our work positively impacts Australians.  If you are mission-focussed and would like to make a difference during your next assignment, get in touch with us to hear about what we have coming up at hello@helixservices.com.au

column3: 12 month Cyber Operations Detection and Response Specialist contract role with ASX-leading organisation in their industry. M365 security. Crowdstrike.
column13: Decipher Bureau are seeking a skilled and motivated Managed Detection and Response Specialist to join a leading ASX-listed business who are committed to safeguarding their digital assets against cyber threats.  Reporting directly to the Cyber Security Operations Lead you will own and deliver effective cyber security incident detection and response capability. This includes the uplift and maintenance of detection and response platforms that form their defence-in-depth posture.  This is a Brisbane-based, hybrid working position.   The day to day:  Lead and coordinate the containment, response and recovery activities from cyber security Support all incident response efforts and maintain incident response tools and processes. Develop playbooks, document standard operating procedures and response strategies for detection rules. Collaborate with Cyber Managed Service Providers and provide high-level advice and guidance for cyber security incident remediation or improvements. Analyse latest malware and vulnerability discoveries to enhance capabilities and where applicable, apply mitigations to reduce the likelihood and impact to systems and services. Develop and recommend enhanced detection rules and capabilities, automating defence capabilities where possible. Own, manage and deliver uplift and tuning opportunities into the relevant detection and response platforms. Effectively manage post incident reviews and undertake initiatives to remediate weaknesses in preventative or detective controls. Contribute to the planning, optimisation and implementation of maturity uplifts for Cyber Operations. This includes but is not limited to Microsoft Defender and CrowdStrike products  How to apply?  APPLY NOW or email marcus@decipherbureau.com if any questions.  *Only candidates in AU with full working rights will be considered.   Decipher Bureau and the clients we partner with are committed to creating a diverse environment and are proud to be equal opportunity employers. All qualified applicants will be considered for employment without attention to race, colour, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, veteran or disability status.

Meraki skills are ideal - Experience with Wireless Networking including site surveys - Palo Alto firewall experience - Documentation and written skills – ability to concisely put together and manage e.g. Change Requests, Solution Designs etc - Ability to manage and implement small technical projects - Proven experience in monitoring, managing and maintaining LAN/WAN and MPLS networks - Experience provisioning, and supporting third party carriage services such as Megaport, Telstra Internet, MPLS - Beneficial: Azure network experience (IaaS, PaaS) - Beneficial: Datacentre migration experience - Beneficial: Understanding of cloud proxy services (e.g. Netskope) - Beneficial: Knowledge of security landscape and toolsets (eg MSFT Sentinel) - Beneficial: Knowledge of AD/Office365 and associated Microsoft services Experience with OT devices Experience working at manufacturing or warehouses Familiarity with Azure cloud and cybersecurity in cloud environments Excellent communication and interpersonal skills Ability to work independently and collaboratively in a fast-paced environment Strong problem-solving and decision-making abilities Project management experience is a plus APPLY NOW!  tom.morgan@ethan.com.au REF:2242J

column3: You will play a vital role in reviewing and analyzing the business intentions, services, processes and information for Business improvement.
column13: Senior Business Analyst | $120,859 - $133,183 + super | Sydney   $120,859 - $133,183 + super Fixed-term Contract until June 2025  Sydney Our Client saves lives and creates safer communities through a trusted, volunteer-based emergency service, excelling in community preparedness and emergency response. Our volunteers and staff work closely with partners to modernize and grow volunteering efforts, focusing on flood, storm operations, and tsunamis, while also providing general rescue services in rural areas.    About the role:   The Senior Business Analyst reviews and analyzes business intentions, services, processes, and information needs to identify and document changes for business improvements. The role involves consulting with stakeholders to map existing and future business processes for effectiveness and efficiency across different areas within the business.  Key accountabilities include:  Manage and support the implementation of strategic and project-related business intelligence solutions and reporting frameworks to enable organizational performance, evidence-based decision making and accountability • Consult with stakeholders to aid in the mapping of existing and future business processes to ensure effectiveness and efficiency across the NSW SES Role Description Manager Business Optimization 2 • Analyze and measure performance against organizational goals and objectives, identifying and supporting business process improvements. • Lead a team to facilitate requirements gathering for projects and process improvements to develop and support business intelligence and strategic planning processes and implementation of strategic initiatives. • Developing, analyzing and reviewing business intelligence, analytics and metrics to support improved organizational performance and business outcomes • Collaborate with internal and external stakeholders to influence business process improvement, support and monitor strategic delivery and promote organizational efficiency and effectiveness. • Lead, manage and plan to ensure effective and compliant utilization of assets and resources (includes encouraging and supporting mobility, responsibility for budget/financial performance, and compliance with governance, work health & safety and other requirements.  About You:   Demonstrated experience in complex process mapping and requirements gathering • Demonstrated experience in business process improvement and/or business intelligence and reporting • Thorough knowledge of AIIMS principles and processes, and/or willingness to obtain competence within 12 months Benefits of contracting through Ashdown People  5th largest supplier to the NSW Government Get paid weekly Rated 4.9/5 on Google Reviews with over 1200 5 ⭐ reviews for candidate feedback this year Offer Insurances for ABN Contractors Consistent communication & transparency Detailed onboarding & support If you are interested please contact sorcha@ashdownpeople.com.au or call on 0483950962.
