column3: Product Owner
column13: Overview  Our commercial client in the financial services industry is seeking an experienced Digital Product Owner to join on an initial 12 month contract engagement with view for extensions. As the Digital Product Owner you will join a team building the digital foundation for a key arm of the business, on a 2 year program of work.  This role is perfect for a strategic thinker with a strong background in heavily regulated environments, and specific experience in mobile applications, portals, and websites. If you are passionate about driving digital product success and thrive in fast-paced settings, we want to hear from you.  Responsibilities Define and communicate the digital product vision and strategy to stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and prioritize product requirements. Develop and maintain the product backlog, ensuring it aligns with business goals. Lead the planning, development, and launch of new features and enhancements. Monitor product performance and user feedback to drive continuous improvement. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Act as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries and decisions. Facilitate agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives. Build the digital foundation for our products, focusing on websites, portals, and mobile apps. Skills Proven experience as a Digital Product Owner in the financial services or a heavily regulated industry. Strong expertise in developing and managing mobile applications, portals, and websites. Excellent understanding of agile methodologies and frameworks. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Experience with product management tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar. Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field (preferred).  If you are a dedicated and results-driven professional looking to make an impact in a dynamic and challenging environment, apply now to join our team!  Contact Details  For a confidential discussion about the role, contact Naomi via naomi@exclaim-it.com.au.

column3: H2O.ai, AI, Devops, iterative, Dataops, Modelops, Tableau, SQL, Power BI, BI
column13: Our client is looking for a Lead Data Scientist with experience in the Financial Services industry. Please send your detailed resume.   The role requires the following essential skills      Required Skills:  Proven experience in a data science or analytics role, with a strong track record of developing and deploying advanced analytical models and data products to enable business outcomes. Proficiency in programming languages such as Python, PyTorch, Java and/or Scala, and proven experience with AI frameworks and libraries. Demonstrable experience with PaaS/iPaaS database technologies, preferably with an exposure to Azure. Demonstrable experience with data visualisation tools (e.g., Tableau, Power BI) and proficiency in SQL for data manipulation and querying. Oversee data quality management and stewardship across all data products, including rigorous data quality standards, implementing processes for regular data quality checks, and ensuring the accuracy, consistency, and utility of data used and generated by data products. Strong experience with the H2O.ai platform, including its auto ML capabilities, support for diverse machine learning algorithms, scalability for big data, and seamless integration with various data sources. Demonstrated experience with ModelOps practices, such as feature engineering, prompt engineering, model training, deployment and validation practices, ensuring scalability, reliability and compliance standards are met. Proven experience with DataOps practices such as automating, orchestrating, and monitoring of data pipelines and assuring data quality and security standards.  Experience with DevOps practices, ensuring the seamless integration between development and operations via continuous integration and delivery, and automated testing and deployment strategies. Experience in iterative development. Desirable, experience in the Financial services industry.   If the above aligns with your skills and experience and looks like a good career opportunity, then please email your detailed resume in a Word format to resume to aroop.banerjee@globalinfrastructure.com.au  For any clarifications, please contact Aroop Banerjee on: 0409 339 957

column3: An initial 6 month contract, to work in Brisbane CBD, as a Business Analyst, working on 2 projects within a large program of work. SaaS | Payments
column13: With a number of projects needing to be delivered over the next 4 years, we are looking for a Business Analyst to work across 2 key projects within the program.  The Booking and Ticketing Project that will source and implement a new and modern enterprise booking and ticketing solution that will replace a number of legacy solutions for the benefit of customers and staff. The Customer Centric Payments Project that will implement a new and modern payment environment for the benefit of customers and staff.    The Business Analyst role is a unique and critical role for the success of both projects. This role takes the business needs and processes and matches them to the technical solution enabling the business to understand how the solution will work. They also define the functional requirements that will go into any procurement processes for suppliers.     Role Overview:  This role will report to the Project Managers for both the Booking and Ticketing (B&T) and the Customer Centric Payments (CCP) projects and will be responsible for determining and providing details of the solution to assist in the implementation of both the new payments environment and the booking and ticketing solution.     Key responsibilities of the role:  Work with the other Business Analysts and Solution and Integration Architects to define the solutions for both projects, this includes:  Defining new business processes Defining functional requirements Ensuring business expectations are met by the defined solution  Being part of the procurement process in defining the suppliers' requirements and evaluating responses.  Work with the suppliers, integration teams and system developers to ensure the solution developed and implemented meets the expectations of all stakeholders..     Essential Requirements for this role:  Experience in the Payments domain and understanding of modern payment offerings. At least 3 years as a Business Analyst. Experience implementing a SaaS solution in a complex environment. Experience in having worked on multiple complex projects at once. Experience in Booking & Ticketing, Event Management. Excellent communication skills. Experience in working with virtual (and shared) teams. Highly developed written skills (documentation, communications, and presentations). Highly organised with a focus on deliverables and able to work to deadlines as required. Attention to detail. Strong ability to liaise with a range of stakeholders. Strong emotional intelligence. Ability to perceive, manage, understand, and reason with emotions, as a team member, when working with others and when identifying the needs of disparate stakeholders with sensitivity. Ability to adapt and change approaches, solutions and processes when required.    All Randstad Digital contractors receive:  Access to a Udemy licence for ongoing learning and continuous professional development Access to exclusive discounts across various platforms Discounts on private health funds Novated leasing options    For more information, or a swift response, please email summer.hall@randstaddigital.com.au or apply now.  At Randstad Digital, we are passionate about providing equal employment opportunities and embracing diversity to the benefit of all. We actively encourage applications from any background.

column13: Overview  Our commercial client in the financial services industry is seeking an experienced Digital Product Owner to join on an initial 12 month contract engagement with view for extensions. As the Digital Product Owner you will join a team building the digital foundation for a key arm of the business, on a 2 year program of work.  This role is perfect for a strategic thinker with a strong background in heavily regulated environments, and specific experience in mobile applications, portals, and websites. If you are passionate about driving digital product success and thrive in fast-paced settings, we want to hear from you.  Responsibilities Define and communicate the digital product vision and strategy to stakeholders. Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather and prioritize product requirements. Develop and maintain the product backlog, ensuring it aligns with business goals. Lead the planning, development, and launch of new features and enhancements. Monitor product performance and user feedback to drive continuous improvement. Ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry standards. Act as the primary point of contact for product-related inquiries and decisions. Facilitate agile ceremonies, including sprint planning, reviews, and retrospectives. Build the digital foundation for our products, focusing on websites, portals, and mobile apps. Skills Proven experience as a Digital Product Owner in the financial services or a heavily regulated industry. Strong expertise in developing and managing mobile applications, portals, and websites. Excellent understanding of agile methodologies and frameworks. Exceptional communication and interpersonal skills. Ability to translate business needs into technical requirements. Strong analytical and problem-solving abilities. Experience with product management tools such as JIRA, Confluence, or similar. Bachelor's degree in Business, Computer Science, or a related field (preferred). column3: CRM Platform Architect, Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Integration and Azure.
column13: This pay rate is inclusive of mandatory 25% casual loading  CRM Platform Architect, Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Integration and Azure.   Job Title CRM Platform Architect  Day Rate Market rates  Location of work ACT preferred, Interstate candidates will be considered  Contract Initial 12 months contract with 12 months' extension option  Security clearance Australian Citizen, must be able to obtain Baseline    Our Client and Job Summary   Our client is an established and complex Federal Government Department. Their Chief Information Officer Division delivers a range of enabling services and provides operational support to the department and Australian businesses. It drives initiatives and ensures the department's IT infrastructure supports its broader goals. This includes managing the implementation of new technologies and fostering innovation within the department. They are currently seeking experienced and motivated Platform Architect to support the work of the Power Platform and CRM Systems section within the Digital Services for Business branch.  Main Responsibilities   Liaising with the delivery teams (particularly solution architects within those teams) to ensure solutions are compatible with the relevant CRM platform and, where applicable, can be integrated with other solutions within the Departmental CRM Liaising with the enterprise architecture team to ensure platform design incorporates enterprise considerations (particularly integration) Liaising with Microsoft representatives to ensure the best interests of the department are represented with regards to CRM and Power Platform. Creating and maintaining CRM and Power Platform solutions. This includes scheduling upgrades and balancing Microsoft's Wave Upgrade schedule with delivery project/programme and other ICT constraints. Liaising with Cyber Security for periodic Power Platform security reviews and risk remediations, in keeping with ISM requirements. Consulting with Cyber Security and Legal, regarding data security and privacy for cloud products' integration within Power Platform.  Essential Criteria   More than 5 years experience as an Architect specialising in Dynamics 365, Power Platform, Integration and Microsoft Azure. Ability to professionally represent the work area and the Department in meetings and workshops with internal and external stakeholders. Responsibility and oversight of all layers of the solution including infrastructure, application, security and information. Diligently perform Power Platform administration, configuration, optimisations, license and storage utilisation reporting, and develop best practices for improved developer experiences. Ensure platform/program alignment with broader departmental initiatives and enterprise standards by working closely with the Cloud, IT Security and Enterprise Architecture Strong problem solving ability and analytical skills as well as a passion for technology and continuous improvement Ability to produce and/or review a variety of technical artefacts including but not limited to: Solution architecture documents, Detailed Designs, Security Accreditation Documentation, Executive Briefs and Options Papers  Why apply with Hudson Recruitment? Wondering which agency to contact for your next role? At Hudson, we genuinely care about people. We are not just another tick-and-flick transactional hiring machine. We value service, reputation and quality and we believe in the power of long-term relationships. We work hard to offer you exceptional opportunities over and again, searching extensively for the best fit for both you and our client. Want to know more? Apply now!  How to Apply: To submit your application, please click Apply. For a confidential discussion, please contact Vera Geng at Hudson Recruitment 0411 521068 or email your CV to vera.geng@hudson.com

column3: Have you worked on a Jira Refresh/ Configuration project? Consider yourself an Atlassian suite pro? Keep reading...
column13: Bring your agile and analytical talents to the next level at this iconic blue-chip organisation and help with their large digital transformation.  Working to an Agile delivery model, you’ll be based within one of the best digital teams in the country, with the latest tools and technologies, on projects that will challenge and excite you. No two days will be alike. You’ll be encouraged and supported to achieve both individual and business goals, in a fast-paced environment that is inclusive and progressive.    The Role You will be responsible for the continuing support of the Atlassian suite of products, as well as taking a leading role in our Jira Refresh initiative.     You will work with Technology senior leaders and subject matter experts to design a set of suitable Jira “patterns” These patterns must result in a reduced ‘run’ workload for the Atlassian team, as well as delivering domain level velocity reporting to Technology senior leaders. Your challenge will be to deliver these outcomes, while maintaining the culture of team autonomy and experimentation.    Key Responsibilities Jira Refresh  Work with domain delegates to design and implement a consistent Jira pattern for capture of planned work in each technology domain Design and implement velocity reporting for each technology domain Align work in teams with over-arching strategic objectives (where required) Provide expert advice on Jira best practice and agile ways of working Reduce the complexity and customisations on Jira platform Identify manual workload for automation Must have   2 years’ experience managing all aspects of the Atlassian suite (Jira Cloud, Confluence, Advanced Roadmaps and Statuspage) and marketplace add-ons Ability to recognise the diverse needs of senior stakeholders and synthesise into Jira best practice Experience implementing domain level velocity reporting, to facilitate productivity and resource decision making Ability to influence teams in ‘ways of working’ and agile practices If you have the skills above and would like to apply for this role. Please send through your updated CV to Kyla@iteraterecruitment.com

column3: Exciting greenfield project for a industry leader.
column13: Senior Frontend Engineer (React, Next.js, Typescript)     The project focuses on developing our clients new web platform, aiming to deliver exceptional customer experiences and accessibility.     The key components of the project include:     Technological Framework:   Frontend Development: Utilizing Next.js 14 as the primary framework for frontend development. This choice enables efficient server-side rendering and a robust developer experience. API Integration: Leveraging gRPC for backend APIs, ensuring efficient communication and data transfer between frontend and backend systems. Cloud Integration: Operating within Google Cloud Platform (GCP), with familiarity with AWS or Azure being advantageous. The team uses these cloud environments for scalability, data management, and security.  Continuous Deployment and Integration:   The project employs a continuous deployment pipeline, allowing for rapid and frequent updates to the web platform. This includes automated testing, deployment, and feature flag management to ensure seamless user experiences.  Responsibilities and Impact:   Engineers are responsible for delivering high-quality features and functionalities to users, leveraging their expertise in React and Next.js. Senior engineers play a crucial role in guiding technical decisions, mentoring junior team members, and ensuring adherence to best practices in software engineering, security, and scalability.     Role of Frontend Engineers:  As an engineer within this project, your role encompasses several key responsibilities and qualifications:   Development Expertise: You will utilize your years of web development experience, with specifically in React or similar frameworks. Technical Proficiency: Strong understanding of software engineering principles, UI design literacy, and familiarity with frontend unit testing frameworks. Cloud Environment: Ability to work within cloud environments (GCP, AWS, Azure) and experience with continuous integration and deployment practices. Collaborative Skills: Engaging with stakeholders, designers, and engineers to build context and ensure project alignment.     Please apply by upload your current resume in Microsoft Word format only (.doc or .docx). column13: Sharp and Carter is proud to be partnering with a well known Not-For-Profit organisation to recruit a Business Analyst for a 12 month fixed term contract. Use your strong experience in Business Process Mapping to help streamline processes and identify pain points and inefficiencies in current process.   The ideal candidate will be autonomous and skilled in business process analysis and improvement, with expertise in Business Process Modelling Notation (BPMN). The role involves identifying inefficiencies across various departments, modelling current and future business processes, and assisting in prioritising initiatives.   Key Responsibilities:  Conduct thorough business process analysis across different business areas. Identify pain points and inefficiencies in current processes. Develop detailed business process models using BPMN, including "as-is" and "to-be" states. Provide recommendations for process optimisation and best practices. Document findings and present them to senior management.   About You:  Proven experience as a Business Analyst, ideally within a not-for-profit, government or similar environment. Strong skills in business process modelling and analysis using BPMN. Ability to work autonomously and drive initiatives forward. Excellent communication and stakeholder management skills. Proficient in creating detailed documentation and process maps. Strong problem-solving abilities and attention to detail.   This role offers hybrid working with an initial 1 day per week from home and a convenient office located in Fortitude Valley. Why Us   We are one of the fastest-growing large tech companies in the world, with offices in 50+ countries across the globe and 219,000 employees   Our company is extremely diverse with 165 nationalities represented We offer the opportunity to work with colleagues across the globe  We offer a virtual-first work environment, promoting a good work-life integration and real flexibility  We offer comprehensive benefits for all employees   We are a certified great place to work and a top employer in 17 countries, offering a positive work environment that values employee recognition and respect   Equality & Opportunity for All   Representing 165 nationalities across the globe, we pride ourselves on being an equal opportunity employer, committed to providing equal employment opportunities to all applicants and employees regardless of race, religion, sex, color, age, national origin, pregnancy, sexual orientation, physical disability or genetic information, military or veteran status, or any other protected classification, in accordance with federal, state, and/or local law.    Note: Please follow the link to apply to the role with your recent resume. column13: About the job Multiple Locations - VIC,ACT,QLD Senior Position - Would suit candidates with demonstrated Federal Government experience Hybrid Working   We are seeking an experienced Developer - Control-M (Analysis, Design and Test) to support the design, analysis, build, testing, and implementation of Control M projects within one of our Federal Government teams.   This is a 12-month contract with 1 x 12-month extensions. Suitable candidates can be based in VIC, ACT or Brisbane and need to have the ability to obtain a Baseline Security Clearance (Australian Citizen minimum)  Key Responsibilities:   Developer - Control-M (Analysis, Design and Test)   Duties may include some or all of the following: * create software and technical designs for the realisation of complex development solutions * provide technical advice on software development and maintenance * provide go-live support and maintenance for complex developments * perform a range of analysis, design, software development, prototyping, unit testing and maintenance activities * undertake analysis of technical requirements to support project evaluation with proposed solutions * Ensure compliance with endorsed software development methodologies * Identify, investigate, and resolve complex ICT issues * Assess, communicate, monitor, and control risk * Develop team plans and goals * Prepare draft reports and corporate documentation * Manage and prioritise own and others' workloads to meet business objectives in specified timeframes * Develop and deliver on projects within the assigned area of responsibility * Perform cost analysis activities as required  Ability to: * Use and encourage the use of digital technology to work efficiently * Translate technical information for non-technical audiences * Discuss and negotiate issues with credibility, transparency and respect * Undertake analysis and draw accurate conclusions based on evidence * Work collaboratively and embrace agile ways for working * Support and encourage innovation and continuous improvement * Remain optimistic and focused in response to setbacks or challenges * Enable change initiatives and encourage others to embrace change * Show care and courage with challenging interactions  Required Experience:    At least 3 years of experience working in large ICT Control-M project teams with complex business rules and high data volumes Exposure SAP PS-CD and S/4HANA technologies Ability to prepare high quality documentation, including detailed functional design specifications, requirement traceability, testing documentation and other implementation documentation A positive attitude, with a willingness to learn and to share information. Ability to commit to action, display resilience in a high-pressure complex ICT environment, and dedication to achieving positive outcomes Ability to communicate clearly, listen, understand, and adapt to the audience; able to Effectively communicate with business colleagues to ensure common understanding    Talented, committed, can-do individuals have always been the cornerstone of this dynamic organisation. column3: An initial 12 month contract has arisen for a passionate SAP EAM Functional Analyst to join a large Qld government department.
column13: An initial 12 month contract has arisen for a passionate SAP EAM Functional Analyst to join a large Qld government department.  In this role, your focus will be to deliver an end-to-end ERP functional capability aligned to the overall Enterprise Asset management strategy. You will have responsibility for the uplift of existing ECC capability and will also provide the S4HANA Project with solution assurance, SAP process knowledge and overall guidance to System Integrator Vendors. It will focus on business partnership, ERP architecture and functional delivery.   Your key responsibilities:  Be a trusted point of contact for business stakeholders and an advocate for the Group - understand business stakeholder vision, strategy, challenges, and opportunities. Deliver functional change via incremental improvements and projects. Work with business and stakeholders to define and scope new work. Ensure value/benefits are identified and incorporated into delivery planning via a prioritised product backlog. Provide functional consulting advice to business and internal stakeholders - harnessing SAP capabilities and best practice processes to meet business needs and exceed expectations. Collaborate with peers in the ERP Platform team to ensure services are coordinated and integrated. Govern alignment of external service provider functional deliverables as a business and ERP subject matter expert to ensure solutions meet business expectations and are compliant with internal standards and policies.     Essential Requirements for this role:  Proven experience in a similar role on at least two full lifecycle EAM implementations. Demonstrated experience of working in SAP ECC and S/4 HANA (EAM) environments in SAP functional consulting and or SAP solution architecture. High level knowledge of development in S/4HANA such as Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planner, Planning Buckets, Schedules etc. Demonstrated significant experience working with SAP Activate Methodology and functional analysis and configuration services in a complex organisation. Ability to stay updated on the latest developments and enhancements in SAP EAM and S/4HANA, proactively identifying opportunities for optimisation and innovation. The ability to lead detailed design and configuration discussions; specifying details to configure S/4 Asset Management hierarchy, and other data objects such as Functional Location, Equipment, Work Orders etc. Conduct thorough testing of SAP EAM configurations to identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies. Demonstrate experience of EAM integration with other modules such as Project System (PS) and Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (EPPM), Material Management (MM) and Production Planning (PP). Demonstrated experience and industry training and S/4HANA EAM certifications Minimum of two full lifecycle S/4HANA EAM delivery and implementation experience     To be considered for the role click the 'apply' button or for more information about this and other opportunities please contact Anita Cunningham on 07 33395626 or email: acunningham@paxus.com.au and quote the above job reference number. column1: ERP Functional Analyst - SAP S4 HANA (EAM)
column3: An initial 12 months contract for a Functional Analyst to manage and deliver end-to-end ERP functional capability aligned to the EAM ERP platform.
column13: The ERP Functional Analyst will manage and deliver end-to-end ERP functional capability aligned to the ERP Platform Enterprise Asset Management (EAM) and Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (ePPM) Value Streams. This role will be responsible for the uplift of existing ECC capability within these value streams and will also provide the S4HANA Project with solution assurance, SAP process knowledge and overall guidance to System Integrator Vendors. It will focus on business partnership, ERP architecture and functional delivery.     Your key responsibilities:  Be a trusted point of contact for business stakeholders and an advocate for the Group - understand business stakeholder vision, strategy, challenges, and opportunities. Deliver functional change via incremental improvements and projects. Work with business and stakeholders to define and scope new work. Ensure value/benefits are identified and incorporated into delivery planning via a prioritised product backlog. Provide functional consulting advice to business and internal stakeholders - harnessing SAP capabilities and best practice processes to meet business needs and exceed expectations. Collaborate with peers in the ERP Platform team to ensure services are coordinated and integrated. Govern alignment of external service provider functional deliverables as a business and ERP subject matter expert to ensure solutions meet business expectations and are compliant with internal standards and policies. Collaboration with the OCM Specialist to assist in the planning, development and rollout of OCM deliverables.    Essential Requirements for this role:  Significant experience of working in SAP ECC and S/4 HANA (EAM) environments in SAP functional consulting and or SAP solution architecture. Strong knowledge of latest development in S/4HANA such as Resource Scheduling for Maintenance Planner, Planning Buckets, Schedules etc. Demonstrated significant experience working with SAP Activate Methodology and functional analysis and configuration services in a complex organisation. Significant experience in multiple end-to-end SAP project implementations as a senior functional consultant. Ability to stay updated on the latest developments and enhancements in SAP EAM and S/4HANA, proactively identifying opportunities for optimisation and innovation. Lead / support detailed design and configuration discussions; specifying details to configure S/4 Asset Management hierarchy, and other data objects such as Functional Location, Equipment, Work Orders etc. Conduct thorough testing of SAP EAM configurations to identify and resolve any issues or discrepancies. Demonstrated significant experience working with SAP Geographical Enablement Framework (GEF), SAP Asset Manager and Fleet Management. Demonstrate experience of EAM integration with other modules such as Project System (PS) and Enterprise Portfolio and Project Management (EPPM), Material Management (MM) and Production Planning (PP). Demonstrated experience in working in a business function related to Enterprise Asset Management and or Portfolio and Project Management. Tertiary qualifications in a relevant or related discipline Demonstrated experience and industry training and S/4HANA EAM certifications Minimum of two full lifecycle S/4HANA EAM delivery and implementation experience    If you have highly developed verbal, written, interpersonal, presentation, facilitation, influencing and negotiation skills together with proven experience in building strong working relationships with all levels of seniority and demonstration of exceptional customer centricity, then apply now.     Your exceptional stakeholder engagement, influencing and management skills - understanding how others think and act - ability to smoothly deliver outcomes through strong business, team and supplier partnerships will assist you in your ability to skilfully approach multiple sources to solve problems - demonstrating advanced skill and keen insight in gathering, sorting, and applying key information.     All Randstad Digital contractors receive:  Access to a Udemy licence for ongoing learning and continuous professional development Access to exclusive discounts across various platforms Discounts on private health funds Novated leasing options  For more information, or a swift response, please email summer.hall@randstaddigital.com.au or apply now. column3: As the System Integration (SI) Director you will be responsible for transitioning the System Integration function from a key external delivery part...
column13: About the Agency  As the steward for digital enablement of Australia’s health system, the Agency has a lead role in coordinating national engagement, delivery and adoption of digital health to enable person-centred, connected healthcare.   Responsible for national digital health services and systems from My Health Record to Electronics Prescriptions and my health app, our work directly impacts the lives of all Australians.   We’re committed to fostering a diverse and inclusive workplace where everyone thrives. We welcome applications from diverse backgrounds. Our flexible working arrangements including, options to work from home or with varied hours, empower and support you to balance life and career seamlessly.    About the Role  Technology Services Division: Join our Technology Services Division, the heart of digital health innovation. We’re entrusted with the operation and enhancement of a reliable, secure national digital health infrastructure and health support systems. Our commitment to fostering innovation ensures that we stay at the forefront of digital health advancements. Your role will be pivotal in transforming healthcare delivery. You’ll contribute to the seamless operation of health support systems that are not just efficient but also safeguarded with the highest standards of security.    As the System Integration (SI) Director you will be responsible for transitioning the System Integration function from a key external delivery partner to the Agency within the Technology Planning and Delivery Branch.    The SI Director will report into the Solution Delivery Director and is accountable for leading the System Integration function in the Agency. This is a key Executive Level 2 position, requiring a person who is proactive, driven and purposeful, with strong leadership qualities. The role will have the opportunity to influence the direction of digital health in Australia and make a difference to the lives of Australian citizens, though the creation of leading technology solutions to ensure the stabilisation, enhancement and modernisation of the My Health Record (MHR) system.   You’ll tackle challenges, make a difference, and enjoy competitive salary and flexible working conditions.   The key duties of the position include:   What You’ll Bring   Establish and lead a team of high performing technical specialists to create a world class System Integration function within the Agency, ensuring the most effective use of skills and abilities mapped to capacity requirements to deliver on Agency’s workplan.   Lead in the end-to-end technical delivery capability from requirements, functional definition, systems design, development, system integration, testing and management of interdependencies through to operational implementation and handover.  Build and maintain effective relationships with stakeholders in the Agency (business teams, architecture, security, IT, operations, contract, procurement, legal) and external partners across a wide spectrums of levels, from executive and senior management roles to team members, utilising language and presentation modes appropriately tailored to audiences.   The SI Director is therefore required to have strong technical skills/understanding with experience in delivery of large mission critical systems, various cloud environments and large databases and applications like Oracle.   Eligibility  Ability to obtain and maintain national police check.  Australian Citizenship is a condition of eligibility.  Ability to obtain and maintain a Neg Vet 1 security clearance with the ability to obtain and maintain a higher clearance if required by the Agency.  Notes   Notes  Minimum of 5 years experience leading a technical team.  Minimum of 10 years senior experience in technology related leadership role.  Additional Information   The position maybe filled in Brisbane, Sydney or Canberra. To apply, submit your resume and a cover letter.    Please contact the recruitment team at careers@digitalhealth.gov.au with queries relating to the application process.  For all queries relating to the responsibilities of the position, please contact Sharon Queen at sharon.queen@digitalhealth.gov.au.   Order of Merit: Applicants rated as suitable will be placed in a pool of merit that may be used to fill similar ongoing or non-ongoing positions throughout the Agency for up to 18 months.   Closing Date: 18 August 2024, 11:00pm       Getting to know the Australian Digital Health Agency   Tasked with improving health outcomes for Australians through the delivery of digital healthcare systems and the national digital health strategy, the Australian Digital Health Agency (the Agency) commenced operations on 1 July 2016. The Agency is responsible for national digital health services and systems, with a focus on engagement, innovation and clinical quality and safety. Our focus is on putting data and technology safely to work for patients, consumers and the healthcare professionals who look after them

column3: The Onsite Services Officer will provide hands on end-user support throughout Western Australia. They will provide first-class customer service and...
column13: Provide hands on Level 1 & 2 end-user support throughout Western Australia 12 month fixed-term full-time position based at our Perth Processing Centre  $75k-$85k + Superannuation + Salary Packaging   Discover life-giving possibilities  Lifeblood is more than just a job or a career, it’s an opportunity to be part of something that matters. As an organisation, our purpose is simple: to give life. Together, we want to help you build a fulfilling career with Lifeblood.  About the role The Onsite Services Officer will provide hands on end-user support throughout Western Australia. They will provide first-class customer service and IT support and maintain excellent Service Call management by providing local and remote diagnosis, troubleshooting and resolution of 1st and 2nd level desktop issues related to hardware, software or peripheral devices.     Being the backbone of our business, ICT provides modern supporting systems, infrastructure and digital enablement to support our evolving customer needs. We’re always moving forward to secure new technologies that are integrated and optimised to deliver business value.     Sound interesting? Here’s what we are looking for;  Outstanding communication, collaboration & coordination skills gained through previous work experience in a similar position Several years’ work in service desk support as well as relevant onsite services experience  Superior knowledge of enterprise level desktop related IT hardware and the configuration of components and drivers Prior experience in issues, troubleshooting and resolution of enterprise level desktop IT hardware, software and peripherals  Networking principals and infrastructure knowledge as well as MS Exchange and Microsoft products for use in a LAN environment Ability to work autonomously and as part of a service-orientated team Extensive experience in customer service Excellent time management skills & ability to prioritise & manage conflicting critical issues/technical problems  This is a 12 month fixed-term full-time opportunity based out of our Processing Centre in Perth. While this is predominantly an onsite role, Lifeblood is proud to accommodate flexible working and we are open to conversations around what this means to you. Must hold a valid Australian drivers license.    Thrive in a diverse culture that cares for your wellbeing  We’re a diverse and inclusive bunch. We’re proud to foster an environment where all people can come together to achieve their very best. Whether it’s workplace safety or work/life balance, we look after our employees’ varying needs. As part of the Lifeblood team, you’ll have access to a generous salary packaging program, plus a great range of rewards like discounts on insurance, groceries, food & beverage, department stores, travel, and more.  Excited about this opportunity? Apply now and discover a career filled with life-giving possibilities.   Next steps When it comes to recruitment we like to move fast, this means we progress suitable candidates through the hiring process as soon as we can.   We are a 2024 Circle Back Initiative Employer and commit to respond to every applicant. You’ll hear from us with an outcome after your application has been reviewed and assessed.  If selected, you’ll be required to complete a few background checks and we’ll help you through this process.   If you require any adjustments during the recruitment process, please reach out to us.   For further details on this position, please contact Tayler on tdobbs@redcrossblood.org.au. **Please note we cannot accept applications via email so please apply online   This vacancy is being managed directly by Lifeblood’s Talent Engagement team. We won’t accept candidates from external recruitment agencies on this occasion.
